h8te-lKrLV8TiH4vZU8DJQ.text: Have eaten here three times and each time it's been great! Food is fresh, tastes great, good coffee, great service.  Try the Belgian waffle you will love it! The owner makes his rounds regularly. Matts and St Francis are my fav Sunday brunch spots!!!

cHsLRwl93fZVY4Ravy7sSg.text: Do check out! Today was my first experience at Matts & I would recommend this delicious breakfast/lunch spot! Impressed with Ample parking, short wait time. The employees were all very nice and accommodating. The menu is small but covers all bases: pancakes, scrambled, & breakfast sandwich. Our breakfast was prepared quickly! I really appreciated they use cage free eggs, extra virgin olive oil, & real butter! I was pleasantly surprised to see all of the improvements to downtown Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main dining room

4PLw5QI-R3CAOdvIJ1AkUw.text: Matt's big breakfast is a nice treat on mornings I don't feel like cooking! Its close enough to ride our bikes which we love. While taste and food quality is much better than typical chain restaurants, its nothing I can't prepare in my own kitchen. That said, the fresh squeezed orange juice is amazing! I will go to Matt's just for that!!!! My husband and I joke that it is a version of Village Inn for a younger and health conscious generation. We will continue to return as long as we live here!

pb0EZ5VskZkIcyVFlR6abw.text: Food was pretty good. Very busy around the clock. Parking sucks, but it's Downtown Phoenix so what can you do? Service was great. Will be back.

PGBvx2JEUadnu-H7tQzSLw.text: If you ever want great service to go along with the best food in the valley, then go here!! The breakfast is to die for, and the service tops the chart! I always have the daily morning special along with a side pancake. And believe me there is more than enough food here to satisfy my big appetite! The pancakes are out of the world with maple syrup!! I love Matt's and always highly recommended it to friends and love ones. You can't go wrong here!!!

f3toK55BvncjoHIqkkq1GA.text: Best breakfast spot in Phoenix! The scrambles are off the charts, as are their home fries. Yum!

BudIn0Mjro8k-KZMoB0Tqw.text: Scott at Matts BB is absolutely AMAZING!!! Some seriously awesome customer service! Thanks Scott! YTM!

wMH9g42eUzJ71KJ9IrbYKA.text: I have been to two locations since I've moved to Phoenix and both are equally amazing! Their waffles, bacon, jam, toast, everything is to die for! And don't even get me started on their homemade syrup! I think I could drink it its that good! 10/10 would recommend!

UM4-9y00lSMJSeaSfKP9tw.text: Loved it the pork chops were Amazing and the jam and bread was the best honestly long wait.. But definitely worth the wait!

dYCz-sMpbsAFr_D05f80rg.text: The best jelly I have ever tasted, amazing fresh serves orange juice as well. Always very packed! But hey. The food is amazing!! I recommend the waffles!

tC6f78apvZEaHtHZZtl0KQ.text: Was downtown today so I stopped in for breakfast.  Fundamentally not bad.  On the other hand didn't blow my socks off.    That being said I will give them credit for being able to scramble an egg.  Most places don't know how to do this properly (trust me most places make an omelet and chop that up and call it scrambled eggs...its not).  This is a small place and it seems like everyone in Phoenix is trying to eat there.  So one really irritating note.  The place is crowded, I'm waiting and I see two people finished with their meal just drinking coffee.  I get seated...they're still sitting there.  I get my food...they're still sitting there.  I eat...they're still sitting there.  I pay my bill...they're still sitting there.  I leave...they're still sitting there.    WTF!!!!!!  People are waiting and you're just sitting there.  To make matters worse they pulled out a jug of Arizona Tea and started drinking that.  Double WTF!!!!!!  I guess the management of Matts are too nice and don't bounce people when they should. I'm not sure if that's a good quality or bad.  What I do know is I just saw two of the most inconsiderate people in Phoenix today.  Probably a 3.5 versus a 4, but that wasn't a choice.

yW2ZCnC0HAAmmZO_HMPmww.text: Omelette and hash browns were alright. I'm not to big on omelettes though. Orange juice was fresh, mmm!!

Tzq7HoxO_PFdyk1cEg3Wrg.text: First time at Matt's and breakfast was great.  Waffles were made perfect served with a side of thick bacon which was nice and smokey.  Griddle cakes were light, yet rich and melted in your mouth.  Atmosphere was extremely casual and help was warm and welcoming.  I will definitely go back, already craving the waffles with bacon.

HULw8meUYa2uUDMC3AkKBQ.text: good, but not worth the hype. Especially for the wait time.

i0ZVjWz1z7ynDBZ3XfslIQ.text: Great food, fast service and if you hit it at the right day/time, no waiting. Unfortunately 4 stars for the ultra skimpy/tight shorts that some of the wait staff were wearing. I'm no prude but come on girls, this ain't Hooters!

MBU2jBPWzzySswLS4G0Kyg.text: Ordered the chop and chick and was not disappointed! SO GOOD! I am a hash browns girl through and through but was advised to try the home fries. No regrets! Those home fries are the best I've ever had! The wheat toast is delicious and the homemade strawberry preserves are worth the wait in line. And you must order the blueberry honey lemonade!

sz_OGQv-huBzeQad1bsvLA.text: Love Matt's! Simple and delicious! Pancakes are so yummy!

E6_IOxfjsCedcOkBrNTgBw.text: Excellent. Great food, great service. Busy on a Friday morning, obviously others know about it.

jMihaK3KIDWz5OWtNSX2NQ.text: This place was SO built up in my head because my friends love it. At the end of the day, it was just "pretty good". I would never avoid the place, but i also would never really feel a need to go back.

X1e-e5_wACGyfWTqYlFk_w.text: Honestly, I was disappointed with my trip to MBB. Ever since I moved here, I have heard amazing things about this place and was so stoked when my friend and I came in for breakfast. I ordered an egg sandwich--which was good and I liked. But I also ordered a side of potatoes--they were covered in oil and an excessive amount of rosemary. The potatoes were completely inedible. When the manager came around to ask how our food was, he looked surprised when I told him the potatoes were inedible to me and had too much rosemary; he politely acknowledged me and told me he'd check with the cook(s) about it. When the bill came, I was surprised to see that I was still charged for the potatoes that I did not like and/or eat. I had to find the manager and politely ask him to remove them from my bill, and he did. It was decent customer service once I had to go out of my way to find someone, but honestly I don't want to go back. Not worth it when Phoenix is a city filled with brunch/breakfast places far better than this.

yXgsX--3Zxan3eNcEbZTtQ.text: Great downtown spot & in the Arts district. It is an easy walk to other local downtown spots & the food is always on point.

KqA28sfM6hw6Ba7gQ025Uw.text: Matt's rocks for breakfast, but lunch is also All American awesomeness!  Cobb salad Macaroni salad Strawberry honey lemonade  The Cobb is fresh & unlike any other with their thick smoky bacon. Best macaroni salad ever . It came in a mound with diced veg, tomatoes- wow. Strawberry lemonade with local honey was money/honey. Love Matt's!

anzyifLoGnsCxc1QKV9NcA.text: Been coming to Matt's Big Breakfast for over 6 years now. We actually got to see Faizon Love there. Really a nice kick back place for breakfast. My daughter likes the Belgium Waffle most.

kkYhGqyb0DV7OI31pJKqpw.text: Solid good breakfast at a fair price. Nothing earth shattering. I had a breakfast sandwich. Expected a big wait (that's what we were told) but there wasn't.

8JVKt_YqM634FUq5k2h45g.text: Was my first time here but didn't know it was on DDD. (Diners, Drive Ins, & Dives). The orange Juice is  and the bacon is peppered. The OJ  is the best I've ever had. I hate has browns but this is the only place I will eat them at. When I go to IHOP or Denny's they just sit on my plate. The construction  might deter you from coming in. But please don't pass this place up. They have breakfast specials as well. I sat at the bar because all the tables were full. The service was really fast. I could have sworn that the food was already prepared, but that wasn't the case. This place has my vote. I wish there was one in North Phoenix.

Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oF6sv6HC6eIqAbuhGvAvxA.text: Matts big breakfast has some very excellent breakfast options. I've never been disappointed. But even if their food was just ok, I would still continue to go back just for the bacon. It is the best bacon I've ever had at any restaurant or home!

LnJ0jS36k9HIu_AnIDZnjA.text: Solid Phoenix brunch spot!  We were out-of-towners visiting for the weekend, and we were hungry the minute we landed. Matt's was a highly rated brunch spot, and it definitely met my expectations. We were anticipating a potential wait on a Sat. afternoon, but there was luckily none!  I ordered the egg dish special of the day: -Egg scramble: delish, except I ended up picking out some bacon pieces  -House potatoes: made crispy and flavorful esp. with the rosemary garnish = addictive -Sourdough: perfect with their house strawberry preserve  Best part of Matt's is the hospitable service and affordable dishes. Food came out soon after we ordered and the refills and followups were continuous.

nXXArjpb04mTZJtyv8l8_w.text: For the price, this place is a very good deal. Food was delivered quickly, was hot and service was very attentive. Portions were large and tasty. Concierge at the hotel recommended we try it. Said it was one of the best in town. The ambiance is equivalent to a subway station, when there are trains on the track. It was loud, VERY LOUD. It is a rickety kind of place that I am glad I tried.

nGEI6n5LkYwlPYYfTW9xQg.text: My husband and I were visiting from California and I have some local friends who raved about this place, so we decided to try it out. It was a Saturday morning and the wait wasn't too bad, maybe like 20 minutes. So we got a table and it is crazy loud inside the restaurant. We had to put out heads together to hear. They ordered our food and drink quickly and then we sat and waited which was expected as it was a Saturday morning. Then they brought out only my food without my husbands. So we sat waiting for about 10 more minutes  before they brought his out. We decided to split a stack of pancakes and get a few sides. So bacon and home fries and eggs with pancakes. The pancakes and eggs were delicious. I didn't care for the bacon. It had a weird pepper seasoning on it but it was thick and crispy. My husband did not like his home fries. They weren't cookies crispy just squishy. The food and atmosphere were mediocre but the price was too high for that. Extra syrup costs more money by the way.

ecoxUlHcuVBZNaW9xxjE9Q.text: I think everyone in Phoenix comes here for breakfast. Everyone. This place was packed with people eating inside, and with people waiting outside to eat. I probably waited 45-50 minutes to eat here. Was it worth it? Maybe. I had looked at the menu while waiting, so I knew what I wanted to order. I ordered the Chop and Chick, which is eggs made to order, and a pork chop, which I think they must use some sort of pesto rub or marinade. I had also heard about their strawberry lemonade, but they didn't have any that day! The server said they had blackberry lemonade, which also sounded good, so I ordered that to go with my breakfast choice.   The food came out pretty quickly. I had ordered my eggs over medium and my pork chop came with choice of hash browns or rosemary home fries and choice of toast (white, wheat, rye, and something else). I picked rosemary home fries and the wheat toast. The potatoes were delicious!!! Best part of the meal and I devoured every last piece. The rosemary flavoring was amazing. The wheat bread seemed to be made in house - it came in thick slices and was buttered. The server brought over (I think) blueberry preserves which went great with the toast. The pork chop was also really good, but the meat was a little on the dry side. I ate all of it, because I was really hungry after waiting almost an hour to eat. The lemonade was yummy but it was too sweet - would've been perfect if I added a little water to it.   Service was fine - it took a while to flag someone down to get the check and to pay.   Overall, I liked the ambiance - it's a cute and fun place, and obviously everyone likes to come here to eat breakfast/brunch. The piggy decorations are cute and I like the orange accents. What I ordered was okay - the potatoes were amazing. If I were to come back, I'd probably order something else (the Hog and Chick was the other one I was eyeing). They have a location at the Airport in Terminal 4, so perhaps I'll try to eat there and hope that it's not crazy busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop and Chick, with eggs over medium, home fries, and wheat toast
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackberry lemonade
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast all day

ShOVLvP6rY-CUxbhjCRjJQ.text: Loved it!  Great service, food and prices!  Excellent quality and quantity.  Fresh squeezed OJ was very good and so was the home made toast and jam.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham and cheddar omelette, home fries.  Home made bread/toast with home made strawberry and blueberry jam.  Fresh squeezed OJ too!

JfhS2qxCUzfgw9mruriBYg.text: This is a must visit. The place is small and simple, yet if you go at the wrong time you'll wait in line. Luckily,  we went early and ate at the bar. The service was great, the food was great, and the bacon was off the charts!

bTEdbDWidIKDWN7nPdeT9w.text: I'm giving 4 stars under the qualification that it is airport food.  We arrived for breakfast and the place was packed. We only waited a few minutes to be seated, but the wait was much longer for folks that arrived shortly after us. The hostess was friendly. The waitress was not the best but what can I say...it's an airport and people are in a hurry to get to their planes. The food was good. We had the very tasty sonrisa burrito that did indeed put a smile on my face. The place is located in terminal B.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A side of steak fries :steak refers to type of cut, not that the fries come with steak :)
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonrisa Burrito with sausage

IgFgoOy4f77NiokG65efwg.text: Good service. Really good food. I got The Five Spot and my husband got the waffle. Both were delicious. Everything tasted clean (not heavy, greasy or processed). The honey lemonade is really tasty The place isn't very big. It was packed with people but they run it well. Decor is cute, sort of an urban farmhouse.  I would recommend and come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vHz1MY3vwUQOGoPWVcGpsA.text: Greasy spoon diner, had the tuna with potato chips and without the bread. It needed a little more mayo, but overall good it came with a pickle.   We did wait outside for about 30 minutes to get a table. They have a water dispenser with lots of ice and lemon wedges to keep you hydrated in that Phoenix sun.   Worth the wait, good hangover food. Only wish they had a liquor licence , sometimes momma needs hair of the dog.

lqDOZFpUiF6oaXTocdKk0g.text: This place definitely lived up to the hype! I have lived in Arizona for a month now and this was on my restaurant list because I'm a big fan of Triple D. Coincidentally I moved 2 blocks away from this place.   There was a 15 minuet wait but so what, it is worth it. I got the hog and chick because I had to try the bacon. It was GREAT! I like my eggs cooked runny and they got them perfect.   The staff was quick, efficient, and friendly. My coffee cup stayed full.

zq5P23SeXBb1u6p7hnyvbw.text: The food was good and the staff were nice. Not necessarily gluten-free friendly. No gluten free toast and they refused to substitute toast with potatoes, only a tomato slice (the tomato was bad). Their spices on the bacon were good but overall I would rate my experience as average.

KVbOxuNcOO-JEmg_piUp1w.text: First and far most expect to wait if not here by opening. Very popular spot. Pork chops and eggs for me both times. First visit fantastic, second visit not so much... manager had my back.... thank you. I'll definitely be back. Understand this place gets BUSY, so yes servers are doing their best to accommodate... try to avoid the frustration if it takes a little longer than normal to wait... then again reminders don't hurt. You can get eggs anywhere... next time I'll be ordering a special... FYI French toast a definite if having a sweet tooth.

XTKhrhU_acXyVIFWKwyiHA.text: I had the Chop and Chick with a Honey Strawberry Lemonade. This food was BOMB! The only knock I have is that due to the small size you are rushed to eat. The wait staff comes by often asking "can I take that plate." I still had half a porkchop on my plate! As for food though.... It was really good!!!! Indefinitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chop and Chick with home fries with ketchup on the eggs!

uF2SRZpiHHfW4aP3AnhFKQ.text: This is strictly because - why on earth would a place as popular as this one not have text when your name is called available...or shaded/covered seating while you wait? In ARIZONA???

tVosy7CPyPAKK6qYa3W0Jw.text: More like "Matt's little breakfast selections"  No vegetarian options and they don't even have avocado

4llWY8W8U_VG8htgmsx5bw.text: This place is definitely very popular, but I think it's a bit over-hyped. We went on a Saturday morning around 11 am. The estimated wait time was approximately 30 minutes for a table for 2. But we ended up waiting 45 minutes. :( During the wait, no one bothered to come by and refill the empty water dispenser for all the customers waiting in the Arizona heat. When we finally sat down and got out food, I would say it as pretty average. The only food item that really stood out was the homemade blueberry jam, paired with your choice of toast. This place is nothing special.

eetZSx3agWJA1XIzo-Z9BA.text: Food is very good. ALWAYS SO BUSY. Parking is hit or miss especially on weekends. My only complaint is how loud it gets. I wish there was some way to lessen the echo and noise.

pXO1MB-VgJHI6Hgm15caOw.text: Loved the food, best breakfast I've had the portion is huge and priced very well. I was full for most of the day after eating here. I would definitely go back food was on point I had the waffle plate it was sooooo  good! Excellent choice!

OALtvGdHdmEn9_lKEJDbTQ.text: Consistently fresh and good. Prices have gone up a little over the years, but the quality has remained high... still recommended - here and the one on Camelback near 32nd Street.

1737kiLfm4CFuN9nO6H_Ew.text: We've been here a couple of times and have always loved what we've ordered. Bacon is THICK. Coffee is GREAT! And most (if not all of their ingredients are local. Bread comes from Wildflower Bakery, coffee is from a local distributor in North Phoenix, meats come from local supplier in Queen Creek and owner's wife makes the preserve spread herself from local fruit  in season.   #1 Best LOCAL Classic American Breakfast

uPVjB8vfduVWyRiBdiyBTg.text: I was super excited to try this place after reading all the great reviews. I'm here vacationing with my family from Austin, TX and staying in a downtown hotel so this restaurant is walking distance.   The wait was about an hour but I expected it since it seems to be a popular place. The hostess did a great job of keeping everyone in the loop of the status of seating and they even served cold water outside. There are several benches to sit as well as a couple of trees for shade.   After being seated the service was pretty fast. Our drink orders were taken promptly and shortly after was our food order. I ordered the griddlescakes and was quite disappointed. They were very dry and not at all what I expected. My cousin ordered the pork chop and eggs and his pork chops were dry. My husband ordered the pork and chick which was eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. Everything on his plate was really good. The toast was amazing.   We had to ask to have our drinks refilled a couple of times but they did the best they could given the best they could.

E5WAaalc4XsZgJoQ_2RrGw.text: What can be said that hasn't been already. First time back in a long time, when they were at the other location a block over. Excellent - went Hog & Chick, add Chicken Apple Sausage. How the heck do the make something so simple so good??!!  You have to try it to understand. 6 Stars! The new location looks great.

Ms9wlfurOcpGmvTwOq_OOA.text: $1.50 for a thimble size of extra syrup, yes you read that right syrup. Food was very good, never in my life have I been charged for syrup.

YmIpAufxUVJ55s_7kI5DVA.text: I read about this place on Yelp and made it my mission to stop in before my flight on the last day of my trip. I thought I planned enough time, but with the July 4th holiday, the place was packed! Being packed is always a good sign and since I planned my time poorly, I almost didn't stay since there was a bit of a wait for a table. Since I was so determined to try their food, I ordered my meal to go. I got the cheese omelette with provolone, onions and roasted red peppers and an oj. The oj tasted so fresh, it was like it was from hand-squeezed oranges! I waited a bit for my omelette and started getting a bit nervous about making my flight. Right about when I was about to ask about my meal (maybe 15 - 20 mins since my order) it came out. I ran to the car to take off for the airport, but not before taking a bite. When I cut into my lovely omelette, it had mushrooms! There aren't many things I hate more I hate than mushrooms and I was so disappointed. Due to tight timing, I thought of just eating the home fries and sour dough toast and tossing the omelette, but decided to go back in and see if anything could be done. The host sincerely apologized and very sweetly promised to make it right. I explained I was in a super rush and she assured me it wouldn't be long. My meal was out so quickly, and I was so thankful. This time when I cut into my omelette it was perfect and was honestly one of the best brunch meals I've had in a long time. I am picky, but everything was perfect. I really appreciate a business that takes care of their customers and treats them with respect - THANK YOU. In addition, in the time I spent inside, I could see the staff hustling and interacting with every single customer. This seems like a great place for the locals and I would spend every Sunday here, if I lived in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This picture doesn&#39;t do my to go meal justice.

SvJv6VEjGUPWof_7X1Kc7Q.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot! It can become very busy especially with the wait times but that just reminds you of how many people enjoy it! Friendly people and great food! Definitely, recommend coming here.

Yx-64pg0QfbUvFNj8D6Mew.text: little gem, i love it! Good local positive vibe!

LzZ0eZNjvTXGaB5Rc3gJ2w.text: First time coming here. Food was good, tad overrated for that kind of wait. Guy up front was a little rude.

IIQ4bN78GKgkMhdd7jLpWA.text: This place is always busy -takes a while to get a table but the service is always great and their food is great. I love this place from brunch.

cbZXEmbbl-GNcByS8whKvQ.text: The food was good but nothing special on the menu - same old breakfast - bacon and eggs, pancakes, etc.  They do have one special per day, but again, same old, same old - Sunday was steak and eggs.  Also disappointed there was no alcohol on the menu - I love a good Bloody Mary or a Mimosa on the weekend.  Extremely loud inside, chairs constantly scraping on the concrete floor.    I prefer the Matt's at the airport.

zlMOulELzuK6RcnvO9IpPg.text: I love this place, even though it moved a while back. I liked the coziness of the original smaller venue, but the food is still awesome and unique.

16-ZdiT8vVaAqU4yf8ap3w.text: We are from out of state and were looking forward to today's breakfast for some time.  I had a cheese omelette, country potatoes, toast, and a side of bacon. The country potatoes were so greasy making  them inedible. I asked for hot sauce and was given a bottle of their own hot sauce that tasted more like barbecue sauce minus any kick. Nothing particularly special about this place or the service, although it is pretty cute.

v9kZnWSjJB9CrilSXUuaXw.text: Realizing the truth about Matt's is that they are simply short-staffed in the summer. Not sure why it is, but winter service is far more consistent (read: better). Over the past few months, when we have visited, we see some table fly right through while others just wait (we even spoke to a couple at a table next to us on the last visit who had noticed the same thing, as they had been waiting a while).   Hey -- Matt's is great and, in a few months, we'll be right back to taking winter visitors there. But, for summertime, I'll be taking a pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast

roPv7CKVAAY5QI5rUJbYMg.text: The food here was AMAZING! I felt like there was not a huge amount of variety in the menu, but what Matt's does, they do very well! The bacon, in particular, is thick-cut and delicious. It took us about twenty minutes to get a table, but it was worth it for sure!

apsavxA6_QeiYdmSy0qfPA.text: I am so sad. You see, we have nothing like Matt's in the San Francisco Peninsula.   My wife said it perfectly as we were eating an orgasmically great breakfast there yesterday morning. "There are places that serve breakfast. And this is most places. And then there are those food establishments that pay homage to the very art of a hearty American breakfast." THIS is Matt's.   Oh, and the service is great too. For breakfast as an event, I can't imagine a better place. And not that you care, but I had steak and eggs with succulent crispy hash browns and buttery delicious sourdough toast. The steak was perfect. And the teeny cup of A1 sauce on the side? Way to keep it classy.  Their bacon is crispy thick peppery goodness. I'd like to take this opportunity to thank my five year old daughter for not eating her bacon.  And now I'm starting to weep again.  THE END

VCjcrliz7iyr8um1MUKtTA.text: If you like waffles at all, then you have to come here. The waffle is like no other waffle I've ever had. The real maple syrup and heaping of butter don't hurt either. The side of bacon is always perfectly cooked, and balances out the sweetness of the waffle.  The hash browns, lemonade, and fresh jam are also must-haves. sure, the wait sucks but if you stick it out the food is well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heaven on a plate

qQQMPsx6DwUR7gaShxuXMw.text: Food is fantastic... Atmosphere is too loud portions are reasonable prices are on the higher side... Bottom line the food is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special of the day was fantastic!

Zc_55KqEqXAEKaddilpoVg.text: This has to be the best breakfast eatery at any airport  in America.  Try the french toast

tEEYTb2MhHn--HoMij0s6g.text: Ive always been afraid to come here because of the wait. I finally said screw it since we didn't have any plans so we might as well wait.  I ordered the pancakes with a side of bacon and my wife and daughter shared some eggs with hashbrowns and my picky grandma got a cheese omelette.   The pancakes are great but just like any other breakfast place you never get enough butter and syrup. The bacon was the BEST ever and everybody really liked the hasbrowns. you could go eat just the bacon and be happy and leave oh and they strawberry lemonade was really good also. would love to come back.

2R7g44ZqA4x6Xxcmee3Djw.text: If you're looking for a great breakfast spot and don't mind a bit of a wait, Matt's is an excellent choice. The building is pretty small, so there are not many tables, meaning you could be waiting awhile. The food is definitely worth the wait though! I tend to get the pancakes, they are huge and delicious. I always get a cup of coffee, and it is always a good idea. This last time one of my friend's got the chili, and she said it was terrific. I love going to Matt's on Sundays for an after-church brunch, and I would say if you're on that side of town when it's open, go in and get some good food.

cRz0qSPdS1HOuXKr7oUBPQ.text: The honey lemonade is my favorite! Bacon is awesome. The diced potatoes with rosemary and grilled onions are great. My favorite is the blueberry preserves and the thick sourdough toast!

oUY_kszE7oGRh-_cPqAnPQ.text: One of the worst dinning experience of my life. Checked in with a party of three and was told the wait was 20-30mins after waiting almost an hour and a half and watching four other parties get seated before mine (was told no room for a party my size even though they sat a group of three that checked in after us) only to be seated and have our waitress take the order of a party of 8 that was seated after us was the last straw! If your going to go to eat here make sure you have an extra two hours to kill...

o6ko0fFN9X6TE5YPVpxF6Q.text: I remember watching this on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives. I really liked this place. Great food and the staff was great. The wait...More than worth it!

cLGIu_wQ4dE-2-nEx513uA.text: Breakfast in downtown .... the line and wait is worth it.  Wish they had a bigger place !

TVbRvdTT2NS_PaHkAqJdKQ.text: Solid little place. Food was great with a very generous portion and servers were fantastic. Very friendly and inviting

MOOEBs0qlklsMqfAKuSbwg.text: Was visiting Arizona for Spring training and was looking for a country kitchen type of breakfast and omg was this place good! We got some seasoned potatoes that were perfect in every way, my husband got a Belgium waffle that he said tasted amazing (he's a very picky eater), white toast which paired perfectly with the home made jam. The place itself is kind of small and the wait wasn't too long. Customer service was awesome..needless to say, we will be visiting again & recommend it!

DhEJOfeX8xgXimJ-Z6aSiQ.text: This place is the bomb. Came here on vacation and it was worth every penny.   B-Rabbit Approved!!

rzrW68suDpaiQCCQK_p8iw.text: The thick cut bacon is the THING TO GET. It's very crowded, so make sure you have a little extra time just in case. They have different specials every day of the week, so check before you go! The home fries are also delicious, with good spices.  The restaurant is loud, busy, and very casual.

tZ4IHif16vKczLDpbX3oAg.text: My husband and I came here for the first time today and it was amazing! The staff was so friendly I wondered for a second if I knew them. Lol the coffee was nice and hot. The food was delicious, nutritious, fulfilling, so tasty, and the portions are generous. My husband and I eat out a lot. We couldn't decide between Le Grande Orange or Matt's Big Breakfast, as far as which was better. We were so surprised but we loved it!

8FJKEeukPpUsnjkg5324vA.text: My bacon came from the pig in back, the rosemary in the breakfast potatoes came fresh from a garden in back right next to the chicken coop that layed the eggs that went into the waffle mix.....at least in my mind, because that's how fresh all of the ingredients tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dk5kcn9528mhEL8IfIrCXg.text: stopped in today with some friends for lunch and got the scrambled eggs with hash browns, cheese, and sausage.  The hash browns were cooked awesome and the sausage was amazing.    The place is kinda small, and VERY loud (it was pretty busy).  It also has a whole "hippie" feel going on which was a little weird, but i didn't care, the food was good and Our waitress (and almost all the others) were hot!

vN9tTGhf_AQcKqDAvG3q2g.text: I've heard a good number of acquaintances say how good Matt's is so I was glad when a small group of friends wanted to meet here for breakfast.  First I'll say the staff are very friendly. Most everyone I saw made it a point to make eye contact and say hello.  That is so unusual by today's standards.    The coffee was good, much better than typical diner coffee and staff kept our cups full & hot. Each of our breakfasts were hearty and good.  Portions were reasonable and we all walked away full.  I'd describe it as good home cookin' with very fresh ingredients.

cYylFcUiMJjLTuAw5cRYcw.text: I had lunch there last sunday me and my wife had a great time good service great food cant wait to go back there again

m4eyCkkDxShYacfuYwAJrg.text: We go to Matt's Big Breakfast everytime we are in Phoenix. We bring our volleyball team here every year or visit during spring training. As featured on DDD, the pork chops and hamburgers are the best!  Sometimes the son is working. We've watched him grow up. He is too cute! Friendly and efficient service; great food.  Went to Phoenix for Spring Training and discovered Matt's Big Breakfast located in the airport. Most of the favorite dishes are served in addition to more lunch and dinner entrees.

jhzx3Ccht6V9RzUhWofrcw.text: Finally made it in during a weekday, food was good but not worth the wait I see every weekend. Solid breakfast and good seemingly fresh food.  Not affecting the review but I want to mention the waitress not wanting to bring back my change, assuming I'd given them a 25% tip. I was happy to tip that amount and can understand the assumption, but when I ask "where is my change" I was disappointed at the response I got back. I hate to be the guy who writes a food that's less about food, but it left a sour taste to an overhyped staple of downtown Phoenix. Better places, better service.

SDP9XWPNhQmD74rcwKzffw.text: Great breakfast place! Huevos rancheros verde is the most unique and special breakfast I ever had !

jlUjkxT4mrXTL4_6OzCTcA.text: Where do I even start? This place is amazing. My girlfriend and I were visiting Phoenix area, and were always down to try new spots. This place had over 1200 reviews so we decided to give it a try. The menu is limited which is cool with us. Had a decent waiting time which went by super fast. The chops are to die for. The vibe is chill. I can't really speak negatively about Matt's. Anyone reading this...if you're in the area check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d_HF0MG2-j_AP4xnedZTzw.text: Ohmergawd I love the pancakes. I love it enough to wait in line and think its perfectly OK to stand outside in the AZ summer for it. The staff is polite and courteous to a fault. The wait, admittedly is the worst part. However they do have a water dispenser and benches for you while you wait and if you are willing to sit at the bar the wait really isn't that bad. They do use locally sourced cartel coffee and not any of that burnt junk from *sucks so that's an instant win. The coffee refills are pretty much limitless and they keep em comin' which given the amount of coffee I tend to drink is an awesome thing. They even offer to get you a to go cup if you wanted to get coffee to go after you are done eating.   Sure it is tight quarters and it is noisy but none of that is why i docked a star. I wasn't even done eating and my tab was at my table. I didn't ask for it, it just came up. That I thought was lame and hence the 4 stars. Not sure what the deal was but whatever.. i'll still go back.. those pancakes... mmm...yummy !

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BRC56O-TnvmXkzChXYOu_Q.text: Airline layover and Matts is an every-time stop in Phoenix.  No secret, busy with locals.  Give yourself extra time or plan to sit alone at bar top.  Just go with the special, never disappointed, fresh and large servings

vlfcp3gH13eRg0k71oqvlg.text: Breakfast was great I had Saturday special; 3 scrambled eggs with chorizo and cheddar cheese  potatoes  and toast & homemade preserves

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6pM66Ll670q_vsU4FPwYGA.text: While my niece and nephew are on summer break, we want to try new breakfast places. It seemed an obvious choice that this was at the top of our list. We arrived about 10:00 on a Wednesday morning. Even though it was busy, we were seated quickly. The service was efficient and fairly friendly. It was the food that wasn't amazing. We ordered the Wednesday special which was French toast and apple sausage; the Chick and Pig or Hog or something, which was bacon, eggs, toast, and hash browns; another Chick and Pig, this one with an up-charged ham steak and home fries. The pork and apple sausage was too sweet and had a very unpleasant texture. The French toast was ok, but certainly not amazing. My nephew gave it a six on a 1-10 scale. The home fries were lacking texture and were served less than hot. The worst part was that there were sprigs of rosemary cooked with them and on my plate. It was literally all I could smell - not good. The toast was thick and tasty - my niece devoured hers slathered in the house made strawberry jam served with it. The bacon and hash browns were very crispy (bacon was actually black around the edges) and pretty tasty, even if the potatoes needed salt. The scrambled eggs were a hit, too. The ham steak was just that, but much tastier than the sausage. Overall, breakfast was $50 out the door. We all decided it was not worth the cost. Oh, and a huge pet peeve of mine - the iced tea was flavored and we were not warned first. It was not to our liking. And what kind of place only serves RC from a can?? Blech.

YFm9zm5PAf7rP95E79JmlA.text: I don't eat big, traditional American breakfast very often anymore, but I was driving from Phoenix to Los Angeles and wanted something that was going to hold me over. I'd had Hotel breakfast at the Hampton inn the morning before and decided to go out for something instead on my last day in Phoenix. This was definitely a quality experience. The atmosphere, service, as well as the food were top-notch. Everything from the thick cut bacon, well done hash browns, sunny side up eggs and thick-cut sourdough bread with house-made preserves, as well as the coffee were on point. This is only my second time to Phoenix, but if I pass through the area again I'll make it a point to eat at Matt's.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hhnj1qGPNhlm5MrTVTtfVQ.text: I'm not sure what the hype is all about.  Par breakfast, par service, definitely not even the scope of mentionable breakfast.  Nothing stands out, just "meh"

LzFTCsfBejZU8F5sRNtxXg.text: Finally made it to Matt's Big Breakfast! It was a long wait but I appreciated the fruit-infused water dispenser outside. It is not a big place and is VERY noisy inside. There's nothing to absorb the noise so all the talking was like a roar ringing in my ears. Not ideal for chatting with my family. I ordered the bacon, eggs, potatoes, and toast. The food came out quickly. The homemade jam for the toast was really good. I did NOT like the potatoes as they had rosemary which ruined the taste for me. Their ketchup was even different. More of a marinara sauce consistency. It helped the potatoes but couldn't save them. I wish I had gotten the hash browns because they looked really good... But sadly I don't see a reason to return.

iBNvuuuuGwGs6hgBx-tCAw.text: This is possibly the best breakfast spot in the Valley! The service is outstanding and the place is neat, very pleasing spot especially the location. This wouldn't be a review without the food appreciation right? Well the breakfast didn't disappoint at, I was pleased with the quality and presentation of the food it self! Although coffee is a must its not as hot as I wanted it to be. I recommend this spot for those who likes to eat breakfast at anytime of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

snG6PocTE2ub6jI157qALw.text: Fantastic food and superb service! The whole staff here works as a well-oiled machine.   I had the breakfast special egg scramble and it was hands-down the best breakfast I've had so far in Phoenix. I'll definitely be back!

UqXujGothd3B9DKF3ZLyfg.text: Another disappointment. I ordered the special while my friend ordered the cheese omelette with mushrooms. She said the potatoes were not fully cooked and the flavor was only so so. My 3 egg scramble with chicken sausage and hash brown were okay but nothing to share with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8p91O2WP85wg5Y9MUTHPiQ.text: First went to Matt's after I saw it on DDD, now, it's my go-to for breakfast when in PHX! I'm a breakfast guy, and all of theirs are top notch, be sure and try the jam! Go early, it gets busy, and rightfully so!

uVwyhdjnme5hJasDaTz23Q.text: I would change the name to Matt's Tasty Breakfast, or Matt's Delicious Breakfast, for it was both those things, but Big it was not. Maybe I am use to a Midwest breakfast, which truly is big. It was a very good breakfast, and it was enough that I didn't leave hungry, but I also didn't have leftovers.  I had a daily special which was an omelette with veggies and a side of potatoes. The toast and jam were fantastic!! Everything was delicious! They also have a house made hot sauce that is wonderful. I am not usually a hot sauce fan but this was so tasty and just the right amount of heat. It is a consistently good breakfast!

R_TBPcM_wz1EzNRHw3XQYA.text: Mediocre at best. This was my 2nd visit to this location and I feel they have slipped. The wait to be seated wasn't bad but the wait for our food was terrible, people who ordered after us got their food first. It wasn't like we had a big party there was only two of us. I was less than impressed with my omelet, the bacon was good and the potatoes were seasoned well and the sourdough bread was good. Nothing to write home about. I doubt I'll be back anytime soon. I make a better breakfast at home.

cgb7AAIZaT0YIW9sKlHMfQ.text: We walked here from the Hyatt on 2nd Street and it was an easy stroll. We queued up and got a few coffees to lift the early morning haze from our brains. That was some super tasty java, I must say. Great start.   We ordered the Waffle (well done) and Peppered Bacon and also the Skinny eggs with the side salad and apple chicken sausage and spinach mixed in with a single pancake side.   Holy Mother of Waffle Nirvana!!! I am still dreaming of that first crunchy, tender, savory and slightly sweet Waffle. It literally blew my doors off. The bacon was perfectly salty and peppery next to the sweet syrup. Ahhhhhh ... easily an addiction.   The skinny egg dish silenced my partner for a good five minutes except for the mumbled "Oh my gosh, this is sooooooo good" in between forkfuls of steaming hot eggs with gooey cheese and sauteed spinach punctuated by occasional "pancakes so amazing" ... and a sound that was almost an unintelligible bleat for the lemon dressed arugula salad.   Seriously good breakfast, folks. Service outstanding. Prices totally reasonable. Almost every table around us had at least one order of the Sunday Special Steak and Eggs. The steaks looked nice and plump and juicy and folks really seemed to enjoy them.   MBB is located near the University and I imagine there is a line around the block to get in here when schools in session. We had to wait 20 mins on Fathers Day which wasn't bad at all. Guess that might explain all of the Steak and Egg orders.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle with Bacon - Waffle ordered well done and it was perfection!!

FvyDgrnSH0NljJf9vlSmWA.text: A good place for breakfast. Staples foods made quite deliciously. Atmosphere is fun, but the acoustics are quite good and the place can get a bit noisy without being too full.  Excellent service and good value for the money

6b_lXbjOcCanmt32ldUgkw.text: This was the first time I've been to this place and I gotta say I wasn't disappointed. It's kinda small inside, and I was debating on staying when I was told there was a 20 min wait, but I'm glad I didn't leave! I got the Saturday special (eggs, chorizo and potatoes) which was 12 bucks a plate. Kinda pricy but I feel like it was worth it. The flavors were outstanding!! The soda I didn't care for, we basically paid $2 for an RC cola can. Orange juice was about 3.50 so I didn't get that. The servers were extremely fast and there was always someone who was available for help. I'd definitely come back to this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hqzWdljfn0mJD4X-_aJLcA.text: The Food quality and flavor is good, but it's definitely overpriced and the portions are small.

-H7DNUI2qtvrPaC1CWw_iA.text: Besides the wait everything was better than expected, the plates were more then a belly full and the service top notch. We ended up in the front room and was nice considering how busy it was. If u have four or less wait for the front room it is quiet and the cashier pays a littler more attention to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nvXrVnA0ZRZxAkIU7-4_mQ.text: Came here today with friends that were visiting from San Diego. The wait for a table was about 45 minutes when we went. They have nice seating out front and they also supply fruit infused water with little paper cups while you wait. The 45 minutes went by quickly and we were seated at a table in the back by the daily specials wall. For drinks, ordered the strawberry honey lemonade and that was amazing! The drink was refreshing and not too sweet with great strawberry flavor. I could seriously drink these all day long. For breakfast, I ordered the waffles which came with thick bacon. The bacon was thick cut and was cooked perfectly for me.. nice crunch but not burnt. The bacon seemed to be peppered whatever the seasoning the taste was good. The waffles had a good flavor to them but I wished my waffle had a nice and crisp outside with the fluffy inside. The entire waffle was soft which made me a little sad but it still tasted good. I tried some of my friend's hash browns and that was delicious! They were clearly browned in butter and had a really nice buttery taste to them and they were perfectly textured. Great crispy outside. I also tried another friend's home fries and those were delicious as well. They had a very distinct buttery rosemary taste. Another tasty item I sampled was the strawberry jam that came with the toast. It wasn't too sweet at all and had a creamy texture to it. I wish that I had that option for my waffles instead of the syrup because I don't like syrup and the jam was scrumptious.   The staff was really friendly and attentive. My boyfriend's coffee was never empty. They would continuously refill without us having to ask. They were super busy and still had great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tcoFDxW8LZv2OYk41tIRNw.text: We came to Matt's Big Breakfast on a Friday around 8:30. It was packed, but we were seated without a wait. I had the skinny which was chicken sausage, egg whites, spinach and cheese scramble served with a side salad. Dining Partner had the cheese omelet with home fries. The hash browns would have been the way to go. Good service, food came out quickly. Solid breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix.

kz4UtcOPMNPmy2Dvtto_TQ.text: Plenty of parking. They were busy but would not seat us till everyone  showed up . There was a 30 minutes  wait . The portions were large . I ordered bacon to small stack. The pan cakes  were a little  sweet so I did not use any syrup  just a little  bitter . Bacon was a little  overcooked  and  on the small size.. it was good experience  . Good service

075Igfg05yotCtHYF4siBg.text: Always a great place to grab breakfast when I'm in town. Food is always great and very fresh. Great service and very friendly staff. Always looking forward to the special of the day.

S7pyCacAAMD3IARc9fG1Yw.text: Amazing breakfast! The wait wasn't too bad and the food some of the best I've ever had. Oh and the fresh orange juice, OMG!

_ONcUT0hho4vNpHZQL56-A.text: The only thing big about this restaurant is the disappointment. It's rather sad that this place has so many stars because this means people here do not know any better. I have lived all over the country and can honestly say that Phoenix has the worst food of any major city in America. The food at Matt's was ok, but not impressive in any way. Any Coney Island back East would put this restaurant to shame.

l24jurN24fmx_cChTywQfg.text: Meh.... I have wanted to try this spot for a long time. I'm glad I did but I won't necessarily come back. We were seated pretty quickly and the service was quick and friendly.   Cons: menu is very limited and the food, well the food was just okay. Nothing special. And it was kinda overpriced for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Busy entrance. But service is efficient

rj4Dp8P92Mn_kFmh-9aEwQ.text: As a food lover, I don't ever get the "lighter" versions of food at restaurants, but Matt's Skinny sounded great and it was great!   First off, let me say, bottomless coffee for a little less than $3 - that's a steal! But off to the food, I got their Skinny, which is a four egg whites scramble with spinach, applewood chicken sausage, and a side salad. No skimping on flavors, but still light and actually very large!  On the side, I got their house made toast (sourdough, wheat, or rye) with also, house made, strawberry preserves. Huge, full strawberries, I tell ya.   Did not fail to impress at all!

enf5D_gMhke4gtsrGtxdbw.text: Breakfast is consistently good! I usually get the ham and cheese omelette with potatoes. My favorite part is the buttery sourdough bread with homemade strawberry jam. It's the main reason why I come to this place. It's amazing!  There's usually a wait time but we've never had to wait more than 15 minutes. The food is always out surprisingly fast and most of the servers are really nice.

nQ0F4BpJJfyG59mlMscxDg.text: Good breakfast place! Fresh and simple ingredients on the plate that was great tasting! No GF exchange available. Was able to get a slice of tomato instead of toast. GF option would have been a 5 star rating. Reasonable prices!

SjmtdfPQiJ90YkZVUFwyHw.text: I mean- for $12 dollars I definitely expected more than this. Called to place a to-go order. Ordered 2 skinny's and a five spot. We asked to sub the "simple salad" on one of the skinny's for potato's- which was not a problem. Asked to sub the simple salad on the other order for bacon was told they could not do that. Period. Um, okay. Why tho? It was weird. She seemed very bothered by the requests I was making. We pick up the food... and everything was super cold. I know it was to go so I didn't expect it to be super hot either. But the food felt like it came from the fridge. The simple salad is exactly that SIMPLE! They just dumped greens in the box. For the price of the skinny I expected more and I also expected better customer service. Not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bC_iEN4FC83hw4q1OOiR8w.text: Fantastic eggs Benedict.  Friendly and attentive service.  The hash browns excelled well beyond the half fried mush that most places serve.  Crispy on the ends but not overdone.  Just right.

PJMoazUdB3GvxF4SVqc5jg.text: I love this place! The food is delicious and they are on top of their game. I've eaten here a couple of times and each time the food was delicious and the bacon is amazing. I always liked bacon but typically, bacon is bacon but not here- this bacon is amazing! The staff is great and they work well together like a well oiled machine. You will not be disappointed if you try Mikes Big Breakfast!

aWUCSPopX1HfphEraZZfHA.text: This place was excellent ! We came in on a Tuesday morning - there was a bowl game at Chase field so it was fairly busy. Our wait was around 25-30 minutes. Coffee was good and food was even better ! I had a basic eggs and bacon plate with hash browns and it was very good. The other people in my party had biscuits and gravy and waffles. I should have ordered the biscuits and gravy because these looked amazing ! Service was outstanding and the food lived up to the hype ! If ever in downtown Phoenix check this place out !

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xQcXDfQ4RVSCe6S1VrwF5w.text: Yum Yum Yum. The pancakes are the best and that peppered bacon is to die for. Go just go and you will see why it's the best.

xaaUiBgrGiYjSZp3T27xOQ.text: Simple breakfast, but very very yummy!   We walked in just after 8am on a Sunday, which was perfect - the place wasn't packed yet and we were able to be seated right away. By the time we left (about 9am) every table was taken and there was a wait.    I ordered the belgian waffle with a side of hash browns and fresh squeezed orange juice. Everything was so good!  I would definitely return again soon!

9uE9L7uzTptpQZSF_7_erA.text: Fact: Matt's Big Breakfast has pretty much ruined breakfast for me for all of eternity. Since first trying it a few years back, I've found that it's done so exceptionally well that I'm constantly making comparisons between Matt's and every other breakfast place in Phoenix. And my conclusion remains consistent:  Absolutely no one compares.  Thriving off of simplicity in a similar manner to Pizzeria Bianco, Matt's doesn't need 500 different types of pancakes, all with varying amounts of rubbish dumped all over them. Blasting thumpy music, making up stupid names for omlettes, or serving up liquor in the AM as a means to be "edgy" are all silly gimmicks that are absolutely unnecessary when your food tastes like this. The fact is, when your food is good, you don't need tricks and tactics in order to compensate. Keep the choices minimal, the dishes fairly traditional, and the quality high and you have an automatic formula for success. Don't believe me? Look at the lines on the weekend.  Practically all foods you find here are either homemade or outsourced locally. I'm told there's no freezer and technically, if food is fresh, isn't that the way it should be? I typically order the Hog & Chick, scrambling up my eggs with one or two of their cheeses. The bacon, which comes from the Pork Shop in Queen Creek, is thick, juicy, peppered, and absolutely fabulous. There is no bacon I've found that even comes close. Add in some hash browns (extra crispy) that have butter cooked directly into them, some toast that's complimented by homemade jam that's personally made by Matt's wife, and you're pretty much covered for a great morning meal. The jam can also be purchased separately by the jar for home use. Even their orange juice and honey lemonades impress!  The Five Spot, which is a sandwich that combines some of the ingredients I just mentioned, is also worth trying. Although I prefer being able to appreciate these foods individually rather than combining them all. Their griddlecakes and waffle are excellent, being served with syrup that's actually hot (other places should take note of this). Although I don't regularly order either, as they come at the expense of missing out on the smaller side dishes (unless your stomach has the extra space).  Service is good, food is great, and parking is a pain (an unwritten legal requirement for all good restaurants near downtown). I've been told they have a great lunch, but with breakfast this good, I don't think I have I'll ever have the willpower to order anything lunch-related.  French toast, which is strangely absent from the permanent menu, is actually a special on Wednesdays and also worth checking out.   Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast Special with Bacon!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Lemonade
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog &amp; Chick with home fries

EcFFnZo1rUvG5AcQIs4bhw.text: Was told this was a "must do" for brunch in Phoenix - wait was about 45 mins for 3 people.  The 5 spot and hash browns came highly recommended by Russ, the bartender at Bitter & Twisted.    I would say the overall sandwich was good, the bacon was good, the roll was ok and the hashbrowns, while crispy on both sides, was runny in the middle!  Not great.  My sister had the home fries and said it was delish.  The honey lemonade was really good though.  Service was nice and efficient but I think overall, not worth the hype and/or wait.

7fE-r3JRBvMfNS4XjzwkcA.text: I had a great experience at Matt's big breakfast. Amber was at the front door helping everyone with seating, she had a great smile and wonderful personality. She seated us in a timely manner. The food was outstanding and also the waitress her name was Ashley she was very helpful and food so good, home fries where the best I've ever had thanks for having my husband and I.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazingly good

c28YyUtXuBH6eYlc61nmxw.text: Food was not great. Frustrated with the giant pancakes and the minuscule amount of syrup. Asked for more and they charge $1.50 for another thimble if syrup. I remember eating at the old location and enjoying it. Not any more.  I will not come back here again.

8lPVr3RRpXPkuBoCRc3JWg.text: no words. no comments. just a perfect place.

-wLhCNYm6wBAAZPBZtbHwQ.text: Honestly, I don't understand why there are so many devotees. Imo, Matt's is good, but not *great*.  The lack of veggie options for omelets and in general needs improvement (this coming from an omnivore).  Honestly, I can make a better spinach, tomato, onion and provolone omelet at home for 3-4 bucks rather than spending ten (!) for their omelet with mushrooms, onions, and roasted peppers.  The hashbrowns are hashbrowns, not "omg, the BEST hashbrowns I've ever had". (seriously?)  I've lived about a half mile away for a little over a year and have only eaten there maybe two times.  There's no way in hell I'd wait over an hour to get in-- that's friggin' absurd.  Not being a contrarian, just really don't understand all the hype.  It seems as if it's one of those places that people feel the need to support at any cost because it has a reciprocal 'awareness and responsibility' factor that people love to tout as an indication of their good taste and discrimination..  (is it local? is it free range? is it local free range? if it's not, I won't eat there..  Can I get a dossier on the hen who laid my eggs?)  *yawn*  Hipster, please.   In my estimation, waaaaaay overrated.

Kk1j26o89-o-JY-_yFwrEQ.text: Wonderful place for breakfast, recommended as a must by Sheraton, and they were not wrong! I travel extensively and this is as good as it gets......great food, excellent service, wonderful teamwork by entire staff. Every dish ordered was unique and surprisingly good. Only complaint was the wait, but it is definitely worth the wait.

57VXvXIVcuYIYUL10uiA1w.text: Really good food, nice atmosphere, and very friendly service!

V93H-fLrqKO9aJN3148C_g.text: Best Breakfast ever!!!!! Try the pancakes or "griddlecakes"- they won't fail! Sweet and tasty!!

nRHXkV7maA8YGuIKP5GgQw.text: We tried to get to breakfast here 3 times, and this last week we finally got in.  Matt's has moved to a bigger location, and the old location will be for take out.  The pork chop was delicious, along with the eggs, potatoes, bread and homemade jam.  However there is always a wait.  I guess I can compare this to Martannes in Flagstaff.  They have both been written up in A Z Highways.  We were in the area for 2 nights and ate breakfast at Matt's both mornings.

9_TW48vGH40So-YOEwFyrw.text: People have been raving about this place to me for the past five years.  I finally made it.  I could smell fresh  hashbrowns and pancakes cooking in the parking lot.  The pancakes were great, the hashbrowns were made to perfections.  The food is wholesome for the most part.  I ordered the special which was sausage and spinach.  The eggs were too buttery and watered down.  This was probably do to the fact the spinach was cooked down with too much fluids.  Instead of flipping the eggs so they were fluffy it appeared as the cooked took the end of the spatula and chopped the eggs.  Big mistake.  Orange juice was nice and fresh.  Overall is was not a bad meal but not the hype people made it up to be.  I met the owner who was very very nice.  She seemed to know how her food was cooked.  I just wish she looked at my plate before it went out.  The wait staff was not overly friendly and seemed a little blah for being a Monday morning.  Over all it was ok but not worth waiting in a long line like they normally have.  There are plenty of other places who will do a mediocre job and have better waitstaff.

Df8jnNZUXYZCk2VJLAfEmw.text: I love breakfast and I'm a fan of visiting places from the show Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives show so I had to check out this spot. There was a long line to wait when my sisters and I showed up and wondered if it was worth standing in the summer heat for. Our thoughts were "Come on, how good can you really make breakfast???" My doubts were all erased the moment I bit into their delicious golden waffle! Apparently, they can make breakfast so good that it is worth waiting outside in the heat for an hour!!! And the joy continued...the thick cut peppered bacon was awesome as well as their sourdough toast. They have a homemade preserve to put on the toast that changes all the time since they buy local and seasonal produce. I have had their strawberry and plum preserves with the sourdough toast. Just mouth watering thinking about it. One of my sisters had the pork chop with pesto. Delish!!! And I am not usually a fan of pork chops. I have been there 4 times now and recommend it  to anyone!  One piece of advice: the best case scenario is to go as a party of 2 since so you might get seated quicker ;)

_9gzW38i7IJgvZLnqSOaoA.text: This place is amazing!! Anytime my husband and I talk about going to breakfast Matt's comes to mind.  The food as always been on spot... very fresh, cooked perfectly and very tasty! The orange juice is freshly squeezed and they always have homemade jam and one different flavor for the day, the blueberry is outstanding! The pancakes are the best I have ever had in my life, fluffy and melt in your mouth! The portions are big, so be ready to eat.  The price's are a bit higher than most, but your getting local, organic ingredients that are cooked to perfection!!  The service is great and the staff is very friendly.  I would have to say, the only downfall to Matt's is the location, it is pretty small (but bigger than the last location they had) and the parking is extremely minimal! There have been a few times the wait is pretty long, but WELL WORTH IT!!  They do have a lunch menu (opened till 2pm) but we have not tried the other menu items, although it is on our to-do list...its always the breakfast for us! I highly recommend Matt's, get down there and be ready to grub!

Xm1O-nLpaDrBgLDWyRrJBw.text: So good! Food is always fresh, good portions and service is always fast. Best part is, breakfast is served all day!!  And if you enjoy a good Bloody Mary from time to time, this place really knows how to serve them up. Ask for the house Bloody Mary with their famous crispy bacon! Amazing!!

yUnpqVa01B5Hf8iOlaGoLw.text: Food was great, but the service and concept is weird. Wasn't walked to our table to be seated instead we were pointed in a general direction and actually guessed what table to sit at.  Server 1 takes our drink order leaves the table, server 2 come and asks us what we want to drink (less than a minute after the other left), server 3 (again as soon as server 2 left) asks us what we want to drink. I'm still confused. Had to get our coffee replaced 3 times because again no communication that we had decaf (told every server that came though!) Got our food then was given our check right away, felt very rushed out. After all the hype, was super disappointed. Probably wont be returning because the confusion wasnt worth the drive from Gilbert.

xcs7VQOyQ0pMTT1GhNhaNA.text: Amazing place. I've only been here once and I always recommend it to people. I STILL drool over the coffee creamer. No joke probably the best I've ever had. Coming back here shortly!

TIth4Ksk6fIvNq172eRsRQ.text: I like to go too restaurants that have four or more stars. I usually get a good meal and enjoy the visit. This was not the case at Matt's. The way this place is run is outside the normal. We had a seat at the counter and our order was taken by a waitress not the person behind the counter. When orders would come up at the window, it was very obvious that the person behind the counter had no idea who the order belonged too. This resulted in plates set in front of the wrong customers. We watch my wife's order set for five or more minutes till it arrived. My order set for a couple minutes until the person behind the counter had to ask the waitress who it belonged to. As expected the meals were cold. Not only that but the food was three to four stars at the best. Coffee was cold and we made a comment to the person behind the counter. She was able to make fresh pots but again with a delay. A place with this good of a rating should be able to handle a full house but it didn't. Service was poor but friendly until you got to the cashier. And that is a story for another day but not another visit. Oh my wife's toast was given to person down the counter.

cVn5FRjYDIzHVfvgcB4faQ.text: This place has the best breakfast and super reasonable.  I make it a point of going here every time I come to Phoenix.  I don't like coming to Phoenix but this place makes the medicine go down.  The bacon is insane!  The servers are great and you can get seated in a reasonable amount of time - 30 mins. on a Sunday during prime time.  My only complaint was the coffee was weak.  Totally surprised because I thought they served Stumptown, Intelligentsia, or something along that ilk.    I saw a review that said they didn't serve non-dairy milk.  Matt, I think you should offer almond milk or soy creamer.  It's really not that big of a deal.  Better yet why don't you MAKE your own almond milk.  I am totally confident you can make us proud.  Don't get me wrong because I don't think it's a restaurant's duty to cater to EVERY type of patron unless it makes business sense.  You do everything else so well why not be the only dog in town to be all things to all people.  Just sayin'............

iVZd5HWUKTX1AwzemqQuTw.text: Cute spot. Great location. I never understood how a place can mess up traditional breakfast plates so 5 stars bc I love breakfast pretty much anywhere and anytime!

L-aOOUJnzwC2SySo9NMIww.text: Amazing! This place is what breakfast is all about! Everything was amazing. Me and my sister both had the pork chops! Pork chops for breakfast!!!!! There was nothin left when we were done! The food came out quick the wait was short! Next time I'm in town I will definitely be stopping here.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chops w/eggs over easy an home fries! Delicious!

cHJViXTE_yAyZeheXjRORQ.text: Good breakfast, a tad over-hyped. Big portions and a good deal. GOOD, fresh juice! Would definitely go back. However it's always packed and there is normally a wait. Tried weekdays to avoid the rush but it's just a hot spot! Work checking out for sure. Be prepared to spend a little time. Staff was wonderful!

eq2f_cNisjaZHHaJ5NdVxg.text: Been here several times now and it is soooo good. The wait can be obnoxious, but once you start eating, you know why. Its a got a nice menu that covers a variety of flavors and the service is pretty fast. The money is in the food though. Ridiculous waffles at this place. The bacon is amazing as well. I'll def keep coming back.

cqEub5bbTEz-eOQ9JzjyHw.text: So good!  You will wait to get in, but you'll want to spend at least as much time savoring each bite of your meal.  Everything's super fresh, the coffee tastes great, the staff's super quick and friendly.  What more can I say!    I ordered the Belgian Waffle on a whim and it was light, sweet and perfectly filling.  I totally missed the specials on the board, but I'm using that as an excuse to get back in there for another breakfast--like, really soon!

3AUwHCza0OZ4UhDPKXyfqg.text: This is the place other breakfast spots aspire to be. With incredible ingredients, top notch preparation and even better service this is truly a Phoenix gem. Owned and operated by Matt and Ernie, their family atmosphere and attention to detail assure a perfect visit every time. DON'T MISS IT!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect breakfast at the counter!!! Thank you Matt and Ernie!!!

dlltfkROeQMczyrj-QMpiA.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing experience! On the weekends they are very busy - probably about a 20-30 minutes wait, but it's worth it! I have tried the eggs and bacon, the Reuben sand which, and their scramble special with sausage... All of them were superb!

CgK0kOObHet1-MaiZYS5mA.text: Amazing place. Very charming and the servers are very nice. It was a long wait but it's only expected... busy means good food. I have their sirloin steak special. It was delicious. They make their own jam and you can taste the love cause it was to die for. They make their own bread and thick cut and you can tell it's healthy. I'm glad we took the time to look where to eat in this area.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

evk1HuNTZkEiuXxUS2UnIQ.text: We were in Phoenix visiting relatives and met for brunch.  I had the 'fav 5' or something like that... it's a breakfast sandwich.  Best $5 breakfast sandwich I ever had.  Everyone else seemed to like the food and all of us said we would eat here again.    Food: Good food.  Worth the wait!    Service: Good service.    The complaints: We were seated in the stock room.  We were constantly interrupted when they needed to get into the fridge and the room itself was very warm.  The main part of the restaurant seemed cooler, but louder.  Even so we would still recommend this place.

Q_aB2azfTc8Sd3U9ejRtfg.text: This place was Amazing. A little busy but really great food and perfect portions. The only complaint I would have is it was a little cramped but again they were pretty busy

3uYUnYkwW0uSFNsReWICyw.text: One of those places where "nobody goes there anymore" because "it's too busy". Classic.  Waiting around for a table and ordered right away. servers were all very busy so a coffee refill and getting the check was a bit tricky but the food made it totally worth it.

8lE-AxDH11Tcpu_VWewaSw.text: Amazing breakfast! Very busy place, that's why I had to try it out. Can't wait to go back.

BT63VRnWKbFX1O48kggXYA.text: It finally happened! After an eternity we finally got to visit Matt's on a day (Veteran's Day to be exact) when the line was only about 10 minutes long. We've been hesitant about the new location after years of eating at the original location, would the new location totally suck, would the food be different, would it be "downtown cold and impersonal"? We had this fear that Matt's had hit the big time and that old comfy place was gone forever.  Well, not so. The area when you first walk in has an uncanny feeling that you are in the old Matt's. The same is True with that weird little closed off room in the front; it had a lot of memories of that weird little closed off room to the left when you walked into the old Matt's. The big dining room has the biggest changes, and guess what? I didn't dislike it. It had that loud high-school cafeteria feeling to it still, tables packing in tight, funky but not pretentious (hard to do). The overworked staff was just as much "family" as in the old Matt's. The menu looked identical, the prices looked about the same, the portions were ... okay, not so "big" as I recall. Big yes compared to Denny's for about the same price (eeech, like someone would actually choose Denny's) but to my memory not quite so overwhelming as it used to be.  Bottom line: the "new" Matt's is still Matt's to me. I'm flexible and I can adapt.  My rating is still zero stars, hated it, horrible food and service, cockroaches in the food, a place even a homeless person wouldn't eat for free ... that "rating" is for the newbies. Please stay away until us locals have had our leisurely meal at Matt's, then make your reservation for, um let's say, about 2 AM on a Tuesday and get your butt out of there in 5 minutes or less to leave some tables for us "Matt-afficionados".  Biggest NEGATIVE? They deleted all of the old reviews just because they moved to the other end of the same block. BOO!  That to me is just kind of chickenshit. If you want to be so pretentious, change your frigging name. Otherwise just man up to the fact that a review for Matt's Big Breakfast should be a review forever. You lost a whole star for that crap, Matt.

IFSLv9ZxzUSk_bHuh2cAvQ.text: LOVE this place! Gets packed on weekends so I try to make it a weekday treat!

AknKeYCVui8kacw6tyqw4w.text: I dont know how the breakfast is, but the "Mamacita Burger" (could be Diablo) was fantastic. Perfect medium rare, jalipeno's kick'in it. Great flavor and perfect with a Kilt Lifter Scottish ale to help smolder the beast of burger!   Nice job Chef!

jJIbM6eOTZuMkLTQBLeYxA.text: Man this place is packed but the turn over and service is impeccable. Came here and had a special eggs with chorizo jalapeno and white cheddar yummy!!   My friend had a waffle. It was really rich and good as well. Their bacon is thick and wonderful. Hash browns could have been cooked longer but that's ok.   Overall I would definitely come back.

0MZa1dShrdrlzcLYWJ0yIQ.text: Besides the fact that they are using cage free eggs and all natural chicken, pork and beef, I'm not too sure what all the rave is about. I wasn't impressed with the service or the food. It's actually really basic and there's not really much to choose from the breakfast menu. I ordered the cheese omelette with onions and for some reason the whole thing was super watery. I get there may have been a little oil or something from the onions but watery eggs are not really appetizing. I couldn't even finish my plate. My boyfriend ordered the pancakes, which aren't anything special or fluffy like other breakfast places we've been to. It's always so busy here so it's more like an assembly line and I feel like the servers are trying to get you out of there so they can seat more people. Don't come here if you are a slow eater or don't want to wait longer.

J3ah69sretG62QbRtom9ug.text: Had a great breakfast this weekend.  Downtown Phx... fun vibe. We had 8 in our party but didn't wait long... got the little private room in front window.  Had the bfast sandwich... $5.95! Very good.. bread was awesome..DEF ..get the potatoes vs the hashbrowns. YUM. Homemade jelly made me order toast... glad i food.  Cool little place very reasonable.

rYJohlX0AjGEBnhkubAo6Q.text: It's worth avoiding LAX layovers just for this restaurant.  They have some awesome cocktails and even better food.  I love the waffle and thick bacon.  They also have an amazing grilled cheese.  Everything tastes really good and its very reasonably priced.

BA8JukkRvp511SofpTgedA.text: We got seated right away waitress was polite and food was awesome we will definitely be back

3WLNPcnPOUm9eFVNt0CJ7A.text: Excellent customer service! There was no wait at 9am on a Tuesday morning. I tried their daily special which did not disappoint.

X6jFgzTap4Owp4i9933tmg.text: Read all the reviews about the best breakfast ever. I have to say it was a neat place. They have the best toast and best strawberry jam I've ever had.. I regret not trying the Honey Straweberry Lemondae. I ordered the Chop and Chick. aka a Pork Chop with eggs over easy and hashbrowns. The pork chop had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. The eggs and hashbrowns were your average eggs and hasbrowns, nothing special. I would go back here just for the toast and jam, it's that good.

7VvfUt82F3qLqs5SuHkUKA.text: We had time in Phoenix before a flight and decided to stop at Matt's Big Breakfast for brunch. My boyfriend had the special; something scrambled with jalapenos. I had the belgium waffle and I will say it was pretty delicious. The only thing I wasn't sure about was the coffee (just decent) and they charged for everything extra. It came off as a little "trendy".  I'm cool with charging extra if you have to, but it gives off the wrong vibe. I also dislike when places only have "RC Cola" and no other soda choices - but that is totally just me! haha

obvV4NcWeALv_ab4nmPhZw.text: Awesome spot in Phoenix! Check the specials first before you order. They are definitely worth a look! Jalapeno enchilada scramble was awesome

32tkPxTE8ZagiJHqkzsmgA.text: The Chop and Chix was pretty good. The sourdough toast was huge and thick and the home fries were delicious. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of seasoning on the meat. It's as though they didn't use any salt. The Blueberry lemonade was amazing!! It reminded me of being down South.

63jbjxoHniasih4Jv6e-cQ.text: Spotty service - but friendly staff. Everything was fresh and great tasting. Order the ham off the bone.

i4lqIKvINJFyonzQ39W1HA.text: THE BEST EVERYTHING. I love how they use REAL maple syrup and just real ingredients in general. I live in Tempe but the boy and I go the extra mile to come here. Love breakfast food and LOVE Matt's!

1k3Bf9h8DdcxZlpjFQmIQQ.text: High quality breakfast place. Generally get the hash browns, omelette, and toast. The vegetarian options aren't vast but they're all delicious, and the belgian waffle is a rare treat when I feel like ruining my gym routine. That said, waiting for a table is almost always kind of awful, and the wait staff rarely radiates kindness. It's really good food, so it's often worth it, but it's certainly not perfect. Probably still the best breakfast joint in Phoenix tho.

TKDMPD1w6UucRZ6rrn1T8g.text: FRESHEST ORANGE JUICE EVER.  How many places have you been to where someone writes about the toast? Even the big fatty piece of toast we got was incredible.  Only had to wait about 15 minutes on a really busy Tuesday (yes, really busy Tuesday) morning.   Weird quick tip to add: if you are seated on the stools, you kind of slide off if you don't sit back far enough.

EtAwqs7cusXnXhwwO36DkA.text: Put my name on the list and was told it's a 30 minute wait. Ok, it's a pretty good waffle so I'll wait.
