After 45 minutes I start to see other people asking where they are on the list as apparently their time had expired as well. I ask how much longer and was told there's 11 people ahead of me??  How can there be 11 people ahead of me after 45 minutes into a 30 minute wait?  I know wait times are approximate, but 30 minutes vs 1 hour and 15 minutes isn't a mistake, it's a lack of knowledge or ability of their staff. For that reason alone, I'll never go back and will be sure to warn anyone who ever mentions this place.

XwiY7_pQ5grEyz05ondBPA.text: Oh that pork chop is going to haunt my dreams.    I have never had such an a,a zingy flavored pork chop.   The hash browns were tasty and crisp.  We also had eggs, which were cooked perfectly...sunny side up and scrambled.   The special was biscuits and gravy, they were amazing.   The gravy had a slight spice and the biscuits were creamy and flaky.   It was well worth the 1:2 hour wait.

t71N0d22GU4OoPKb80QJAQ.text: Always the best! Love Matts Big Breakfast! I go here with my mother and then to Easleys Fun Shop for Halloween shopping. It's a tradition.

JeABuYB-sn_vUiHUO_XveA.text: Perfect time to come and no line out the door. Great service, delicious specialty foods and cool temperatures. Hell Yeah!

Pc436mMA1-TxlRgzMe6bxQ.text: Four stars for Matt's Big Breakfast is high praise. I'm selective with my enthusiastic brunch recommendations. This is the kind of place that will appeal naturally to men.   Portions were large and lines were long. Even on a Monday morning at 9 am, we waited on a table for two seemingly forever before ultimately taking a seat at the bar. Judging by all the baseball paraphernalia on fellow patrons, Spring Training and the World Baseball Classic were clearly a major influencing factor on the crowds. Perhaps other times of the year will be slower? I can't imagine trying to land a table on a weekend.   As for the food, I liked my omelete but the hash browns were the standout. I am almost frightened by what must have been done to the hash browns to get them to taste so good.

O7NdqNSLHATYBAgLb3bbGQ.text: This doesn't belong in an airport. If you only have 45 minutes to connect you won't make it.   We ended up getting it to go and barely got our flight. Others had to just leave without their food.

5OdiFZx2NvdemA9rVH4-Bw.text: Ate at the Matt's in the airport, excellent food! Will go to the downtown location when I get back to Phoenix!

W8z21FdpjEnSwNkXEiJ7SQ.text: Sorry folks I just didn't get what all hub hub is about , it wasn't bad but it was nothing to get excited about. To tell you the Hod's honest truth I have had better breakfast at some local Greek diners and with bigger portions to boot. Maybe I went in with great expectations after reading the reviews and catching the Guy's triple D show, and was expecting manna from the God's. I had to chuckle when our name was called and proceeded to the hostess where we expected to be walked to our table but instead she pointed to a far away table and were told to it there, I guess there's a first time for everything. I would give Matt's a middle of the road review and it's worth a try if your in the area, but I for one would never wait more then 15 minutes to be seated it's just not the old.

uwXNyG25JL7yhbna2OJ0og.text: Good breakfast. I think they could tell I was not a local. They have individual Window bar where I sat. The stools were not fitting my butt. Very slippery.  I was surprised at 10:00 the place was packed.  Staff was very friendly.  I went with the hash browns instead of home fries.  One egg and one griddle cake.   Very good combination.  I really enjoyed the warm syrup.

U2uJ7KuUfvT2CLaJXsFt1Q.text: Delish!! I went here with a friend a few weeks ago on a Sunday. We were expecting a huge wait but luckily we just beat the Sunday church rush. The menu is simple, but it definitely works. The waffle was amazing! I personally hate bacon, but even that looked delicious. It isn't just another breakfast chain down the street, it is really about quality food. I will definitely be back :)

N8VS9UHjo2WZMBzFZpLfow.text: After hearing such glowing reviews, my boyfriend and I got up super early to be there when Matt's opens. We were underwhelmed. The service was fine. The ambiance was fine too. We just didn't think it was anything special. For a place called Matt's Big Breakfast, I didn't think the breakfasts were very big, and neither were the options. It wasn't bad-it just wasn't great.

AOgnJEY0AmJYph6rYIkEiw.text: I bet the food is great. It's too bad we didn't get to that point. My friend an I arrived a few minutes before meeting our other friend so we sat at the bar because we were kinda in a hurry. We saved her a seat and expected her any minute. Now, as far as I've ever been told about dining customs, is that the bar, whether it be one that actually serves booze or what, is open seating and can't be reserved and the host can't make you give it up. Two other girls walked in and wanted a booth but the host told them to sit at the bar instead. We told the girls we were saving this one seat for our friend and the host came over and rudely said, "YOU ARE NOT SAVING THIS SEAT!" As our friend walks in. The other girls were like hey, it's all good, we wanted a booth anyways and he MADE US sit here. Rude as FFFFFFFFF. We were confused. But hey, Jobot is just a block away and I suggest you try their chorizo biscuits and gravy because it's AMAZING.

8q7CvqWwqcLHqOweEv3jyA.text: What can I say that other haven't? It's all True...this place kicks breakfast ass! I have been to several high dollar steakhouses that don't cook a steak as perfectly as Matt's does. You will be able to find me here at least a few times a month...

RiOEIdpSq0W74rMhPQYevA.text: Staff was friendly, clean restaurant, cozy overall. My family and I were in town on a visit and this "hit the spot" The food was delicious. If I were to visit the area again, I would go back. We are a family of 8 and everyone ate their food :)

vo5xiUiV1sMrDE7S5rOmbw.text: As a downtown local, I've been going for a Big Breakfast since Matt's opened. It got a little ridiculous once the trend-seekers discovered his former spot, and the new location just barely lessens the crowding/waiting problem. I no longer take the chance of going to Matt's and having to wait, but still take out-of-town visitors here for the best breakfast in town. Vovomeena is now my preferred go-to breakfast spot. I can walk there from my home, and it is almost as good

wF59A3mSaO8eucfYGzeBAQ.text: I love this place, this is basically the Harlow's of downtown Phoenix.  The food is great - that cook makes one hell of an omelet, the first one I ate was so good I sent a tip back to him.  The waitresses that work the counter remember your usual order after 2-3 times, and it's just a great experience.  The only reason I would put it a tiny notch behind Harlow's is that they don't have as diverse a menu, but that's not that big a deal to me, as long as I get my omelette.  Great breakfast place.

IySPy2rMVV6RyefsaXlQNA.text: I love breakfast food! I wish I could go to breakfast restaurants every day lol. Let me tell you the Belgian Waffle I had here at Matt's was the best Belgian Waffle I have ever had in my life. I also got the home fries which were really good, hash browns not too bad either. I did go a second time a few weeks later and got the same items. I would go again and try the pancakes this time.

TPfLAOHghKphm0UuFeYDGQ.text: I had a cheese omelette with spinach and onions with hashbrowns fried in butter. It was decadent. My wife had a waffle and bacon. It was amazing as well. The strawberry jam and sourdough toast were worth the trip by themselves. Great coffee and outstanding service. We had a little bit of a wait but it was well worth it. I can't eat like this every day, but that's what vacation is for, right?

gDqxLLpHApyVZqXn0bFCXg.text: First time here and was pleasantly surprised! The quick and extremely FRIENDLY service! The food was amazing! Delicious! We hope to be able to come back soon! Ordered the Hog and Chick, waffle, pancakes ! All delish!

fP-apMvsONtZ2t81uAJ52A.text: Tuesday morning no wait!! Food was stellar, small menu, simple and good, price was a little rough thirty five bones for two... But worth it for triple D,spot.

_-tnsW6PAooL6ilvpKUsRg.text: I've been coming to AZ for the last 6yrs. Only this year I was able to discover this little breakfast joint. They have the BEST hashbrown I've ever had and of all places, the best strawberry lemonade. They have a simple menu which is what I like and their service is excellent. The only down side is that this restaurant is too small! We had to wait over 1.5 hr to get seated. But it's worth the wait, so we end up eating there 3 times in 4 days. A+++

j9y2MifGuv3x7XaTotFuPg.text: Unclear what all the fuss is about. I certainly wouldn't stand in line for this place. There was nothing too interesting on the menu. I had pancakes. They were fair. Wouldn't get them again. The server at the counter was very pleasant and efficient.

kXv1fdaeE9IIT9FkGBHnMQ.text: I must say everyone here is super friendly!! Their customer service is really great! I had a scrambled egg, bacon, cheese sandwich with hash browns and it was all so tasty. A lot better than most breakfast places!! It was crowded, and I can definitely see why!

nQLLwr3WUdKI9GixTv-__g.text: $20 bucks for 2 eggs,toast, milk, sausage and hash browns, really and it wasn't even that good. It's an egg for god sake !!! And she forgot the milk had to asked for it twice.

Bm9S09ofQIwGBCR9ebYt0g.text: I was in downtown Phoenix this morning and decided to try this place out.  I have several friends that rave about Matt's and of course they have a good rating on yelp.  At 8am on a Friday this place was packed.  Parking is terrible and they have a guy that makes you move or doesn't allow you to park in other lots so you are forced to find a spot on the street and walk.  The restaurant is smaller and very busy/loud.  They seated us fairly quickly and the service was very good.  The menu option are pretty basic and only have about 10 items listed.  I ordered the cheese omelet with home fries and sourdough toast.  My wife ordered the eggs, hash browns, bacon and sourdough toast.  Food was out within 5 min.  Again, no complaints about service.  The food though was nothing special and certainly not served in HUGE portions like many of the reviews claim.  I found the potatoes to be fine and the omelet to be an omelet (nothing special).  My wife's food looked like scrambled eggs from a buffet and hunk of soggy hash browns (literally where sitting in grease).  I would certainly go to other places (Biscuits, Butterfields..._ than Matt's again.  Unfortunately, there is nothing special about their food and, again, the parking terrible.

9lyVVTAPh5GQzM3IhI3zbA.text: This place was quite the unexpected treat - breakfast was amazing and the portions generous....there were four of us and we each had something different, but equally outstanding. Go treat yourselves if you have not already - you'll be glad you did :)

Tdd4QtOOirhytsolJDZEBQ.text: This review is for their location in the Phoenix SkyHarbor Airport, which my friends tell me is every bit as good as the main one.  I love Matt's Big Breakfast. Great food - some may say comfort food - but done in a way to make it even more enjoyable and healthy at the same time. I've never had anything bad here. The only problem is that it is so popular - even in the airport - that you need to make sure you have the time to wait if it is busy!

cYavTZNFt5ivFeSxoSSqRA.text: After seeing all of the reviews when we first moved out here, we decided to give it a shot one morning while exploring Phoenix. We really weren't all that impressed. The food was "ok," the service was "ok," the dining area left something to be desired, for sure, and was incredibly noisy. I guess if we're around the area and literally can't find anything else, we may stop by again... But it was just "ok." We don't understand the hype.

s0lVFol-1l5fF3X8GL1qvQ.text: Look up deeeelicious and you'll find eggs, bacon and potatoes by Matt!  Love the locations and love the staff.   Job well done, friends!!! :)

Ynud7srf17pgXP5SKZiD3A.text: I heard about this place on diners, drive ins, and drives and wanted to try this place for years. So I finally had the opportunity today. I had looked in the previous reviews and pictures and had my heart set on the French toast only to find out it is not on the menu everyday ( it is a small daily menu) needless to say I was disappointed by that. I ended up getting an omelette with mushrooms, onions, and cheddar that came with hash browns and sourdough toast. It was good but nothing to write home about. I'm just glad I didn't have to wait an hour in the blazing sun for it. I would come again.   I came on a Monday morning around 11:30 am. No wait at all probably because of the larger locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette with cheddar cheese, mushrooms, and onions. Served with very crunch hash browns (a good thing), and sourdough toast.

UWJpSfOyhwDO4ozIzhajYA.text: Has Matt's become a victim of its own success?  Food was great as usual and word has definitely gotten out but in opening more restaurants has quality given way to quality?  In terms of service, this morning the answer is yes. We sat for a while before our order was taken after a "Have you been helped yet?" (Which is a sure sign of lack of front of house organization).   My food came out with hash browns instead of home fries but since it took so long to get the food after ordering and since we weren't checked on anyways, there was no opportunity to correct the mistake.   The toast with our order came 5 and 8 minutes after our entrees hit the table which is baffling and unexcuseable.   Water and coffee refills were also few and far between and a microcosm of the lack of attention demonstrated today.

gbpx-JilnSQVOdCSKoBYuQ.text: You know how sometimes you hear about how good a place is so much that by the time you try it the hype is so high the place can't possibly meet your expectations? Well this is not that place. Matt's delivers on everything you have heard (sadly this includes the wait).  Matt's is basically your favorite local breakfast spot on steroids. Rather than a run of the mill piece of bacon it's a thick cut peppered slice cooked to perfection, that is from the Pork Shop (see my review on them) in Queen Creek.  The eggs? Yeah they are awesome.  On a recent trip I went and got the Chop and chick which was a couple of great eggs coupled with a slap of pork that was not only gigantic but super flavorful. The hash browns are about as perfect as hash browns can be crispy outside but not burned and great potato goodness inside.  The coffee here was also really good and exactly what a cup of regular old coffee should be.  Service was great and they are very quick to make sure you are taken care of. The prices are right in line with what they should be especially for the quality of the food.  Only thing is be prepared for a wait if you here as they are pretty busy especially on the weekends. But you are welcome to go inside and grab a cup of coffee while you wait.

Khy3DCCy5G9DSyrPGwZ9jA.text: Reviews were correct - this place serves amazing food.  Fresh OJ, omelet, and home fries were spot in.  They turned tables over quickly, so even with about 15 people before us, we waited less than 10 minutes to be seated.  Prepare to be stuffed in the most delicious way possible!

_6tGqmA__IBfg4THN-QT3g.text: Moma Mia love Big Mat and his Big Breakfast.  This guy knows good food and keeps an eagle eye on staff and quality to make sure all is up to snuff.  No wonder his other locations and Giant Coffee remain in the Snacksters permanent rotation.

_3ym2u-_KTYX7WAckfUXMA.text: Always worth the wait! You can taste the quality and freshness in each bite. You can't go wrong with the pancakes, just make sure you are prepared to take home leftovers. The jams is a must so make sure you order a side of toast to try.

QN1e1I7H0R37GwfFe5NsLw.text: It is the usual American Breakfast place. There is nothing novel about any of the dishes. The service was horrible. One of the hosts dragged our table as we were eating without even asking first to make room for another table. That was an absolute low point.

jYgDc3Cr3w45svYtXT6keg.text: Delicious breakfast!! One of the best I think. You have to wait for it but your won't regret it. If I return to Phoenix I'll go back here for sure.

FGI9vvzHQKqUiUoNAbjdIg.text: So, everyone and their grandmas been talking about this place, I had to tske my family here to try it out. Nice layout. Love thw chalk board special.  :) So, Ummmm yeah. Phenomenal breakfast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My cheese veggie omelet was amazing, I asked for jalapeno in it whooo. It was bombbb. the hashbrown was crispy yet soft. I loved my meal :))  The waffles were delicious :)) oh, and the wheat bread, it was thick and so filling.. It came with strawberry jam.   Service wise. We had literally five people helping us.lolz. when we needed napkins or more water, we didn't know who to go to.   Anyways. I'll be coming back. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AOwwbRc0Wny81BmP1sf6dA.text: I've heard a lot of people talking about this place so decided to try.  Small space with a lot of 2-tops so I'm glad I came in a party of 2!!  Expect to wait a long time if you bring a bigger group.   Food is good, executed well and quality ingredients.  The waffle is great!   It's EXTREMELY LOUD in here and for that reason I probably won't come back.. I couldn't hear my breakfast companion at all which kinda ruined the point of going out for breakfast in the first place. Concrete floor, brick walls.. They would do well to make some small changes, hang up some fabric or canvas on the walls, panels on the ceiling to cut down on noise.

4kOwOOZyd7EtxNLGFCLp9A.text: Great Food! Better Environment!  Visited this place solely because I it was on "Diner, Drive-ins and Dives" soon realized what all the fuzz was about. Sure there is a long wait but it went by fast. All food was made with the freshest ingredient and portions were well served.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nlHOukiHGm6HWLmbphqcaQ.text: My hubby and I went to this spot a while ago and I have been meaning to post.  The food was delicious and very fresh, the service was great as well.  It's your usual few suspects in the menu but all in all, very fresh and good taste.

AhflsEIt9OCm_19H4PZT0w.text: Wow...I can't believe I haven't been here in years...next time will be much, much sooner!  We stopped in at lunch time last week and I ordered the skinny with egg whites, chicken apple sausage and spinach with a side of grilled tomatoes and a blueberry honey lemonade - absolutely perfect and delicious!  Great atmosphere, great service and amazing food!

8ugc-Ibhlk2mWSJOrzIsVA.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has got to be one of the best breakfast spots in Arizona. I've been going to Matt's for as long as I can remember, and it never disappoints. I could never get enough of their house fries, which consists of yummy potatoes, onions and rosemary cooked just right. Try their belgian waffle and the specials they have. Oh and prepare for the long wait!

idtJnkYcl0svGQ3lAQNxeg.text: I ordered the cheese omelette with provolone, added mushrooms, roasted peppers, and sauteed onions, and a freshly squeezed orange juice. The omelette came with hash browns and sourdough toast with house-made strawberry preserve. The omelette didn't have much flavor, and the insides were a bit watery. The hash browns were too oily and didn't have much flavor. The best part of the breakfast was probably the strawberry preserve, which, well, wasn't supposed to be the star of the breakfast. The freshly squeezed orange juice was fine too. The service was pretty good, but the food just wasn't up to par.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sourdough toast with house made strawberry preserves
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelette with mushrooms, roasted peppers, and sautéed onions, hash browns too
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Freshly squeezed 8oz orange juice

cTEVJ_8mSAHuazP83RU-WA.text: What a great place. Fort of all I have to say you will never wait to be helped or served once you get a seat. All the wait staff work together to make sure no one goes for more than a few minutes without being helped. What a great concept. They do not have a huge various crazy selection of food options, which at first seems limiting but when you realize that what they do have and serve is done right, fresh and full of fresh local flavors. A++ to the all the people who make this a great breakfast spot!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fA5vE2kmEU-YK4NYmrLZ0Q.text: Limited menu selections for breakfast. I had a cheese omelette which was thin and flat; no fluffiness whatsoever. Not a fan of their style of hash browns either, and while the thick toast is good, you only get one slice cut in half and an additional slice is $2.50! The best thing was the coffee! I would have given 3 stars but the noise level is painfully loud. Metal chairs scraping across the floor make you teeth hurt! Very disappointed!

9J7Et-VfpO8uol6i2iWO6Q.text: I went to Matt's Big Breakfast on Tuesday for the first time as I heard so much about it.  I will tell you about my experience.  There was a wait, as expected.  My sister and I didn't mind because we had a lot of catching up to do.  Our name was called and the Host asked if sitting at the bar was ok.  We said yes.  We started to sit down on the stools but decided that it was not very comfortable.  My sister noticed that there were two 2-tops available and asked the host if we could sit there.  He said that that was fine but to let him know ahead of time "so that we didn't have to do this dance again."  We swallowed our pride and sat down.  The female server never smiled and we had to ask for another cup of coffee so she was probably "slammed" with tables.  The table next to us got their breakfast first even though they were sat after us.  We did get our food eventually by someone other than our server.  The food was fabulous as expected.  But please don't let the poor service keep you away.  I would have given all five stars had the service had been as exceptional as the food.

3ITdZzS_os745emGaecjgA.text: Located near gate B4 across the US Airways customer service. Daughter loved her Big Butter Burger and wife liked the egg and sausage. I had the pork chops and eggs. Very good. Son didn't like the Mamacita Burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The counter and TV

UzGZ3-5-jf553nGoaWlWmQ.text: Great Breakfast - fresh ingredients, professional service and a nice atmosphere. The daily breakfast specials are off the charts.

ZvORHrFjkz9yYxhgWqht0Q.text: Love the food. Love the staff. Hate the wait. Only solution for us is to try to hit it at an off time. Good luck. The bacon is superb and the rosemary potatoes are a can't miss. Everything else, including the vaunted pork chops, are good, but hardly off the chart. I get the charm thing, but it's breakfast and I'm hungry. Find me a seat.

cmNMQt7aFlD3QYFK0Va0Ug.text: There hasn't been a breakfast place as good as this for a while. I loved the local produce, the ambience and the location. It's the best way to go out for breakfast and consider the direction of your upcoming day in a relaxing, yet stimulating environment. The menu will have you coming back again and again, you can't do it all in one sitting. I'm happy to recommend this to anyone.

PH01oebzRG0mNoAFoQYeAA.text: Thought it was very high priced for what you get. When we got there and walked in there was no hostess and people were all over the place. Finally a guy came up and asked our name and how many in the party. Then he just walked away. We didn't know if we were on a list or even if there was a list. Finally I went up to the counter and asked if we were on any list and turns out he had put us on a list but didn't have our name correct. None the less we got seated eventually. The food was good but not out of this world My wife and I each had breakfast, orange juice and I had coffee. With tip it was almost 40 dollars. For that price I thought we should be able to take the pig home with us.

7r2ktMxqatV4E67q9Vwp7w.text: I am in Arizona for business. This place is the bomb.com. I had had the special.. 3 eggs, cheddar cheese, jalapeno and churizo with hash-browns and well done bacon. Also a side of toast With fresh blue berry jam. The tea was non gmo and delicious and the food was fresh. Matts is probably the best meal I will eat in Pheonix. Skip breakfast at the hotel and go to Matts Big Breakfast!

TLx0jGjDKkQ5LrjAInNG9Q.text: You wanna great breakfast? I  mean a GREAT down home breakfast. This place will exceed your expectations. There is not a lot to say other than AWESOME! The lines are LONG. Why? Cuz it's worth it. The plates are filled with top notch food. EVERYTHING is great. Hell even the water is great. This can be like a mini trip to Disneyland on a Saturday or Sunday morning! Just go here and eat! You will thanks me. I reserve my 5 rating for certain dining experiences that usually are very expensive places. So it is tough for me to give Matt's a 5. Otherwise I would. This is one of the top 3 places to have breakfast in Phoenix!

Jz-dbJqkLuOeC3qEmML3kA.text: Great food and friendly service. I ordered the daily special and enjoyed every bite. Would definitely go back for seconds:)

IH-Rb13bUCgwztCUtJqy5Q.text: Went to go check on this place for the first time. I had heard such great things. Walked in to get seated the guy who was taking our order was rude. So we told him we were not ready yet so he went about his work another person came by took our order. Once we got our food. My potatoes where completely burnt and way to much oil. Had to send them back. Got a new order in less than a minute. They were not burnt. However still lost of oil. Other than that the food was okay.

0a6O8V9_x2DCCEpbIqcq1A.text: I was excited to discover that Matt's Big Breakfast had opened at Sky Harbor but it was quite possibly the worst dining experience I've had at an airport in quite some time.  I waited for nearly 15 minutes for a bowl of oatmeal and a coffee. After asking several times when my breakfast would be ready, and being told "Just a couple more minutes," I realized that I was going to leave the restaurant without my breakfast.  I requested a refund, however, the manager couldn't figure out how to work the register to handle my refund so I left without my receiving my breakfast or refund.  The manager kept suggesting that I be patient while waiting for my breakfast and again when I requested my refund.  Unfortunately I had a plane to catch and didn't have the luxury of waiting over 15 minutes for breakfast or to get my money back.    In case they haven't realized it yet - The airport is not the place to ask patrons to be patient!  Don't waste your time or money at this establishment.

Y4oOiESY0x38dn5sD1GvZw.text: After seeing this place on the triple D food show, I had to give it a spin. I arrived early and was offered a spot at the counter which was fine with me as I was dining alone and didn't want to take up a full table.  Waiter was the best: friendly, slight flirt, busy but did not forget me, checked back 4 times.  I ordered the Belgian waffle with bacon and a side of eggs. Perfect meal. The waffle was so light and fluffy. The syrup was real maple. Eggs cooked perfect. Bacon well seasoned/peppered/smoked. I could have eaten a full slab of it.   I will be coming back here. You will not be disappointed by the service or the food, they both rocked. Thanks

rOBz0WqAlmxcOut5cGofWg.text: Great food and a lot of it.  When ever my son comes to town this is his first choice.  Every thing is fresh and the service is great.  Pick this for a best breakfast location !

czGFJwtIVHZG043hRDMGJw.text: The Reuben is fairly decent for airport food. Home cut fries as well. Make sure you order an IPA to wash all that down.

yDB4aOxqSNUFmjiAAgCv_g.text: This was a good honest breakfast.  Love the lemonades made with honey.  I have tried to duplicate but still trying.  I would have breakfast here every Saturday if I lived there

NQ3TWBlDx7655GNAYKxzSQ.text: First I have to say, we went to Matt's big breakfast after seeing them featured on Diner's Drive ins and Dives. Have to say its good but nothing special. The service was great, ambience good. We were pretty able to get seated right away. I ordered the cheese omelet with hashbrowns and hubby ordered the hog and chick. Hashbrowns good, bacon good, but wasn't really nothing special. Good portions, the flavor is fresh but just a basic breakfast. Menu was small not a lot to offer. Wouldn't say we wouldn't go back but its not all what its cracked up to be.

8jUb1cxaTcakvMk6K3c79g.text: Worth the wait AND the hype. I ordered the pancakes, which admittedly are a standard staple, but they were amazingly delicious and I had to finish the entire massive portion. I didn't eat again until dinner after consuming these fluffy, flavorful pillow of carbohydrate bliss, which were just accentuated by the whipped butter and maple syrup.  The service is fast and the line moves quickly, but there was a line even at 10 a.m. on a random Friday.

hjXnZNU5mS_3RE6cNmj_Jg.text: Loved the strawberry preserve on sourdough toast. The potatoes were a little under cooked though. Cool atmosphere and good service.

KBBSF_5cq4NvkSGtQNyM0g.text: Just terrible Customer Service experience. Hostess at entrance has no respect for customers, and cant even commit to basics as:  - "Is the Bar open sitting or List assigned?" - - "It's both.." After having to deal with that, we ended up with mediocre food, in front of us.

0YK13CELBc_Potugknyk2g.text: Great food, and the service from Chelsea was second to none. Overall the experience was fantastic.

3gjq1R_Gv7HEY7wMj-qhNw.text: Amazing quality in the taste of their food. Good service. I would come eat here daily, if I could.

61pIOG3V-Ue5VyAUPsmAoA.text: Nice short walk from the Westin.   Homestyle rosemary potatoes with the eggs Benedict was delicious.  Other entrees ordered were the tuna sandwich served on thick slices of soft restaurant baked bread and fresh made chips.  Chicken sandwich served on ?pesto? Grilled bun  and fresh made chips.    The only small negative was the hash brown ordered crispy were soggy on the inside. Which were kindly replaced with their rosemary homestyle potatoes.  We will definitely be coming back on our next visit to Arizona!

i1BySNkTskZB6mVLB6fXfg.text: Wow, I am so glad I gave this place a shot! Being that I go to school on the downtown Phoenix campus I have always heard of this place but never have been able to check it out until now. You will not be disappointed! My friends and I all ordered the cheese omelet and let me tell you, it definitely lives up to the name of being a BIG breakfast. What I loved most about this place was the fact that it was so affordable for the size. I paid $12 for a meal and drink which I thought was a steal for the quality. Everything was fresh and tasty.   The overall ambiance was very cute and reminded me of a breakfast place back home. The only thing that wasn't big about it was the size of the restaraunt so be prepared to wait to be seated. We only waited 15 mins on a Thursday morning but I can't imagine the wait times during the weekend. Overall I cannot wait to go back, my stomach is getting hungry just thinking about it.

VToqCXtKNO1nYsJj5KWbYA.text: Was expecting a wait since this place is very popular but we got seated right away. It was definitely packed.  We started the morning with their freshly homemade lemonade with honey. Highly recommended! The honey at the bottom makes it complete.  The special for the day was the French toast and sausage.  French toast was surprisingly not soggy but right texture. It was not overly sweet either. Sausage waa grilled to perfection.   Had the scramble eggs with arugula salad. This was a light and refreshing dish to start the day.  Staff was very attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled eggs and salad
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast and sausage
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey lemonade

JnUnfZS0BU-N2Uqu16ic0w.text: 3.5stars. What can I say about Matt's that hasn't already been said? Generous portions, fresh ingredients, seriously amazing toast. I never thought the day would come when I'd rave about toast, but Matt's thick-cut toasted wheat toast with homemade blueberry compote is what I crave when I think about homey brunch food now.   This downtown location has a small parking lot of its own. The inside is decently sized, but lines are out the door for lunchtime and brunch most days, weekdays included. Service is mediocre, not the most attentive because it's always bustling in here, and there have been a few times where I've needed to aggressively flag down a server to ask for coffee refills or to-go boxes.   Matt's has a small menu, but there are specials for each day of the week. The menu items stay consistent, and the daily specials are written up on a huge chalkboard at the back of the restaurant.   Drinks: Coffee is decent and comes with bottomless refills. The strawberry lemonade and honey lemonade are both really good and not too sweet, although they come with quite a lot of ice.   The Hog and Chick: Standard breakfast fare, this comes with two eggs, choice of meat, choice of hash browns or home fries, and a slice of thick-cut toast. The hash browns are made well, and I like the crunchy exterior and soft interior. I did notice that the first time I came, the hash browns were made perfectly and the second time they were slightly mushy in the center. Still good though. I tried the sausage links, and I don't know that I'd order them again.. maybe I'll opt for the ham next time. Eggs were well-cooked with a nice runny center.  Salami scramble: This comes with scrambled eggs and salami (additional toppings for extra charge), hash browns or homefries, and toast. I really like the homefries because they come with sprigs of roasted rosemary, which are incredibly flavorful. I've found the homefries to be consistent and delicious, especially with the house made thick ketchup. One thing that did disappoint me a bit was that the scramble was undercooked. When I got to the middle, the egg was still oozy and watery, which left an unappetizing puddle on the plate. I'd gotten a different scramble before where this didn't happen, but I think the chef probably just underestimated the cook time by a minute.   Cheese omelet: This omelet was so cheesyyyy. I thought the flavor was really good, and I really recommend adding in toppings (for an extra charge) because it really helps balance out the cheesiness and richness. I did find the inside a tad runny again, but it wasn't super noticeable with the cheese mixing in. This dish again comes with choice of potatoes and toast.   Toast: The toast here is so good it deserves its own mention. The thick-cut toast comes out sliced in half and smeared with butter. One of the servers said that they use an old-fashioned toaster (which must be magical), and the slice comes out perfectly crunchy on the outside but still soft and fluffy on the inside. The blueberry compote is made with fresh blueberries and sugar, and it always tastes fresh and not too sweet. I haven't always finished my meals here, but I've always finished the toast.   I'll be back to Matt's for its convenient location and comforting breakfast food, and of course the toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thick-cut wheat toast with homemade blueberry jam.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salami scramble with rosemary home fries.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade ketchup.

EN5wwbmGGBC9euaE41z_ow.text: Not great at all Hash browns were weird Omelette was boring Seeing that it had like 2000 4 star reviews expected much better!

0hjTxOsbItTB8buIRYSVlg.text: This is going to be my first 5 star rating but Matt's is definitely worth the praise.   My Girlfriend and I were looking for a trendy breakfast place on a Saturday morning in the downtown area and was surprised by the lack of Breakfast/Brunch places not including cityscape and local hotel restaurants. We picked Matt's off of "restaurants nearby" on a apple maps search.  For being downtown, there is generous parking. The corner property is open to off-street parking and diagonal additional parking on all adjacent streets. We walked in and put our name on the list and the hostess let us know we in line for a 30 minute wait. Honestly, I have waited 45 minutes to an hour at iHop so 30 minutes it reasonable. Even more reasonable when you factor in that there were people lined up around the block for this place.  We got seated at the window bar facing the street and make pleasant small talk with some of the other patrons. After looking on the menu, we were slight disappointed to not see eggs Benedict on there. I ordered the Hog and Chick and he ordered the Grains Greens and Beans. Water and refreshments came quickly and I like the pulpy cloudy apple juice. You could tell it is fresh.  Our food came out in about 10 minutes and it was everything I expected. the Ham off-the-bone looked charred and straight from the grill and the thick cut bacon was a SLAB of pork sprinkled with pepper bits. AMAZING. My GF's grains were fresh and flavorful combined with the fresh earthiness of the mushrooms.  Our bill came out to $43 because of some the extra sides I ordered. Pricing is very fair and the food was a tremendous value. I wish this place was closer to our house, but Matt's is definitely worth the drive on a Saturday or Sunday Morning. The pictures do not even do this place justice.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Lkt8BshgsskjTpgZLJUT5g.text: I visited Phoenix for the first time a couple months ago because my friend moved out west. Being a big Diners, Drive In's, and Dives fan, I decided I need to try a couple spots since Guy almost always ends up in Phoenix or Bakersfield, CA every episode. I specifically remembered on the plane the episode with Matt's Big Breakfast...it's amazing what you remember, considering that episode first aired 5+ years ago.  For the daytime portion of my trip, I was alone to discover what Phoenix has to offer as my friend had to work. I'm completely fine with that, and the morning after my arrival I set my off to find Matt. I was pleasantly surprised to find it was only about a 20 minute walk from my hotel, which was perfect considering the weather was 60 with a slight wind. (I didn't know Phoenix had wind!?)  I arrived shortly after 10am to a filled restaurant. Luckily I was by myself so the hostess was able to seat me almost immediately at the bar. I had decided on the Skinny, but the scramble of the day was almost the same but with a different sausage. I decided to go with the daily special and waited only 10 minutes tops for my food. I was surprised by their ability to get food out to me; perhaps their motto of serving simple food makes it easier to serve food fast? Whatever the case, I was very impressed. The scramble, along with the accompanied potatoes and sourdough, were hot and delicious. The scramble was flavorful without being too cheesy, and everything was seasoned perfectly. I didn't add salt or pepper to my meal, and it's very rare that I don't.   They live up to the name of Matt's Big Breakfast - for some reason I took my leftovers home even though I had no intention of eating them.  (Not because they weren't delicious, but I was only there for 4 days! I had many places to eat at!) Guy Fieri, thank you good sir, you done good man, you done good.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scramble of the day w breakfast potatoes

vtV5m4jRt_WD6M4NZVxcvw.text: Their toast is life. They give you thick Texas toast with homemade (?) jam which was amazing. Check the menu before you go they have daily rotating dishes. Downside is the wait time before being served on weekends. Definitely recommend

Ea7AAWRbDTlYyT0PRQkM0g.text: Always a wait and hype so had to try it and was pretty disappointed.  Here's my breakdown.  We're gonna brave the lines a second time to see if was a fluke and bad day and adjust accordingly.  Very well put together and incredible looking meal; 10/10 for looks.  Rude and aggressive wait staff which is understandable from the lines but maybe be a little nicer?  Felt very pushy with the exception of the women working the Counter.  Home Fries were smothered in so much rosemary it tasted like soap.   My first experience with that ever as I usually am into rosemary potatoes.  Bacon tasted pretty dang salty and had a texture close to rehydrated beef jerky.  Very tough, and not really a bacon flavor just kind of salt and I'm not sure.  Eggs were ordered over easy,  they came out raw and clear in a few spots which I braved instead of sending them back; food poisoning today which I accept responsibility for as I ate them but they should air on the side of caution when preparing food like this.  Hollandaise sauce was neither good looking or delicious.   0/10 maybe that's why it's a once a week thing.  Ham was excellent but I feel like maybe it was just a honey baked ham?  Ordered that way and reheated?  No idea but delicious for sure.  Overall I've had tastier and more satisfying meals for 1/4 the price at Denny's and waited 1/4 the time.  This place is probably great to take that hipster girl / guy and pretend your a foodie or sophisticated but honestly you are better off going to the plethora of other options in the valley for a more satisfying experience.  Skip the lines pick another spot.

wXKBX2rXk7v2--ONJszUSA.text: I came to Phoenix - where would I eat?  It a big breakfast person as I intermittent fast, but came here. Wow was I surprised. Great food. Quality food. And what I love the most, which shows I am getting old lol, the food comes out hot. DONE!

2fvf1ixpqkWNJEUFmSotXQ.text: Located in downtown Phoenix, there's limited parking, however, worth the visit. Food is cooked made to order with real butter or virgin olive oil. Service was fast and friendly. Wife ordered a cheese omelette with mushrooms and hash browns. She loved it. I ordered the salami scramble with hash browns and my dish was spot on, too. Coffee was fresh and refilled right on time. The toast with jam was also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rXbiPV3adIM-8RZr54JM2Q.text: I am here in downtown Phoenix for work. I am from Philadelphia, PA. I decided to treat myself to Matt's Big Breakfast - which is a stone's throw from my hotel. I love breakfast at anytime and noticed the lines out the door on weekends so...  I chose the #2 Special: Egg scramble w/pork tenderloin, fontina cheese and spinach. If just a PINCH of salt + pepper were used to flavor this dish it would have tasted that much better. As it was: the eggs were overcooked, the pork was dried, the spinach used was old and the overpowering taste was the cheese - which usually tastes great but in the large amount in my dish today it completely overpowered everything. I used a LOT of ketchup. ...and my Mom used to say: "If you are using ketchup on anything then the cook did a bad job."  Is there such a thing as to "friendly service"? I was asked 5 times by no less than 5 employees how things were going: twice with food in my mouth, once when I quietly was taking a call from my kids and once when I was actually drinking - and the waitress, not mine, btw, stood there with a sour look holding plates she cleared from another table waiting for me to finish drinking so I could answer her. I said "I have a waitress already, thank you."  I thought with the ingredients, the location and the popularity the VERY high prices were probably justified but I was not expecting my meal to taste less than good. And at $4.95/glass getting another orange juice would have put my bill at almost $25...that is a ridiculous price for one person to pay for a bad breakfast.  I could have all of the above (and the oj refill) at any one of the many great diners in and around Philly for under $12 bucks and it probably would have tasted better.

3O6zGsyGLhl5rehA9bZhVQ.text: I ate at the Matt's in the Phoenix Airport. There was a 20 minute wait. We wanted the breakfast for lunch food and the place smelled great. We had Bloody Mary's to drink. We didn't like the tomato mix as it was very watery. I prefer Mr &Mrs T mix. The veggies were not fresh and seemed wilted. We had the French toast and the Eggs with sausage and potatoes. The meals were ok but not exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s Loaded Bloody Mary.

k86lHN9hH8MG2m1N4btoGw.text: Big portions! And amazing taste. I got there a little after they opened and it was already busy on a Friday morning. Got a seat at the bar since I was solo... everybody raving about the service but I thought it was a bit slow and the couple next to me got there after I did but got serviced first. Oh well, the food is great, hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The special
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mxQWUQjMZvb0kWO2ZUv6sw.text: Ate here on way to airport.   Food was really good.  Nice small mom & pop type place.   Wish there was more gravy.  The gravy was very good.    The room was very loud.    I give this place 5 stars.

NgIabtXNmKhYoUurSL0vXg.text: Yummazing!! We were in town for a Limelife conference and thankfully, a friend woke up and found this place not far from our hotel. If you are going with a group, be sure your entire group is there when it's time to be seated or they will pass you up until everyone arrives. I totally get this policy because this place was packed and they didn't need someone taking up a table waiting on their friends.   On to the food and let me tell you, the food is worth the wait. Our table ordered a stack of pancakes and a waffle to share so we could all get savory breakfast items as well. The pancakes were fluffy with a hint of vanilla sweetness but sadly, I didn't get to try the waffle but it looked tasty.   I ordered the two egg breakfast and since it had been an exceptionally long night, I opted for bacon and sausage, both of which are local and I think, house cured. The sausage had a bit of a kick and the bacon was thick and cooked to perfection. The aroma of the rosemary home fries would provide a pleasant waft of love and a flavor explosion when they hit your taste buds. The eggs were cooked just as ordered. I was pretty much done but decided to try the fresh sourdough toast with the strawberry jam and man, am I happy I didn't let that one slide. The jam tasted just like my great grandma's homemade strawberry jam and I felt as if the strawberries had been picked fresh that morning. I know that's not possible, but it was very tasty.   Anyway, if you are Phoenix regular or are visiting, give this delicious breakfast joint a try.

vdChmbh6yuZmDoTF4KsDfA.text: We needed a local place to eat before heading to the Grand Canyon, this place popped up as #3 in the area and I can see why! We both ordered the sweet and savory French toast special with pork/apple sausage, it was so delicious. The pork sausage is one of the best I've ever had, I could tell it was made locally and with top ingredients! The service was great too. One negative is that they use plastic straws, would love to see those phased out! If we're in the area again we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet &amp; Savory French Toast with Apple Pork Sausage

ACR_Zge7-9EoP0AZvmei3g.text: For my first meal following an early flight, I chose Matt's as a good pick-me-up breakfast. And it was well worth the wait. (About a 20-25 minute wait to be more exact).   I ordered the special of the day, which was a scrambled egg bowl with jalapenos, cheddar cheese, and sausage (which was supposed to be turkey sausage, but they ran out) with a side of home fries and a warm tortilla. The person I was with had the same.   And it was delicious. The scramble was cheesy and spicy, with the sausage providing some extra zip. The home fries were excellent too and had a hint of sage. Definitely try the homemade ketchup while you're there too, it's a good compliment.   It is worth mentioning that this place is busy: like very busy. Our empty coffee cups remained that way probably much longer than they should have. We weren't alerted to the lack of turkey sausage for 20 minutes after we ordered. The waitress was very kind in apologizing. Just be aware that this place gets backed up.

fwVRWiDcnbBsCzZAdvQZFQ.text: Stopped by Matt's when I was visiting from out of town and it's a solid breakfast place.   There was a long line though because it was a Saturday, but wasn't anything unbearable. I had the cheese omelette and hash brown and the portions are h u g e. The top of the hash brown was nice and crunchy (and really good after you add a little more salt and ketchup) but the inside was a little soggier than I would like and I think it's because it's so thick. The omelette was really good - not too much cheese - but needed a little salt and pepper for more flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

S1AdrR_nh6kN_He4Fzo3mQ.text: Great breakfast.  I had the Belgian waffles and my friend had something called the Chic N' Chop or something.  It was basically your traditional eggs over easy with hash browns, toast, and bacon.  It looked amazing. The Belgian waffles came with bacon and it was real good.  Some of the service staff was a little rude.  Granted, we came in around closing time, so the waitresses were tired and a little snarky.  We tried to get there after the rush, but no one likes it when you come in close to closing.  I understand.  We tipped big.  I'm just recounting a memory... I give 4 out of 5 stars because the ambiance isn't great.  It's a mix of diner/trendy eatery bar feel without the bar.  It's small.  They also sell their own products which is tacky to me - Matt's Ketchup and such.  The bacon was super peppery.  I was talking to my friend and coughing because of the amount of pepper and I like spicy.  They could have worked on ramping up the ambiance - making it more special and less Kitsch.

AQ3J81Y6gQiNKaJScoAy0w.text: This is a quintessential breakfast joint even though they serve lunch also. I have had breakfast here a couple of times and have been very happy. In addition to their menu they also feature a daily special.  Earlier this morning I tried their 3 egg scrambler (today's daily special) and it was superb. Scrambled eggs with habaneros, protein and choice of potatoes (I chose hash browns).  The eggs were delightfully prepared, not too soft and not too well done. Just right. Big pieces of habanero were intimidating but had just the right amount of heat. The hash browns were excellent: crispy exterior and nice and soft inside. One big slab of goodness. BTW, great coffee too.  The restaurant is small so expect a wait. But it's well worth it.

Kz97Y9O1OM9Hozqn-yk_Eg.text: Mmm...my buddy suggested this tasty place while continuing to validate the original esteemed praise from "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives".  We split the Tuesday Special of Biscuits & Gravy and ohhhh am I satisfied.  Get the side of thick bacon.  Matt's has a kind atmosphere and a young service that is very attentive. We always had water in our glasses, (and she always remembered to keep the ice from me! ) There was misbehaving couple whose toddler was continually blasting screams, but we were still able to appreciate the designed experience.  I'll happily return when in Phoenix. There's probably a weekend line, but it'll be worth the wait...

ba8G6GV-bzEgonYMp_fqoQ.text: Come hungry!   The portions are generous.   My husband ordered The Pancakes, nice flavor and very fluffy.  Served with maple syrup.  I used my blueberry preserves from my Toast.    I ordered the omelette with cheese, lots of cheese.  I ordered a side of bacon with my eggs which I expected it to be included in my meal.    The Vibe is cool here!  The crowd is loud.  Good place to meet friends for breakfast, just don't expect anything fancy.    Simple is good.    Servers are quick and friendly.  My coffee cup was always full.

Uzp7SC44NYIZEogHDZ91Dg.text: Hearty diner food with good flavors. Nothing extraordinary. Limited menu. Was hoping for an Acai bowl or green drink but that's not this type of place. The real downer was the small dining space which was super noisy and not cozy. Hipster place with a rustic industrial/farm decor. Overhyped but super popular with college crowd.  Friendly service:)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Does this bread look toasted? Overhyped place.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bcoUCTnSx5trWRXneTSQXg.text: Stopped in while driving to Cali...wanted a wholesome solid breakfast.  This place did not disappoint!!   I got eggs Benedict with home fries. My daughter had a Belgian waffle and my mom had a veggie omelet.  All were so yummy! The home fries were prob the best I've had- crispy, flavorful, fresh and lots of onions and peppers. The bread used for toast was legit artisan bread. So good and hearty.  Only complaint: they didn't have half and half for coffee! Had to use almond milk or regular whole milk. But they did have the raw sugar and the coffee was fantastic.  Restrooms were clean too!!

KHooGyL-Pxesn2u53HdJVQ.text: Best American breakfast joint in AZ! I've come here many times and will be coming back.  I love there applewood thick cut bacon it has a lot of flavor. The hash brown is to die for its crunchy and crispy. The strawberry preserve is fresh and complements the toast real well. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and sweet.  Be prepared to wait at least 25-30 mins but it is well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exterior wall
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The five-spot (Bacon, 2 eggs, grilled onions and cheese)
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thick cut bacon, Hash brown, over medium eggs with white toast and strawberry preserves YUM YUM

KLIaYBqRiidK0I4my3C7lA.text: If heaven had a waffle maker..... I saw the Food Network show with my mother and she was intrigued so I decided to surprise her and take her to this restaurant for breakfast. My first thought was this food better be fantastic. We waiting to be seated for 45 mins outside in the heat, granted they made water with lemon readily available it did not sooth the blistering heat. Once inside we were seated and I thought as an owner if you see demand you would get a larger location. I had the omelet with hash browns and honey lemonade. The meal was organic and fresh. I have a taste of the waffles and it was like it was served by an angel from the kitchen of the almighty. That's how good it was! I would return with intentions of waiting or preplanning better. Thumbs up! Update* they've now opened a 2nd location to accommodate the demand.

GpSChdP858PpnGIGzTF8xg.text: It's like Denny's but old and dingy. Got a disappointing omelette. Bacon was okay. Staff was nice and helpful. Shirts were too much money for me.

pNdNNXtP3-0BicTQQGFjVQ.text: Probably give the food about 2.5 stars and the service about a 1.. we came about 20 minutes or so after they opened so they weren't super busy yet.. the waitress came and took our order and got our drinks but that's about the only time we had anyone take care of us.. they dropped off our food and just left... there were no "do you guys need anything else?" Etc etc.. the waitresses kept refilling everyone else around us but for some reason they just skipped our table every time... the food was simple breakfast food but it was just okay don't know what the big fuss is about this place.. their bacon was good and their strawberry preserves that came with their toast were pretty good.. (bought couple jars to take home) but their hash browns were greasy and the waffles my boyfriend got he said were just okay.. I don't think I'll be coming back but now I can say at least I try the placed out..

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffles and bacon
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Greasy&#34; hash browns

mHqB7KC4blfqG3wQBgOMsA.text: Friendly, fantastic food and fun atmosphere. Did I mention the bacon?  My family talked about it for two days!  Great place!

uLmAdjrf37_vUT2apNP67g.text: One of my favorite places to go to for breakfast! Typically there's always a wait and parking is hard to find, since it's located downtown. But the food is always amazing! I came yesterday's on a Saturday afternoon is was half an hour before they closed and luckily my party was seated immediately. I got the daily special which was the 3 egg scramble that included chorizo sausage and jalapenos w/ hashbrowns and substituted my tortilla with sourdough toast and their famous jam. You can't go to Matt's and not get their toast and jam! Their potato fries with rosemary are also a must try! Every time I go I must have a large fresh squeezed OJ, none of that boxed stuff! Food is amaze and service is always fantastic!

47AIzUbG9Nx1OgA_EOzrJw.text: I can't believe I have never left a review for Matt's before. My wife and love this place so much. It is defiantly my favorite breakfast spot. I usually get the special or go for a scramble of some sort. Everything is always rich in flavor and the service is always great as well. Also make sure you get toast so you can enjoy their flipping amazing jelly they make in house.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scramble with sausage

qNRXGwuGTFJ7ApyFtP1dMw.text: I don't understand all the hype and excitement behind this place because there wasn't anything special about the food. Don't get me wrong, it was good but it definitely does not deserve all the attention it gets. If you're gonna do breakfast it's either gotta be flashy or tastes amazing and this was neither. Also, would it kill them to refill my water?   Oh but the bathroom was clean and parking wasn't bad at all so if you want to eat generic breakfast food, it is easily accessible.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is overhyped as hell but at least I got this cool photo.

i3Pv3fAa_See2CACC_iVcQ.text: Awesome breakfast and great service. Coffee is perfect as is their breakfast sandwich. Just what I needed.

ln69L-rl7kXkCvr0yR4qAg.text: This is a cute little breakfast place located in downtown, I've read great yelps and decided to give it a try. The service is great! The prices are fair, I tried this breakfast sandwich and it was only 6 bucks! The quality was good, and the bacon is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

q_ejHkdgjxmr2ikTpje2uw.text: This was the best meal we had in the 7 days we visited. Coffee was amazing, sourdough toast was the best I've ever had. We ordered breakfast comfort food and it was all delicious. The place is small so you will most likely wait. Definitely worth the wait.

vjVnDqWm9ASP-rWfu2xuFg.text: We love Matt's Big Breakfast. The food is fresh and the portions are a good size. We love breakfast food and Matt's Big Breakfast hits the spot. We are excited to return.

cvGWvX5jWKMNY-Pr7dsQww.text: We've been back to Matt's Big Breakfast quite a few times now and after having had breakfast food at many other places in the valley, I have to update my review to 5-Stars!  I think that if you're a fan of breakfast foods then you'll be a fan of Matt's. My favorite item to get there is the cheese omelette (except I ask for it to be scrambled) with mushrooms, a side of the house potatoes, and sourdough toast. They serve all omelette dishes with 3 eggs so it's definitely a generous portion. Same for the potatoes, you'll get quite a bit of those as well, and they offer you an option of regular hash browns or the house potatoes. The house potatoes have lots of seasoning & taste different with rosemary ... I recommend trying them out! Even the toast tastes great as it's thick cut sourdough, and they serve it with yummy homemade preserves.  The only annoying parts are the parking situation and sometimes the wait time. Parking can sometimes be challenging to find and the wait time can be long if you are part of a large group. Either way, the food makes it all worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle (bacon on a different plate).
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Current special: 3 egg scramble with enchilada sausage, potatoes, &amp; a tortilla.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Griddlecakes.

f9QGQ_lDDd4KJ2oCJ-nQCg.text: Amazing Breakfast... Farm fresh ingredients.. Friendly staff.  Had "The Chop & Chick" (highly recommend), come with a juicy pork chop, two eggs, hash browns or Rosemary Potatoes, and toast. Side of thick Peppered Bacon (Amazing).  Place was packed (not sure why people complain about things like this, it means it is really good), but no wait on a Thursday morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE HOG &amp; CHICK
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Eggs Benedict... In a league of its own. Truly Amazing...
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Specials

0ryOcM64c08P91FlT9Ndig.text: Matt my friend,you never disappoint!   I chose to meet here for a business breakfast and was very happy with my choice. The goal: local, character, solid meal, easy parking  and central location. Mission accomplished.   Had the daily special with home fries - my MO is to trust the daily special and I'm always happy. Always love the coffee - though I would love to see some fresh cream from a local farm as an option.

ClhG2ffy3hRgRPj1UeSVNg.text: I've heard about this place from so many friends and colleagues that I had to try it for myself. So, I head into downtown Phoenix between breakfast/lunch to grab a bite. I got lucky and found a parking spot in front just down the street....be warned though, it's metered parking and it's an old school meter, so you need quarters & dimes. I only had enough for 45 min, so I prayed that it wouldn't be packed inside and that I could get in/out without a parking ticket. I walked in and found a seat at the bar. I saddled up to the counter and browsed the menu. I ended up ordering: Five Spot Breakfast Sandwich (Eggs, Cheese, Caramelized Onions, Thick Cut Bacon) w/Hash Browns, $5.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/matt... yelp.com/biz_photos/matt... The order came out fast. I took one bite and loved it. It was full of flavor...the Caramelized Onions really added to the taste of this Sandwich, I was impressed. The Bacon tasted great, but was a little undercooked for my tastes...I should've known better and asked for it to be cooked crispy, especially since it was thick-cut...my bad. It was till a great Sandwich anyway. Except for the Caramelized Onions, it's exactly how I'd make a breakfast Sandwich. The Hash Browns were good too, went well with the Sandwich. The service was great, I was in/out in 30 min....so I had 15 min to spare on the meter. Lunch menu looks interesting, I'll have to come back and give it a try. Return Factor - 90%

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Five Spot w/Hash Browns
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Five Spot w/Hash Browns

-UH40RqHDqyat7fuaajLPQ.text: Okay so there was a wait to get into this place but damn if it isn't worth it!  Omg! Amazing homemade food.. The bread is homemade, the eggs are free range, and the bacon is nice and thick! I'm in love! Definitely coming back to this place.. They serve a big enough portion to fill you up and finish it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 5 spot with Home fries!

eWHd7pxAwdoBFDEK-aCbUA.text: This place is worth the wait! Excellent food, fantastic wait staff, great prices. Totally missing out of you go elsewhere. Upgrade your breakfast to off the bone ham, you won't regret it.....

8EsfPu_tbodFkO4hKrjgpQ.text: This a great place if you are in need of a great tasting, hardy breakfast.  We ended up arriving there with a large party.  Wait time was crazy since it was a Sunday.  But it was definitely worth the wait.  I ordered the steak and eggs and my wife order the chorizo and eggs.  Both were delicious!  The steak was just how I wanted it.  You can tell that their coffee was freshly brewed and it came in endless amounts.  There was only a couple issues with this place.  The place was loud and they don't have the technology to split the bills.   Other than that, a definite joint my friends and family would return to.

DhxFRmoBcAuBBg5PnxNM0A.text: Matt's is a cute little breakfast place in downtown phoenix.    They are always busy and the staff is really nice and sweet.   I always seem to get the special every time I go there.   The one thing I really like about Matt's is that the food is always fresh.     There is sometimes a wait on a Saturday morning.  But normally the wait is about 15 to 20 minutes long.  The only thing I wish they had on the weekend is french toast and that the coffee was a lot stronger.  It normally takes like water down coffee.

VjGximi_AkVGZkw3krLVQA.text: Worth the trek and worth the wait!  Thanks to my D D& D app (thanks Guy!) I found out about Matt's while in Phoenix and convinced my sweet boyfriend to take a detour downtown and, yes, wait a while to have breakfast.  It was worth every minute!  The pancakes were absolutely fantastic and I'm the ultimate pancake snob.  They were possibly the best pancakes I've ever eaten.  You could taste the batter.  Don't know how else to describe it.  They were just the freshest most batter-y tasting pancakes I've had in years.  Orgasmically good! I also got a decaf, which was fantastic.  My boyfriend loved his omelette.  Mine was actually just OK, not great, but the pancakes, coffee and service made up for it, 100%.  Our server at the counter was a hoot and although super busy, kept us refilled and entertained.  Real maple syrup.  Yay!

-Cqw4m6Ltz0MQzfGGLkTSA.text: Great breakfast for the church crowd.   Would give them 5 stars but no alcohol at brunch. We are in Mimosa and Bloody Mary country!! Get with the program LOL.

m6j9LMmRVaJFKkKgNZbddA.text: We try to come to Spring training every year for 2-3 days, we stop at MBB every morning we are here. Great breakfast, great people. See you again soon!

yExL1DfhHeyCOABFAHdoyQ.text: The owners of this establishment will go above and beyond to make sure that the people who visit their restaurant eat healthily and are always satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blue cheese burger

UzJH9ka9cIUcKYAgJKQmcA.text: Decided to try this place for a breakfast to catch up with some friends. Food was phenomenal! I had the cheese omelette with some mushrooms and it was delicious, so were the homefries (although a bit too oily, but they tasted great). One of my friends had the steak and eggs and the steak was tender, juicy and tasty! we loved the food and the service from both waitresses that helped us since it was our first time there. Menu could be considered 'small' but you trade that for the quality of food served there. Be prepared to wait for a table though! the place is packed and busy! If your whole party is not there they will not seat you (for obvious reasons). They have a couple of benches outside and some shade from some palo verdes. Parking is free right behind the restaurant, but only a few spots, if you are lucky you can get a spot and don't have to pay for parking. It is downtown Phoenix after all. Only 'bad' thing, which is not a bad thing really, but it may change your mind depending on what you are looking for, the restaurant ambiance was too loud! Since the place is small and packed with people everybody talking (loud in order to hear each other lol). Food was excellent! Service was superb! I highly recommend this place.

8ro44W9M8EP9cdgDq42JOg.text: Big. Awesome. Delicious.  Stopped in here for breakfast one morning while in Phoenix.  My other half had the blackboard special of Chorizo Sausage and Jalapeno Omelet with potatoes and a flour tortilla. It was big, awesome  and delicious. It was so big, she couldn't finish it.  I had the stack of pancakes with a side of sunnyside up eggs and ham off the bone. It was big, awesome and delicious. And I finished it all off because I'm a gavone.  Service was attentive. Whenever you need a coffee refill, BAM, it was refilled. Nice.  The only thing that was odd, to me anyway, was that the pancakes came served on a hot plate (Ruth Chris Steakhouse style) and the maple syrup was also heated up.  Other than that, breakfast was Big. Awesome. And Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stack of pancakes with a side of sunnyside up eggs and ham off the bone
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Sausage and Jalapeno Omelet with potatoes and a flour tortilla

ypNy97hWdSqo0yqklVZflQ.text: I love this place.  Even when they get your order wrong  [three times over 7 years]; it is still Very Good!!    Hog & Chicks is my favorite!  & Some of the Best Ice Tea in town.

ec5eL7AfyD2-ndsIV8t1TQ.text: Sorry but I really don't get the hype of this place. As you may know from reading my other reviews, my bf and I are poor and like to eat cheap. This is why we consult diners drives in and dives everytime we go to a new city. My bf and I were super excited after a positive experience at Chino Bandido (which was also a DDD recommendation).   I will admit that I'm a little biased when it comes to breakfast food (I hate the majority of it) but the Chop and Chick seemed non breakfasty enough for me especially since I got homefries. They didn't know what I meant when I asked for a soft boiled egg so I got my eggs poached. BF got the hog and chick.   We were so disappointed when our meal came out. The portions were normal sized and everything just tasted ok. The sourdough with fresh strawberry preserves was the only special thing about the meal. I wished the sourdough were more sour though. The porkchop didn't have much flavor and was a little tough. My BF felt the same about his order. We walked out feeling like we would've been just as happy going to Dennys (and then I would have had more non breakfast options too!)

myz3gA62cizGuVQ7XLCwuw.text: Came to Phoenix for Spring Training from Los Angeles, this was an amazing breakfast! I ordered the waffle and I'd say it was the best waffle I have ever had. The place was quite a wait, but it was well worth it. The service was fast and the waiters were very friendly. Food was great! I would recommend Matt's Big Breakfast to anyone in Phoenix!

4uqwKT3vEn8XoBiFrK3Wdw.text: Love this place.  My FAVORITE breakfast spot....hands down!!!  The portions are great and the food is greater.  I have several friends wanting to check this place out when they come to town just because of a picture I posted on Facebook.  Keep up the good work Matt's Big Breakfast.  I am a fan and will continue to be one as long as you keep making my stomach proud.

iR2QllcpYQbZtHBfW-YVoQ.text: This place has moved, couple blocks toward the freeway,  save your time it is way over rated. It is so noisey it hurts,  why people bring babies is beyond the border of cruel and inhuman punishment.   This was featured on Triple D, Guy you weren't in this place, the guy bussing tables & seating must own this because he's working harder than ALL the stuck up Waitress' combined. Probably not fair, some of the snobby girls were working, had to in order to makeup for the others. Maybe it's just age discrimination or ... .  Food was very limited, few egg plates, no flexibility didn't prepare as requested, had to send it bsck, while mine was getting cold trying to be polite and EAT TOGETHER.  We have deleted all reference to this & other MBB establishments, if this is how they hook us it's not worth it.  The food we finally did get wasn't anything special, beats McD, but not byuch except cost, way too oops much.

hRJum8Myq_lXR91SrkSkLQ.text: If you want simple breakfast nailed to perfection, with excellent customer service, I highly recommend this place.  As always, I tried to keep my expectations super low because of the hype, but honestly, it deserves the hype!  It was rainy today so we got an unusual late start on the day. Worked in our favor because there was no wait when we arrived (about 1pm).  Everyone there was super nice. Like, genuinely nice. We ordered coffee and the fresh squeezed honey lemonade. The lemonade was delish! They must put a ton of honey in there because you can really taste the flavor. It's so good. The coffee is great too. It's a special blend made especially for Matt's from Cave Creek roasters.   For food we got the special - 3 egg scramble with andouille sausage and fontina cheese. Omg... Now you can imagine how easily it would be to screw up this dish. But it was not greasy, eggs cooked perfectly, and the HASHBROWNS WERE THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. No seriously, how do they get those hashbrowns so crunchy?!?! The andouille sausage was nice and spicy. Great dish.  It came with a side of sourdough toast and fresh house made strawberry compote. Soooo good and fresh. Compote not too sweet. Great!  The waffle was light and crispy. Bacon was the real deal y'all. Thick. Crispy. And they have REAL maple syrup.  So...they forgot our waffle and we had to remind them of it. No big deal at all to us. But the way they handled it, they comped the waffle and apologized over and over. Over the top customer service. Over the top.  It really doesn't get any better than this for me. Simple food cooked perfectly and great customer service. And the place is adorable too. Will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle (comes with 2 slices of bacon but my lil guy was quick to snag one)
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special - 3 egg scramble with andouille sausage and fontina cheese

hKXI_LjMX1zCyPRcp_es6g.text: We went this morning for breakfast and I was pleasantly surprised. My sister is a student in the area and had been once before so she took us out of Towners.  My mom got the skinny, which was egg whites with chicken sausage and spinach, she's all about that stuff so she loved it. My sister and I both got the hog & chick. I got ham which was a thumbs up & sister got bacon. Both delicious. Step dad for the special which was steak and eggs. The steak really impressed me, not only was it cooked perfectly, it was a nice thick piece of meat, they don't cut corners. The toast might have been everyone's favorite part of breakfast, even my carb hating mother. I didn't give 5 stars because I wish they had a bigger menu, just a few more choices!! :)

y3P14kFxSUVPtHliye65kA.text: The food is great but there are no big breakfasts on the menu.  Don't let the name fool you.

G3veYlkPKJhivvt_2OwESw.text: This is literally my favorite breakfast place in the whole wide world. If I lived in Phoenix I would probably go broke because I'd be here every day. The pancakes are everything a pancake should be: fluffy, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. The home fries are an explosion of flavor in your mouth. I look forward to eating here every time I visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pancakes and home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pancakes and home fries

1CkWF3ZuaWQBkySA5bunDw.text: There is always a wait unless you get here really early, but it is worth it if you know what you are getting in to. There are always so many tourists here, but it is understandable cause the food is great. It was recently my fourth time at Matt's Big Breakfast and I finally got my own plate of waffles instead of eating them off my boyfriend's plate. Best waffles ever and I don't usually go for the sweet breakfast foods.   If you like reubens and it is lunch time here then GET THE REUBEN!! It is so good! The bread that it is on really makes the whole sandwich.   Everyone in Phoenix should try Matt's Big Breakfast at least once.

7tkRb6oGMH47mz3PeiENng.text: What Happened... Haven't been in a while and dreaming of Matt's, but was greeted with disappointment. Matt's to me has three things going for him... Great food, great food, and customer service. Well the latter is there,but the food...Got the special which is usually fantastic,but this time small portions and my home fries which are my favorite were cold and waxy. Matt what gives,the quality of the food just wasn't what I remember, I can only hope this was a one time thing... don't know what could've happened and you even went up on your prices.

kYl8BDB_r9nUKIHjCHGJNA.text: I remember the bacon, and the potatoes the most, we had to wait to get a table but it was very good.

FJPJaefEo5kFMOi9GVWH-A.text: Good food and made fresh to order, but because of the TV coverage on Food Network and tiny size you can expect LONG waits to get in. Not so special it's worth a 60-90 minute wait for me.

1aQ4TR9v3b5q6IWexWXPXg.text: I think its not what its all hyped up to be, and its overpriced probably due to location.

jlbPqaMX7Pz7u06eqq8log.text: Visit Date:  10/4/14  This. Is slowly getting worse. .. today strike 2.  Last week was not good, today the same. Eggs over cooked, potatos burnt. Quality is dropping.  I'll give this 1 more chance.

pHKPc5E-oZ-Zd6MqyC-YNg.text: Look. Matt's is good. But is it great? No. It's just good breakfast. Sure, it's a lot better than Denny's or IHOP, but there's a lot of great breakfast places in Phoenix that I'd rather go to, not really wait in line and get the same quality food.

_ye8zAScCvkH3IR4r8JGOg.text: Best breakfast in Phoenix? No, if I could rate negative I would. My first time and I will never go back to any location.
