5b9g6FNWFurMAqdI7Ssaxg.text: I'm pretty forgiving my nature but you've got to be kidding me when I just watched my tuna salad sandwich and coleslaw sit under the heat lamp for over 40 minutes, and then it was served to me.   At least I was charged full price after pointing this out and not eating my wilted hot sandwich and slaw.   Too tired to be an ass  over it so I just got the hell out of there.... Jeebus

SSDNHQi6WgriLepX6mZk-g.text: I ordered the breakfast sandwich to go. It was huge and damn good! Bacon was perfectly crispy too. The only reason I gave them 3 stars (vs 4 or 5 stars) is because of the nasty girl at the take out register who made me wait nearly 10 min without even acknowledging that she would get to me. She was too busy walking back and forth between the kitchen and the take out register for no apparent reason. Then she was doing something with the coffee maker or something - again, all the while I was standing there waiting for her to take my order. Talk about lack of customer focus. I can't imagine management would be happy with her behavior and lack of customer focus.

T_fI8DKtSnrY6eB2ANaXVA.text: The hash browns had a unique sweet taste, the vibe was hipster and vintage, sourdough toast was thick and tasty with a unique side of actual fresh blueberry marmalade. I enjoyed my salami scramble and will probably be back soon!

9NJ3tOeWU4G9N3akNfc53w.text: Ate here for the first time a few weeks ago on a Sunday. Only had about a 30 minute wait, mainly because we got there later in the day. The food was good, but $4.50 for a glass of orange juice is a little over priced. I don't care if it's fresh squeezed, that's to much to charge for a glass of juice which is not refillable. I wanted French toast & found out they only had it on Wednesday. WHAT?! What kind of place that serves breakfast doesn't have French toast. They need to put it on the menu for EVERY day.

FvPs5GudeNCe9U4kK_iSNQ.text: Just had breakfast at Matt's on Saturday after moving my daughter into her dorm. It was a short walk away. This is one busy place. You will wait if you have a large party, but I thought it was worth it. Really old brick wall place that has tables and counter service. I had the scramble eggs with bacon, toast, and home fries. The bread and jam are home made! Really good. Bacon was thick cut and had great flavor. No complaints. Everyone enjoyed their meals. I had to finish another one since my wife couldn't.

aKPArYoS6P5LTiez61VYnw.text: Average breakfast and limited menu.  Pancakes were dry.  Waffle was good as was the bacon.  Not sure it is worth the long wait

Fbu_mKaosmnt8lJvR_yc_g.text: Had a big group here, and it was a wonderful experience. Great staff, food was awesome (especially the potatoes), and Ernie couldn't have been nicer. I will be back next time I'm in town!

aYtKtm8TnMeiKQLFHP09kw.text: It was good, but I wasn't blown away. Staff was very nice, very attentive. However plenty of 5-star breakfast joints in this area so we are not likely to return.

rQUgDfkZ2jzjHa34JJAQkw.text: Just arrived in Phoenix last night and was looking for a place for breakfast. We picked Matts Big Breakfast based on Yelp reviews and because it was close to the Sheraton.  We got there about 7:30 and had no trouble getting a seat but by 8:15 or so people waiting in line.  First of all, the waitstaff were fantastic. They must do some sort of "collaborative" serving here because it seemed as though every single one of them was taking care of us.  It was not as though they were constantly interrupting our meal to ask us if we needed anything, they were quite simply on top of taking care of our every need regardless of which one of them happened to walk by.  I ordered the eggs Benedict with a side of bacon because that was the Thursday special and it was fantastic. I would definitely come back for breakfast or lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thursday Special. Eggs Benedict.

lbJXphlIcKe0cEF1Dt-i_g.text: Went here this morning for breakfast with my Mom and enjoyed every bite. Great atmosphere, staff, and food. My Mom had the slim and I had the BLT. Food was outstanding. Prompt service and attentive staff again. Highly recommend this spot. I had the opportunity to meet the owner and she is now a 2nd mom to me. I'll be back for sure!

OfXFcKD_r5RR9heTomKXuQ.text: so great!!!! we did have a bit of a wait but it was so worth it!  The stand out was definitely the bread and homemade preserves.  I could eat that from here every day.  Amazing.  We all got omelettes and while they were the perfect size and very tasty, could've used more cheese!

nZMwjdv1cqI7E2hk7KeoOg.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and I was amazed at how delicious everything was. I got the hog and eggs w bacon. The eggs were lightly fluffed w just the right amount of butter, the bacon was thick cut and they give you hearty portions. The strawberry honey lemonade was absolutely delicious and so was their Rubeun. I would definitely recommend this cute, hipster place!!!

bR4HDdDPkJ0EPDR5nDyFmQ.text: Went here for the first time last weekend. I was so amped to eat there because I had seen many reviews of the restaurant on Triple D and other such shows. I ordered the Hog and Chick, which is 2 eggs, potatoes, breakfast meat and toast. Eggs were cooked as ordered. Sausage links were the maple-rosemary variety, which I found to be unpleasantly sweet and over-seasoned. The home-fries were overcooked and not crispy. Toast consisted of home-made style bread, which is about 1.5 inches thick. Best part was the strawberry jam. And the iced water. It was hot!!

K1lOwA0L1La8kg1AsHpIuQ.text: A good place to enjoy a late breakfast marred by relentless crowds insistent that eggs waited an hour to eat taste better. Easier to get in as a solo diner.

zQaDwv3nZAspuTfvKuA0yA.text: I enjoy cooking breakfast. But sometimes I don't want to cook, I just want to eat something delicious...and simple.   There isn't much on the menu. Good food doesn't have to be complicated. My favorite breakfast here is their griddlecakes. They are like pancakes but better. Paired with their thick cut bacon (and hash browns if you're REALLY hungry) you won't be disappointed. And customer service is top-notch...EVERY time.

_SORhPNagyOIp12zIVjrAA.text: Not sure why all the hype. Food was extremely average. Couldn't get a crunchy breakfast bread to go with. Eggs weren't hot. Bacon not crunchy either. Wait staff not interested in making it a great experience. Just overall.. meh.

TxVYNcmjKblH9g9_DqXWKw.text: We didn't end up eating here because there was a weird vibe in there. The waitresses were staring at us and one waffle with nothing else is $9.

xEK_qHG6zsaF45YDalUFZg.text: Not super impressed...everything from service to food was just ok...i think this one is overhyped by the hipster crowd...but overall it was fine as long as you can find something on their limited menu.

LplqB8vUrrNvMj3XUxApeQ.text: Service was great. Food was healthy & fresh with homemade jam & amazing pancakes! We will return for sure! Highly recommend it.

rTH7FThwxqm848NXqg9zew.text: Finally got to experience Matt's Big Breakfast yesterday after hearing about it for so long. We were not disappointed. For Sunday brunchtime, the wait was not too long at approx. 25 minutes. After being seated we were greeted quickly by our server who took and delivered our beverage order. Two people in my party ordered the special and another steak and eggs. The meals were brought out so quickly, it was amazing! They all raved about their dishes. I ordered a waffle with a side of eggs over-medium well which were cooked absolutely perfectly (which happens rarely.) The waffle...oh that waffle!!! It was heaven on a plate! Our server was very personable and kept our beverages filled throughout our meal. A friend had toast with Matt's homemade strawberry jam. Wow!!! Yes...I now have a jar waiting for me in the fridge. So good. Can't wait to go back.

4gRgveC2JMnhw_xOKwgMRQ.text: Long wait but always worth it. The bacon is amazing here, so don't try Matt's without enjoying it! Coffee is also great here. I appreciate the small menu as I know they are good at what they do. Not too fancy, but good ol' fashion good breakfast. Come early as the line gets a little crazy.

_mZwTTsbfIeZmB3CGWpNvw.text: I'm a huge fan of the food here.  It's all good.  Breakfast sanwich , the hog and chick, the butter burger, the list goes on and on.  All made with fresh, lucally sourced ingredience.   Darnell Dockett was in for Breakfast today.  Peppered bacon, and homemade preserves are to die for

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s big breakfast.  Open 6:30 to 2:30.

EhXtdY39EKkh4691BXep-w.text: Tight, excellent menu. Friendly efficient staff. Great vibe. This is how a breakfast spot should be. I'm impressed - by the quality of the food, the cheery staff, and the fact that they run this place like a well-oiled machine.

daXrUu3B4zZy5YhGfzGTxg.text: Great place !! Friendly service . Managed well .. Food was great !! A must stop in Phoenix for breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop and Chick .. Very good

B44w7romknscE239w7VHaA.text: I was on a detox/diet when we came here. They did great at accommodating my requests. Will definitely be back again to try the pancakes. They looked amazing.

F58UDQ1rcYW196XF6FTTow.text: Great food and service. Pretty simple menu, so if you're looking for anything fancy this is probably not your spot. This place gets busy so expect to wait a few minutes for a table. Worth the wait and visit!

iZ-0Yljm-CuecmaFogvyZw.text: I so wanted to sooo looovvveee this place and while it was good I wasn't oh so impressed.....we waited awhile, it was Saturday morning, once we finally sat down we were greeted quickly but after that it went down hill....my boyfriend got his food 10 min ,before I did...the people next to us who sat down 15 min after us got their food before me...the waffle was ok...nothing special. I will try it again and hope for the best...

Uz_F_q9qvlZkszLKVlfT7Q.text: This place did a great job with a small space. The good had big flavor and our whole family enjoyed it. Waffles, pancakes, and even Mac and Cheese. It was also very hip.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bAl-_VOW4RR9gQyNgFmPYA.text: Holy freaking deliciousness! My boyfriend and I were spending a few days in Phoenix for a mix of work/fun, and he found this place on Yelp. We waltzed in for breakfast around 10am on a Tuesday and were seated immediately. My first observation about this place was the high energy atmosphere, which made me feel really excited to be there. Noise level was moderate - buzzing with conversation but not noisy, making intimate conversation easy. I also got my coffee immediately, and my request for almond milk in place of regular was accommodated. Always a good start :)  After poring over the variety of unique menu options, my boyfriend ordered the Griddlecakes with a side of Thick Cut Bacon and I went for the Salami Scramble. Griddlecakes were pleasantly fluffy but maintained their flavorful density, and the bacon was coated with a sprinkling of peppery goodness. The Salami Scramble was equally enjoyable - thick cut strips of salty/fatty (that's a good thing) meat distributed throughout a helping of scrambled eggs. Ironically, my FAVORITE thing on the table was the side of potatoes that came with my scramble - thick chunks tossed in a perfect medley of sea salt, olive oil and the FRESHEST rosemary. I typically try to shy away from starchy carbs - not for lack of obsession, but out of consideration for my waistline. These potatoes, however, were irresistible. I literally couldn't stop eating them! My boyfriend seemed to share the same sentiment.   If we ever make it back to Phoenix, I would certainly put this Big Matt's location back on my bucket list for breakfast or lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best wheat toast. Ever.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salami scramble with rosemary potatoes. Heaven.

XWV0Cr0JDg_SAb0oSYMn1A.text: Great Place to Eat, LOVE to food, the area, the service is GREAT, Wish they were closer to me, or I was closer to them....  Thank You

PZVZ_KIrWOUBAzw_TFWhWw.text: Long wait, but worth it!  In town for Spring Training and found Matt's on Yelp!  We had traditional brkfst of eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast...food exceeded our expectations!!  Very limited seating capacity, but if you do have to wait, it's worth it!

27t3yFM7phBnUwVb3sQNFw.text: Loud, busy, but not bad. French toast was good, loved the whole sausage and pork chop got a thumbs up. The chairs aren't comfortable, 5'2 and my legs and feet were falling asleep. Wakes was nice, had to ask for water twice. They don't have cream for coffee, just milk. The place was kinda small but loved the decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu and specials

aiyYJo3YkEZgFBIgL6RZ5g.text: Omg out of control the pork chops off the hook this place is a must have. Don't miss out

yzc9yEuznKEjgA52fR2FBA.text: Very cool breakfast place. Had the waffle and chicken apple sausage. Waffle was awesome. Sausage was very good, not a lot of flavor. Coffee could be stronger. Sat at the "bar." Service was great. Very, very busy on a Sunday morning.

ZSiSoL0iv_DL0_h8jHBhow.text: Matts big breakfast is awesome. It took me back to when I was a kid and how my morning breakfasts with the family were !! I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hEccGgdDT-y-I6KKiRo5kw.text: The place is quaint yet very loud. Could barely hear each other. The food was...okay, I guess. I couldn't taste the bacon, couldn't taste the hashbrown either, it had too much butter. Eggs tasted like butter too. The toast was perfect tho, perfect amount of butter. Hubby had country potatoes, which was good. It was chunky enough the butter didn't overwhelm it. His sausage was skinny and almost tasteless too. Hubby said the jelly was good, I got a different taste...a beerish taste. He also said the ketchup was good, I couldn't taste it, the butter on the hashbrown wouldn't let it. I wouldn't go back.

6BDoEgTHZfpQ4j_P_D00Fg.text: At Matt's you get huge portions!  It's like eating portions at home. Well my home anyway-I got the eggs and sausage breakfast.  They have great county potatoes!  Love the old fashion country decor.  Got to be hungry to eat here

5jHRPplkI2yA4ZwLjrswoA.text: Matts is a place everyone has to go to at least once and if you don't fall in love with place idk what to tell you...   The staff is super friendly I got to have a little chat with one of the managers (I believe) he was really nice and seemed to very much love his job! Their food is super tasty and pretty affordable too. But heir strawberry jelly my gosh! DELICIOUS! Their menu is sweet and short just how I like it. Honestly I can't stand when places have an encyclopedia of a menu. I will get overwhelmed with all of the options I would probably just walk right out. The deco is really cool pretty industrial. I believe this place was on the food network so that says a lot! Also I recommend coming here early as they do get super packed. I remember trying to get a table on a weekend forget about it! It was an hour wait. I'm sorry you can be the best restaurant in the planet and I will still not wait that long.  However a definite must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kwui0-IZYI4Dv4aKz2_ikQ.text: Amazing as always. I ordered the Pesto chicken sandwich. The macaroni salad was good but could have used a smidge more mayo. The thick cut pepper bacon and delicious iced tea more than made up for it!

O9B8ZGTXsPzHuMDfIaKnKQ.text: Bringith the masses and come hungry! Huge portions of comfort breakfast. Beware, you will be in a food coma after.

EkIip-YBGv7mVisXAh-flw.text: They have hands down the best jam ever! The breakfasts are great as a classic all American breakfast done in a home style way rather than a standard diner. I love the their hasbrowns and I'm not a potato person. I think their mixed scrambles are better than their regular scrambled eggs. The waffle is okay but sometimes comes out a bit soggy in the bottom.

TSFmwI10OFiMmfwV413ulQ.text: The food was so good! I ordered the waffle and it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was perfect! The OJ is freshly squeezed and you can tell! The hash browns were perfect as well. Go have brunch with a friend:) I recommend it:)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IIPJ1N3FsgbmDqHva1wAHw.text: My gal and I were downtown on a bit of a staycation, since we're locals, and I'd been to Matt's before... at the airport. This place lived up to expectations...!  There was significant road construction so you couldn't park very close to the place and it was a Thursday morning... and still, when we arrived, the place was packed with a bit of a wait - 5 minutes.  The food was good, I had the breakfast sandwich and we ordered the special eggs benedict as well as a waffle to share... all of it was really good!  The service was fast and attentive... and even though the place was busy the food came up quickly.  This place has had quite a local reputation... and I have to say if you're in the area and would like to get some breakfast - definitely try this place out.

q28KRGwM5_ylBmYsfvORYw.text: Just a head's up for vegetarians and vegans: they don't do any substitutes. I had been wanting to check this place out for a while and was really excited about trying the French toast special. When I asked to swap out the meat for a non-meat side, they wouldn't let me (even after I told them I was a vegetarian and was willing to pay full price). The manager tried to explain why they can't do substitutes, but her explanation made no sense...it was something about having just the right amount of ingredients for the specials. (Swapping out would have left them with EXTRA ingredients for the special, not less). So I left. The whole experience was a bummer; I had already ordered a coffee and felt obligated to pay for that. I had already paid for parking too. Not planning to go back.

mxcu9PB5IkbqMpQ2HFqrfA.text: The ambiance is what makes this place. Fast service and up-beat atmosphere. Big portions will fill your stomach. The food was so-so. The sausage in the biscuit and gravy has MSG which makes your whole mouth and lips feel like there is a party going on. Not great for people who it affects negatively. They should really disclose this, especially since they are so proud to advertise that they use real butter and extra virgin olive oil.  My spouse had the ham and cheese omelette, and he said there was a lot of chewy fatty ham. He said it was a little bland for his liking.  Also had the blueberry lemonade at the waitresses recommendation, it pretty good, very sweet, I couldn't finish it.  The rosemary potatoes were delicious, but probably not good enough for us to come back during our stay.   Good: -Ambiance -Price -Speed -Rosemary Potatoes  Could Use Improvement -Stop using sausage with MSG -Use less sugar in the Lemonade -Get more creative with spicing up other dishes

x-D5TicKMGDSUdmjIZKY3g.text: Who ownes Matt's this is not as it was in it original location. Matt's is a far from different restaurant, it is a meir shadow of its former self. I do not THE MATT would let it fall THIS!

IvPmf7SxC53r--HYY10M-Q.text: Best breakfast in town. Menu seems simple but  execution is perfect and ingredients are local and to quality. On weekends make sure to go early.....a line starts and grows quickly after 9am since it's so popular.  My go to suggestions are the salami scramble with hash browns and the griddle cakes but everything is spot on. They make their own fruit preserves, have a different lemonade each day, and are super friendly.

7o4qTkwc3tjZZmn8M_9FiQ.text: So I'll probably get some hate, but whatever.   It's good, but not top ten best breakfast places in the valley. I enjoyed it and the service was solid but I wasn't wow'd. Have it a few tries and never had anything I couldn't reproduce at home with some effort.   Like I said the food is good and the service is solid. Especially for the price, but come on! Lol  I'm shocked at the amount of 5 Stars this place has... either people just blindly love all things DDD or they need higher breakfast standards.

wd7NcbCKucwq5j3tOHsFqA.text: Yes on every level! I love the small, hipster vibe. I feel like this place is authentic in that regard even though it's becoming "so mainstream" to have a restaurant that is laid back. I love the bacon!It is my favorite bacon in Phoenix! I eat a TON of breakfast restaurants/takeout . It just depends on what you are looking for in a breakfast or brunch and mood. I am sure you will enjoy this rustic vibe. And did I say BACON?

TjY0PO5brG-V_4RefEopHw.text: After the we arrived from the Phoenix airport we arrived here due to the good reviews on Yelp. The food was good not breath taking. House potatoes were a bit overwhelming with spices (Rosemary I believe) and had to drench with tapatio for different flavor. Eggs, bacon, sausage link and waffle were great.  RC cola was there soft drink choice, which was pretty cool to me because you hardy ever see that.

vLRsmv4bBqqUyL6Qvjf3vw.text: When downtown, for breakfast or lunch this is a great option (best at seating parties of 1-4). Upscale greasy spoon with a short menu that includes all of the standard options. They have a ever-changing daily special that is usually the best option to go with, if it sounds tasty to your likes. Some free parking is available in the back of the restaurant, and in the couple blocks around (mostly metered).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UTpmz7xG_0fsf74xcKzf2Q.text: One of the must in Phoenix. Really nice breakfast before heading off to work/visiting.

eZAtmaZFDSj_k2c_nmZBgA.text: This place is awesome.   It was the 1st time I had been there and I  sorry I didn't go sooner!   They have excellent food and lemonade and have fast, friendly service.   The bacon is to die for!   Will be going back soon!

u_Cty3Woy-pK2dif3p6GNg.text: This place was out of this world, great staff and friendly. Chicken apple Gouda with cage free eggs and spinach was delish and OMG the home fries were outta this world. Nice tasty thick sliced wheat toast and homemade strawberry jelly to compliment the meal was one experience I will never forget. Matts Big Breakfast is a must to visit again when in the 602 area.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty yellow rose on the table to welcome us to the table coffee was great
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Home fries, chicken apple Gouda sausage with cage free eggs were a tummy pleaser.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey strawberry lemonade a real thirst quencher

X8BOhYY0fT1Mga3Dg0zK2A.text: I had heard how amazing this place was and had been avoiding it because it often has a very long wait. We decided to try it on my birthday for breakfast and was so glad that we did! We got seated right away and they served us a great cup of coffee quickly. They also had eggs Benedict as the special that day, which is my favorite! It was wonderful! The service and food was great. I cannot wait to go back!!

8CKowdNr6P-jQoX0I7z6WQ.text: Best breakfast place in the greater Phoenix area! The problem with most places that have high reviews is that they don't live up to the hype and your expectations are too high. That being said, I went to Matt's with high expectations and they exceeded them. I think a lot of breakfast is bland and similar to other places, but not Matt's.   Sure, it's busy all the time...that's because it's good. Sure, it's loud...that's because it's busy. Service is good. I love sitting at the breakfast bar because the service is even better.   My favorite dish is the salami scramble with added jalapenos. Waffle is the best I've tasted. Hash browns are up there with the best i've tasted. Hell, even their jelly is better. I've been here about 10 times and never left dissatisfied. Only tip would be to get there early. After about 8:30 it really starts to pick up, at least on the weekends.

_gLw3Ai8fuSaQqqaST-CkQ.text: Ok, I've seen all the positive reviews on Matt's Big Breakfast and had to try it out.  I've never been to the original location, so this was my first time eating here.  At first I have to admit I thought that this just might be a lot of hype.  Just another downtown hipster joint with over priced food.  Man I was way off when I saw the menu and eventually received our food.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the wife ordered the waffle and bacon.  Man both were really really good.  The bun for the sandwich tasted like it was freshly made, and the bacon was great.  I ordered it without onions, and sadly didn't order the home fries so I'll try that next time.  I tasted the waffle and it was fantastic along with the thick cut bacon.  The syrup was very tasty and real butter was a nice touch.  Even their coffee was good.  We had great service and were lucky enough to get seated right away.  I really enjoyed our breakfast and for 2 it was right around $20 bucks.  I'm not a real big fan of eating out for breakfast so for me to give a breakfast place a high rating is something to say.  I'm glad I finally tried out Matt's.

Xz40kpOS126tVp6iZq0_Pw.text: Really fast and really good food. We waited for like 10 mins and got our food in two seconds. Probably because we got the hog and chick and it's requested a lot but whatever the case we got in and out and it was delicious. I recommend sour dough bread with the house made strawberry preserves. AZ so far so good! Ps best earl grey tea I ever had in life...

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese thick cut bacon and home fries with fried onions and rosemary. Earl grey tea

-FyOpONKAR4hcT1AiQ5J5A.text: I checked out this place a couple years ago and was not impressed.  I came back today since they relocated and still not impressed.  The waitress was not very friendly,  the hasbrowns were soaked in butter, if you love butter you will love it.  The coffee and homemade jam were both good.  None of the wait staff seemed happy to be there.  They really needed someone at the door directing people.

w8hO8Zr1NbEvPE3omchz5Q.text: I've been here a few times and there is always a wait but its really worth it. The food here is everything you want out of a big breakfast lol.

l0_cdcb2HS5d27QmB16BYg.text: Very limited menu but seems to work in your favor because everything there is delicious.

_kCGZj-YduAvTH0V87yZ9A.text: The day after I moved to Phoenix I was wandering around downtown alone, and came upon this gem. I may be a bit biased because breakfast food is my favorite food, but I was super impressed with the quality of the food and the culture Matt's propagates. I felt like a super nerd for eating alone amongst groups of families and friends, but the servers made me feel like a priority. In addition to my waiter, I had several other employees fill my coffee cup and water when they passed my table. It's rare to find a restaurant where the servers watch out for each other, and put the customer first, regardless of whose table they're at.

AyenYLE9OgzcAPF9O-lVMA.text: Great restaurant for the neighborhood.    Great atmosphere and a perfect place for all ages.  Nice patio and inside is very spacious.  Had the tri tip sandwich.  Was a little small but that's alright bc most places serve too much.   We will be back when we are on that side of town.

A4QDsOAvnoz773y5xjDmHQ.text: Our experience was disappointing from the very beginning. After waiting for over 30 minutes, which we were fine with, they proceeded to seat another couple who signed in after us. I brought it to the hosts attention, no big deal, they got us another table. We sat down, and the host rudely came back over to us and told us to sign in next time, which we had done, they just skipped over us. Them missing us wasn't a big deal, his attitude when he approached us was a huge turnoff. Whatever. We were ready for this awesome breakfast after reading all of the reviews. I got a waffle and bacon. The waffle tasted the same as any other regular waffle on planet earth, the bacon was good. That together was $7.95, at least throw an egg or two in there! They also give you 2oz of syrup, which was enough for my one waffle but not enough for my husband's 3 pancakes (no one likes choking on a pancake). It was $1.50 for an additional 2oz of syrup, which I find absolutely ridiculous. Again, the pancakes tasted just like any regular pancakes. My husband sat with no refill of his water for over ten minutes before I had to get up and ask for it to be refilled.   Overall, we were unimpressed with the service and food.   We did eat breakfast at Vovomeenas on our visit and it was phenomenal from start to finish and reasonably prices. I would take their breakfast ten times over Matt's big breakfast, no questions asked (get the BMOC!)

DdTBimM4ZZ_tm7jeavU_-w.text: Likes.......  Staff & service, fast & friendly!  Simplicity of the entire place, including a  small menu, but it serves it purpose w/o being  overwhelming.  The bacon rocks!!!!   The fresh baked bread & preserves are awesome!  Dislikes.....  My eggs were anything but over medium.  (Super runny)  My home style potatoes were raw. At lest 3/4 of them were not cooked an not edible. :(  My husbands sausage patties were still visibly pink in the middle. (Not anything that's gonna kill ya, but IMO pork sausage should be cooked thoroughly.)  I really think you guys have a great place, I just think  maybe the cooks need to slow down a bit & get the food  cooked properly. Obviously, the place is normally packed w/ people waiting & I am sure that puts a lot  of pressure on everyone. Sometimes you have to take a  step back to take a step forward.

9zfG2CnW-wk4vVXf0svVzw.text: After thinking about it for almost a year, I finally tried this place out! Truly great food (had the omelet and other signature stuff), friendly servers, and well, the waiting line was not that long - or perhaps I just made a right decision to go early in this regard.

tKEJncdt91buA35LvNL60g.text: I was looking for a place to have breakfast and Matt's Big Breakfast popped up on Yelp. The restaurant is small and crowded. We arrived at 9:30am on a weekday and waited about 30 minutes to be seated (party of four). The service was excellent and everyone in my group enjoyed what they ordered. I had "the chop and chick" which was two eggs, a pork chop, country potatoes and toast. They make their strawberry jam from scratch which was really good. I would definitely go back if I'm in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chop and Chick

HT7WuGY6F4cewblScjEm1w.text: We came here based on good Yelp reviews. Delicious fresh and great. I am not a big breakfast fan so for me to be psyched is unusual. The restaurant is darling with exposed brick and utilitarian pendants. They moved down a block last year to accommodate the crowds.   We sat at the breakfast bar and enjoyed a fabulous breakfast. I had a cheddar omelet with mushrooms and sourdough bread. The former was cheesy and exceptional The toast was served with marvelous fresh apricot preserves. My dining mate raved about his home fries (with fresh rosemary) and the special which was a ham scramble with fresh jalapenos. Both were winner choices.     Our server was really efficient and rather mesmerizing to see her take care of dozens of people with apparent ease. Watching her whisk around, felt like I was watching a lava lamp while waiting for breakfast, I am dinging a star because the place is really loud. Also my bottom kept sliding off the half dollar size bar stools. Noticed the ASU kids didn't seem to have that problem.     We will definitely return.  Thanks Yelpers

CAQjmhc6ViF-H2fKWcjTrw.text: I've been coming to Matt's since it was in the tiny hole in the wall place down the road from it's new location and I have never been let down.  Their menu is fairly small but their portions are gigantic. Just the waffle alone takes up a whole dinner plate, and their omelets are to die for. Literally the first bite always brings a tear to my eye. I always go for the ham, red pepper, and American cheese which just oozes cheese and its innerds with each bite. Their bacon is also soo good, thick cut and well seasoned. They sautee their onions in some delicious oil that I have yet to place but always tastes fantastic. And their lemonade is the perfect mix of sweet and tart, and made fresh daily with real cane sugar and comes with fruit options as well. And each breakfast comes with your choice of bread (sourdough, wheat, white, and occasionally other options) and a side of freshly made jam of the day which is always incredible. I go for their sourdough which is always wonderful but their wheat is just as good.  The only thing I have found lacking is the hash browns, some days they are great but more often than not the bottom half is under cooked and soggy, get the home fries which come with sauteed onions and a sprinkling of fresh rosemary (they are sooo good).  Its family owned and Matt (the owner) gets all of his ingedients fresh from the local farmer's market. It wasnt uncommon in the past to see him helping out tables at the old restaurant but now with the new locations, he's more busy making sure each location is as good as the original.  Parking can be a bit difficult but their is an ally that connects the new restaurant with the old which allows more parking. And their is often a wait if you come before noon, but trust me it is well worth the wait. This is by far the best breakfast joint in town.  I would recommend this place to anyone, whether you just picked up friends or reletives from the airport or if you're just looking for a good hearty breakfast. It can get loud and it is a bit longer wait for large groups (come after 1pm and you won't have a problem) but everyone will thank you for the amazing meal. I seriously suggest this place to everyone I know and everyone says its the best. Whether you stumble in after a long night drinking (they open at 6am and the food is just as good then) or if you're grabbing a bite before starting your day everything here is incredible.   And hey now there's an airport location with a full bar, which I've heard has the best bloody Mary's. The other locations definitely don't match up with the original though so try the place where it all started first.

DSFKGuou6GcNjDcfHbQzLA.text: Grabbed brunch here with some friends after landing at PHX. First stop on our road trip!  It was quite busy for a Friday morning at like 9am (don't people have work?!) but we were seated within 10 minutes. I ended up ordering the cheese omelet and added bacon. This also came with toast on the side, of which I ordered wheat. Yeah ok, this was literally a big breakfast. My plate was FULL with home fries (seasoned with rosemary yum) and my omelette took up more than half the plate. The pieces of toast were massive, yet the perfect level of toasted. Not crispy, nor soft. Perfection. Everything was delicious. I left feeling satisfied and full. Also, our server was super friendly, and was on top of refilling our coffees, as we were all suffering from sleep deprivation.

i1c0fXAGxEfz8kbm8NWwEQ.text: Great breakfast stop! It seems to be popular with local and out-of-towners, so it may be busy - the food is worth a short wait though! Service was friendly and fast with the prices also being very reasonable.  I really enjoyed the griddlecakes - great consistency with a slight sweetness. Their bacon is also excellent - peppered and cut thick.  All in all, MBB is a great find for a tasty breakfast. Be sure to check out their location in the Phoenix airport as well!

3pBKVN5Hq8ySjx0qT_LzjQ.text: Great breakfast place!  1st timer here  The long wait is definitely worth it people! ( only waited for about 20 minutes )  I had the scramble special and it was delicious! Home made strawberry jam is AMAZING!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gsEopSwySiDsDctlPFB5qg.text: Awesome meal!  Portion size is great and the staff is very efficient! Will go again on our way back to the airport!

EkpHvgTlvktG3WGRge7Hdw.text: I always enjoy coming here. The breakfast is always on point. Always comes out super hot. I love there different specials. It is packed and sometimes a wait but so worth it. And it usually goes by pretty quickly.

t7PWGWLfA6Q1hsfm9G9WRg.text: Ate here on a Friday morning. Arrived around 10am there was a wait!  It's not a big place I wouldn't go here with more than about 6 people. My husband got the daily special with hash browns and I got the waffle with bacon and a side of the rosemary home fries. I also got the strawberry lemonade. It was super tasty but not sure it was $4 good. My husband loved the daily special and they have made in house hot sauce which was also good and he said had a slow heat. Bacon was thick cut and fully cooked but not burnt which isn't easy to do. The service was ok. It took a bit from when we were seated to when someone asked about our drink order and a time or two we had to flag someone down for more coffee or water. Overall it was a good experience and I'd go back but the 4 stars is due to the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily special with homemade blueberry preserves.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle with bacon and a side of home fries (extra crispy)

MxAQ1Lhl-XEEugHUpgmHrg.text: Phoenix is definitely lucky to have a great breakfast/brunch place like this. The 20-30 minute wait is worth it. Now, confession time: as much as I tell myself I'm going to change it up, I always revert to ordering the same thing: the Hog and Chick. My order comes with: Scrambled eggs: I'm not usually a fan of eggs at restaurants, but Matt's use of butter makes their eggs fluffy and absolutely delectable, almost reminiscent of homestyle soft-scrambled eggs. Bacon: Thick-sliced bacon. Need I say more? Those three peppery, perfectly cooked slices are what every pig aspires to end up as and my favorite part of this dish, hands down. Home fries: When given the choice between hash browns and home fries, I will always opt for home fries. Matt's home fries are what I would call skillet potatoes. They're crispy and super flavorful, cooked with onions and rosemary. Dip in some of Matt's special ketchup for a sweet and savory match made in heaven. Toast: Thick buttered slices every time. Served with their yummy preserves. The strawberry preserves are my favorite. It's a busy, bustling atmosphere, a nice kind of energy to start your day. If you have the time and patience, do yourself a favor and stop by! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog and Chick... That bacon, though!

jA8Z2UDN7T2zMY8tdYWp-Q.text: It's 6:20am on a Sunday morning- Mother's Day actually. I am waiting with a small crowd outside for Matt's to open. We are warmly greeted and welcomed in at 6:30 on the dot.  I am alone so I save the tables for the crowds who will be coming in behind me and sit at the counter.  I order the the hog and chick and it is cooked perfectly. Adam is my server and he is friendly, knowledgeable and on top of it. Here is the surprise for me and why it was so easy for me to give 5 stars. Typically the god I get from breakfast restaurants when they first open is undercooked and pale hash browns and  bacon that is not crisp. Not here- the bacon was incredible and the hash browns crispy and brown. This was at 6:40 in the morning- Bravo Matt's for your quality and consistency!

saekdoq8cyIxyBsF4IU-uw.text: So I've gone here MULTIPLE times before during peak hours and NEVER have I had that rude of a wait staff or HOST for that matter. Don't lie to people saying 20-30 mins. Then nearly almost an HOUR later you want to give me an attitude for asking why a table for 2 has been empty for the last 20 minutes?!  Only for you to tell me you're saving it for a big party to come in... last I checked you don't take reservations. Fast forward 10 more minutes and you seat a couple who came in AFTER me at the table that's been open for 20 minutes! How COMICAL!  So then when you want to try to be nice after the fact you realize you've pissed me off.  So when I tell you to leave me alone you want to tell me I need a better attitude?! lol you're a host who can't manage their job tasks. You're not a life coach so you can F off.   Never will I ever go to this restaurant again after the horrible service. Lack of service. Insanely incorrect wait time given and lack of compassion. I can eat anywhere. I don't need to eat here. If people don't eat here you don't stay open. Remember that.

_QTCPOGUGJyMHlB9TFrgbw.text: Big Brekfast. Lots of food. Don't be surprised if you can't finish it. A simple 2 eggs, bacon and house potatoes with toast is more than filling.  Loved the fresh squeezed orange juice.  Great service.  Would recommend.

0zfGvDyxKz2q_tOf9fe4RQ.text: went back for a second time and got the waffle, oats, and eggs Benedict. I really wanted the french toast, but it's only served on Wednesday. The waffle had a really good flavor. Similar flavor to the pancake. I would suggest the waffle or pancake at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle and eggs Benedict
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oats
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple sausage and side of pancake.

GW5yD-ftD_n8oEnNzw65TQ.text: 8oz Thick cut Ham is their signature dish. You must try it. One guy next to me said that is the best breakfast he ever had. So order a HOG and Chick.  ASU,,,30,,,!

thtZm1pd-V9YRWlFT0mOhg.text: We were down visiting my daughter and we decided to come here based on yelp reviews.   It was pouring raining and not a lot of space inside to wait to be seated which was about 30 min wait.  We were seated at a table for four of us and immediately greeted by our waitress for drink orders.  She quickly took the drink ordered and came back quickly with our waters and then later with rest of our coffee, tea and juices. We proceeded to place our ordered. I got the special which was a three egg scramble with bacon and spinach, mini me got the hot and chick with bacon and we decided to share the Belgian waffle.  Our food came pretty quickly and wow the portions are generous and the price is so affordable too. We all enjoyed our food too. It was quite noisy but we manage to have conversation while eating.  We would definite come back to eat here again when we are back in the area.  We also like the service here too. Very quick, fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle so light and airy and so delicious!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 egg scramble with bacon and spinach special. The potatoes were so delicious!

tVd8xDPlOIKbwBP1_GAK1w.text: This Matt's 'Big' Breakfast location is actually very small, and loud.  But the service is very good, a bit chaotic but friendly.  The average breakfast of eggs, bacon, sausage is nothing special (but bacon and toast are thicker).  If that's all you're interested in, you might get a better deal at a Denny's or IHOP that's less crowded.  However, if you go for their more interesting dishes, that's where Matt's shines. People really like the french toast and pan cakes with REAL maple syrup, large hash-brown portions, beautiful omelettes, homemade preserves and more.  Matt's was also featured on 'Diners, Drive-ins and Dives'

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-2a-SxWUdvcXW8KV9T_DYA.text: This is a great spot to stop in and have an informal breakfast.  The menu has a good assortment of the expected fare and some great specials.  The portions are just right, the price is right, the service is quick.   It is a little loud and a little hipster but absolutely a place to make a regular haunt.

G7_VrTxk4Dm3FkDxrOfyyA.text: Thank goodness I finally made it. Went on a Sunday morning around 10am expecting a wait and didn't wait longer than 5 minutes, I think the horrendous construction might be keeping people away.   The flavors in my Saturday Special three egg scramble with Cabot cheddar, sauteed jalapenos, and Shreiner's chicken enchilada sausage were bursting. The jalapenos had great heat. The hash browns come in a slab with the perfect ratio of crispy top and bottom to a soft, almost creamy center. Then, as if you needed some more carbs, they throw a large tortilla on top of it all. My scramble plate and his waffle were easily shared with two of us- we both left stuffed. $27 including coffee.   Coffee- great! Waffles- light, fluffy, savory, and slightly sweet, served with real maple syrup.  The incredible bacon like they serve you reminds you not all bacon is created equal. Service- fast and friendly.   We have so much more to explore on the menu. Can't get back soon enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Saturday special three egg scramble, Cabot cheddar, sautéed jalapeños, and enchilada chicken sausage. Plus hash browns and tortilla.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle.

xhH9oZBuNZwQqGGLRlzXWw.text: Place is super cute and very busy for a Thursday morning. We ordered the Eggs Benedict's (Thursday special) and waffles. The waffles were delicious and worth getting! The bacon was my favorite part, it had this peppery smoke to it! The Benedict's were just ok for me. The English toast that the poach egg and ham sits on isn't my favorite and the hollandaise sauce wasn't a wow for me. BUT, there hash browns extra crispy we're so good for being thicker than what you usually see for hash browns. Place was packed but service was fast!   A lot of reviewers mention friendly staff but we didn't get that warm, happy and welcoming vibe. Host was a gentlemen and he wasn't rude but was running around the place and just quickly took your name (appreciate that his a fast and hard worker but a quick hello and letting us know how long wait wouldn't hurt). Our server wasn't rude but also did her job, hello. Took our order. Checked back. Drop check. Nothing engaging to remember or make the visit better. When dropping off a check, one should let the guest know when your ready to pay, you can take it to the encounter. Don't assume everyone is from that town...

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JPoVLYHdl7-oeRBvoYISmQ.text: Downtown location is my favorite breakfast restaurant in Phoenix. Be prepared to wait outside for a table most days and times because it is the favorite of almost everyone else too! Great menu, especially the daily specials - try anything with a Mexican flair for an authentic experience few can match. Hip fun vibe, honestly friendly servers who care about your experience and a great customer mix. Matt's always serves good size portions, real flavors from honest cooking with real ingredients and bottomless coffee that you'll actually want more of... Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchilada sausage jalapeño scramble with home fries and fresh tortillas... Amazing!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili huevos rancheros with home fries and house recipe slow cooked pinto beans, corona cheese to top it all.... My FAVORITE!

mrGOJ4BxU8bZi6ZKE0r_lQ.text: Delicious food every time. Good service. It's always been crowded when I'm there. Consequently the wait is really long. Don't go if you're starving cuz you WILL get hangry.

LMW6xWIzaxwWlvytSW1eiw.text: After all these years, I decided to see what the hype was all about. Well I can say that I'm right with the rave reviews. From the fresh squeezed orange juice and perfectly cooked eggs to the amazing bacon and delicious preserves, everything was wonderful. Great service as well. I'll be going back.

i_s8a2XIiHPKdRkBsiqKDQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is located in a little building on the corner of 1st Street and Garfield. It is always packed and if you don't arrive before roughly 9AM you will wait for a table. Luckily we were able to get the last table on a recent Saturday. It is at this moment that our luck ran out.  I have said this before: there are only a handful of breakfast spots in downtown Phoenix so to hear people tell it, this is the greatest breakfast place in the world. However, this analysis is False, the breakfast is average at best and is elevated in lieu of other options.   There is parking located behind the building and all along the streets. At various times a song would come on the speakers inside and drown out the chatter, and then silence for 10 minutes. Maybe we came on an off day.  Perhaps someone can help me with something, I ordered the hash browns and they tasted as if they were smothered in vanilla or something sweet. This was immediately off-putting and I could not tell if this was intended but it ruined the whole experience. I did like the jam they served with the sourdough toast, it was probably the best part of the meal.  Ordinarily I would ask a server about this strange flavor choice for the hash browns but it was so incredibly busy that waiting 10 minutes for a water refill seemed to signal to me that I should just move on with my day.  I tried the salami scramble and there massive chunks of sopressata haphazardly tossed in a mountain of eggs. It came with potatoes on the side, they were tasteless and I couldn't finish them.   I may return to try their lunch menu at some point but I will not eat breakfast here again unless forced to.

9BWl_DJyz5aWY1CUTdfihA.text: Awesome local breakfast spot. Ordered the special and was extremely pleased with it variety and taste. Wasn't overly crowded and the servers were very attentive. Would definitely recommend and will return.

z5q-DgQAkmNNMbsvd61-ag.text: What a great place. Terrific food and friendly, attentive staff. I had the french toast combo. OMG! Delicious!  My husband had Matt's Big Breakfast. He thoroughly enjoyed it. Melinda was our server and she is amazing! The handsome, dark haired waiter who served our food is also great. Two thumbs up.

aUhYIbpLh5EV6eiXQs0ldQ.text: Breakfast sandwich is great. First heard of matts years ago but it was always so busy that I never got a chance to try it... it's well worth the wait

pAmpqhxepCpeMST1xipDAA.text: Ate here since it was relatively close to the airport, and it was good but not great. The waffle was buttery with a light crunch. I wish it came with some fresh fruit or something to top it off with though, it was a bit plain by itself. The menu is quite small as well.

oMNZzh0XPe_Dl5VQgouihQ.text: Gotta try Matt's! They really are putting out a superb breakfast. Love the thick cut toast and Pork Shop (queen creek) thick sliced bacon with cracked pepper. Even the bottomless cup of coffee is a great coffee. Keep up the great eats Matt!!!

FZsazlM54PanmCuTJKko5g.text: I had a bit of a wait for a table, but I expected that as it was Sunday morning. I was dining alone, and was seated in about 20 minutes. My waitress was engaging, and promptly brought water to my table. I was ready to order, so she took my drink (coffee) and meal orders at the same time. She returned quickly with the coffee, and I was surprised how quickly my meal (steak and eggs) came, given how busy it was. Steak was cooked as ordered, everything was hot and fresh!  I visit Phoenix on a regular basis and have eaten here several times. Staff have always been friendly and accommodating. Nice job.

BFWd4WI20YHJ7pRkqTEjDA.text: We had a long wait for a table at Matt's Big Breakfast recently, but the food and service were worth it.  I had the Skinny, which is made with four egg whites and chicken apple sausage and comes with a small side salad.  My guy had the Chop & Chick, which is made with eggs and pork chops.  The food was really tasty, and the price was very reasonable.  We shall return!

4-e3Cbck1HColrCYQnZIGw.text: While visiting Phoenix we ate at this cool little restaurant recommended to us by the rental car agent. For $10 I received a huge plate of perfect hash browns, 4 slices of bacon, 2 eggs over easy, and 2 huge pieces of amazing sourdough bread with homemade jam. The place was packed but they kept food coming out quickly and the waiting staff was efficient and attentive, providing great service.

b-cmYO-ziARz05k1nOW3Kw.text: First time at Matt' Big Breakfast. Arrived at 10:15 on a Saturday morning and waited 20 mins: much less than most reviewers.   My son-in-law and I both ordered identical breakfasts: the special meal and drink of the day. We each got the Three Egg omelette with Schriner's Chorizo a jalapenos and it came with potatoes. We both got a side of sausage and a Strawberry Honey Lemonade.   It arrived in about 10 mins. The eggs were nicely cooked and the potatoes were cooked crispy, just as I prefer them. The sausage were a bit small for the price but I got full anyway. The drink was too sweet and would've been better without the honey.    Overall a good experience. I will bring my gluten-intolerant wife and see what she thinks next time.

2VsQZioJ9uZvdymfX2pUKw.text: I've been here before and I did not remember, somehow, that the breakfast food here is amazing. The bacon and patty sausage are the best I've ever had. I'd describe the bacon as being marinated and slow-smoked under and angel's wing. It's that good. The eggs are perfect, the greens were delightful. This place was 5+ stars!

o7KlH6AlIjLdAZGu0LU3qQ.text: Went to Matt's Big Breakfast with 6 of my peers after an informational session on a Saturday afternoon. It was very busy, there was at least a 30 minute waiting period, and we had to wait for all the members of our group to be present before our waiting period even began.  Even though we ended up waiting for a little over 30 minutes, it was well worth the wait because we got to sit at this big table located in a little room they have off to the side. It made the setting very intimate and homey since we were surrounded by cute decor and a refrigerator holding Matt's homemade preserves.   The first time I ever went to Matt's Big Breakfast I was really craving egg salad so I ordered the egg salad sandwich, which even though it was good, it wasn't anything I would return back for. With that in mind, this time I decided to order something Matt's Big Breakfast is known for, that being BREAKFAST! I ordered the special of the day, the egg scramble complete with local cheese, spinach, and sausage. Between the hashbrowns or home fries I ordered the home fries  (basically quartered potatoes, crisped to perfection and seasoned with rosemary, YUM). The scramble came with a side of toast with butter and a little cup of their famous preserves. I ordered sourdough toast and the preserves that it came with were strawberry. Their preserves are definitely worth a try! Not to be confused with jelly, their preserves have a nice consistency with bits of fruit noted.  I would not recommend dining here if you have big groups in which the check needs to be split. I say this because if we wanted the receipt split according to what everyone ate, we had to take it up to the counter where we were informed by the cashier that she was unable to split it by item, we had to give her dollar amounts. This got a little tricky since the receipt wasn't itemized but rather grouped into by item (i.e. 3 hog and chick's were ordered and the receipt only showed the total for all three). Additionally, we didn't have menus in front of us to determine the individual item prices and our group was fairly large which made standing at the cashier doing math quite the inconvenience for anyone in line behind us.  It mostly seemed like there were families and parties of one here at Matt's Big Breakfast so definitely go solo or with your family.  I would definitely recommend Matt's Big Breakfast if you're looking for homey breakfast food with subtle modern nuances.

Cukzjcx3N5DzaKU5ptFr2A.text: Been here too many times! Big, greasy, Scrumdiddlyumptious breakfast!!! Good vibes, excellent service and delish home made food!!!

64QOaAEWbIvN73-PlhzdFw.text: Great breakfast place, especially for crowds coming through downtown Phoenix and the Convention Center. Matt's is very busy- I had to wait 10 minutes for a 2 person table at 10pm on a Friday morning.  The food was fantastic- I got the bacon and waffles. This big, syrupy waffle was cut by two generous strips of peppered bacon. My bottomless coffee was solid and the server never let it empty.  I visited here with a friend and her young son. The staff was very accommodating to this twitchy toddler (and we were not the only group there with a young child) and had a high chair available for the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle comes with pepper bacon!

Vol9ISegMvUAAOk1jVR_kg.text: Matt's Big Breakfast!  I came in on a Monday morning around 11 and believe it or not, only waited 5 mins. for a seat!  Sat at the bar and was able to order right away. I had coffee and The Hog & Chick plate which comes with Thick cut bacon (or sausage if you'd rather).   The thick bacon was incredible and so tasty and totally lived up to the hype that this place generates.  Tasty coffee as well and the staff is super friendly but fast and efficient.  Overall awesome food and experience!

D_OofN0qw8R6sNzY2KpPKw.text: I'm not much of a breakfast guy, but I've heard a lot of good things about this place, so we finally made it a point to stop in and see what all the hype was about. So, some things seem overpriced, some things seemed pretty fair. I dig the vibe of the place, though it's very small, and very loud inside. We ordered a few different things off the menu and had no complaints there. Overall, it was a good experience, and if I ever go out for breakfast again, we just may pay Matt's another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another breakfast thingy. This one with a pork chop.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some sorta breakfast thingy.

ady8CLQSuUsp_OALw7auCw.text: I loved this place! It was a short walk from the downtown hotel where I was staying. I think I was about the only person who wasn't a local. Friendly and attentive service. Great food served in generous portions and a good cup of coffee! I will definitely return whenever I have the chance. Left happy and full, ready for the day.

lnmEJT5eE8Qs0FZjkMajFw.text: I love the food here. They open early and always have a crowd. The menu was accommodating for non-pork eaters as well, so that is a huge plus for my fiance and I.

sIra8xkldOLHHgeTH4Drhw.text: Not just for breakfast but they do breakfast right. The big breakfast is enough for any hungry traveler! Like any airport place it depends on time of day for service and timing. They do a great job of getting people in and out but at peak times its a wait but if you have the time it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daniel Vallejo rockin the customer service on the early shift!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot coffee in the very early AM after an overnight flight! Thanks Matt

bg5wwEprqjdHLlhT3rwmPw.text: Found this place through yelp it showed up as the number one breakfast spot near us and had amazing reviews. The food & coffee was pretty good I ordered the hog and chick. Had very thick slices of bacon. I also received the wrong toast with my order which I'm not that mad about, it is understandable for a mistake to happen with how crazy busy it was. My waitress however was very rude. We asked a question about what type of toast they had when we ordered she rolled her eyes and was very snarky. If I had not had that experience with the waitress the place would definitely have an additional one or two stars.

Y80wT4lSLSoTPm6J39Pizg.text: How can something so simple taste this wonderful?  Mine is not to question, but simply to enjoy. The omelet with hash browns and sour dough toast with strawberry preserves was excellent. The bread has the proper balance of crunchy and chew!  That is the only way to describe the bread!  The pepper bacon was phenomenal today. Not too crunchy and really lean.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelet with hash browns.

nEc563UVe6z1dt89afweTw.text: Delicious!!! Food was great but service was crap. We waited for an 1 to be seated. They skipped our name so we waited 20 extra mins. It would have been longer if I didn't ask what place we were in. I like drink refills and the server didn't ask if I wanted another.  Food 5 stars  Service 2 stars

ozFnTvtEhdpX95yzBTuuqw.text: I normally LOVE this place because any other time, I would've given a five star rating. Today, I went for the first time in a couple months. Normally, to keep my toddler distracted I give him gold fish or some kind of snack from home. I know that's he's hungry and toddlers don't understand the idea of waiting. I was feeding him gold fish when a waitress came up to me to inform me that I can't bring outside food in. His sippy cup was allowed but that's it. Are you serious? I didn't bring Taco Bell in. I brought in gold fish for my toddler who would, if I let him, cause mass destruction just by running around. It was ridiculous.   The food was good but to be informed I can't give my toddler snacks from home inside, it gives me a reason not to come back. I know, I know most people wouldn't see this as a problem but if you can't accommodate my child, no reason to come back.

zV3aYUEELRhMth-dDnNe7A.text: Good food great people and atmosphere Really enjoyed the staff very accommodating highly Reccomend....

0Ksy2RfIHQTJt-ZUgRtDqA.text: This is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. I got The Hog & Chick and it was amazing. Scrambled eggs, amazing thick cut bacon seasoned to perfection, delicious big sourdough toast, and hashbrowns I could eat for the rest of my life. Everything's made in house or sourced locally and it tastes like it--super fresh and satisfying. Even the iced coffee is ground daily and was lovely. Couldn't have asked for a better meal. Also the decor and entire old school hipster branding fits perfectly--very appealing.

tye22HEmplmCTWdMWNVipg.text: Best eggs Benedict  I've ever had in all my travels! Highly recommended especially if you have kids. Lots of food! Come hungry

Eep3oWIkp5POTDE8fqA2Rw.text: Worth the wait!  Keep in mind there is always a wait.  They have a a water dispenser outside and benches while you wait.  I prefer to keep an eye out for the limited waiting area seating inside, though!!  While waiting, people forget the seats inside free up as those people are call to their tables.  Staff is very efficient, yet still personable to their customers.  On our last visit I loved how the hostess called me by name when she came by to check on my table.  And you don't just have one person checking up on you.  They all do!    Now, on to the food.  There is a reason why Matt's Big Breakfast is iconic here in Phoenix.  It's delicious!  The menu is simple and straight forward, but anything you order is phenomenal.  And although you've had a version of everything on the menu before, the way Matt's make it is so much better!  They also have specials so even if you visit more than a few times you can still try something a little different on each visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom omelet with thick cut bacon.  I also got a side of sourdough that comes to your table already buttered.

5NUnXndQ1H7f2Ro0CfqPgw.text: Amazing. Felt like I was back home in Texas at an organic restaurant. Full of love.  Everything was filled with taste. Nothing bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Too full lol

CVuYK12gqYo0OcFLUe5mQw.text: The line and wait explain it enough. Matt's is a great place to wait, especially if you are willing to wait in line. The best times I like to go are during the weekdays when the service and food come out as quick as you order it appears at times. The staff and customer service is as good as it gets, especially given the busy rushes. The plate sizes/portions, and the selections are a main reason why we all keep going back no matter the wait. Dont wait too long, head out now and beat the rush....

g3JUhD0gUk8JLy1X9kIIBQ.text: This place has some of the best breakfast ever! Everything was good from start to finish, customer service was good very friendly. I ordered the skinny and it came with a spring salad and an egg white omelet that was to die for. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

P1YBSHLo2zc3bTcxPdhUAw.text: So this place was such a let down. With all the hype I expected amazing, one of a kind eats. Instead, I got any other breakfast joint that made good food. I definitely wouldn't pay for parking and wait more than 20 minutes for their food.  You're better off driving to Arcadia area where thwy have several restaurants with the same kind of ambience, price, bigger portiins and free parking. Also, if you're a breakfast place in AZ that serves eggs and don't carry Chaloula that's just blasphemy. The service was good, their definitely quick. Although, they forgot our sausages by the time it came out we were done with everything else. But that happens sometimes, I'm sure they were just busy. The decor is cute.

A_4PR6c1202FnTL0oxc1uQ.text: Was in Phoenix for just a short bit on our way to Sedona and was looking for a breakfast place for our family of four. Matt's Big Breakfast came highly recommended on Yelp and we were not disappointed. Went on a Saturday morning around 9:30 and there was a short wait. Waitress was friendly and efficient and the food was delicious! Wish we lived in the area so I could go again!

l0sjPPTvhXhi0xnWf8KGww.text: Really great experience for myself, mom, sister-in-law and two year old niece.   Enjoyed the waiting area, cool bench, muriel and WATEr. Plenty of space for the niece to walk around and be entertained.   The interior was hustle and bustle. Friendly wait staff. The place is buzzing with energy.   Unfortunately the food just isn't that great. Everyone was happy and full but no one was impressed.   Unless we want a cool place to hang for breakfast, not likely to return anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N3_QZsTNyOCBsX3hMDkRaQ.text: The waiting time & super noisy small space is too great to ignore. The food was ok but not necessarily worth it. Won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Basic breakfast. The jellyjam was the best thing about this

Vx-TomMhu5p3xiTktpingQ.text: Great breakfast.   Hip, Cool spot. Only drawback was loud . Everything else great and food was good

zhhmNCYhm1FT7JI6H_Hn_g.text: Used to be a nice place but has gone downhill. Second time in a row we have been dissatisfied. Had to get up from my table to go get my own coffee refill as I could not get anyone to come to our table . Manager finally was more attentive. My food was luke warm.

5A3CrmDfUwT_oBF_cI8slA.text: Start off by saying vague options for breakfast....service semi-okay...when order brought to table not complete and never did the rest come out....ordered BLT in which the bread was really hard to bite and bacon more undercooked then I prefer. My husband however did enjoy his eggs Benedict and recommends!! Unfortunately the worst part was when we got to the counter and asked for our bills to be separated due to Meals being granted by my work the server said he is unable to do that and has never had to do that. Which  I felt is very poor customer service and that should be something that the facility should do when asked especially since it seemed as though many diverse groups of people go In there and don't pay off one check!! Maybe better service next time will get you more stars!!!

dRBdIkihtcUFzcUdYdsTEQ.text: By 'big breakfast' they really do mean BIG BREAKFAST. Affordable breakfast place with a straightforward menu, and a few locations scattered throughout Phoenix. We hit the 1st street location on a Monday morning, 8:30 am, and apparently beat the rush - as a party of two, we were seated immediately, but as we ate we watched with some surprise as pretty large groups kept coming in and were willing to wait for quite awhile - can they not tell it's a tiny location with primarily tables for two? As for the food, my tomatillo/eggs/tortilla/pinto beans were pretty good, though not the unforgettable experience I'd expected, judging by the other Yelp reviews which guided us here in the first place. My husband outright hated his eggs & salami scramble, describing the salami as 'rancid.' But honestly, eggs and salami together sounds awful anyway, so perhaps he should have played it safe and gotten a classic eggs & bacon option. Coffee refills slowed down as the place became more and more busy.  Anyway. We're glad we tried it as it filled us up for several hours, and it didn't break the bank.

GCTU0YczBFD2UtiIlXb9oQ.text: Wowzer ! I love this place. I get to a lot of breakfast places but this is awesome.  #1. The service is some of the best I have ever seen. Very happy attentive folks!   #2. The food was always fresh, local, cooked perfect.

7cFCS1LoCVqFU76HYWccZQ.text: Great little diner. Coffee is ok service is good. Food is ok for breakfast. Inexpensive and atmosphere is good.

wC_HxmYTY1kbVQOz5ZGcPA.text: My boss brought us here for breakfast and it was excellent! The food was great, service was impeccable and the wait was not too bad. They advised us the wait would be 15 minutes but we were seated in about 5 minutes. The portions were large and definitely got out money's worth. I plan on going back again.

pR3czxtLm6kUKTJdWoN4zA.text: Incredible servings and consistently good food. Better come early or be prepared to wait - there is a long line for a reason.

touiIGIqfEmiePbCanvnzg.text: One of my favorite downtown breakfast places.  Do wish they opened earlier on weekdays.  I love the bacon--some of the best I've had--and recommend the french toast, the pancakes.  The coffee and OJ are fine, the service is fine.  Had one dish w/ the hashbrowns--they were so-so..don't recommend them.    But the french toast and bacon are what's worth coming back for again and again...

KiJ0W-TKZVtWn3gYtQEpwg.text: This place is great. Simple menu and great prices. It does get a little crowed and can have a wait but it sure is worth it. I have also done pick up on a saturday and I was in and out and under 5 min.

c8F6tnLSCRwm8o-Qq8v9HA.text: Breakfast perfection!   Everything was spot-on perfect....  Worth the wait (and there always is a wait)...  Fresh ingredients, made-from-scratch delish breakfast is THE BEST BREAKFAST in  metro Phoenix....

5RpYfMseieQtwajhUQmHeA.text: What a surprise!!!!!!  I love chorizo and eggs and was very worried about ordering at Matts. Hands down the best chorizo and eggs!!!!  I have been here twice and order the chorizo and eggs every time I am sure the rest of the food is good.

SL23CvZwIvOYW5Rkcfg4kQ.text: I went to Matt's Big Breakfast with my mother-in-law a few days ago and had a great experience.  It seems like everyone on this thread is already raving about this place, so I guess I'm just going to add more to it!  Yes, it's busy. So be prepared to wait for a table. Wife, her mom, and I waited for about half an hour for a table. But that was okay.   It's very simple, clean inside the restaurant. Their food portions were big and plenty.   Their country potatoes are stellar and so is their bacon. Eggs are eggs anywhere. It seems a lot of people liked the orange juice here, but I didn't try it.   Their coffee was great though! The server was very nice. But when we asked her about a few of the entrees, she wasn't very helpful because she said she didn't eat meat.   I think that's part of the reason I chose a more traditional breakfast. Eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast.   It was good though!

MtICbTDdxRf3yC79fee67Q.text: This place gets so packed! I had to see what all the rave was about and I'm just not too sure. Their menu had very typical items that are prepared as expected. No knock against the place, but it has nothing that would bring me back.

eBBg2Q_16qVq_IcggeEqOw.text: Best place for breakfast. Must try there waffle and  bacon. Hog & chick is amazing my wife loves there eggs and toast so fresh.

g8v1yYmL67oM_82KcI19Kg.text: I have stopped by for a breakfast a few times in the past few weeks.  Great food, reasonable prices, and the City of Phoenix parking meters don't start needing coins until 8 am.  The best part of the place?  Chelsea and Torie (Tory?) are the best servers I have encountered in a LONG time; friendly, attentive to your dining needs, willing to spend some time to get to know you, interested in what you as the customer are doing (with Torie it's books and reading, with Chelsea it's career and family).  Makes for a very pleasant eating experience.

qDYFf0igaK4hV4k0PGzPtw.text: Maybe it was just all the hype beforehand.  I had heard about this place for six years.  I was ready to be amazed.  Unfortunately it is very, very mediocre.

-45xAqN3db8HA0TvVgC4oQ.text: This is hands down the best traditional breakfast place in the valley. My boyfriend and I are huge foodies so we have eaten at almost every breakfast place in town. Matt's has the best bacon and hash browns I've ever had. Their bacon is thick-cut, seasoned with maple and black pepper. Their hashbrowns (and probably everything else on the menu) probably have three tablespoons of butter in them, but trust me its worth it. There is usually a wait, so be prepared. But just do what we do and go there anticipating an hour wait, not when you're starving. Sip some cave creek coffee and enjoy the day while you wait. You'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hash browns, bacon, cheese omelette with sausage from Niman ranch, and a waffle

GcXz6ZZoqx7-SRj9A3_2oQ.text: Absolutely not worth the wait. I've given two tries... done. Has to be the worst breakfast in town.

ORVs2m7_bKjVoixV6UVVcA.text: The food is good but way over priced, one waffle and a piece of bacon for ten bucks. It had a cool atmosphere, and the people were friendly, maybe I am just to dollar conscious for this place. It was worth it to go once. You won't be disappointed on the quality.

VPW1ZOVE9WBcPtOBqrlxZQ.text: After my ARR 5k @ South Mountain I drove home on Central.....decided to stop and try this place. Walked right in and was able to sit at the bar. I ordered OJ and the basic 2 eggs, toast, delicious thick bacon and the best home fries.....they are awesome rosemary white potatoes with onions. The only draw back is the place is small so it's a little noisy.....but very popular!

BA_sdG9On0wAIGhp2YEtNg.text: Yes it is very busy, yes Guy Fieri went there... but OVERRATED! The food is fine but with the rep this place has, it really should be a whole hell of a lot better. The coffee is great but everything else is something I could whip up in my own kitchen

r2o-Xyu73E6XKa2MkD0OzQ.text: Delicious food! It was kind of noisy though.

9g_Bfx_VtyPjjsM9OXn-Zg.text: Great breakfast.. the wait was a lil long but all in all some good food..  the bacon reminded me of the pepper bacon at stater bros

MKxeUM1VViM0r6lAjbzAmA.text: This place is SO WORTH THE WAIT! Came here on a Saturday morning so there was a huge line and we waited for over an hour but your patience will be rewarded.   They do good, old-fashioned comfort breakfast food and they do it well. They also use local and organic ingredients and cage-free eggs.   I don't remember what my friends had as we ate there awhile ago, but I had the Hog & Chick. Bacon was crisp but not overcooked and was delicious! Eggs were cooked perfectly as well and the potatoes were crisp and perfectly seasoned.    Once you get seated you are well taken care of by friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff who are more than happy to help you decide if you're having a hard time, which is understandable given the variety of tasty options on the menu. They keep coffee and drinks topped off and make sure everything is cooked as it should be.   I have not had any of their lunch items yet but if they're anything like their breakfast menu they are sure to be phenomenal.   Definitely plan on going back now that I have most weekends off!

oXggV8J-5a4qQaBvT7e0mQ.text: I have friends that rave about this place but because it's a ways from my neighborhood and due to the wait, I just never made the effort to try it out until this weekend. I met up with a couple of friends yesterday for brunch. There was a line when we arrived and I think we ended up waiting about 30 minutes, which was fine and expected, we used the time to catch up. We were seated in the little semi-private room right up front where an old skillet is - very cute. The menu is diverse but isn't huge. Two of my friends got two of the breakfast items I was eyeing and said I could try some, so I got the Big Butter Burger and Honey Lemonade. The honey lemonade is amazing. Something you could definitely make at home but I did not mind paying for that sweet sweet juice. The burger was very good, not extraordinary. I thought I would be fine with the kettle chips but I wish I had gotten coleslaw instead. What blew my mind though was the griddlecakes. OH the griddlecakes. Honestly. So good. And the bacon. Fantastic. Their lunch is good but they serve breakfast all day so just go and eat griddlecakes and bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big butter burger and honey lemonade

Q-Djtxj3Pi6OLffulRZ1lw.text: This is by far the best breakfast in AZ. Their bacon is the best you can get. Oh and the hashbrowns! The hashbrowns are yukon gold potatoes and they are crunchy and a little soft in the middle and just melt in your mouth. The service is amazing. Everyone that works there is super nice and the owners are always there to great their customers. If you're in town you must stop by.

gJkk1l-JkXTjlaHnhZtJEA.text: Wanted the check you what all the hype was about at this place.  Was very disappointed about the breakfast not to mention the price.  It was outrageous for two people's breakfast.  We waited in line for at least 30 minutes only to be disappointed with the food and especially the price.  Not worth the money.
