Cug2_sac1WR1TgLbI1NndA.text: My family took me here for breakfast today 9/13/15.  See my yelp review for Charlston's yesterday which was 5 star.  This was my first encounter with Matt's.  It was for my birthday as was Charilston's yesterday.  Unbelievable!  Are you nuts?  Almost, not quite an HOUR wait on the street??????? And then, when we get in there, NO ice in the water?  No lemon slices for our "free NO ice water".  And, NO  salsa for the potatos?????   We asked the waitress to break down the bill (11 of us) and she said they will not do this.  HO HO  HO.  NEVER AGAIN!!   Finally NO regular white bread toast???  This place is a joke.  I spent a dollar extra for a BIG piece of burnt ham steak.  I wouldn't do this for TJ's out on Avondale south of Van Buren which is truly great!!!  If you're on the West Side, go to TJ's.  If you're on the East Side, try Mircle Mile on the the weekends for breakfast or the Bisbee Cafe on Dobson and Guadalupe.    This place is way the hexx overrated..

ZHVXwELNnf5Fvpni1LMPLg.text: Fabulous, fresh food. I was alone and was seated immediately at the counter. The waitress and other patrons were warm and friendly. The coffee mug never reached "empty." This was a good experience. It seems to be a happy place--and the food is special.

1pMuCRtdyKvb5ofVoyFlTw.text: We had a terrible experience here.  The place was absolutely deafening; we couldn't talk while eating because we couldn't hear each other.  The food we were served was cold, they messed up my order, and overcharged us.  The waiter only came by to get our orders, deliver the food, and deliver the bill.  He never checked on us or asked how the food was.  Even if the food had been warm, the overall taste was bland and unappealing.  Not a good way to start our day in Phoenix.

-ZPlYVq2uWAIQuHhNUPL1g.text: Was in Phoenix over the weekend and grabbed breakfast here on Monday morning.  I ordered "The Chop & Chick" with bacon and had my eggs scrambled.  Food was great and the service was even better.  Will definitely grab another meal here next time I'm in the Phoenix area.

RBvD2MqrKJpzSZlUJ8rbeg.text: The waffles/syrup and eggs were mediocre. Sausage, bacon and homestyle potatoes were really good!!

jdOg6QBfEFpqfDmlGH8Xrw.text: Great food.  House made preserves are amazing.  Love being able to get bone-in pork with breakfast.  Sausage and potatoes well done.  Only complaint was watery, listless poached eggs.

sIHI5uGBjTxfSzbSmcqx3g.text: My friends and I found this restaurant via Siri and Yelp. The reviews were so great that we had to go! We went on a Sunday around 11...bad move! Our wait was about an hour. While the food was very tasty,  I'm not sure that it was worth the wait time.  Our service was average; we kept having to ask for small things like spoons. One of my friends had the special,  chicken artichoke sausage and eggs which were delish! Another friend had pancakes and apple wood sausage; pancakes were good but sausage was burnt. Got a free replacement but it arrived lukewarm!  And there was a moderate cost for extra syrup. I had the hogs and chick breakfast which was great.  Nice place but next time we will plan a better time to come.

WiX8UxwXwh_vYkYxspdWRg.text: The best breakfast I have had in Phoenix. Hands down. All natural, real butter, Maple syrup!  The pancakes were soooo delicious. They come out buttered with a little jar of maple syrup to pour over them. I thought the syrup was not going to be enough to satisfy my need of having to eat pancakes smothered in syrup, but TRUST when I say these pancakes were so good that they did not need to be smothered. Also had an omelette with bacon, sausage and peppers with a side of home fries. Yes, it was as delicious as it sounds. I love food and Matt's did not disappoint. Portions were large, expect to take home leftovers unless you arrive with a hungry man appetite :) the only bad thing I can comment on is the wait. If you do not show up bright and early, expect to wait at least 30 minutes. But once you are in you will realize the food was worth the wait :)

7ibYp5L6zVFUQCFKlR_n3w.text: First the good, then the bad. I arrived at 1:45 PM and was seated / waited on in a very timely manner. Service was good and the food came out quickly ...... too quickly as you will read in the bad. The potatoes were hot and well seasoned, the eggs were as ordered (over easy). The toast was very good, but only one piece (thick toast).  Now for the bad. The bacon was not even close to being cooked (half raw) and I sent it back. By the time the bacon came back I was basically done with the other food. The worst part was the amount of oil in my plate. It had to be almost an 1/8 of a cup of oil.  I am not a health nut I have eaten at plenty of greasy spoon restaurants and would gladly go back to a few....... but this was ridiculous.  I mentioned this was my first visit when I ordered and as I was paying the waitress asked how my breakfast was. I told her "I have never seen that much oil on a plate and as you know they bacon was almost raw" .......  her reply was at least it is olive oil.

lWbA8DZHTJHFEuD2dSjP7g.text: Very nice experience.  We went about 1:30pm and there were no crowds to worry about.  Staff was very attentive and friendly.  Waffles were light and fluffy.  My husband loved the special which was an egg scramble with roasted peppers and andouille sausage thick slices of sourdough bread and house made strawberry preserves.  Would recommend trying.

WaifqWwsrSjS64laJUs7zg.text: Can never go wrong with a nice fluffy waffle! The waffle comes with thick cut bacon that's delicious but a bit too peppery for my taste so I sub sausage (doesn't cost extra).Yummy light maple syrup. My boyfriend is literally obsessed with their pancakes and could probably eat them everyday! Definitely plan on ordering the french toast special on Wednesday!

BLrclvAm5FMljuwVYVIN4g.text: Food was decent....wait was long...service was great! When we arrived we were told it was going to be a 45 minute wait. We really waited 30 minutes. The wait staff is plentiful and are very friendly and helpful. The food was brought quickly and was correct as ordered. The waitresses asked several times if we were doing okay and refilled our drinks promptly.  Will return!!

QFMA38oGW7sYivT8d2X-Fg.text: I have had a love/hate relationship with Matt's, but in the past couple of months since they changed locations it has definitely been on the love side! I have gone to the new location a couple times and I think I have figured out the 'secret' to eating here. I live about 3 blocks away from Matt's so when I want to go I get up super early and arrive no later than 7:30. This generally ensures that I do not have to wait. Then, I order either the griddle cakes or the waffle, with the waffle being the better choice. The waffle is light, yet obviously bad for you because it tastes sooo good. Unlike the griddle cakes, the portion isn't crazy over the top and it comes with bacon which I like to tear into small pieces and put a piece in each of the little waffle pockets (or indentations or whatever those things are called). This plus the real maple syrup and butter is a sick....deliciously sick....combo. The griddle cakes are still awesome...like I said before, they taste like pancakes your grandma would make if your grandma was a really awesome cook. Also, the coffee no longer tastes like metal, it is, in fact, quite enjoyable. All in all, this place is good, especially when you don't have to wait.

xzMkl20IoQ1Jc_sNxTYp6w.text: If you like breakfast, and you want to flavorgasms as you eat, this is the place for you. I got the salami scramble which is three scrambled eggs with molinari sopressata salami, and I got the side of hash browns and toast. (Potato side and toast comes with all egg meals) I never would have thought of salami in the eggs, but it was the perfect complement with the peppery taste it packed. That being said, the eggs themselves were extremely tasty and could have been eaten plain. Coffee was hot, fresh and taste good. The toast was Texas sized toast and they had quite possibly the best strawberry preserves I've had in years, if not ever. Service was fantastic; my only negative that is keeping this from being 5 stars is the hash browns.  I'm not complaining about them, but they weren't on par with the great quality of everything else at Matt's. I highly recommend this place, but the wait can be long depending what day and time you get there (this place is loved by the locals) we got there at 815am on a Sunday and were seated immediately (the last available table)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best strawberry preserves I&#39;ve had in years
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salami scramble with coffee, toast, strawberry preserves, and hash brown

nFuKVwyTtOlv3UrjHW6IXw.text: I drove by this place several times and Decided to stop by as there is always a line of people outside.  Well was I surprised...now I understand why...great breakfast!

6CqTKFaq_PIDeDn3mCXhUA.text: This is one of the best breakfast places I have been, Had two eggs with a delic ham steak, hash browns. Add fresh in house made bread with home made jam. What more could you ask for?? Everything was cooked to perfection and totally awesome!  Mayor Greg Stanton was sitting at the next table. This is one of my favorite breakfast places, I will be back!

56zUi-VPypKzLge3ZgQBEg.text: Good food and good service.  I really like the food and I've been here two times with a friend who referred me, and once on my own.  They have home-made bread and jam, and good food overall with good portions.  Daily specials will change frequently over a morning or afternoon, and the specials are good--unique.  Now for why I didn't get it all 5 stars:  It's pretty busy all the time, which means packed, which means you probably will have to wait.  That's the mark of a good restaurant, and they are quite efficient at getting people in and out, and served efficiently.  You will usually have to wait in a line to pay, but often the wait staff will take it up for you.  Tables are very close together and you are right on top of your neighboring diners.  Most of all, it's so noisy you can hardly hear yourself and your tablemate talk.  If you are by yourself, you will be put at the counter, period.  They rightfully maximize space. The environment is a little overwhelming.  But the service and food are good.  One a single one-room bathroom is inside each for the Guys & Gals, and there was a line each of my visits.  Even if you are not waiting, if other people are in line, they can be right in front of your table where you're eating.  It's a small place that is open for breakfast and lunch and does a booming business.  I've only been here for breakfast and I would go back with my friend.

2H605If2H9_orCQw_pcG8Q.text: Loud, crowded, overpriced, mediocre.   Poached eggs came with the whites uncooked and gooey - Twice! Pork chop which was recommended by server was dry and bland.  They are not friendly for allergies or food intolerances. I ordered almond milk and they brought regular milk. They did not offer a substitution for toast.   I gave two stars instead of one because someone (manager?) did come to the table and tried to assist, but there's only so much you can do when every food item received was unacceptable.  Not worth the price or the wait. Very disappointed.

f8IMWQ6Mnr5bgRlblp1weA.text: Literally got off our flight and were starving. We looked up some breakfast places in the area and chose Matts. The wait was a little long but it was worth it!!! The bread that came with our meal was AMAZING! The waitresses were very kind even when we had a tired screaming baby on our hands.

oN2KK55dWu9acJek8PNQjQ.text: This place is great for its food! Generous portions not too long of a wait time and very clean!! My only complaint was they were eager to seat us down that they crammed 3 of us at a table clearly built for 2 with one of our backs awkwardly to the table next to us .. it was crammed and a tight space as our food came. I wouldn't have minded waiting a little longer to have more room haha but other than that no complaints!

FbSb37QLHK9XkhUeQOSqxA.text: It's nothing great, the lemonade was by far the best thing I tried (Honey Lemonade.) Service was rushed despite not too many folks being there, griddlecakes were ok. Not sure what the big fuss about this place is. Lots of parking, near downtown so convenient-ish.

tJTg-xCFICtOSJQ5jf1Omg.text: We've been to Matt's several times, but it's actually been a couple of years. Last time was actually pre-Yelp for me.  Anyhow, Matt's has not skipped a beat since our last visit. Once you get seated (there is usually a wait) the service is fast and efficient. When I say fast, I mean we ordered and the food was on the table in less than 5 minutes. I had the Skinny, an egg white scramble with chicken sausage. Damn tasty. Wifey had the stock Bacon and Eggs. Matts bacon is the reason we come here. Excellent. Noisy, busy and crowded...but highly recommend.

cJhR3gV9F9xY2e0OBK5H6A.text: Arguably the best breakfast in town. High quality ingredients cooked properly.

ul3483K3Vbk_9f2ivDdryA.text: Awesome food great price friendly staff we will be coming back for sure when we come to Phoenix I would recommend this place to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast of Champions the most important meal of the day.

JXzSfIv6TkjsZHDJozknNA.text: Waited 20mins to be seated at a table large enough for only 1 person. Didn't even sit down to order because the table we were being seated at was next to the RESTROOM in the walking path of the kitchen! There are 2 tables in this restaurant that are so positioned almost in the hall aye to he restroom. I understand getting as much seating as possible into a space but give up the 2 tables. No one wants to feel like they are eating in the restroom or kitchen at a restaurant!

Q4UrQdtcRUAw8Gq8jfHw1Q.text: The service is on point. Best service I have ever seen, and they are super efficient. But you only get to see this is you arrie well before 9:30 or there will be a minimum of an hour wait.  Luckily we got here at 8 am.. and it was great. The coffee is roasted in cave creek, and being a coffee snob I fully approve.  Pancakes amazing Breakfast sandwhich - minus bacon + sausage patty = WOW the spices on that patty were incredible Omlette special - I was jealouse my friend ordered this and I didnt.. I almost took it from here and ended our friendship so I could enjoy her food on my own Hasbrowns - mor elike hash mashed potatoes with amazing spices and the best hash I have had in a while  Toast - YES THE TOAST IS GOOD. How can toast be worth mentioning... because it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biacuit Special
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee is bomb
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rk0Gy79j3LRP3xXPlJnebg.text: Well I finally made it to Matt's on a trip to Phoenix and all I can say is WOW.  Fresh local coffee, fantastic bacon and hash browns too.  Do yourself a favor and put this place on your bucket list whenever you are in Arizona

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7Fv9nm2GABwjP3yhUiFU1g.text: Ordered the cobb salad.  It was a disgusting mess and tasted horrible.  For $10.95 one would anticipate a better salad.  The lettuce was cut up into tiny pieces like it was all premade the night before and tasted as such. was not even served as a traditional cobb.  Would call to get my money back but I'm sure it is out of the question.  never going back.  Not sure how you butcher a salad that much.

-52t4OqGfx6B2yTYC_KiOg.text: Omg. I went here with my family and got the egg whites with spinach, chicken sausage, and house salad. So good!!!!!!! This place is small but mighty and has amazing breakfast. I am all about the atmosphere and this place has a great one!

RNoynPYsSlGIU3s7jn0Rog.text: Matts used to be the place for breakfast in Phoenix, now it has spiraled down blah-over priced tooo hip not the great experience it used to be.

FWmTetUB3F8yW0NP085nJg.text: This is our favorite place to go for breakfast. It is so delish however, it's not the healthiest food, so be advised. The wait time is usually a bit high but the service is super fast. From the time we ordered, it was only around 10 minutes until our food came out. My boyfriend and I would totally recommend this place!  From My Boyfriend: ...but he didn't even mention the real maple syrup you can use to dip your peppered bacon in, or the fluffy waffles, or the kickass rosemary potatoes with onions and butter, or the thick cut toast with homemade preserves! This place is truly special... just watch your waist line!

l8UHsr5QWN46-Cii4v-laA.text: I really liked the atmosphere and it seemed like the staff was really friendly.  I ordered the Chick & Chop.  It was eggs your way, choice of home fires or hash browns (I chose fries), and a bone-in pork chop.  The pork chop was a little over cooked but the flavor was delicious.  It was seared nicely, but because it was only 1/8" thick, it was quickly over done and dry.  Otherwise, I would have given this place 5 stars.  The coffee was excellent, the home made preserves was delicious, and the home fries were savory and perfect.  There was a long line, but since I was alone, I sat immediately at the bar.  The service was fast and friendly.  It was kinda loud, but that was a sign of good food.

aSDpjJpLxJ5dPUtzhqsEsw.text: This breakfast was so good. Split the special with my niece also split pancakes, all was delish!!had to wait 1/2 hour, but weather was beautiful and they have a nice waiting room/patio. Very big portions so share dishes if possible

BW4jckKnR-ICaBPbjv9mKA.text: We found this place while waiting for our luggage to arrive at PHX. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast choice. The griddle cakes were light and fluffy. The Five Spot is a breakfast sandwich on a deliciously soft roll with eggs, cheese, bacon and onion. It was really good. I had the Huevos Rancheros Verde, it had a slight spicy kick to it. I thought it was pretty good. I'd definitely recommend this place and I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thick cut bacon and rosemary home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chalkboard with the special of the day.

DWp_qIr1nIM1CDPQhJrBEQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast places out of Arizona! Any out of town guests I take them here for breakfast!  They have many options for being such a small menu. They support local business and even sell homemade jam!  I usually get the 5 spot sandwich! It's fulfilling and you get a bite of everything.  Definitely worth the wait

yEMNYoWj5trvkWn8JE4RZQ.text: This local eatery was excellent.  From the eggs to the irresistible home fries and the awesome sourdough toast with fresh preserves, a truly great meal.  Parking was tough due to local construction.

xL9tJrcX3RPAjARVYAjmrw.text: Long waits are worth it! I suggest a party of 2 if you can make it happen, just because when you smell the delicious things coming out of the restaurant, you are not going to want to wait for a table to open for a big party!   Local, fresh, and unique dishes that make home style breakfasts im used to with local flair such as AZ grown fruits and veggies or thick cut peppered bacon. Not to mention the REAL fresh squeezed orange juice.   Servers are hit or miss. Last visit I had a gal completely forget to put our order in for about 20 minutes, but the kitchen is fast so it wasn't more than 15 minutes after she did that we had our food.   No real complaints, Matt's food is worth the wait!

5JA9Nfh1giU8rGu6IgchQA.text: **Disclaimer: this post is long.  For a summary/breakdown of my rating, scroll to the bottom.  Let me begin by saying that if I could award this establishment 0 stars, I would have. I visited Matt's for the first time yesterday morning with a few of my coworkers.  I was told great things about this restaurant and was excited to try it out.  I ordered their special which was an egg and cheese scramble with pepper jack cheese, pork tenderloin, and roasted green chilies; it came with choice of hash browns or diced potatoes and a flour tortilla.  A friend told me they had great diced potatoes so I went with it. Wrong choice. I love potatoes, I love flavor, but there is such thing as over seasoning, and Matt's perfected the act.  I took a bite of the potatoes first, before trying anything else, before adding anything to flavor my food, and was blown away by the amount of rosemary.  I assumed it was just a fluke, nope. Tried another potato and it was just as bad.  You couldn't taste the potato at all!  Just seasonings.  I doused them in ketchup and still couldn't choke them down. The scramble was decent, nothing spectacular, nothing awful. The flour tortilla was terrible.  I assumed they were homemade, since Matt's boasts about all their natural, non-gmo, freshly this-and-that food.  The only way to describe the flavor was salt dough, the kind you have a five year old put their hand in to create a Christmas ornament... Yuck!  I asked for some butter, which came with a side of judgement that I will get to in a moment, to put on my tortilla but it didn't help at all, I gave up on it and tossed it down on my plate next to my unfinished rosemary...I mean potatoes. I also had a "large" glass of fresh squeezed orange juice.  It tasted good, but silly me, I didn't think to check the price before I ordered it.  $4.50 for a large glass that was /maybe/ 16oz.  I get that they offer freshness where most do not, but get a grip!  I know this issue was my own fault, it could have been avoided if I had just glanced at the price.  The juice is not factored into their low rating.  Let's discuss the service!  Since it was a late, weekday morning, I didn't anticipate much of a crowd, and to my relief, there wasn't one, so we were seated rather quickly.  Someone promptly brought us water and took our drink orders, then made several trips to bring us our drinks (there were only 5 of us).  Whatever, we got over it.  Then we went to order and discovered that substitutions are not made, even for those with food allergies and intolerances.  Because that's fair, right?  We didn't have to wait long for our food to come out, which was nice, but then the service fell flat, like their job was done, time to move on to the new paying customers (not that there were a whole lot of them).  A completely new waitress came and asked as we were finishing up how things were, which was when I asked for a side of butter.  She looked at my plate as if to see what I could possibly need butter for, as if it was any of her business.  Got the butter, it didn't help make my tortilla taste better, then they dropped the check off (I had inquired about separate checks when we were ordering...they don't do that here).  This may just be my own issue, but I feel that we shouldn't have to ask the waitress to refill our water, yet I did.  It's called being attentive in your customer service.  The vibe that this place put off was just plain snobbish.  I stem from Southern California, where restaurants with natural, non-gmo dishes are a dime a dozen, and they don't serve up near as much of a pretentious attitude as this small diner in downtown Phoenix.  Honestly this place needs a huge reality check.  Rating summary:  Customer service: 0/5 stars for being completely unaccommodating Food quality (taste): 1/5 stars because natural food should not taste this bad... Prices: 2/5 stars because I understand that natural food is not always cheap, but that doesn't mean gouge your customers. Atmosphere: 0/5 stars; over-priced, penny-pinching and pretentious do not make for a good restaurant vibe.  Overall: terribly overrated.  Do yourself a favor and make your own natural breakfast at home; it'll taste better, save you money, and the service you'd get couldn't be any worse than what you'd receive at Matt's.

mqp6ILqeU9_E4fVMBCPkoA.text: Wow!!!! What a sleeper. I went inside to grab some dinner a kill an hour and a half. Food was outstanding and the services as even better.

v5mVOe_ZJ27vHJMao6R-WA.text: This was a great way to break up an airport layover.  I had the BLT which was served on thick toasted bread and had delicious thick cut peppered bacon.  To my delight it was served with homemade kettle chips and a pickle that was pure pregnancy heaven.  I asked for another pickle and to my surprise three more were served up on a plate pro bono.  Seriously this is no Vlasic, this is some a-grade zmyology.  The kiddie meal of an egg, two pieces of the same high quality bacon, and hand-cut thick fries were a steal.  I was tempted to order a hand squeezed honey lemonade or a hand squeezed oj but I stuck with water.  They even had a high chair.  The food here is prepared with quality ingredients.  For example they make their own corned beef versus cheap-o deli meat. This ain't yo average airport fare.

sazcWU_z1HUjO-nw29kGIA.text: This is a kind of place I picture of when I see that Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives show on tv. That obviously not being an insult. This place is a must try. Little loud but the food and prompt service made up for it.

BHJTbWsMSUO2DqaaDDRqKQ.text: I was lucky enough to have flown out of the US airways terminal and I'm so glad we did because this place is THE PLACE for breakfast within an airport. I've heard of the downtown location so i was eager once I spotted this bad boy.   I got the waffle which came with bacon.. The perfect combo for sweet and savory. The spices they use for the bacon separate this place from any other breakfast joint. I would come back here in a heart beat.  I might to stop at the downtown one more often now!

f0GM9FRC72xvkViwvN6N8A.text: Best Breakfast Place I've ever been to hands down.  The bacon is heavenly, and the pork chop is amazing.  I usually just go for the special of the day when it is a scramble, can never go wrong with that.  One thing though is that they recently made their hash browns thin cut.  I miss their thick cut hash browns, they were the BEST.  Please go back to your thick hash browns Matt's!

MKtxY2IgTLCGzeAAm4Z0Pw.text: Sooooo good. They're very quick with their service. Always have unique specials that you do not want to skip out on. Homemade preserves for sale are especially worth it.

mvgG_ZPqUkQz0zZ6fJNIbQ.text: Everyone loves Matts. I don't need to review it...   I do want to fill you in on the new location they just moved to in 2013, a block north of the old. It is larger, thank Gawd! but not much, thank Gawd again. That was part of the charm. Go on a weekday, when you have the day off and it wont be crowded. Being a sucker and going on Saturday at 9:45am is surely going to cause you to wait in line. Thats rookie business.   But the new location, is still small enough to keep its charm and unique, downtown, local vibe but large enough to not have to pull tables together for a 4 top!   Their food, menu, daily specials, and coffee all still consistent and amazing as always.

Xwgzu5atbw1iv1Q_mQ-GgA.text: My dad and I stopped in here a couple weeks again to get a quick bite to eat. This place has become one of the most popular and talked about breakfast spots in Phoenix. Now that I finally got to try it I can taste why it had so much hype. From the customer service to the food and the decor everything was great. I can't wait to go back and try a different dish.

Dr8QQo1Ey0g_4usHrFDifQ.text: Awesome foor. Great service.  Prices are reasonable. Worth the drive. Go during the week for shorter wait

uCKxYka9s9fPynfsvN8iag.text: A serious disappointment. The original Matts big breakfast is great but the airport one is nothing like it and the food is just overpriced and tasteless.

DrfZZcPBjVR0ZJyzCkNkQg.text: It was organic ingredients which is always a plus but I wasn't to thrilled with there choices or what we got. Not sure what the fuss is all about, might have to give it another shot.

40BP2wHTtoS_yqcu48Hm1A.text: My favorite breakfast place in the entire state of Arizona!!

dQAFm1DBJ-cg7SopehJFCg.text: Went here for breakfast and got more than I was expecting. The portions are really big and everything is delicious. I had an omelette with cheddar, mushrooms, sausage, their home fries, and wheat toast. Their home fries have a great flavor and I love that they use rosemary. My husband got the French toast special and a side of bacon. I didn't care for the sausage that came with the French toast and it didn't taste like the sausage in my omelette.   I also suggest getting coffee. Their coffee is absolutely amazing!

YXsRjifKm0_p0gCnZa2A6Q.text: I'm not a huge fan of breakfast food.  But I got breakfast here just for you~~  :P  So I can see why a lot of reviewers said to go for the home fries.  The hash browns looked fine, perfectly golden on the top, exactly the way I prefer it.  However, I'm pretty sure there weren't the additional flavorings like the rosemary and onions in that~!  The home fries had great flavor AND they cooked crispy on at least one of the sides of each piece.  Absolutely one of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had.  I got the special of the day which was 3 eggs scrambled with ham off the bone, anaheim chili peppers, and cheese with a side of tortilla.  It was delicious.  Good char on the tortilla too.  It was very slightly underdone, but I actually prefer that over the risk of overdone eggs.  I guess the one thing that detracted from the place was the limited menu.  They don't really serve any alcoholic beverages (which is actually a bit refreshing), and some common breakfast items are not on the menu (ie biscuits and gravy, french toast).  But hey, if I can pick anything off their menu and it will be equally delicious, I would always come back!

SMWpGgcVJDkqu0p2zIcMYg.text: We lucked out with no wait by going at 8am. Cool vibe of the place but the meal I chose (griddle cakes) wasn't anything special. Parking is a bit of a pain - there's a tiny one-way lot if you're lucky; otherwise street or church parking. Great service but probably wouldn't make the effort to come back.

fUI2E4aGRvP2kqckyu-KRw.text: I've heard many people ranting and raving about this place and I was a thinking it was "too good to be True".  I went, I tried, and yes, friends - it is so good and so True!  The breakfast here is "wait - for - it".....LEGENDARY!  The toast was good, thick and crunchy.  Same goes for the bacon!  The hash browns were probably one of the best hash browns I have ever had.  They were cooked oh-so-perfectly and we didn't have to wait too long to get a table.

i1zW3zP6c6pFwBCueFnjvg.text: A little confusing walking into the side entrance for take-away. I almost thought it was a order and then sit down establishment. Once we found the hostess stand and were seated the food I must say was good. the service however I must admit for not good. No refill on my coffee, waitress never came back to check on us and I ended up having to ask for the check from whom I believe was a manager.

56kAAF2g3j3032AJd1flPA.text: I came here with my friends, on my last day of vacation before heading back to Chicago, and I must say I came to the best brunch place downtown. The homefries are delicious and though I'm not a bacon eater, their thick cut bacon was awesome! I'll definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4TL81qasoH6S86D5F5Q_Jw.text: The perfect breakfast spot!  This was my irate time and I'm head of heels for it. I had the special: French toast with bacon. Seriously, the best French tat I've ever had! I'm going to guess this has more than a little to do with the fresh, local made bread. Follow that up with some strawberry lemonade and this is the absolute best Saturday morning breakfast.    Oh! And if you can get there before 7:30-8am ish, you'll likely be able to snag a seat immediately. The place is small and popular, which leads to crowds, but that seems to move smoothly and quickly.

pvrO7L6wwO-KdSJ2ZHRtFw.text: I always thought I would never write a review and post it. To me the option of others regarding an establishment is moot, we all have things we value over other things when to it comes an establishment. However the one thing EVERYONE can agree on is getting what we asked for in a timely manner. That brings me to this review about Matt's Big Breakfast.  I have wanted to try Matt's Big Breakfast for a while now. I know there is usually a decent wait to get a table, but I had a foodie friend in town from NYC and thought she is the perfect person to go with me. We got there on Monday after the Super Bowl at around 11am... as I thought we were on a wait, 30 minutes, not bad.  They called our names and we sat right by the door at the bar that looks outside to the street. Our server was fast to come to us and take our drink order. Our Strawberry Honey Lemonades arrived and she took our order and went to put them in. Now it doesn't really matter what we ordered but I will tell you anyway; The Hog and Chick, with a side pancake and the daily special (omelet of some sort) with a side pancake.  After about 10 minutes The Hog and Chick plate arrived, 3 minutes later both side pancakes arrived, 2 minutes later the bill arrived. When the server came back I told her our whole order had not come out. She said oh yeah you didn't get your toast, she leaves before I could say anything. She brings back a side of toast and I said the other dish, the daily special didn't come out yet. She goes back brings more toast and says she put in the daily special. 5 more minutes go by and the same server takes away my plates (yes I ate, I was starving) and she asked did we get the bill. I tell her yes, but we still are waiting for my friends order. 5 more minutes go by and I go to pay. I told the manager behind the counter about our missing meal, so it could be removed from the bill. The manager asked if I had told the server we didn't get our entire meal... yes I told her. The manager just seemed more concerned that she pointed out the error of the server, because she asked me this question 2 or 3 times. The manager then asks the kitchen, the kitchen didn't know anything about a daily special on that ticket or about having one told to them 5 minutes ago about it being done on the fly.   The manager removes the meal; just the daily special and I pay for the rest. The manager says they will get the daily special out for us right away. I tell her I am done, my friend doesn't want it and we are leaving so there is no point. The manager insisted that we wait and take it, okay I think she is trying to make it up to us... we will wait. So 5 more minutes go by and I see a bag up in the window, a few more minutes go by (as it sat in the window) and I tell my starving friend let's go. As we are getting up to leave a server runs over and says "here is your to-go order" TO GO ORDER! That is funny!! I ask for the manager and she said "you already spoke to her."   I was not happy that the manager didn't deliver it herself and apologize to my friend, I was not happy that my friend now had a horrible experience and was still starving, I was not happy that the server said I had already spoken to the manager.  I am disappointed that a small restaurant in downtown Phx that was featured on a national TV Show didn't care enough about a local to come over and say anything, giving us the meal to go was pointless (it went in the trash)  Next time work on customer service, not pushing the bill on guests (there was no longer a wait) and make sure EVERYONE in the party has their meal. It's a little late to ever change my opinion, maybe my friends (yes I have told a lot of ppl about this experience) will still go and judge for themselves. If they do my advice I told them... don't go hungry, you may not get your food.

gvlNA9cO4zBdvvdjfIa7tg.text: Been on my list since I saw it on tripD and stopped in both times going through Phx, was pleasantly surprised and happy with the service and the food. If your in Skyharbor you should try it!

-oHg1ywdmd-ALIMkCuVw2A.text: We went to the original location years ago and it was amazing!  The wait was crazy though since it's such a small place but it was worth the wait.  The food is delicious!

7MMbIBP7EyIC-gpPNatwTA.text: If you are ever in the downtown Phoenix area I highly suggest you drop in on this retro/modern diner that was featured on Guy Fieris Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.I have been in phx area for 10 yrs and finally decided to try this critically acclaimed diner. Aside from being slightly difficult to find (my inability to give directions, lol), Matts is an excellent healthy alternative to your run of the mill breakfast places. I went on the thursday morning prior to Superbowl 49 expecting lines to be around the corner even though it was close to 10 am. Although busy, our party of 3 didnt have to wait at all.  While ordering and eating it became busy enough that people began to have to wait.  I chose to order the cheese omelet with mushrooms, onions and sausage. I also had  their hash browns, wheat toast and coffee.  where do I begin? The coffee is so good that it needs little if any sugar in the raw (rather than processed) or milk (organic).  The toast is thick and grainy (aka awesome) and best of all not processed. To accompany the great toast was a sweet yet all naturally made on site raspberry preserve. I was informed that this was a rare occasion that they were sering the raspberry as they normally serve strawberry or bluberry also both all natural and delicious (im guessing).  The first few bites of both the omelet and hash browns threw me for a loop until I figured out that I was tasting or rather wasnt tasting artificial cooking oils or grease (which unfortunately Im used to). I was actually TASTING the food. I typically do not care for hassh browns because they tend to either be too dry or not dry enough but these were perfectly done with just enough crisp and moistness....no need to add anything other than a bit of hot sauce.  The omelet was thin and large enough to hold all the cheddar cheese, onions, and mushrooms. Unfortunately either the waitress didnt hear me order the sausage or the cook forgot to add them to the omelet. Had the sausage been in the omelet I think they would have needed a third egg to hold all the additions. The atmosphere on this particular day was one of turn and burn (aka busy) and locals, and out of towners.

V1YI317yuBHNxmPTqgElEA.text: simply amazing. the wait is so worth it. i love everything i've had so far. i'm obsessed with the orange juice.

Xmy8I5JlS8Yc5iqvR_JCKg.text: Absolutely no reason to come here. There's no parking, there's usually a line, the portion sizes are hilariously insufficient (I ordered a "Large" orange juice for $6 and it was brought out in what appeared to be a slightly oversized shot glass). They have a bunch of oddball menu selections, most of which are greasy and flavorless. No idea what the hype is all about.

H0U56vnJ6UxEi17Q2I_NvA.text: Wife took me here on a day off. Knowing I love breakfast I had to try this place out. The first challenge was finding a parking spot. We eventually found a spot & just by looking at the line outside, we feed the meter for two hours of parking. We weren't aware of signing in on a list until a waitress came outside shouting names. I was eventually told you have to sign up on the list inside. After waiting for 45 minutes we were seated at the breakfast bar and the waitress took our order right away. We both ordered the hog and chick plate. We asked if it was possible to order a single griddlecake on the side knowing it wasn't on the extras menu. She was able to accommodate our request. I also ordered a coffee and orange juice. Coffee to me was coffee but the freshly squeezed OJ had my taste buds ready for the rest of the meal. Seriously refreshing. The bacon, eggs, sourdough toast & fruit preserves were on point. Tasty, tasty, tasty. Wife & I honestly didn't care to much for the rosemary home fries...way too much rosemary seasoning & garnish for us. Next we decided to bite into the griddlecake & again our taste buds were in heaven. Soft and moist like a baked cake in the form of a pancake...the best we've ever had. This place is going to be my go to breakfast joint on another day off no doubt. The wait time was definitely worth it. Thanks to the staff for their prompt & friendly service. We'll be returning whenever I have business to do in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog &amp; Chick Meal w/ Home fries.

jeo17w8G3hrAbfo-XlDeOg.text: Gosh, we love this place but not at this location. Slow service and terrible food. We nearly missed our flight to bring breakfast on board. The burrito was filled primarily with potatoes. I don't mind spending money at the airport for a good drink and grub, but our $60 dollar tab was a huge disappointment.

NSLtT3vACK5uSuJ2HOQZLg.text: I am not sure what the big deal is. The food is good but nothing was spectacular. If you have to wait more than 15 minutes I would go somewhere else.

1QABDlBX8my9GU17hvz1mw.text: Really good lemonade and ham (not necessarily together). Their eggs are just eggs but they have a few unique items that really are good.

5ZlIzvRZMeNHc7lun4O2Yg.text: The new location does add a lot more room! But the old house I preferred, even if it meant an hour wait. I always walked else where and got a coffee to pass the time. Kudos to the cereal, though a tad pricey, but they do not slack off on portion sizes for the dishes. Worthy of a side note, order the bacon! (unless you do not eat meat)

81qqPUrzdk7k424IO2HT6w.text: The Good:  I like the vibe of this place, a pleasant neighborhood type greasy spoon, but not dingy and grease-spattered.  Attentive wait staff.  Good opportunities for people watching.  I had the Hog and Chick.  Excellent hash browns...riced potatoes with a nice greasy bottom with pan drippings and pepper clinging to them.  Just the way I like them!   The strawberry jam with the toast was superb.  And the coffee hot and tasty...no need for cream.  The bacon was curiously unflavorful.  Next time I'd get sausage.  Not sure what went wrong with it...not enough salt/smoke in the curing?  It was cooked okay, just not a lot of flavor to it.  (Of course, I still finished it...even mediocre bacon is still bacon!)  $12 for a breakfast seemed a bit on the high side, but not super exorbitant.  Had the bacon been good I would not mention the cost.  Still a fan though.  3.5 stars would be a better rating.

B-nCO3BlnK3AQg4Qkp9PHg.text: We came here when I was 9 months pregnant, that was an excellent choice. The orange juice was great, and so was our food! The pancakes were amazing, I kept stealing them from my husband. Will definitely come back!

gmIRdRMdegwReKtqIeCtVQ.text: We stayed in Phoenix over the last weekend and Yelp helped me find this breakfast wonder.... Matt's was awesome. Locals wait in line for this great good. Service was fast and efficient, food was great quality, home fries with Rosemary were outstanding, bacon was love in my mouth, and the best part.... Their strawberry honey lemonade. This is legal "crack" if there is such a thing.  It was rather loud inside but not annoying for such a small place. Since the weather is so hot, while you wait outside they have refreshing lemon water to keep you cooled off. Had to split checks at the minute and it was not a problem. Definately visiting there again if I ever return to Phoenix!

ZtXjJ16G82f-qX1WKb95Rg.text: One of the best breakfast places in the city.  "Hog and chick" is my favorite dish.

_7mmVJbNMhMAU3ws7Orz3w.text: One of the best places for breakfast. The place is very cute,the staff is very friendly. The food is one of the best and the homemade jelly is outstanding! The owner is nice and a hard worker, so is the rest of the staff !

V0q15VA6vpTeL9hD9ha1cg.text: Always and I mean always yummmmm! Service fast and friendly. Local,organic market fresh foods! Bacon big flavor.

LRCo3P8QYMM67KeHcL-UOw.text: I don't mind lay overs or delays because i know I've got a great crispy waffle and Honey Lemonade waiting for me here!  The bacon is too thick for my liking, but they will sub with 3 links of yummy sausage.

h7Ren-DWaXrnm4vN4Mb23w.text: Over priced breakfast all hype sorry just my opinion I was really let down since friend always talked about it ..you will pay 10$ for breakfast ..eggs and hash browns

SX2r5Ma_4oIGyQzs6nFmbA.text: Love this place. Love this place. Let's talk about the bread and jam. It is to die for. I could eat that as my meal. But every time I go I order something new and it is great. I would recommend everything on the menu. I'm really happy that the moved to a bigger location because I use to wait in line for this food. This is a must go.

oeU5qwsU3wJGtoeQZqyhbg.text: Bunch of self-absorbed chumps opening WAY after they said they would open, all kinds of people waiting, these guys acting like princesses on stage   While we try to get breakfast before an early flight. Prima donnas on parade.  Thanks, you bums. Have a starting time and stick to it. It's an airport, as in "schedules"....

Cm7GIopXcn9TsQgbjnIEMg.text: Not worth the wait. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait and "maybe quicker for the bar". We waited 50 minutes. The omelet was dry and lukewarm. The toast was soggy with butter. The OJ and home fries were good but not worth missing our movie for.

h69bGGzdpztiq2srMPBdhg.text: Good pancakes, good bacon but poor customer service and nickel and dime you. I've never been asked to pay more for syrup. I get things are expensive but I'm paying 9.00 for big fluffy pancakes a little extra syrup might be nice.

RjZBSwV7Dilo6odszO6xOg.text: Based on previous reviews. My family and I decided to give it a go and enjoyed our breakfast and lunch today. We'll be back!!

ZUc8Bunby5dPZG3Grv6o7g.text: Matt's is cute, loud (get over it), and super friendly. They have some of the best breakfast you will find in the area, Parking is not hard and the wait is not bad at all.  All of the food is great, but we especially like their waffles with a side of potatoes. They are just marvelous. They are pretty well know for their chops so try them. They are good and get eggs and toast with that.  Their coffee is great and the service the best. Have a great time.

SRKqu49qxNiPaVJ4bnxOqQ.text: Great place for an all American breakfast. Wait wasn't bad about 20-25 minutes for a party of 10. Hostess is very friendly and service overall is great. Everything that out party ordered was great. From the steak, pork chop, bacon down to the toast with there jam.

MtkiMHhHNRVByAOFjC56yg.text: Great ambiance and great food. Limited menu disappointing to me but the food that we had was very tasty! Great service from Louisa and the manager did come by and was very friendly.  We did experience this restaurant in Tempe.

EWne0JAfEuXST2PwHQsKfQ.text: While visiting we decided to eat here for breakfast....SOOOOOO GOOD! We had the eggs Benedict special...WOW. Excellent food and service was amazing! Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting:)

Bz-gS1kqmFmPymd2UAdSmw.text: Had breakfast this morning at Matt's. Everything was spectacular! The coffee was wonderful. The orange juice was beyond terrific. The omelet was outstanding as was the has browns. Loved everything a bout this place !

5jr-zaUWzU_JcgtgpBzGnQ.text: Omg omg omg - simply the best breakfast - Chick's n Hogs- sourdough bread - herb potatoes-- perfection

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One piece to share! Not!!! Perfect pepper bacon- I mean PERFECT
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small but mighty
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best server in The State

yQo3DRsbBuaLoZwWNJHLDQ.text: Stopped in just as they opened on a Sunday morning and the place was already filling up, which turned out to be a good sign. The restaurant was clean and offered a cool, industrial feel which provided a great atmosphere. The food, including The Five Spot - an egg sandwich with thick-cut bacon - was excellent as was the coffee. The staff was incredibly friendly and the coffee refills were right on time. Highly recommend if you're in Phoenix area and looking to score some breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An Excellent Cup of Coffee
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

3PpGdG-FvM3PE4Hacs8F7Q.text: What a GREAT breakfast place. If u go to the downtown MBB at 1st n Garfield hope you get Paige to serve you.  Very helpful in menu selections, great personality that exemplifies Matt's. I ordered my food n was served very quickly. Try the salami n eggs WOW.  I'll definitely be back to one of the three locations, including Terminal 4 at Phoenix Airport. Hope u enjoy ur meal n service as much as I did today.

gUfpL0ezgprcV7a_eHTnLQ.text: This place has such great food but is being dragged down by long waits for food. This is my 2nd time here in the past month and both times took longer than normal for food service. Today I sat at the bar and ordered the special. After 25 minutes I asked if my order had been put in and a few minutes later I got it. Then asked for it to go.

K2mXykdIW4muxqN61FpW4g.text: Found this place from yelp and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. There was a wait on a Tuesday which is usually a good sign that it's a good place to eat.   We were sat in a little private room which was neat. It had and old school vibe in there but it was fun.  The menu was short and sweet which made picking what you wanted easy and you didn't feel like you are missing out if you don't get something. They have daily specials which today (Tuesday) was biscuits and gravy which is what I got and let me tell you they were fantastic. I like to consider myself a b&g connoisseur and these were up there and top best for me imo. I split the pancakes as well and those were also great.   The only cons I really found were they don't give you enough syrup and to get more it's an additional 1.50. Also they don't serve alcohol which is a bummer at the location we were at. But other ones do! (They are supposed to have good blood Mary's I believe at the airport one)   Overall great Phoenix spot to check out for breakfast or brunch! It was so good I forgot to take pics of my food! I was only able to capture my friends daughter checking out the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Checking out the menu

jSJrx1iGZ7ftTqAERPogXw.text: Matts is a great brunch spot in the downtown area. I found this on yelp due to the reviews and it didn't disappoint. We came on a weekend and although there was a 45 min wait it was worth it with plenty nearby to occupy. Seating is somewhat limited but they turnover tables fast.   The menu was simple but the options were all you need and more. I like the daily specials and the unique takes on well known dishes. I ordered the jalapeno scramble and it was delicious and had me sweating by the end.   I would recommend for families and small parties and I look forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seating Area
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped Salad

j0ezpa5irQ1SwoRrvQy5iQ.text: Matt's definitely deserves the positive reviews it has received.  The menu is simple I will admit, but they have achieved breakfast mastery.  I had the French toast, and I seriously couldn't stop thinking about it for the rest of the day.  Wholesome, genuine, delicious.

CEmbTWcZg-ePNphTtGCdhA.text: You get a LOT of food with your order, but it's nothing that will blow your socks off. It surprises me a bit that there's always a line to get in. I've only been there twice, but I have yet to get the appeal.

4Egmy7JTOUTkR3e4pTECgQ.text: Well, the bacon was pretty good, I'll give them that.  Common sense would dictate if you serve flavored tea, you would inform the customer.  As it turns out, that would be the least of my concerns. The pancakes were more the consistency of cornbread and somehow managed to lack any flavor at all.  The syrup was served too hot, which made it the consistency of water. I asked for an extra and was told I would be charged $1.50. Really????  Again, the bacon was pretty good.

SSvY7rtt4goVd5HPruq3iQ.text: Had a great breakfast. The Belgian waffle was amazing, warm syrup, nice touch. Has Browns perfect. Menu a little limited but what we ate, we loved.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BcNeAsljDhfJNH8EV9dEMA.text: I can finally understand why this place is hyped up so much with such great food all over Phoenix - this is one of my favorite breakfasts I've had in a long time.  We placed a to-go order (skip the long waits!) for the chop and chick and the five spot. The pork chop was huge (great value), the rosemary potatoes were very tasty, and the toast was super thick and soft. It came with a great mixed berry compote as well. The five spot had awesome thick cut bacon and good flavor with the grilled onions. All of this came out to around $20 after tax which is a great value.  I would definitely come here again and I'm not even a big breakfast/brunch kind of person!

kiIoTB4cr8YYrN2l_FM5-Q.text: It's all in the name!!! Line out the door but worth any wait. We went twice while in town and told many others to try. Food is great!

f_ZhOXvmBgJO9hpjhrKR5A.text: I panned this restaurant's original downtown Phoenix location a long time ago, but their Sky Harbor Terminal 4B location has made me a believer. Matt's now makes the BEST STEAK & EGGS in the state! Yummy thick bacon made with brown sugar and fresh artisan breads.

P7X9FtmFc91mAXNMkW9XVQ.text: Had a great time at this place. Coffee was good. Food was amazing. Service was quick and friendly. Bacon was thick, and so was the sourdough.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rSCW6Ao1j011Op6mFI5eDg.text: It was delicious! Loved atmosphere, very busy at the time I went on a Friday morning sometime between 8 and 9. Food was fresh! Highly recommend!

jZkiHJpVNeRVnWkO9EKk6A.text: Great food. Attentive servers. Coffee and water refills without asking. The best thick cut bacon! Soooo good. Will be back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vT13d5lIojVX3DHwshSi1Q.text: If you love breakfast then you MUST try Matt's! I had the cheddar omelet with hash browns, side of sausage patties, and wheat toast. I LOVE sausage patties so was so happy they had them! The toast was fluffy and perfectly buttered and it comes with homemade compote. The omelet was also fluffy and fully cooked. Nothing I hate more than an undercooked omelet! So kudos to them for getting that right! But I just have to GUSH about the hash browns. Literally, the BEST hash browns I've had in all my 40 years on this earth. I don't even want to know how they make them as I'm sure it is with many things not approved by my healthy eating plan. LOL. But I HIGHLY recommend the hash browns. Run, don't walk! The honey lemonade was also a perfect accompaniment to this AMAZING breakfast. Will definitely be back!

yXLZll32finvnhzmliiBKQ.text: Yummy! Loved their bone-in ham and waffles. And the maple syrup tastes fresh! Very casual place, you sit wherever you want. We came at just the right time (just before 12nn on a weekday), as we were able to grab a table immediately. It got busy pretty much soon after.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H40OAjKAuNGhn7reAAQWdA.text: Solid breakfast joint. I got the omelette with bacon and American cheese and it did not disappoint. Decently crispy hash browns. I was feeling the chocolate milk- it was just regular milk with a very generous portion of chocolate syrup. Not great for groups- we had five people and it was a little cramped to be at a four top.

M8hFp8VLLf0AarrrvSbVKA.text: The service was great they were very friendly and wanted to help. The waffle was great and so was the sandwich.

j9lunP-1u_kQiNXQaIS9ig.text: The breakfast was great - nuf said! The home fries are tender, and cage free eggs are delish. I will be back

IznVLV-Z7K-HrJGDFAgNAw.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy! Does get busy but its worth it. The sausage is nirvana. The bacon is deeeeelish!

FS_FzDAWwpUk4s5-4qMUQA.text: It was really good nice place to eat but if you have to wait on parties or other people to show up I don't like that you have to wait for everybody to show up at one time

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rq5UflLXA9nF_f7w5PvjRQ.text: We stopped at the downtown location on the way back from the airport and it was the perfect stop. The downtown location is the original so go there if you can. The waffles, coffee, and sausage were all fantastic but it was the homemade bread and homemade strawberry jam that put everything together. The bread is obviously homemade and sliced about an inch thick with butter and jam it was so so so good. I wish i could have tried the french toast because im telling you the bread is that good. I cant wait to go back and bring others with us. By the time we left at 1015 there was an hour wait so go early if you can. The coffee was good too just black. It was nice smooth and they have raw sugar if u like it sweet. We will be back.

mGQurLG3IF4CSol_yCCb_A.text: This is a nice comfy place for breakfast. The service was polite and snappy, prices good, and the bacon delicious.  I had a waffle which was fine but nothing special.  I wouldn't hesitate to come here again if in town again and try something else for sure.

UGI7aM_N7HnFmhIzrbrypA.text: Matt's Big Breakfast did not disappoint! Arrived before open .  Tried 3 other times the wait was too long. The Hog with the $1 ham was salty and delicious their potatoes have onions and rosemary yummy The chop was cooked crispy and was not dry Eggs over easy The sour dough toast with amazing fresh strawberry jelly I could eat all day long. Good coffee that was filled often  and even gave us  to go cups. We will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HsaLkvns5XYPrRCyWyhsfg.text: Eh. Pass ... maybe because my husband and I are from NY and know what good breakfast is... this place is overhyped and pricey. Better off going to Denny's. Bacon was like eating a tire. Waitress was rude, won't be back.

TMM6X39NXkmmKRwEjj_hYw.text: For once, the Hub enjoyed his food !  What is with the warehouse turned restaurant decor???? is this the new fad now...  I have to agree with of the other surveyor on this page....I was not wowed.   it started with my coffee. they didn't have half/half. ..I know, I know but to be a breakfast place, milk just don't cut it for me...sorry semi-coffee snob.  BUT...the service was fast! all the servers worked together so when we flagged down a server, they all came running   Did I mention we got our food lickity  split?!?!?!?!?  I got the hog and chic... (not a fan of crisp (almost burnt) peppered  bacon with crispy Hash brown (that was good) and 2 pcs of thick slices of sourdough. ...they automatically gave me grape Jam, which I don't like, so I asked for strawberry instead. That was homemade...not the smuckers kind with the foil top.  The Hub got the Saturday special, chorizo scrambled. ..he loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sourdough toast with grape jam...if you don&#39;t like grape, ask for strawberry. .it&#39;s yum
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hog and chick. See the bacon....it was peppered
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hubs Saturday special

UnqHaQ8lpp5n2PX3vPXW9w.text: Good place for a classic breakfast. Service is quick and friendly. The menu is pretty basic but down really well. However there is always a crazy long wait which I don't really get. There is another Matt's big breakfast location and I would much rather go to that one since it tends to be less crazy! I just can't justify waiting an hour for a table at breakfast

QeDj1BlhyaJaAvdG86IHkQ.text: Never really write reviews on here but I knew I had too after I ate here. Loved the food and great costumer service, totally recommend!!

BqWhrg3Jt-DW-CCIAWUJOw.text: Very surprised by Matt's Big Breakfast. I guess I was expecting something different by the name. However the breakfast was amazing and very flavorful. The homemade ketchup and hot sauce were delicious. I would definitely recommend any dish with bacon which was thick cut and awesome! Fair price and good food, I will be back again when I am staying in downtown Phoenix.

1xB0h5RKH0RCa2juRLxy_w.text: Great breakfast, we went back two days in a row it was that great. Spring Training and great breakfast!

iEPJaELZzyPP4GA7jmZaGw.text: Went there today... very good food and good prices with quick and friendly staff. I saw the restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives... I'm from out of town but I'm sure I'll go back this weekend before I leave!!!

diU1PMJ6mOPuS7rQBqdv0Q.text: Friendly staff and great service. Love the homemade fruit compote they serve with the toast alongside the meals and the fresh lemonades they offer. I always get something different when I go typically the special of the day. One of my favorite breakfast spots.

WUnk31jfoRc_i-zabWJhqw.text: Best bacon I ever had. Eggs were cooked perfectly to order. Great pancakes sour dough bread and hash browns. Coffee was fantastic. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in town! Atmosphere was awesome as was the service. I'll be back!

e7PU_2Td8T52JlhWSbZ0yQ.text: Got the 5 spot and special scramble with schreiners sausage.  Always a favorite breakfast spot of ours

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great as usual.

GvChhTHIvqj3PplWNJYduw.text: I was staying in Phoenix overnight at the Sheraton & didn't want to pay $20 for the average quality buffet in the hotel.  This place is a short walk (10 mins) from the Sheraton & the food was excellent.  I arrived was quickly seated at a very busy place. I selected the Skinny without cheese & really enjoyed the turkey sausage, egg white omelette & the fresh salad.  The staff were extremely friendly & the atmosphere in the place was fun to go with the decor!!  It ended up being about $14 as I got tea as well.  I will be back the next time I am in town.

ur6XVa8t70-VOjEy-pkrAg.text: The best of the best. I eat here almost once a week - it's that good!  The OJ - fresh squeezed and always perfect. Wish it wasnt so expensive but you definitely get what you pay for.   I get the waffle everytime. It's literally the greatest waffle this side of the Mississippi (actually its the best one ive ever had but trying to sound slick LOL).   The butter - swear it has crack in it because you will want to put it on everything!!   And now the best part of Matt's (dont laugh!), the sourdough toast. Man ol' man!!!! I swear its better than any sourdough toast from san fran. Amazing!! I get two orders everytime.

09vo9LHH8D5DXy05S9E82Q.text: It was the 6th month anniversary for The Breakfast Club UYE (woot woot) and the placed picked to try was Matt's Big Breakfast.  I picked this place because I had heard they do take reservations of a large groups and thought how sweet is that, I called them and verified that they do, then told them I would call back with the final details.  When I got all the information, called them back and told them what day & time and how many, and was told then that the reservations is actually for groups of 5 or smaller :( whomp whomp , but was told that they could hold a party of 15 we just needed to get on the list, and then she asked what is the meaning for the reservations, and I said we are monthly breakfast club and we picked Matt's to try this month, I was then told that Matt's turns tables over fast is it's not really the type of place to hold meetings, I laughed and said the type of meetings we are doing is eating.    Got there around 8am on Sat morning, put my name on the list for a party of 15, I was then told that the entire party needs to be there in ordered to be seated, I told her that I would need to be saving one seat, someone is running late, I was told only way to save a seat is to order their food for them that way all orders are going in at the same time.  Just stating this on the review to give people with groups the heads up. Everyone showed up, and we were seated pretty quickly!  When I figured out that we were headed to Matt's Big Breakfast, what I wanted to order, had to have, needed to taste was there waffles, when I got into Matt's and seated at the table I looked up and saw the daily special and said, oh that's what I'm having.  It was three eggs scrambled with Schriener's chorizo fresh jalapenos cheddar cheese and home fries and flour tortilla. This dish was delish!! The jalapenos where so fresh!! The home fries were perfectly cooked; the eggs & chorizo were very good stuffed in that flour tortilla! Only thing that could have made this better was some great hot sauce! The dish for me was lacking in heat, but was great in flavor!   I did see a waffle or 2 at the table, and let me tell you, they looked great, but I think I made the right choice, see I like to have some waffle of pancake with my syrup and at Matt's you get 2 ounces of real maple syrup, additional 2 ounces can be bought for a buck 50, so if it was me, I would be spending like 5 bucks just on syrup.   Wonder if I can bring in my own haha  I have wanted to try Matt's Big Breakfast for a very long time now and am very happy I did, everything is fresh and fast! I look forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The special. Three eggs scrambled with schriener&#39;s chorizo fresh  jalapeños cheese home fries and flour tortilla
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Breakfast Club UYE 6/15
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nm21fE60iseQ7Jdo_4Vuow.text: Little restaurant, big flavor. We waited for about 30 minutes to get seated on a Sunday morning. Honestly, it was worth it. Plus, their freshly made lemonades are so good.

xVRoTNtceyD6cmyvQHUKpg.text: Good food that gets to your table fairly quickly. The staff seems to work hard. Big negative- long lines and minimal waiting area (especially in extreme weather). My advice- go during off peak/non-weekend hours or don't bother (unless you enjoy waiting 60+ minutes for breakfast). I've been twice now and probably won't be back.

_ctfGolp3A8n7ZGczUgk7w.text: My favorite place when at PHX airport.  The food is delicious, service is absolutely great!  I've spent 10 minutes to 3 hours there depending on flights, and I'm always treated to good food and good service.

F0ySOSie2x7O1wKylvkeAQ.text: Always busy and always an excellent meal. Came here for a late breakfast a few weeks ago and was not disappointed. Ordered the hog & chick, scrambled eggs, bacon and hash browns. All was delicious and extremely filling (needed a nap afterwards!). Would love to come for lunch one day and try something different.   Also, the airport location makes an outstanding bloody mary!

-3vI05FzXBMYAAy1zFv_Mw.text: My boyfriend came here on a Saturday morning (probably one of their busy days) and waited maybe 10 minutes. The short wait was SOOO worth it. We ordered two blackberry honey lemonades and my bf said it was the best lemonade he's ever had in his life!  A customer next to us ordered the special of the day and it looked so good we had to get the same! It was some sort of sausage hash with rosemary potatoes (writing this review a few weeks later so I can't remember exactly.) First off, it was a HUGE serving. the rosemary potatoes were perfect and the strawberry jam that came with the toast tasted like biting into a fresh strawberry.   This is definitely the best breakfast in Phoenix.

gQ-QGoAqwl18FPTaFrv8Mw.text: I love this place!  They have great specials every time!  This time I got the special which was 3 egg scramble with sausage, cheddar & pepper jack  cheese, and their home fries which are amazing... They grilled onion and a little bell pepper with fresh sprigs of rosemary!  My boyfriend got the pork chop with 2 sunny side eggs and home fries.  His pork chop was delicious & seasoned in loveliness!  We both got their oj... I loved it but my boyfriend added sugar to his.  Everything was amazing! Oh- they also have some of the best pancakes I've ever had... I HAD to have one pancake! Mmmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The special! 3 scrambled eggs w/ niman ranch chipotle cheddar sausage,  jalepenos, &amp; pepper jack, home fries &amp; a flour tortilla
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork with 2 sunny side eggs and home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My cute boyfriend devouring his pork chop!

Rnm58V6CUKXpZZOBUs2eQg.text: I was really looking forward to finally going to Matt's Big Breakfast after hearing about it for many years. I was kind of disappointed. My wife's pork chop looked good, but lacked any kind of seasoning. My omelet was OK, but could have been better. The hash browns were delicious, but the toast was to thick, and was hardly toasted. I think I'll stick with Black Bear Diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special of the day &amp; Pork Chops

zROIAHCrTzvtm5q7KKz_TA.text: Great food, the waffles were out of this world! But there weren't very many options to choose from.

w9A_wb3rDfd0wY8hxd1ZLQ.text: My husband and I are pretty new to the area and we found Matt's Big Breakfast and were pretty impressed with their breakfast fare... until our last recent visit just yesterday.  I decided not to order my usual 5-spot breakfast sandwich and had the Hog & Chick menu item for a change.  I ordered my eggs over easy and hashbrowns, instead of the country potatoes.  All three of us order the hashbrowns and all three of us were very disappointed.  The hashbrowns were soggy, lukewarm, and almost the consistency of mashed potatoes in the middle.  Yuck!  My easy over eggs still had runny whites all around the yolk... double yuck!!  The only saving grace was the yummy bacon.  The food certainly wasn't worth waiting in line to get in the joint.  If we go back, I would stick with the 5-spot breakfast sandwich and the country potatoes.

g43pLz3Wjod38uaQGYai5g.text: Everything was great, the lemonade, orange juice, waffles, pancakes, too the fresh jam etc. everything was seasoned very well  and u didn't have to add anything. It's really not geared toward large group but they fit all 9 of use mostly kids( 9 months - 13 years old). We will be coming back when visit my family in Arizona!!!

4WuE9WonADGIv4zo7uZnXQ.text: Ok, I am still dreaming about the fluffy, buttery pancakes I had during my last trip to AZ during Spring Training. Drooling now, as I think about it.   Besides the pancakes, everything else is pretty spot on. The chick and chop - delicious, tender, subtle herb seasoning pork chop w/ eggs on the side. The hashbrowns? Off the hook! Buttery and crispy. Bacon? OMG. Perfectly shaped, and wonderfully crisp.   And the service, for being as busy as it is, they make you feel right at home. Sure, the manager checks in with you towards the end, so she can gauge when you will leave the table, but it still felt genuine. Made us feel right at home, like a regular "veteran" - despite really only visiting once a year on our Spring Training trips.   See you next year, Matt. See you soon (but not soon enough).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham off the bone. Tasty. Not as great as I thought it might be for the extra charge, but decent.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a good photo, but GREAT/FANTASTIC hashbrowns. Crispy on the outside, buttery and soft on the inside. I am drooling now.

ozsqsjkKdIPWB5N4pkdn7Q.text: Awesome Sun AM breakfast. Prompt service at the counter.  The home fries were fantastic and a huge portion.  The sour dough toast and homemade strawberry preserves were a treat.  Will definitely return next time in PHX for breakfast.

yLeSgLaSCJ7fQ8UJSgosKg.text: Just had brunch at Matt's.  Service is wonderful, you never feel rushed even though there are people anxiously waiting to get a table. Food is fresh and delicious. They really care about the food they serve.   The only things I wish were different are the bacon and sausage.  The bacon is thick cut....I love me some crispy bacon but even if you ask for it crispy it just never comes out that way. The sausage is good but I wish it had more seasoning like sage and all the other yummy stuff they put in sausage. I'm a sausage eater not a sausage maker;)  Those are the only things I wish were different. Other than that Matt's is awesome!

KYHVs0LSb5kA4grArZIPbg.text: everything has pepper on it, the bacon overcooked with bacon, potatoes has rosemary all over it. If you did not want something that is comes with, could not get substitutions, the tea is awful, do not have plain tea, when asked for tea bag, they gave you one and charged extra for every tea bag, service was awful and place small, this is not the best place at all for breakfast I do not care what anyone says, it is GROSS, there are better places then this.

cURXw4pa-kJz7y9KAhA3YQ.text: Kayla Becker's "Fleek Scale" (5 being SUPER ON FLEEK, 1 being FLEEK-less)   **5**  SUPER ON FLEEK- This is my favorite breakfast spot downtown. I like that their menu is limited, so I don't have to worry about my indecisiveness getting in the way. I almost always just order the special. If you go on the weekends, prepare to wait, but I promise the lines move quickly.   Things I'd like to see: mimosas and bloody Mary's. My friend and I asked once if they served mimosas and our waitress looked at us like we were alcoholics. We aren't, but if we were, even more reason to slam some OJ and champagne in front of us.   Things I could go without seeing: Since alcohol is not served, I'd assume this spot would qualify as a family establishment. With that said, the waitresses could cover up their tatas. When I ordered biscuits, what was busting out of their shirts weren't what I meant. But your boyfriend might be okay with it.   Overall - love this spot. I crave it often.

ceLsb5h3BJstqt6Btb3E9Q.text: Great simple fresh breakfast menu. Whenever I travel to PHX I make it a point to hit this place. I like the "skinny" breakfast but it all looks great

3pujkJjWm_tnjDk8M25YgA.text: One and a half hour wait. Cement floors make this place louder than an active warehouse. Waitstaff was present for the order and dropoff but you have to beg for refills on coffee or cokes. Food was OK but heavy on the a la carte pricing and for breakfast, which makes a big margin, I found it expensive for basic fare.

omP-fUq9POL-s3LiE_J7uA.text: This place is my favorite breakfast restaurant of all time. If you like hash browns, this is your place. It's at a great location and I'm normally not a person that eats in the morning but whenever we go here, I eat.

qwaqu0xdQSVT_nw_jtAbmg.text: is it just me or has the selection been reduced since they moved to the new larger location?  I took some out of town guest to Matt's - Saturday 8am - line was short.  there was about 8 breakfast selections - yawn.  the food is good - but no longer excellent.  there are many better locations and the service was lacking. I had to ask 5 times for a cup of coffee - finally took my cup to the counter for a refill with my food  Average at best. It used to be well worth the drive to matt's from No. Scottsdale. Now, I would save the gas and each local

AQvK8KXKs7eeif9UH9QYXA.text: Totally worth the wait. Even the toast was amazing. Fresh, cracked-to-order eggs make the difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog &amp; Chick

Iqmq8XQYzzKYLZt4LfkrsA.text: I will never understand the hype about this place.  I've been several times, once at its original smaller location and a few times at the new larger one.  And I don't get it.  The food is good, solid fare and you could do a lot worse for breakfast, but I just cannot wrap my head around why people are so nuts about this place.  This place is only worth it if you're willing to get up and go in before 7 so you don't have to wait for a table.  If you see people waiting outside, go somewhere else, because the food is very much typical breakfast food that you could easily get elsewhere downtown.  If you get it, it's very good and the staff are very friendly, but the wait time baffles me.

7Szt7J-f6UzHig_c-cFMHA.text: I love this restaurant. My one complaint is that they don't make or provide salsa. And hot sauce just isn't cutting it. But you don't need salsa for everything and I find that if you order the special of the day, you have the best experience - it's what the chef feels like making! Go on a weekday morning to avoid the crowd.

gp7TWgNRqO8-7jyeOZy8iw.text: came here for our last breakfast before I got sick on vacation (isn't that great) anyway it was delicious and I was happy to have fresh chocolate milk compared to the out of the bottle at other places. my husband loved his food (can't remember what he got) I wasn't a fan of the home fries but I didn't realize what they were cooked in. should have got the hash browns. no wait when we went and it's definitely a local kind of place which is exactly what I wanted.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmm chocolate milk

PIeOWpJWwHVTzucuzwFgYw.text: I read many of the reviews and couldn't pass up a breakfast here. We had the waffles and the Wednesday special, which was French toast. The French toast was just average. My daughter says the waffle is the fluffiest and best waffle she's ever had. We did not have to wait for a table at all (a Wednesday at 9:30) so that was nice. Parking was also easier than expected: plenty of street parking and a parking lot nearby. Service was ok. Waitress was prompt with order taking and very pleasant but once our order came, we were forgotten.  No water refill until we flagged someone over to ask.

n5oMEr27NOvtI42ZVJmM3Q.text: When I drove by Matt's, there was a line already waiting outside. I ordered the Chop and Chick since it was highly recommended by My fellow Yelpers. My husband got the Five Spot. I ordered the food to go, since I didn't want to wait and had a baby with me. I'm sure the food would of had me given it 5 stars if I ate it fresh from the kitchen. My favorite by far was their Jam. I'm NOT a jam persons ever but I am for Matt's Jams. It's to die for. It's original and divine flavors can't be duplicated. LOVE!
