photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining Area
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Side Wall

-dODThzaothweHCbt7QLiQ.text: Its just a regular breakfast joint.  Defiantly not worth a wait in line.

OT0hC2pDppEjPvq4kMM58Q.text: This place is awesome!!! It is a popular spot so be prepared for a bit of a wait however it will be worth it! Excited to hear that they are opening in Tempe as well! Everything here is so farm to table fresh  and the service was outstanding! Great place to bring out of town visitors in a charming spot of Downtown PHX.

Xlj6pQVjWk1P97JzZkTNjg.text: Small Menu and I feel they rush you to eat and leave. Great for sunday morning breakfast but that may be about it.  ............but the canadian bacon is on point

KQxBaoU5LhlJEXCZIBtE1w.text: The food was okay, the lemonade was AMAZING, the service was the worst I've ever had. I know it's a serious allegation to make, but I think the staff I encountered on the day I went there with my girlfriend were likely racist. I'm not saying they were for sure, but to me it was strange that the waitress wouldn't make eye contact with my girlfriend, much less even look in her direction. In fact, I had to order for her because she blatantly ignored her. I even tried flagging a different waitress down and was met with the same behavior. I'm the first to admit if I'm being a D-Bag or rude but all we did was sit down, place our order, and eat so I can't think of any other reason why we were treated this way. We eat out a lot and were from out of town so I think our table I side manners were fine. I don't want to say this incident is representative of the staff in the restaraunt as a whole but it was definitely an unpleasant experience and I will never go back when I go back to Phoenix and I will recommend people against it when they decide to go too given it's a fairly popular restaurant. Sourness aside, the food was decent; a little cold and the honey lemonade was to die for. I've tried making it at home to no success. To bad this place is mediocre and is staffed with mediocre quality people otherwise I'd go back every time I go down to Phoenix.

mxIJ0nTGmsGeKxbAetHSlA.text: Breakfast is off the hook. Crowded but short wait time. Excellent staff. I doubt there is anything on the menu that isn't as excellent as what I ate.

95rP6rgQO-g0zu4br67mHw.text: Great food, great service, great prices. It was our first time here, we definitely hope to come back next time we're in town. We stayed downtown so it was only 5 mins to get here. Hotel breakfast is so dull and all the same, refreshing to get something better. I would come back to Matt's.

mNI9iULbowr9b1NCyG3HJQ.text: We came here before we went to the SF v Arizona game, we decided to walk from our hotel wow ~ was it hot. I tend to sweat and boy was I melting as we made our way past Arizona State Law School's campus.   The woman who was handling the seating and waiting arrangements did a great job engaging the crowd, despite it being 100 degrees outside their restaurant. It was a Sunday and it seems as though everyone in the historic district had the same idea as we did.   Food was good, came out quickly. Only thing that I was not too happy about was the iced coffee that they offered me and my wife. It seemed too watered down, to a point where my server asked if I wanted more iced tea. Besides that we had a good time service was attentive, Never mind that we were decked out in our best 49er apparel, they still treated us like very nicely.   I had the peppered bacon and the 'world famous' waffle with real maple syrup. (You can really put the words 'world famous' in front of anything.)  Definitely a must if you are in the area and you are looking for a brunch.

oTFZO_o2XSNfgXPaN5OFSw.text: This is the biggest joke on the internet. The people (staff) are the rudest in the state, PERIOD! The food is standard fare, nothing special. Like all restaurants in Phoenix, they (owners) all visit each other and write great reviews for each other.

dXDc8gZ2Jhahz-0u8NWKDA.text: OK, maybe I was a bit premature giving a rating after one visit.  Went back the next day.  Got there before 8.  Place was nearly empty.  Ordered hog and chick.  Not nearly as good as previous.  Bacon was burned and hash browns were greasy and dark brown.  Needed a knife to cut a piece out.  Servers and cooks spent much time chatting.  On my first visit the place was packed, but food and service were excellent.  Maybe they work better under pressure?

lLhHngI8TFAuneH-3mA7cQ.text: When I saw that Matt's had four stars on here, I was anticipating something pretty great. After eating there, I felt duped. I waited for almost an hour to find that there were only eight things on the whole menu, and none of them were worth the wait or the price. I got the special of the day and it was, kindly put, less than special. The omelet was cold, bland, and nearly empty of filling and flavor. My boyfriend had the cold and dry pork with less-than-thrilling eggs. The only saving grace was the strawberry jam, but when jam is your only redeeming factor, you've got some work to do. After trying to power through this underwhelming meal, I got the check and thought "THIS is what they think that food was worth?" I entirely regret my decision to go to Matt's. I felt deceived by the four star review and felt like my fellow Yelpers deserve more honesty than that.  However, since then, I had the pleasure of going to Mark's Cafe in Tempe (at Rural and Guadalupe) and had an absolutely incredible experience. Rather than wasting your time and money at Matt's, I suggest going to Mark's. Great food, great price, great selection, great service,... Take your money to a breakfast spot that will earn it.

Wi4-a4plHYTqJoxd39Ccdw.text: Do not expect to feel like Dennys here.  It is a busy little mom and pop shop that produces some of the best breakfast food in town.  Everything tasted amazing and the portion size was almost too large.  The price was very fair for what I consider the best quality around.  My waitress Maritza was great as well.    I highly recommend this business to friends and family.

SAET0k_niSxXT8umjN1UtQ.text: The breakfast burrito was delicious. It was filled with peppers and chunks of bacon. Matt's obviously specializes in bacon.

c9X7rqsfzi4ABNwv7GD0HQ.text: Overrated. Poor service, especially the hosts.  You shouldn't get brownie points for non GMO food- but this place does in Phoenix.

uACCe_8L2BwfK_oxc-8xpA.text: I was here the other day and it was a great hangover cute. However their omelette did not have a lot of flavour and the hash-browns needed a lot of salt. It was alright on the whole, the atmosphere and wait staff were great but I expected a more flavourful meal. It's decent but nothing to write home about.

CO7G1TPk_u3Se0uZ_mpGoA.text: Have also review this place under it's former address just down the street - but have only eaten at this particular location.  Went in for lunch last Tuesday but got breakfast. Still was pretty busy but managed to get a parking spot in their tiny lot behind rather than pay a metre. Inside, we were almost immediately offered the bar area but, after sitting, found the seats are polished steel and I kept sliding off. They are not made for larger customers and some cushions with traction would not go amiss. So, we waited an extra 10 minutes for a table.  Got a large Belgian-style waffle with butter and syrup and the daily special lemonaide (strawberry honey). The lemonade was tasty and the waffle was delicious, but honestly a little costly for the amount of food. I definitely should have gone with the omelette - which is the same price but you get a huge omelette and a side of bacon and home fries! The waffle - which also comes with excellent thick-cut sliced bacon - definitely needs to come with a side of potatoes. A side of potatoes ordered on it's own is over $2.  However, service is super friendly and attentive. Still recommend this place but if you're hungry, skip the waffle and get something more generous!

njuGDW9qDLJWsmBpxrYgng.text: This was the first time that I ordered eggs Benedict and it came to perfection. Everything is fresh and delicious. The staff are friendly and prompt. I do recommend this place.

HxGvsnyha606uV9jLvbhfQ.text: Good food, but I felt rushed.  I hadn't even taken my first bite and already received the bill!

JQg_mphH6uqD0N6df_9nwA.text: This may sound strange but I've never actually had breakfast at Matt's Big Breakfast, only lunch. In my opinion they have one of the best burger's in town. My only criticism is that the side is potato chips. But I love the burger. My friend gets the ruben and he says its one of the best he's ever had. The service is always great there too.

ZfzgUHTLH11yfSgbpEtw-A.text: My absolute favorite place for breakfast!!!  The waffle literally melts in your mouth.  I have been going to Matt's for over 10 years now and have recommended it to hundreds.  The owners and staff are amazing.  The ingredients are fresh and I have yet to have a dish I did not like.  I would come early as it is very busy, but worth the wait!!!

L6tivZnUkguAixdxvneTBg.text: This place is amazing. Certainly beats out Denny's or IHOP. The eggs and French toast were amazing. I'll be finding myself back here soon enough :-)

_El0p2oh5NayzPDqb3kazw.text: Breakfast was awesome. Fresh, fast, and tasty. And coming from San Francisco - this meal was a steal.   We came for breakfast on Tuesday and was seated without a wait and food arrived quickly. We ordered the special scramble - grilled pork tenderloin scramble - and the waffle with bacon. The scramble was huge and the hash browns that came with it were so delicious, as everyone else has described. The waffle was light and heavenly! The bacon was seriously thick-cut and a perfect complement.   The staff was super friendly and attentive.  This was definitely a highlight of our trip.

jCYF7diexTjqA0ulEBQfzw.text: We came here on a Saturday morning and waited 45 minutes. The menu is small but what we ordered was really good. We ordered a blueberry honey lemonade and a strawberry honey lemonade. The best drinks I've ever had. We got griddle cakes and a scramble that was the special of the day. Best pancakes and syrup I've had and the egg scramble was amazing. Definitely I would come back.

VfqgwV19NqmD9LntNpWATw.text: This place is so overhyped. The food is your average breakfast food at a premium price you pay because it was featured once upon a time on TV. The service was even more laughable as the last time I visited I had to actually get up and ask for the remainder of my order. And don't even expect to be able to just pop in and out like a normal breakfast joint, the wait times alone ensure that you will be there for at least an hour or more.

BRJ_-7anGXjh0nDB5p4xwQ.text: I was kind of surprised about the small menu since I have heard a lot of hype about this place. I was happy to see the words "cage-free" and "organic" throughout the menu. We tried the Thursday special- Eggs Benedict, a side order of bourbon cherry sausage, a side of bacon, and a stack of griddle cakes. All of the meats were awesome, especially the sausage! The griddle cakes were not bad, they tasted like maybe they used corn flour in addition to the standard pancakes you get everywhere. The prices are higher than your average breakfast joint, but it comes with the quality of the product, so I think they were fair for the organic options.  There is just not really any reason to go back since we tried almost the whole menu... I'm not embellishing on the small menu part!

JY50ZHTVk-XWYe0RtvIo8A.text: I love love the waffles at this place so delicious sweet and the syrup is tasty.  I've had only pleasant experience's at Matt's.  The staff is also excellent very catering to your needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heavenly sweet.

l5yg2JIThnuvV4hOU0Cryg.text: Get the blueberry honey lemonade! Three egg omelette and pancakes were good! Busy but short wait on a Thursday morning at 10am.

j5W4s5jUUVCSyOCAPC7rJw.text: Best breakfast in town. Be ready to wait almost any time. Better towards closing time at 2:30. They use local ingredients. Yummy waffle with huge piece of bacon is the best.

g3MhRN_8QPpVYEx9UYpuSA.text: Flew into Phoenix on a terrible red eye flight with screaming kids in the rows in front and behind.  From the airport, went straight to Matt's downtown.  Yeah I know they have a place in the airport but there's something about airport food places that I don't like.  Too much hustle and bustle.  Anyway, got to Matt's at the right time.  Got a parking spot in the small lot behind the restaurant.  Went in and had a choice between sitting at a table or at the bar.  We went for the bar which offered a little more arm room for the 3 of us.  Service was great. Our server gave us tips on where to visit and other places to eat.  Food was tasty and big (no lunch for us after this breakfast).  The restaurant has a nice design featuring chalkboards with the daily specials. There was a good mix of families, workers, locals and tourist.  It is a little noisy due to the small size of the restaurant. As we left, a line for those waiting for tables started to form.  I would definitely come back to Matt's Big Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Salami Scramble
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

At4_fpZmC6__FwcKpjtQHA.text: I have been a customer for many years but I was only compelled to write a review today. There are a few things I want to address.   First, the menu is extremely limited. I don't feel that the quality and presentation are up to par for such a limited menu. If you serve few things, those few things should be executed with perfection.   Next, there is most always a wait here. I have seen the crowds and lines on the weekends. I never visit on the weekends because I don't believe that it is worth the wait. You can usually score a table with 5 mins or less wait during the week days, but you do need to arrive early.   Now let's talk service. I consistently get trash service here. It's just one square room where the servers can see you all the time but seem to just avoid your eyes when you try to catch their attention. My drinks have always sat empty, even the water! They are always rushed and don't make friendly conversation. The one compliment I do have is that the food is always FAST here. The kitchen has their act together.   Last, it is loud in there. The metal chairs scrape on the concrete floors, and those sounds combine with three dozen or so different conversations and kid noises. It is labor intensive to have a conversation! I don't want to have to scream at breakfast like it's a nightclub.  This is allegedly a Phoenix great, but not for me. The food is okay, the service is bad, and the atmosphere is better than when it was in the little house, but still not good.

xWVMpcuLgY4A1B9QRJbUyQ.text: Love this place it was rustic it was fun it was happening and the food was bloody spectacular great service great attitude

PH3BaDm7yIY7wFO4q6qrqA.text: Came here on a Friday for lunch with a couple of friends, and am so glad we did! Fortunately, we did not have to wait at all and got seated right away! I ordered the freshly squeezed honey lemonade and waffle with bacon. When I drank the lemonade, I thought it was good..but more honey than lemon than I wished. Now...I'm craving for one.   Our food came surprisingly fast given how busy it was. I chowed down and cleaned up the entire plate very fast...the waffle was crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside, and the bacon was thick and yummy. Yum yum yum.   I tried my friend's potatoes and wheat toast with jam, it was so good! I'm a PB without J kind of person...and I really liked the jam. My bill was like $14 total..I would totally go back again for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmm waffle, omelette, and tuna sandwich!

ykAMaH6nswQLYN78gN4Ysw.text: Wow! Incredible breakfast! I got the Monday special of huevos rancheros and a side of bacon. Phenomenal breakfast! Yummy and incredible service. Will def come here again.

0l0NQtyXTdXkEFNf7IkSkg.text: It was okay. Went there because it had been featured on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives. Food was fine, but I have to say I prefer to go to 'First Watch.'

nRTSwHF5l7Fio5ziODPD1g.text: Nice breakfast spot. Most importantly...THE 2nd BEST BACON I've ever had! Their thick cut bacon deserves to be on the Mt Rushmore of pig product. Absolutely worth the price of admission.

KR8xrOTJ04SPQQYSeJiFww.text: When I'm looking for a breakfast that reminds me of what my grandmas would make.  I love their food. The cheese omelette is solid. I've also had the salami scramble, which is really good. The oatmeal is good if you're looking for a healthy option.  I think what makes Matt's stand out from other breakfast joints is their ingredients.  They make their jam from scratch, which is a nice touch. The thick-cut  If there's one complaint, it's the home fries.  Not a big fan of the rosemary seasoning for breakfast -- just a personal preference.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good toast

4021i_eqMBEl0ZqwxdX7fg.text: I'm partial. There is just noooo place better for authentic, organic, delicious breakfast and lunch items in Arizona. Love, love MBB's!

JDaJ_t6rtvZqU_VIXmS43Q.text: Amazing! The best waffles I ever eaten, actually everything we ordered was very good. Great quality!

iJM5hNBsgXYtHwm_2R0CZQ.text: All in all, good breakfast joint . Little parking but you can find metered parking on street. We had a the special egg scramble of the day and the cheesy omelette. And the Toast and jam was great ! A little salty for my taste but I'd come again.

RalnFiYmZvtjN4nBHVnoEQ.text: Don't buy the hype. I love a good breakfast, but that's not what I got here. I had an omelet with ham, mushrooms, and provolone cheese. The omelet was sub standard. The ham was like sliced deli ham very thin. Not at all like the chunks of ham I envisioned. The mushrooms tasted like they came from a can. As for the potatoes, they came overseasoned. So much so that i left more than half on the plate. The only redeeming thing for this breakfast was the toast and jam. The jam was delicious and tasted homemade. Overall though it was an overpriced meal and a mediocre experience. The service was decent and they made sure my coffee was never empty.

-upP-TJs9wkgjbaRnBpXAQ.text: Great breakfast spot! Friendly service and even better food. Love that they use locally sourced foods whenever possible. My husband and I both had the "Hog and Chicks." I had mine with crispy bacon - fantastic, crispy, not greasy - and eggs over easy. My husband had scrambled eggs with sausage, also excellent. Loved the homemade sour dough toast and strawberry jam. Hash browns also were good. What a gem in downtown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jWUyRRFWzzVwVIwF8B4hbA.text: Drove out of our way to try and we were not disappointed! Fast Great food in a funky close atmosphere, and amazing food !

B3P04klXJLpMLtQ7xEtEDg.text: Delicious food! I highly recommend the Eggs Benedict. Great coffee too!!  Just flew in and looked for highly rated on yelp. This one popped up and am I glad it did.

bAwYwBONQ_2nuItKrxIcHg.text: A friend from Napa was in town and on a whim we decided to go. Matt's, as expected was busy, and as promoted it was absolutely worth the wait.   I had pancakes and my friend had a more traditional egg breakfast with a bacon option. Extra extra good bacon.    My friend was still raving about her breakfast last week and it was over a month ago that we had gone to Mantz. Just remember there will be a wait and it will be worth it!

MNmJzmrvwYe19dcshwIIgA.text: Yum yum yum....these guys know how to do it right. The potatoes are served hot and crispy, and they taste amazing. They know how to do a perfect poached medium egg. The service is fast and there's a counter if you need to eat in a jiffy. Great coffee, local biz....great place all around.

0oCPUPyDg6nsHxaGOizW2Q.text: Breakfast is always delicious here! I had the special this morning and it was so good! The only thing that is a downer that and kept me from giving a 5 star review is that there is little to no AC here!  We were eating a delicious meal sweating up a storm! If the AC was on and it would have been cool it would of been an amazing experience.

STEAJhMg8753rZpQJo8aCQ.text: A small but busy diner/breakfast joint. Fair prices for what you get. Food is good, we had the skinny, waffles and the special (3 egg omelette) and a side of hashbrowns.   Waffles were dense, syrup was real maple and bacon was smokey. The Skinny salad was great but I thought the chicken apple sausages were a bit too sweet. Salad on the other hand pretty good. Hashbrowns tasted like real potatoes... Which I don't get very often. The special was good, the preserve served with the bread was quite delicious. We did find it a bit peculiar that it seems AZ eggs are smaller than CA eggs ... Not sure why.   Overall good quality food, perfect portion (not too much and not stingy) and fair prices. We waited half an hour and thought we made the right decision. If the wait was about 1hr+, then we would have said not worth the wait.

rpO8meZ0fh2ekxDYYUp2wg.text: The breakfast here is pretty good. HUGE portions and solid offerings. The menu doesn't have anything mind-blowing different but everything is very very solid. The wait is a little bit of a turn off though.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TUGwLhXjtY1WTMMG0KDlzA.text: Where do I begin???? This is hands down the best breakfast place in Phoenix. I went 3 times and I would go everyday if I could. I was in town for work and this was the highlight for me. The reviews are very True, anything you get will satisfy you. I highly recommend the blue berry lemonade made with honey. Absolutely love this place, I got the waffle it was perfect, portion sizes are really great and the staff is always helpful. Portions are fantastic you can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side pancake and sour dough bread
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cheese omelet with onions, peppers and sausage plus home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The five spot to go! It hit the spot.

Jj_ljoENOYSerbrb3ycutw.text: Truly the best breakfast we have ever eaten out. Everything is fresh and above quality ingredients.   The omelet had sauteed portabello mushrooms, thick cut bacon and real cheddar cheese.  Belgium waffle so fresh and tasty served with real maple syrup. The add on hash browns were real fresh shredded potatoes.   Plan on an hour wait for a table but the staff is wonderful and food is so worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Qg2q12usFaykS7SeKI4P1g.text: Found a great breakfast place about 10 minutes outside of the airport. I noticed they list a location inside Terminal 4 but, for some reason I missed seeing it.  As I arrived at their downtown location, I noticed a crowd waiting outside the front of the restaurant. This is always a good sign that you're in the right place. I sat at the counter and ordered their classic Hog and Chick (bacon and eggs) with home style potatoes. Their potatoes are well seasoned and their bacon is nice and thick with the right amount of black pepper. It came with 2 thick pieces of sourdough toast with a special home made jam that you should not pass up. It actually looked like a small side of salsa. But, it came served with my toast. So I tried it and it was amazing. I don't know what's in it but, trust me when I say it's worth a try. This is significant since I'm normally not a jam person.  Great friendly staff. I highly recommend it if you're ever in the downtown Phoenix area and have time for breakfast, stop by Matt's Big Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Hog and Chick (bacon and eggs) with home style potatoes
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahh. The counter. Good for people like me. Party of one
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Weekday breakfast crowd. Line outside. Must be a good place.

GbiaDQhAOXFKYylJ5MgaxQ.text: Their bacon alone is worth the 5 stars. So is the strawberry jam they serve with their toast. Oh yeah the egg dishes are pretty good too.

49epTVN1Y0HXc5DD3XbrxA.text: We try to come back here any time we visit Arizona. The bacon is chewy instead of crispy (really good), and the eggs just taste better. I highly recommend the fresh squeezed OJ, and the bread with homemade jam. If you happen to be in the Phoenix area, it is more than worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog and Chick

v56XLnMbyA-f9jYbkDBy1Q.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in the city. The food is fresh and delicious, the portion sizes are large but not giant, the lemonade and jam are pretty much straight off the tree. And the specials have always been artfully paired and very tasty. I just wish it was physically larger, but that is the nature of downtown.   If there was a West Valley location, we'd be in every other weekend.

j_FPbjlaEVmlh8ZJA6E2kg.text: Definetly 5 STARS. Matts BB is my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix, in the world really. I'm definitely not a regular there but they know me by name. Even the owner, Matts wife, know my name.... Very cool. Everything is great, my favorite is the waffles with real maple syrup, huge bacon, and toast. With either coffee or RC Cola in a CAN.    It may take awhile to  get in, but I promise you... Well worth the wait, it's funny because nobody in the line complains, because they know....

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really....
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome waffles $ bacon!!

-nVmgtePA2YC53D7eenwKw.text: Came in For Breakfast, I Tried the Breakfast Sandwich it was good! Included Bacon, Egg & Cheese I loved there House Potatoes had a lot of flavor to them. The Pork chop and eggs is a good choice as well. The coffee was a bit too strong and I wanted to try there biscuits & gravy but unfortunately they only serve those on Tuesdays and I came in on Saturday (bummer) the waitress explained to us that everyday there's a breakfast special and it can only be served on that day which doesn't make sense, they should be able to serve it everyday and maybe just one day make it at a discounted price since its the special of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Sandwich
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chop Breakfast

Xu7UBjroBmbcjoVsFlgX3A.text: We found this gem while traveling. This is seriously one of the best places I've ever had breakfast at. I had the omelet with cheese and sausage, served with hash browns, strawberry honey lemonade, thick cut wheat toast, served with homemade preserves, and the pancakes.  -The Omelet was very hearty, I ordered it with sausage crumbles, and hash browns that were super crispy, which I loved.  - The thick cut wheat toast that came with my meal was insanely delicious with the homemade strawberry preserves that was served with it.  - The pancakes were huge, fluffy, and super delicious. I used my leftover strawberry preserves to use as a topping for my pancakes. OUT OF THIS WORLD!  This will be my go-to place, anytime I go to Arizona. I know it gets pretty crowded, we lucked out ND got seated right away. I honestly wouldn't mind waiting. The quality of food and service here will make it worth it. I look forward to visiting soon!

H5NJ15_8IUka5CU1Nu14Zw.text: Went for brunch during the week, and were not disappointed! Great spot for brunch!  It's just street parking around the restaurant, and I can imagine that when this place is busy, parking might be kind of difficult.   Inside it's wide open seating with a small counter/bar seating area as well. It's pretty noisy/loud inside, but not to the point where it bothered us. The service was excellent! Very fast! Very friendly!  The food was also excellent! We had the Skinny and the Special (egg scramble w/ schreiner's chorizo, jalapeno's, white cheddar, potatoes). Both were delicious, and were only $10.95 with good size portions! We also had the signature bourbon cherry sausage, which was a really interesting mix of flavors, and had a nice crunch to the casing. We definitely left very full!  Overall, great brunch spot in Phoenix! Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;inside&#34; of the bourbon cherry sausage
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. signature bourbon cherry sausage
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the skinny

cU5sACdj-rdgDyvu40a3xw.text: Found on Yelp and Guy's Triple D. Hard to find because they moved and there are One Way streets. Worth the search. Big Fresh Hearty breakfast. Really enjoyed. Staff brisk, not busy time, but courteous.

u4kFJytYY7zy0PiZlEyH3A.text: Excellent, speedy service. Restaurant was packed at 8am on a Sunday morning. Food was awesome!

DN1HWcpRLPWg3LUHaYKjPA.text: I am not a huge breakfast person but when I am out of town I like to fuel up and indulge!   Matt's is the place to do so in downtown Phoenix. This place gets busy so expect a wait, but don't leave, you'll regret it. The menu is rather simple and short but the food is top notch. I had the Hog & Chick which was scrambled eggs, homefries, thick cut bacon, and sourdough bread. The difference between this place and a million other run-of-the mill breakfast places is that Matt's pays attention to the very last detail. The breads, the jellies, the lemonades, ect are all homemade and delicious! The freshness and attention to detail will have me craving their breakfast til the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hog and chick, toast is also included
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh flowers at every table
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Page 1

t_1DMEna04FlQXXR89l1fQ.text: Been eating at Matt's Big Breakfast since they were at their original location a couple blocks away.   Always busy with a line to get in but great places are like that so if you want to eat quickly go to Dennys so I don't have to wait so long.  Everything is made from scratch and fresh. The Waffles are outstanding as are the Griddlecakes.   I am a really  big fan of the Big Butter Burger also. The burger is just plain good and when they bring it to you, you will be happy.  If you can make sure you get some bacon here which is very good.  Service is good and the new location is spacious compared to the original restaurant.  What is nice is that the small feel still transferred to the current location.  Would recommend going there either early in the morning or later prior to closing to minimize your wait.  Can't wait to go back!

jxLJF0YP5azCuVG2o9RL8A.text: Had not been to Matt's in a while. There was no wait. We went around 11 on a weekday and beat the masses.   Got the pesto marinated pork chop and chick. Riquisimo! Over easy egg and hash browns on side with a splash of tapatio made it perfect. Side of sourdough bread with blackberry jam also was delicious. Service, as always, was top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto marinated pork chop and chick. ¡Riquísimo! Over easy egg and hash browns on side with a splash of tapatio made it perfect.

jirRcIJAKrXWRywnjP4pHg.text: I have always loved Matt's Big Breakfast.  The staff is always friendly, and very knowledgeable about specials and the downtown area.  Matt's restaurant is  located in an awesome area, located centrally in downtown Phoenix!  It is adjacent to the Phoenix farmers market and other local restarants.    Due to Matt's popularity, it is extremely busy with limited seating.  However due to the quality of their food and customer service it is well worth the wait in my opinion!  My girlfriend and I were told there would be a wait time of about 25 min.  We went to walk around and when we came back we had already been called.  The waitress in the front told us that it's okay and sat us as the next seats became available.  It's things like that, that seperate mediocre service to superb service and I will always be a customer of Matt's for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 7/19/2014 Belgium waffles and there fantastic bacon!!! Omg delicious!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was the special as of 1/3/2015. Artichoke chicken sausage with spinach, eggs and cheese.  Tasted so amazing, big portions.

S2tVVDldvjx-GTqjcszRTQ.text: You gotta love Matt's -- but, don't you miss the bright, sunny old place (assuming you could get a seat!) as opposed to the concrete-bunker feel of the new place? Plus, while tiny tables made sense in a tiny spot, the tiny 2-tops in the new place give you no room at all.  I had the oatmeal (served just barely lukewarm), their wonderful bacon, and coffee.  Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes, just about the best Bacon ever!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal

QqJrgcHsX1B3ylYtOulCmg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I am usually not the biggest fan of breakfast places, as breakfast is not my favorite meal of the day, BUT this place is my new favorite. You may spend the extra dollar here and there, but the portions are huge and very tasty. I had the omelette and hashbrowns, and honestly, I don't know if my mom could have made them better!  Another nice surprise was their jelly/jam. It was fresh and flavorful-not at all like a Smuckers package!  I'm very glad to say I'm within walking distance because I know I'll be coming back for more. I would say though, the lines are long for a reason! Save yourself some time and call it in to go if you have the chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It looks like a hipsyer breakfast place! Perfect for an place near Roosevelt Row! Not let&#39;s see how good the food is...

S1hsGPgxjQ05cAKp9Tlk_g.text: Came here for breakfast, it was my last day in Phoenix and I wanted to eat at just one more place before I left. The have a daily specials menu for breakfast but you cant mix and match days. I didn't care much since they still another option i wanted. The service is a little slow but I guess that's what happens when the place is packed. The home made jelly was very good but it needed some sugar. I chose not to add any extra sugar since it would just ruin the flavor.

FjLTlFjG903BeyO6m7vLeg.text: *****reader note: i rate based on ambiance and yumminess of food. i never consider service in my rating (no matter how bad or good)******  Typical brunch place. Nothing special really. Come if you want something solid without cooking, but honestly you're better off saving your money and time. Food ain't bad just not worth it.   Food: 3/5 Ambiance: 3/5 Service: 4/5 (not factored in ratings)  Worth it?  Nah fam

300zitZlDbrDy6FvteuArA.text: One of the best breakfast places I've visited.  Everything we had was fresh and tasty.  Service was great.  A bit hipster, but well balanced by smiles and quality eats.

cHEDPddsF06cOynN34budQ.text: Best breakfast I've had, the bacon was absolutely delicious. I really wanted French toast but they didn't have any I guess it's only a certain day. Well we were in town from CA we went to see the Rams & cardinals game. And this was the best food I had on our trip. I would go back for the bacon and pancakes

EUQkthKas1Pa-BtVz3lfUg.text: Matt's has a thoroughly Wonderful Waffle that's flavorful exactly like home cooking ought to be. We loved the Heuvos Rancheros, too - a Special on Mondays.

2BppH75_edAB19l6NOSyoA.text: Ate here once after seeing it on TV and it didn't disappoint. The breakfast was great and plenty of it. The place is small and has a fast paced diner atmosphere. Not fancy but the food is worth it.

eOltr9OEc7oGzWZo_vTyRA.text: What a fantastic place for breakfast. Prompt service, great coffee and good food.   I ordered the Five Spot and my other three family members ordered Thursday's special- Eggs Benedict. Everybody at the table was happy with their food, the waiter was courteous and we had our breakfasts on the table in very short time. We will definitely be coming back.

APVo1ohaO-CeyuRlyp2eBA.text: Breakfast review. Came in when it opened. Waited a while to be served. No gluten free menu options. No fruit options instead of bread, only a sliced tomato. Only dairy options for coffee (no heavy cream). Having a place with cage-free eggs doesn't necessarily make you a healthy option merely conscientious. Probably wouldn't return. I also thought it was slightly overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three egg scramble with chicken sausage and spinach. Coffee was good.

z_zE9pZgniyDw4_Jzt-x6A.text: This is the second time I've been here, and I LOVE it!  The last time was at the old locations, and I like the new location a lot better.  It's bigger and has this hipster-feel to it.  This place would be a huge hit in Seattle or SF!  Whatever you order, get the hash browns.  It tastes like buttery goodness.  I don't know what they put in it, and I don't want to know.  But it tastes like angles flying around your mouth and dropping butter on your taste buds.  Yep, that good!  And cheap too!  Every plate is under $10.  Definitely coming back!

iYb6fjQ8yYP1jCMeuHErpg.text: My wife, my 2 boys and myself were in Downtown Phoenix this weekend and ate at Matt's.  We now have a new favorite. Everything we ordered (Pepper Scamble, Griddlecakes, Waffle, Hog & Chick) was the best we ever had.  This place is like breakfast Heroine.  We are addicted and cannot wait to go back.

e17p3OdNIDYZY04N0Hgacw.text: This place is the only reason I get up at a decent time on the weekends. My boyfriend and I love it! We were going to the downtown location a lot and now we go to Biltmore because it's closer, but downtown always has good service and great food! Love this place so much!

CUiz2bhGjG24khHNOUOhuQ.text: Not sure what I can say that everyone else has not already said:  Their Pork Chop is excellent, I generally get the Waffle (it is very hard to get a good waffle that uses it's own batter versus pancake batter) and sub out the bacon for the Pork Chop (+4.25), their hashbrowns are amazing one of the best ever (per Mrs D) and their homemade strawberry preserves are exceptional  The more simple a dish is, the higher the execution needs to be and the sourcing of the ingredients needs to be, and Matt's does an excellent job of both - They do a great job with a small menu that they can execute at a high level, for American Breakfast food you cannot beat Matt's if you can get there before it is packed

RxWZE8ZywpDH0yzlMHN_YQ.text: Yea, it's okay. A little stuffy in there--lots of tables placed closely together and very loud because of it. I had the 5-Spot. Meh, it was okay. Nothing too exciting. The service took a long time. I was running late so I had my co-workers, whom I was meeting up with, order for me. I arrived 10 minutes after the order had been placed and we still waited another 15 minutes for our food. Very basic. Nothing exciting. I'd go again but only if invited by someone else.

eN-Ql17iTsL0ndgAASnpiA.text: I've heard about this place for so long we had to try it! We got here at 10:30 and waited about 15 minutes, which is not too bad... maybe because it was a weekday? I have practically heard war stories about waiting in this line, so I was pleased.   I had the griddlecakes and they were huge (like, grab a friend to help) and tasty. Real maple syrup, too! Yum! My man-panion had the Big 5 sandwich. The onions gave it a fab flavor. It was an interesting mix of soft bun, crispy onion, salty bacon and eggs.  Our other brunch guest had the special of scrambled eggs, sausage, cheese and peppers. Wonderful mix of flavors, too!   We thought all tasted wonderful and will make a point to come back!

I13h1Fx5vz-zk8RwpbpmJQ.text: Yum, yum, yum, with extra yum!  Oh did mention yum!?  This place rocks!  They are well known for the specials which change daily. So I did the three eggs scrambled with southwest chicken sausage, and fresh jalapeno which was excellent. My wife did the Griddle cakes which was awesome!  They might have been the best cakes I've ever had due to the freshness. We will be eating here all week!  The only knock is the noise levels might get a tad high.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the daily specials  three eggs, chix sausage, and fresh jalapeño.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Griddle cakes!

2uJrzsH3pisFUqTJ6nCPoQ.text: I had the waffle it comes with butter and delectable syrup! Hands down the best one I have ever had! For a Monday morning it was pretty busy and chaotic really made an interesting breakfast! All the employees seemed to work together to serve each table which makes it quick to get in and out. It was a great experience!

usQehuPAjEuBiBDS0q6GKw.text: If you are anywhere in the areas and need breakfast this is the place to go! Great food and fast service. You will not leave hungry!

3cQ5XI2T2keqq5WZb0oWtg.text: With all due respect if you are religious, but on a Sunday morning Matt's Big Breakfast can be even more spiritual than church! This is Phoenix's best breakfast hands down. The pancakes are so light and fluffy it's like someone took the clouds straight out of heaven and onto a griddle. The bacon is thick and satisfying too and the ham steak is just another level of flavor I've never experiences during the day hours.  Portions and prices are spectacular, but now comes the bad part: the wait is worse than vegas' best nightclubs. Just like vegas too, if there's more than two of you, you're not getting in. Best bet is to order over the phone, get it to go, and enjoy this goodness at home where at least nobody else can see you drool.

zoKWXvxan3e1Jd4xQDOB4w.text: The premier close to downtown/ASU breakfast spot in Phoenix. They have one in the B finger of terminal 4 at the airport too, and while good, it's just not the same. Excellent wait staff, yummy food (waffles are great, with just enough flour to hold the butter to-gether!!! and the chilli is a lunch time must have!). Remember they are two blocks north of their old location! Look for the orange umbrellas...

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Even this won&#39;t be left in about 45 seconds...

3f6haRuvt99xcjPer8i1gw.text: Regular old American bacon eggs potatoes breakfast. Like an updated, higher-quality Denny's. High quality ingredients, but definitely not healthy. I couldn't get excited about the menu.

aLMFN5AFqeGhsICkmHTgeQ.text: because of the Guy Fieri review, my husband and I went there for breakfast (duh).  The lauded/drooled upon pork chop on Triple D was dry and very thin.  The breakfast was honestly nothing all that special. I prefer the meal at either Eggstacy or First Watch

MtVHdTTyjJorhPZB1T9q5w.text: 1. Best bacon i have ever had. 2. The sourdough toast and blueberry jam was delicious.  Seems like those two things did it for me, but not necessarily.... I ordered the hog and chick(wanted their french toast special bit french toast and sausage was just not enough of choices). Over medium eggs, 3 pieces of bacon(thick crunchy bacon may i add), hash browns and sourdough toast with jam. Water to drink. Eggs were nothing special but still delish. Hash browns were a little too buttery for my taste but definitely not your average tasting which i definitely enjoyed. Bacon was the best i have ever had as already mentioned, it was seasoned just right and no sogginess, all crispyness. The sourdough toast i could really keep eating. Im not sure if it was the toast or the jam but it was just perfection. Water- no sink water taste. ;-) Overall it was really good. Party of 3 only had to wait 5 minutes at 11am on Tuesday. I guess this is rare but we were fortunate. Service was friendly but did feel rushed at times. But as you see still 5 stars because at the end the food was the star.  Note - coworker had the waffles and said its one of if  not the best they ever tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Has all the main components.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close up my bacon friends.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Glistening crispyness saltiness deliciousness bacon

p6IlB_sHedehghZRhMGGwA.text: This place is so cute and the food and staff are phenomenal. Great prices. They really thought about every aspect of a great breakfast place and then went above that.

XcIS35g6UQTmGeU1ZBbsWQ.text: What can I say about Matts, it's an awesome place. I've been here several times and also took my friends visiting from NYC and they're always spot on with food and service.   It can get crowded at times but never to long a wait.

7GP8OFyiy0u9KGRZsjthdA.text: This place is incredible! I found it on DDD and wanted to give it a shot since Guy Fieri usually hits the mark. I went here for my ASU graduation breakfast with my Mom and boyfriend and we all were beyond satisfied. The waffle is wonderful with a touch of vanilla, the bacon I hear is heart-achingly good, the omelettes are savory and hearty plus the bread and homemade jam is just outrageously good! We went here again today because, why resist?

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros with rosemary home fries and pinto beans.

I14oYeYccCICGUEUwoH56w.text: Everything was delicious especially the fresh squeezed lemonade with honey is on spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Its about to go down!!! Cheese omelette with grilled onions and mushrooms!! Yummo!!!!!

rVMqYrLYLj-QUaxisrEb6w.text: That moment when you wonder who this person is that didn't give this place 5 stars? Perfect, thank you

tOsMKA9V12bDEIpMosifcQ.text: I'm quite impressed.  Very clever business model -- they work extremely efficiently, given what little space they have.  Despite how many people are always in line here, the wait is fairly reasonable.  They have you check-in when you first arrive, and they'll do periodic spot-checks to see who is still here and who just returned from a neighborhood walk.  With that comes wonderful service -- the staff seem genuinely happy to be there.  Service with a smile, really, and they were running about the organized chaos.  I never saw any one staff member stand in one place for more than a few seconds, which is nice because it shows dedication to the business.  I ordered the salami scramble with potatoes and sourdough toast.  I honestly think the best part of my meal was the toast -- crispy on the outside and soft in the center, serviced with some delicious strawberry jam (but it was fresh and tangy and flavorful!).  I think I would have been crazier about the jam, but I'm weird and not huge on jam.  I wish they had the option of butter instead.  Anyway, the salami was almost too rich for me, but it paired well with the eggs, which were nice and fluffy.  I also enjoyed the potatoes, though I thought they were a bit heavy on the rosemary, which actually surprises me because I like my food heavily seasoned.  I had a bit of my fiance's chicken artichoke sausage, which was part of the special, and that was divine.  The orange juice tasted like an orange in a glass.    A little pricey, but considering the quality of the ingredients you get (organic and local), I understand the markup.    Personally, the atmosphere isn't for me -- it's loud and clanky, but that's just my preference.  Doesn't mean it's not a good restaurant or business.  I just like it when I can have a conversation without raising my voice.  Great place, though!  Definitely a place worth checking out.

wXRQOtS4jLsQp6u7qvzdKg.text: I loved Matts! We went around 7:30am and there was no wait, it was full but tables for two available! Short and to the point menu but still hard to choose because everything sounds great. I had a ham and cheese omelet with hash browns and toast with marvelous jam. Mom had the breakfast sandwich which she loved, the bacon!! Cant wait to go again, even if we live in east Mesa!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham, Mushroom and Cheese Omelet!! Hash browns delish!

g1qOcXA45BCIBLZA0CEfZQ.text: Happiest place in Phoenix! Awesome experience all around. The Hot Spot Breakfast sandwich was delish! The place was extremely clean to include the restrooms. The food came out hot, fresh and fast. The vibe in this place is so cool, everyone is smiling and genuinely happy. I asked one of the staff members what was the secret to everyone's super happy demeanor, she told me that everyone really enjoys working here, the management is supportive and you pretty much have to know someone to get a job here which gives it that tight knit family environment. Wish this place was closer to home I would come here everyday just for a dose of happy

1o08PRxngT0i5v7zhnTcCw.text: I went with my friend on a Saturday morning between 730-8am upon her recommendation of amazing pancakes. She ordered Pancakes and My order was for The Hog & Chick breakfast, that came with 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, 2 slices of bread and potatoes with herb. Bacon slices were nice and thick and pancakes tasted great as well. Looking at their menu, there is not much of it. Breakfast from the looks, was pretty mediocre. Their homemade Blueberry jelly was amazing, right amount of sweet and tasted very light. In my opinion, the prices are high for the amount of food. Service was great, couple servers passed by, always filling our coffee and water. The server did not spend much time in asking if we had any questions but were quick with their services. Food came pretty fast as well. No problem there. The high stools were little uncomfortable to sit with trying to park the legs somewhere. It is a noisy place and i had a hard time understanding my friend until we started talking loud to make up for the noise. I saw the reviews of this place, i did not encounter any service issues. It is not a bad place, i would definitely go back but i will not go out my way to go back there.

d_NwyvrFAecCIJsRyHVXHw.text: As someone who has worked in customer service oriented businesses since my first job, I find this as one of the top things when rating all business establishments. From the first minute I walked in, there wasn't a glimpse of good customer service in the place.  The first woman greeted us and asked us to come to her host stand. We said we wanted a table and she told us to write our names down. Already slightly annoying that she asked us to do her job. She told us the wait was 30-45min and that the bar was first come first serve. Since we noticed 3 open seats at the bar, we walked up and got ready to sit down. A man that worked there walked up and said "you need to put your name on the list." I mentioned that we had done that already and that the woman up front had mentioned that the bar was open seating. Very rudely he yelled, "NO SHE DIDN'T!" and then pointed to the host stand. You were not there when she told us it was open seating, so do not tell me what she said. Yes, she may have made a mistake, but that isn't my fault. There are much nicer ways to talk to your customers.  This wasn't even the part that made us want to leave. We continued to wait because of the excellent reputation this place has. We waited, we waited, we waited. An hour goes by and we've seen people who came in after us continue to get seated. So I approached the hostess again and mentioned that we had been waiting for over an hour and that others had been seated before us. She picks up her list and says "well, there's still 20 people in front of you" and shows me a completely different and new page of names that wasn't there before. I mentioned to her that list wasn't there before and showed her where our name was written. She informed us that we had "created our own new sheet" while they still had one they were adding names to and that we put our name in the wrong place. Well, maybe you should have done your job in the first place and written our name down for us. Not only that, even though she knew that we had been there for that long, she didn't offer to rectify the misunderstanding and seat us sooner. I will forever not eat at this place and I urge, nay, I warn you not to eat here either.

njB2CV8Dvgz1n2RRUCuzgA.text: Stopped in while traveling for work. On the downside, the atmosphere isn't great/comfortable, but the staff are friendly and the Monday breakfast special was delicious. If I were in the area again I would stop in, but wouldn't go out of my way for it

aSy49h-Q_Vty1uU1KF87vg.text: Even though they have moved to a bigger building... Like literally down the street, the wait is still long. Hence why I give them 4 stars.   When it comes to ordering food though, I go for the special when they do their scramble. It's my fav! It'll usually be some kind of meat and cheese scramble that comes with your choice of potato (hash brown or home fries) and a tortilla. Their strawberry honey lemonade is delicious as well!!!

KJ3a9X5COnM2YVULj4OsOg.text: I'm not sure what Moar O. is talking about. Their waffle is NOT standard stuff you could get at any hotel. I had two friends visit me from out of town, so I took them here. They loved the waffle and bacon so much that they insisted we come back again two days later. What I like to do is go here with someone who likes to share. One person orders the special for the day (usually an omelet of some sort with side of home fries) and I order the waffle and bacon and we split them both. Otherwise, if you eat the waffle by yourself, you will die (or just feel really sick because of all the butter and syrupy deliciousness).  Also, servers and other staff are always VERY friendly. Waiting is a drag, but it's to be expected so you just deal with it.

Ty7Jrf-xO1EolRktUq3DLA.text: I honestly don't understand the hype for this place. It's just breakfast, nothing special.

Z38CHVhTOmjgFnbJrFurlA.text: * There will be a wait. * It will be crowded. * It will be loud. * The food will be worth it.  I came here on my birthday. On my wedding day. On the first day of the year. Whenever I have a friend in town. Whenever I wake up early. Whenever I'm hungover. Whenever anyone mentions breakfast... There's just never a wrong time to eat the most perfect waffle ever created.

Bb2TbjXDTo8A82am41-5Zw.text: This is the best place to eat ever! I love their home cooked potatoes. I go there at least once a week. Staff is friendly and the price is right too.

Hkgumra_JNEdDzWend7TcA.text: When in Phoenix, this is THE place to go!  The hot cakes? AMAZING! Soft and fluffy and heavenly and sooo good!!! everything was good, even the maple syrup. I also ordered the lemonade...just as good! it was made with real honey not sugar. Forget any of those breakfast chains, dont even think about it just get yourself to Matt's!  Do expect a wait, likely and hour in the morning, though if you come in later (got there closer to noon on a week day) the wait is much less and the ambiance less hectic also. The decor is cute and everyone was very friendly. It's a must for sure!

jo69F4bVUWc_G0Z-ACnF8Q.text: The menu is extremely limited and the service here was HORRIBLE! The workers weren't too friendly, except for two of the guys that worked there. The portions were decent sizes but the food definitely wasn't worth the price. At the end we split the bill and when we told the girl that she had split the bill wrong she started to argue with us so we just decided to pay the incorrect total and leave. We are definitely NEVER going back there.

T_ul6QEHI3mmyJQCRKvtLw.text: Got off the airplane, did a quick Yelp search for breakfast and found Matt's. What a great find- this place is legit! The food is high quality and tasty. I had the Classic Eggs Benedict special- my favorite breakfast dish, and it was perfection. My companions had the breakfast sandwich and the Skinny. They enjoyed theirs just as much as me. I can't understand how this place could be rated less than 5 stars. Don't be a hater because you have to wait 25 minutes for a seat- it is worth it! I will also say it is clean and has good service.

4HhxprietXbSUJhUp0Cb5Q.text: Noisy.  Limited menu.  Controlled chaotic restaurant environment.  Took forever to get a table, so we left.  Went to the Breakfast Club in Scottsdale.  Nice location, seating outdoors, and food that rivals Matt's.  No longer have any reason or desire to go back to Matt's.

TeQZNhVLdh1bVNsVGYi5hA.text: After an early/long drive from Anaheim to Phoenix, my wife and I desperately searched Yelp for a great breakfast place. Thankfully, Matt's jumped to the top of the search and we headed to the restaurant.   We were greeted by some friendly faces and quickly grabbed a couple spots at the bar facing the window. We were waited on VERY quickly and we both tried the Strawberry Honey Lemonade. That truly hit the spot after getting hit in the face with 115 degree weather.  My wife ordered the special, Eggs Benedict and I had the Salami and Eggs scramble. The food came out REAL fast and boy am I glad it did. Everything had that "home cooked" taste. The salami and eggs had that salty deliciousness you'd expect from a dish like that. The hash browns were extra crispy with the right amount of seasoning. What I'm still craving (12 hours later) is the fresh baked sourdough bread with the homemade strawberry jam! I could eat a loaf of that and be one happy (and fat) Yelper.   My wife's Eggs Benedict was also incredibly well put together and tasty. The English muffins were thick and crispy and the Canadian bacon was generously cut.   Next time we're in Phoenix, we definitely want to try out the lunch options. Great work!!!

BJnUJ1XKZpRxAm7dXIUgGA.text: Not my favorite.... if you come on a weekend, prepare to wait! The food is okay... but the orange juice is phenomenal

0ZdYZn9Vl7eskRO6MWNtMQ.text: I'm not sure I really understand the hype around MBB. I guess if you love traditional fare, it's the place for you, but I can make most of their dishes at home, for half the price and none of the long wait.

k1fkxE7_fuqb53SKktT13g.text: Had the bourbon cherry sausage with rosemary potatoes and eggs and it was unreal good! Service was friendly, prompt, and the waiters had  good personality.   If you're a jam lover the strawberry is well worth the price to pick one up.

rridhoXKt9n_OhQl9zeSQg.text: Newer, bigger, modern and just slightly up the road location. Same wonderful food. Matt's Big Breakfast may have lost it's dive-status, but it's still a great place to eat.  The menu, like the restaurant, remains simple and small. But all the offerings are delicious and plentiful. I decided just to go with the griddlecakes. I was left happily stuffed for hours.  Even with a few more tables than at the old location, I'm willing to bet that there's still a big line on weekends, but at 7:30am on a Tuesday, the restaurant was practically empty. If you're around downtown Phoenix during the early morning hours, why not stop in a Matt's Big Breakfast?

5VgOqc68jZ8ewIIgqAi0kw.text: I couldn't think of one thing wrong with this place or  with the service. It was my first time here and I actually had my puppy with me. The employees were so friendly. I got the blt and I was so impressed. The bacon is absolutely amazing. I gave this place five stars because I honestly didn't have any problems at all. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a nice environment and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT

G7u9J0NjqcKjL_AE-3qE3w.text: Matt's is my favorite breakfast spot. The food is amazing and you can taste the farm fresh ingredients. The only downside is that Matt's is extremely popular so plan on at least a 45 min wait during the weekend.

wOQKGLeUjMzDrM-cdZnTmQ.text: Matt's has been a favorite of mine for years! The food is good home style cooking that is served in big, hearty portions. The fresh baked bread and house jam are amazing together! The only downside to this place is the wait - come in on a Saturday or Sunday morning and expect to wait for at least 30 minutes. It's worth it but brutal in the summer if you have to wait outside.

vUernBucP0arB1xYvPfn_w.text: So here is a crazy, slightly relevant way to describe Matt's Big Breakfast.  Matt's is one of the places you are almost obliged to like, because if you don't, you look like a total, unsophisticated schmuck.  No one talks shit about this Phoenix icon!  To speak one bad word of Matt's is like cursing the Virgin Mary.  But here is the thing, all the genuine, honest compliments you can heap onto Matt's is well deserved.  It's like the cool kid in school is well liked for legitimate reasons, not just because he/she is popular.    Meal: The fiance does a great job of always getting something new here.  Typically its a vegetarian omelet.  I typically get the slinger (shhhssssshhhh, secrete menu item!) and whatever special lemonade is available.  Taste:  Every bite is pure heaven.  The homemade jams are special and remind me of home in the midwest.  The ingredients are fresh.  The homemade bread is spectacular.  The meals are amazing.  I feel like its a safe bet in saying that Matt's is the best place to get breakfast in Phoenix.  10 out of 10.  Value:  You aren't going to get a steal here, but then again, this isn't Home Country Buffet.  The portions are above equivalent to Denny's and the prices are about the same.  Because of the great taste and freshness, the value is above average.  4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  This place is busy.  There are always lines, but they are efficient and quick.  The waiters and waitresses are always pleasant.  The are knowledgeable and the seem genuinely excited about the food they serve.  They sometimes lack attentiveness, but it doesn't come off as being inept.  8 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  Matt's fits the the downtown scene.  And Matt's is the type of place where the things on the wall don't distract from the food.  The crowd is very diverse and the dining area is kind of loud, but kind of perfect.  5 out of 5.  Overall:  If heart disease didn't run in my family, I would eat here way more often.  Believe the hype, Matt's is the place to be! 27 out of 30 points, 5 out of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili ... Hash browns ... Sausage ... Cheese ... Bacon .... Two eggs over easy ... Washed down with a strawberry honey lemonade

NDiGA1Z0x-5V8uwIZhM8ag.text: Amazing food and atmosphere. Best breakfast in PHX

b2UK3lNfyh_sOK6Jtqdg9w.text: The food was just okay for me. Nothing special. I had the waffle. The real problem I had was with the lack of respect this place has. During peak hours they rush you in and out. They practically delivered the check with the food! We couldn't even enjoy ourselves because we were being rushed at every point in the service.

7-OkVGHfs1zZ1RdWA-Kbdg.text: We have been here a few time, really hard getting in, expect a line because its that good.  I have had their  Chop-N-Chick; eggs and pesto pork chop, let me tell you, that is one dish you need to try. I tried it because it was on Triple D, Guy would never send us down the wrong path. It is a bit pricey, but the food is worth it.   Homemade jam. I understand that everything is all fresh, they don't even have a freezer, shipped fresh and organic every morning. 4 stars instead of 5 is for the gluten free options. When we are in the area in the morning, we will be back for our breakfast fix.

f0CmuU8G6w72PpbIOYn-Lw.text: Truthfully, I just don't get the obsession with Matt's. While the food is good, it is just basic breakfast food. Meanwhile, there are always ridiculous wait times?? Another Yelper cited Matt's as "[The] best American breakfast joint in AZ"--I've been here a few times and each experience is lack-luster. Maybe I'm ordering the wrong dishes?? I usually order eggs; any recommendations fellow Yelpers? What am I missing? Ha! Further, I preferred their old, tiny location, which gave them more charm than their new, darker location. Neverthless, it's not that Matt's has bad food nor does it have bad service, it's just not wow-ing me.

t6Wa5DlByTp0yl-nIU9UyQ.text: The menu is short and simple, but you will find that the food is anything but. Everything is organic and natural, which I'll admit does not mean much to me, but the TASTE is what matters. You have large servings, juicy and grass fed meat, cheesy filling eggs, and Friendly staff!

3GX5qjdqvxIH8EgbJ3ONiw.text: Service was Good got in pretty fast  .. Got Hog and Chick   Eggs were good  Bacon wasn't my favorite wanted it way crisp  and wasn't  and potatoes  were my least favorite seems like they were cooked ahead of time  and they were just BLAGH     and im a big time potato girl ..   toast was good Jam was good little runny    over all was ok  i might go back one more time  and try different choice  but  not sure when . for all the reviews i read  i dont think it should get more than 3  but that's just my experience..PS  i did think prices were some what high for the quality of the food   but thats just me

xQhQBUyXnQw1fVJUI5VODg.text: This place is an institution in downtown Phoenix! And for good reason - great food cooked just the way you want it and lots of it. Every time I am downtown I want to eat here.

S1FYNnUkCTZjX34dSWQdlA.text: I was skeptical but decided to try this restaurant upon hearing all the talk or hype.  My son was visiting and thinking he would order pancakes since he loves them. Well he ordered the skinny and not any pancakes. We had a short wait around 11:20 AM on a Friday cause this place stays busy.  First thing ordered was coffee and it was mediocre which was not good because now that set the tone for the meals. Our meals came out hot and delicious. As was said in a review, the menu is not big but the options on the menu are done well. Staff is great and menu is priced right. Oh and those Rosemary potatoes just fabulous.

wvkTIL4R-wrUM7yk885DqQ.text: Not a fan but the service was good. Nothing wrong with the food it's mediocre and overpriced

0-5KVCBwwkURyVklr75ewA.text: Went for brunch with some friends. Had the griddle cakes and hash browns which were so good! I am definitely ordering the honey lemonade next time. The only downside to the place was the noise.

H_f4RnEMTvH3CqFXDSX-bg.text: This place deserves a 4.5 star rating.  The half point deduction comes from the limited parking and the really, really long wait if you don't arrive early. We went on a weekend. If it is your first time, maybe decide to go on a weekday instead.   I have the say the hour wait was worth it! They have great daily specials chalked on their blackboard in the back and good coffee. I understand where the BIG part comes in when you see the dishes. I ordered a waffle with a side of bacon and hash browns. Hash brown was delicious.  The bacon is the good kind! They were thick, succulent slices, not overly thin and burnt to a crisp stuff. By sampling a bit from everyone else's plate, I got to say everything was top notch.  Hopefully, I will return for a second  helping!

PSlhw_aDimnrXzv6Lu8kRg.text: Well I was underwhelmed! However the toast, and the strawberry preserves are the best I have ever had. It was good but the wait was long. I was a little disappointed because I was expecting more with all the hoopla surrounding matts. To be completely fair if there was not as much hoopla surrounding matts I'd rate it higher. it is an above average breakfast spot.

1XjRc0M4Cq_gAHonAKUzuA.text: If you don't have to wait to get in it's very good. Nice, medium size menu for breakfast that gets it all done in a great way. Quality all the way around.

ZIHJgS4pi3cr2sduVBiJOg.text: Simply put, my favorite breakfast in Phoenix.  No other breakfast joint can match the deliciousness that is Matt's Big Breakfast.  The waffle is still my go-to meal, as it is the right amount of fluffiness.  Plus it comes with bacon!  And the bacon here is amazing... thick, peppery, and cooked just right.  I have a hard time ordering bacon at any other restaurant as it simply does not compare with Matt's.  The daily special usually consists of an egg scramble and a side of potatoes and is wonderful as well.  The food here cannot be beat.  Now that they've moved to a larger location, too, going to eat is more reasonable.  The wait can still be long during peak hours, but it's not nearly as bad as it once was.  The restaurant still maintains its character even with a new home.  If I had to pick one restaurant to take a friend for breakfast, this would be it.  Breakfast at its finest.

xVIZqoaVx63GOJNVMASWNw.text: By far the worst experience of my life.  Not only did we wait forever to get seated but the food and service was horrible. The noise level was loud it was hard to have a conversation with the people in my party.  The waitress got my order all wrong.  We did not get our food at the same time.  My omelet was over cooked my daughter's waffle was undercooked.  I had high expectations based on previous reviews. Definitely not worth the wait.  Highly overrated....

9kD3Kr420yjm_rH2k9eDDA.text: Fast and friendly service. Food is amazing and Fresh. I like going out of my comfort zone and ordering the special. I've never been disapointed and I can't wait to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh OJ, Amazing Pancakes, and I Recommend the Daily Special.

mPncx9zaFxU0LJLbEk3Dsw.text: I consider myself a huge breakfast person so I have tried many different places here in Arizona. Matt's Big Breakfast is still one of my favorite. The wait is kind of long but definitely worth it. If you're going for the first time I recommend ordering their waffle. Everything down to the taste of the butter is amazing!

ryt09HqikK_U9-1Bwa8p2w.text: I can only give this two stars at the airport I love Matts in downtown  But this one lacks the good food and is in jeopardy of being typical vs special  Ordered the bourbon chicken and it was bone dry and tough to cut  Wait staff didn't seem to care  Coleslaw wasn't the same no flavor which they tried to compensate for with pepper I rather walk down to cowboy ciao which is another speciality that so far is holding up to standards

svcZY_SKTxeSPIunKZIIKg.text: If cost isn't an issue then Matt's big breakfast is a good spot to check out. The Biscuits and gravy were very good except for that mint garnish they put on the potatoes mixed with the gravy and the aftertaste wasn't too good lol. But over all I think it was a fun experience, good food, friendly staff, but save up it's costly.

b8egW-ynJ_DGI1NK5Cu-1Q.text: I only had 36 hours in Phoenix, and wanted to make sure I had the "Only in Phoenix" meals.  Everyone told me to go to Matt's (the bartender at Barrio cafe, the concierge, the Uber drivers).  But really, can't you get eggs and bacon anywhere?  I'm from Northern California, and organic is everywhere so I didn't feel this was that special.  But Monday morning, I woke up at 6 am and was starving by the time my lecture was over, and figured Matt's was the closest.  I headed over there and had the best meal in Phoenix.  I had the Monday Special, which was Huevos Rancheros.  Can eggs, tortillas and cheese melt in your mouth?  First time it did for me.  Also, I could just eat their strawberry preserves for breakfast.  Next time, I'm bringing ice packs to bring that jam on the plane!

EmS4kQThvFph5ZHRhmHMUA.text: I haven't eaten there yet and after reading all the reviews it made this fat boy hungry. I'm heading there when I get in town on June 30, 2016!!!!

ElHUyH4tNWZykOIcv88q4g.text: Great food! Long lines but very worth the wait. As seen on TV and not disappointing.

uEg8x8sy1g3GYAa7S3R7Kg.text: New location is cleaner and has more seating.  But of course still a wait no matter when you try and go.  Waited 40 minutes for table for 2.  People always polite and food of course is fresh and worth the wait.  I'll be back and stand outside for a good breakfast,  if people wait weeks for a new phone or concert tickets,  there will always be people willing to wait up to an hour or so for a fresh good meal.  Prices are right average $5-$15.  Where $5 is a bowl of cereal and $15 is steak and eggs.  Note they do not serve alcohol and while the rear parking is free,  it is limited.  Also phoenix meter parking now charges on weekends.  There is an older grey haired lady riding around with a bad attitude and always unforgiving...

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs with fresh orange juice.  Sour dough bread and fresh strawberry jelly.

HOncGg1VDvVsmW4Rvgn0VA.text: The rental car agency recommended Matt's when we arrived in Phoenix on  Monday morning. She said it's best place in town and normally there are long lines on the weekend so we be good time to go. When we drove up there were people waiting outside, which confirmed the fact that it obviously was well loved. After waiting a short time we were seated. It's a relatively small space but atmosphere and wait staff was great. There is a relatively small menu but everything look and smelled great. Ample servings size, quick service and very helpful and friendly wait staff. I had the chorizo and jalapeno pepper omelette with toast and my wife had the breakfast sandwich. Everything was great and the toast with homemade preserves and butter was amazing.

EFqiOcR1F6HrfnOjjCDyig.text: I dont cook so eating here just grabbing something simple but when i ate it it was better than i expected

tlfEagDnJFLzzl76chrYQg.text: Great spot. The food is amazing and the wait is absolutely worth it. My biggest recommendation would be to ensure that you have about 1-2 hours before going because you may have to wait 45 minutes to get in. However, if you enjoy breakfast, you will leave here happy.

J30ZoYt7I43BDhwW2BGJSQ.text: Great pancakes fresh beacon , and really good coffee !! They even gave us refills to go in to go cups !! Super sweet of them !! The black cherry homemade sausage was amazing and I'm not much of a sausage person but I loved it !! Only reason not 5 stars is because the wait can be crazy !!

2dT049QcEW4obLk2m2auJg.text: Exceptional customer service, the waitress was very friendly and helpful. Delicious food!!!! All of the ingredients used are natural and of quality. They buy from local suppliers when possible. I had the Griddle Cakes, to die for! Especially when they have me handmade strawberry jam. I definitely suggest these if you love pancakes. I wish their floors would have been cleaner, but I can only imagine how hard it is to maintain them when they are extremely busy. Definitely check it out! My friends from out of town truly enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ed2mAPq8sZx9LKet6EfLBQ.text: Go early to avoid the wait. Excellent food and excellent service! Best organic apple juice. And fresh delicious food. Server Miranda is the best.

b6-9sBirZdDFot33xMZhcA.text: School teacher with a summer vacay mission: eat breakfast at every joint in town that you can't normally go to without waiting in a weekend line!    Matt's was at the top of the list!  Five stars for the buttery delicious waffle - a little crisp on the outside, a soft and tender inside and the BEST bacon in town. 2 stars for the chop and chick, eggs and skinny over-cooked pork chop with the wimpy soft breakfast potatoes. I'll round up to 4 for the ROCC bottomless coffee and the nice counter waitress. (BTW, do all restaurants just top off the creamer containers from other tables and give them to someone else? Maybe that's standard but it kind of freaked me out.  Maybe it's better for me to just not know!)

hGkfZrh23LmTL1hVYvFjbA.text: Wowzer...seriously...Matt's Big Breakfast is the real deal!  Things to expect:  *You will wait no matter what time you go BUT the line moves fast.  *Their bacon is re-donk-u-lous! Seasoned with black pepper...oh man.  *Eggs are organic and cage-free, score!  *Go with Hog & Chick to get the best of both.  *Strawberry jam is home made and I could just drink it like a fruit drink...so good.  *Friendly service...mostly young kids who are going to school nearby. ASU.  *Inexpensive for the amount of food you get.  *Bread taste's like it's made in house...yummy.  *Coffee isn't life changing but it will do a good job of waking your butt up. *Check out their daily specials it happened to be the one my wife picked and it was delicious!

VxVnQNNOplaUCBgwWpCIbQ.text: My first and last time!   Nothing in my order was correct but it was so busy that it would have taken so long to get it corrected.  My server was unapologetic, so that I think, made it worse. Never going back. Was really expecting much more.

bpBsAbKrT4QhDl7yOYS3Ug.text: Breakfast surpassed my expectations. Service was good, food came pretty fast,  and was so delicious! We were in town visiting from California, and randomly picked on yelp due to it being conveniently  close by. Let me tell you, potatoes (cooked to perfection with rosemary) are so tasty, eggs fluffy, and the homemade jelly is Y-U-M. We had a slight issue and was remedied immediately by the manager. Awesome customer service- two thumbs up!

3emT88IJpKkNxICAr4R_tQ.text: Never should have waited so long to finally experience Matt's Big Breakfast!!  My daughter is a flight attendant and was laying over in downtown Phoenix so I suggested we go to breakfast up the street from her hotel at Matt's. Waited outside about 15 minutes on a very busy Sunday.  As we entered the noise was extremely loud so conversation was not going to be the highlight of our meal.  But the food was so good we didn't need to talk, just enjoy the meal!  My daughter said the coffee was excellent and the OJ terrific.  I had the honey strawberry lemonade it is was refreshing.  We both ordered exactly the same breakfast, the hog and chick (bacon and eggs with home fries).  Dish was served with sour dough bread and fresh strawberry preserves, delicious!!  Our eggs were cooked perfectly, sunny side up.  The potatoes were to die for.  Tasty chunks of potatoes with fresh rosemary and onion, these are a must try if you eat here!  But the thick cut bacon was my favorite of all!!  Thick slices smothered in pepper and cooked perfectly, not burnt nor overly crispy, just enough where the bacon was fully cooked yet tender.
