It was a bacon delight.  I'll be back without a doubt, still want to try the waffle with real maple syrup and more!  Great breakfast, thank's Matt's!!

bk8SDqS1aa7wZGJuXfFwuA.text: Got here around 11:45 on a Saturday morning. You put your name on a list but they don't quote wait times. It ended up taking about 20 minutes.  We ordered a 5 spot, a chop and chick, and a hog and chick. Food came really fast, within 10 minutes. The bacon is some of the best bacon I have ever had. It is thick and has great flavor. The hash browns might have been the best thing on the plate. Buttery and just enough salt. The sourdough bread was soft and sour and with some of the jam it was the perfect bite.  From being seated to leaving it only took like 30 minutes. It's fast and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop and chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 5 spot
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LD_pWBaE2Y0-btqy5AGvlQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast truly lives up to the hype. Friendly staff even when the place is Uber busy. The host is amazing, food was great and don't expect jam from a little plastic tub their stuff is awesome. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s Big Breakfast

TXwzugmROGmiwqBAgQL1Tg.text: During my Spring Training trip in Arizona, my friends & I wanted to look for a good place to either get breakfast or brunch in the morning.  We found Matt's Big Breakfast on Yelp; and with over 550+ reviews with an average of 4-stars, we decided that this was the place to try out.  We came here on a Friday at 11am on 3/27/15 during Spring Training.  We thought that if we arrived after the breakfast hour and before the lunch hour, we could beat the crowd.  We were wrong!  This place was ultra crowded!  We put our name down and still waited 30+ minutes for a party of 3.  The good thing is that while we waited for a table, we had plenty of time to check out their menu and their specials, so we were able to order once we were seated.  They even provide you with water outside their restaurant while you wait.  As for the food.., it was very delicious!  They use real maple syrup, their strawberry jam has actual strawberries in them, their bacon was crispy and NOT greasy!  Their quality was fantastic, their prices was low, and the quantity was very good.  Other than the long wait for a table, I loved everything about this restaurant.  I will definitely dine here again the next time I'm in Phoenix!

h45U7mFUZuW2W7sIGzFxQg.text: So I walk up to this place and the surrounding area actually almost made me turn away. Then I walk in and it's really nice. I was greeted right away. Servers are great. I have to say the Manager seemed to not be very helpful as I was brought the wrong food TWICE and when he brought me what I actually ordered he said "sorry she messed up when she put it in" I'm pretty sure that wasn't the case but even if it was for a manager to place blame on his servers I felt was wrong especially since he brought me the wrong food the second time! Other than that the food was good can't really mess up eggs. I would prefer two slices of thin toast then one thick piece but that's just me.

1ZdJUFtDJ2Rv_LXoyZsGZA.text: When in downtown Phoenix, this is a "must stop"!  A short wait, excellent service and a tasty breakfast served until 2:30 pm. The pork and apple sausage had a great snap to it. The hash browns were crispy, buttery, and had a hint of sweetness. Definitely, put Matt's on your list.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6Fdwos3YpBjO9lUzG50vlg.text: Salami scramble--that is all.   (Chicken sausage is just OK... don't go healthy here--get the bacon.) Rosemary home fries are crispy and made with so much butter it hurts (in a good way).  Sourdough bread is thick cut and buttered served with amazing homemade strawberry preserves. I seriously could have this for breakfast everyday.  So sad we don't live in AZ... this place is totally worth the hype.

30H5ovcAWy67-U4MDSuk8w.text: The service was quick and excellent. I ordered the ham breakfast sandwich thing but was surprised that it wasn't an actual sandwich. They give you the bread on the side and you basically have to assemble the sandwich yourself which is impossible because the ham is HUGE! Not complaining because it lives up to its name, it's a damn big breakfast! I enjoyed the choice of sourdough, white or wheat bread which i chose wheat. Their honey lemonade is to die for !!! The eggs were eggs, I mean who can mess that up?! The hashbrowns however were terrible. Something off about the taste and they were incredibly soggy on the bottom! There's crazy road construction outside of this location so it's hard to hard and navigate to get to it. Their griddle cakes are amazing, good flavor to them and they are huge and fluffy ! Couldn't eat but just a bite

gVZBDOZtV445nfECwH73ug.text: This place is insanely overrated. Walking in, the place was dirty, and people were running everywhere yet we couldn't get a seat until a waiter yelled at us from across the room to grab a seat in the corner right next to the bathrooms where people kept coming in and out. Being next to the bathroom probably ruined the experience because of the smell. Why even have tables there??   I ordered the skinny with potatoes. It was nothing special whatsoever. The eggs were super greasy and had my stomach churning. The potatoes were also way overcooked, and the rosemary tasted like ornamental, not cooking rosemary.   For the price there is no way I'll be back, but Matt's get's 2 stars and not one because my friend liked his waffle

dBDH8Jibn7pCqNxXU_ER3g.text: One of the best breakfast places in all of Phoenix.  If you don't mind the wait it is totally worth it. Delicious every single time!

E4-l0CHTL4H20HA1PbvV2Q.text: Excellent little breakfast place. A great local hangout but come early to beat the crowd. Service is quick and polite w many friendly faces.   Breakfast menu is all natural ingredients. Haven't tried the lunch menu yet but it all looks good.  You will definitely feel full when leaving!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salami scramble w home fries and griddle cakes. Bothe delish!!

a6XaUpO7EdtzFr_Vw-nW7Q.text: Good hearty breakfast accompanied by superior service. Omelet delish and hash browns crispy.  Nice jam with the toast. Very good service and attentiveness. Thank you all beautiful. Will return.

enz1IXRd3p3RX0GGS3Y-dQ.text: The food is incredible. Most servers were nice but I'm rating a 3 because our server was soooo rude and grumpy.

BJXzQDF5d4U84JRAw5l9pQ.text: Matt's was awesome. Both the food and service was perfect. I'll definitely be back On my next trip to Phoenix. You'll be very happy you chose Matt's Big breakfast.

ESVwi1GmYZwkazdqWZmIXQ.text: While the coffee here is among the few favourites I have, I do however have to say that the enclosed environment and small tables give the restaurant a clostrophobic feel. The sound within the restaurant is amplified due to the small area, and metallic objects making the restaurant an even harder environment to converse in. During my five visits to this restaurant, I've had to more or less yell to speak to the person sitting directly across from me which, isn't ideal. The food is okay, here it's not absolutely amazing but neither is it bad. So while I enjoy their coffee, I myself am just unable to deal with the loudness of the restaurant so therefore, I shall not be returning here anytime soon.

xpDbbt2_V_h0rMJXIg83Yg.text: I ordered the "Five Spot" breakfast sandwich and orange juice.  The sandwich was good, nothing spectacular but good quality food.  Fresh squeezed orange juice was good.  Nothing memorable but I would come back for the good quality ingredients, if in the area.  The place is very loud with everyone doing their own thing.  There is a little bit of a line on Saturday mornings but the wait didn't seem to be too long for most people, maybe 15 minutes.

FfGWlaxjHgT--0Ajrbqz-Q.text: Matts big breakfast was everything it was cracked up to be the wait  was minimal but I would have  waited longer. If needed as a very hip place right off a downtown right now heart of everything I really enjoy the scenery and the service there was top-notch a fantastic place I cannot wait to go back and spend more time which will be soon

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s big breakfast

ZTmoQLri6eCA8zDsYGw4Mg.text: Matt's Big Breakfast was featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-ins & Drives! And this meant that even though it was a 45 minute wait for brunch, we were going to wait and stick it out. This isn't really related to the food or service but they have a really fantastic mural on the side of their wall. A cute photo op for sure! Anyways, they have a pretty small menu and it's very straightforward. All their lemonades are made with honey too instead of sugar which is an interesting change. We ordered their Honey Strawberry Lemonade and weren't quite sure if we liked it or not. Maybe lemonade is just meant to be made with sugar!  We ordered The Five Spot with House Potatoes (breakfast sandwich with 2 eggs, 2 slices of thick-cut bacon, American cheese, grilled onions) and The Chop & Chick with Hash Browns (2 eggs, skillet-seared Iowa pork rib chop). Now, Guy Fieri actually said on Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate that his breakfast of choice is The Chop & Chick. It didn't look too impressive when it came out and it didn't taste all that impressive neither so I have no idea what Guy Fieri is talking about. The pork chop honestly was thin, dry, and pretty flavorless. We didn't like it at all as far as pork chops go. I wouldn't order this or recommend this dish ever. My Five Spot was a little better but it wasn't anything that I could't make at home. Nothing special at all. Just your average breakfast sandwich you can get anywhere. The one thing that really made Matt's stand out was their potatoes. It was seasoned to perfection with herbs and aromatics which made the potatoes the best part of our breakfast. Also the toast and preserves that came with The Chop & Chick. That was also delicious.   Honestly, I wouldn't really recommend Matt's Big Breakfast. It wasn't worth the wait at all and I didn't understand the hype. I don't even understand why it's called Big Breakfast when the portion size was average at best. If I had to dine here again, I would just order their house potatoes with some toast. At least then I wouldn't walk out feeling like I spent too much on some mediocre food. 3/5

xYI3TAnN7yDYb6ubnwN2rw.text: This is the perfect spot to get a great breakfast. There's usually a good wait included here. The food is great. The pancakes are big, the eggs are on point, as are the hash browns. The sausage and bacon is good too. I love their honey lemonades. I will try and make this my breakfast spot every time I'm in Phoenix.

AwTcdEz5aIBiPYnN1sRjRQ.text: Ordered a Bloody Mary at the airport. It had a meal with it! (Bacon, cheese, olives, pickles) Tasted great. However, was treated rather rudely by the waitress when trying to engage her to ask if I were to order a second, if they had one without all the food. Not impressed.

ibL3_ysI0FGPZ4RwNh-B9A.text: I have been wanting to try this place because of the breakfast! I ordered a waffle with bacon the waffle was phenomenal but the bacon was burnt. My boyfriend ordered the house potatoes and as much as it looked appetizing it tasted like I took a mouthful of RoseMary. The freshly squeezed orange juice was great! And we had great, friendly service!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SYHh7ts3PqSs6VPzgeEtQA.text: Small menu but I see why, they've perfected everything on their menu because all our food was really good!! Potatoes and toast were the BEST. Wait for 4 was about 45 minutes with only 3-4 parties in front of us. Thought it was weird that the wait ended up being this long because once we were seated they were pretty much rushing us out the door. I get it's a small spot but it just felt rude especially after we'd waited as long as we did. Service was meh. Our waitress was sweet but everyone else could care less about looking at us when they brought anything to the table let alone speak to us. If you don't mind poor service and are going strictly for really tasty breakfast food then this place is your spot!

0EAGk2iBVhfRxGVbo6Fy3Q.text: Excellent attentive servers. Timely service (food to table time) less than 10 minutes. Freshly squeezed OJ is truly freshly squeezed!   Don't miss out on their daily specials - check the placemat under your menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bomb Breakfast sandwich!.

md2s5w6uvxqw4VxeiLVPYw.text: Surprisingly the line moves quickly.  I was expecting an hour wait when I saw the line but we were seated within 15-20 minutes.    The menu is very limited and somewhat disappointing.  The daily specials are nice additions but they were unwilling to substitute anything so that was a let down.  I just wanted a different cheese in the scramble and they refused to do so.    The food was good but between the parking and lack of selection I'll probably go elsewhere in the future.

9DgiUhRX8XfhN08n_dcq2w.text: Happy St. Patrick's Day :-)  I can't believe this was my first time coming to Matt's Big Breakfast!!   "I'll be back" (in my best Arnold from Terminator voice)  Wow what an amazing experience. Definitely worth the trip/journey if you'er not in the area. Don't let the wait time scare you, it's so worth it.   We had to wait a half an hour to get seated, which wasn't too bad. The beautiful AZ weather made it a pleasant wait and it went by quick.  We were seated at the bar which was quick and convenient, but the bar stools were not that comfortable.    The food came out relatively quick for how packed the place was.    I wanted either pancakes, french toast or a waffle.  The waffle decision was made easily because the side of bacon it came with sealed the deal for me.  The waffle was cooked to the perfect consistency and you could tell the batter was home made and not some Bisquik instant waffle. Very flavorful.  The side of crisp peppered bacon was the perfect savory compliment to the sweet delicious waffle.    I also sampled my buddy's pancakes, they were amazing, very tasty.  Simple menu, but the food speaks for itself.  I can't wait to come back and try something else ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna Salad Sammy was yummy
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Game time
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Custom Veggie Scramble they made for my wife

yEr2rlbswcLIICz_vpm2qA.text: Great breakfast food with decent prices. There's usually a wait but it's definitely worth it! Best eggs and sausage in Phoenix!

HMSN5ANaE5iB7khseFpA_w.text: The waffle I had was very good. I found the coffee to be undrinkable though - extremely bitter! Which brings down my review as this is a breakfast restaurant and there's nothing better than starting off breakfast on the weekend with a hot coffee...

60aVdN52C5jCwTI4qGYq6w.text: Went over to this spot based on the Yelp reviews here, and there wasn't many options honestly in the downtown Phoenix area to choose from for a breakfast spot.  Wait time was pretty quick. Food was good, but not spectacular.   Honestly, I don't care to give a in depth review on this location since I will probably not come back unless I need to get breakfast somewhere and we are close by :)   Try it out if you want. Your not missing anything.

9UwwQ7VrbFizGBEF6IERjQ.text: Excellent food! A Great little Place to eat breakfast at! Service was excellent and would dedimitely come back again! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8A4Kcic538WfW7g0GI7gJA.text: LOVE this place! One of the best breakfast experiences I've had in my travels to Denver. Awesome atmosphere and amazingly fast service (serving hot, fresh food)! Run, don't walk. Get in line!

eTe_Sc_Vo8TOwm61bcrglQ.text: Always worth the wait. Food is awesome and so is the service. Definitely recommend. This spot is a tad bit small so I wouldn't recommend bringing a party bigger than 4.

8vjDwl4fb8kdtkMyoGfTNQ.text: The first thing I noticed upon sitting down was the noise.  Wow is it noisy!  I will not return as I could not enjoy being there due to the noise.  I could not hear the person I was with, who sat across the table from me.  Everytime someone pushed out their chair, I crindged!  Regarding the food, it was so,so.  I had an omelet with onions and peppers (blah), chunk potatoes hash browns (they were overly peppered), and sour dough bread (looked great, but no taste).  Coffee was the best!  Customer Service was excellent!  Disappointed after all the hype!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tiNhzonaRhtRPwRYmewDSw.text: Summary:  crowded, high priced, mediocre food,  good service.  I read the mass volume of amazing reviews and showed up here with high hopes.  A roughly 20 minute wait and we were seated and served promptly at about 10am.    After approx 10 minutes or so, food was served.  We ordered the special (thick cut French toast) and a plate with eggs, bacon and hash browns.  Hash-browns were thick and oily,  practically dripping.  French-toast was thick cinnamon and raisin bread, maple maple syrup.  Nothing more.  It was really just thick toast.  Bacon... thick and dry, pretty crispy.  The homemade lemonade was really really sweet and seemed to me a mix of strawberry or blueberry syrups in our cups with lemonade.   Wasn't exciting or homemade in flavor.  All in all,  food was sub-par on a scale with a typical IHOP or Dennys, but much more expensive.  Food and drink for three before tip tallied at over $50.  Kind of a bummer.  Service was good all around.  I wouldn't come back.

2BBtWGzJIC6W83-wuyrwTw.text: I've wanted to eat here for years and finally made it. It was a Tuesday around 11:00AM, it was very busy but not packed so I only waited for about ten minutes.   I ordered a cup of coffee to drink and the cheese omelette with a side order of bacon. Ordering the side of bacon was a must based on word of mouth and all of the reviews.   Coffee was very good and fresh.   My omelette was excellent, fluffy and full of melted American cheese. It was served with either hash browns or home style potatoes. I opted for the potatoes and they didn't disappoint. Seasoned with rosemary which was unique and delicious.   Now to that bacon...It was probably the best bacon I have ever had. Thick cut, peppered and tender. Cooked just right. Oh so good. All of those reviews were spot on.   I am already looking forward to my next visit.   Matt's is a must!   Enjoy!

Eotd1ftR92qBtRi2jaw4qg.text: This was excellent. Wish I would have taken a picture of my salami scramble with home fries done crispy. Delicious! Highly recommend this place. Cannot wait to visit my son at GCU to have breakfast here. Yum yum!

FunpMFMq3rgzJGvd0Or2ng.text: There was a bit of a wait for breakfast here and now I know why!  It was absolutely delicious.  I love the decor as well.  But the food was what really rocked my world.  I had the salami scramble, i think it was called and I added cheese to it.  It was amazing.  The hashbrowns...to die for.  I was in food heaven.  I also love that the butter your toast so the butter melts, I miss that in Chicago.  Overall, a great experience!

TrlzHVYsurg9SO-pQzzGIw.text: Went for the first time yesterday. It's not a huge place but we got seated immediately. The staff were all very polite, friendly and attentive. I got breakfast potatoes, ham steak and eggs. Usually I would comment on the meat, but the potatoes were brilliant! It was all served in a timely manner and prices weren't ridiculous. My meal was about 9. Which is standard these days I think.   Definitely recommend!

aTaX5GR8FN30z20-HDvpjw.text: Disappointed. Many of our friends enjoy this place & I cannot understand why, Limited menu and NO biscuits and gravy?!  Ordered a cheese omelet  and had to eat 1/2 of it before I got to any cheese! Good bread and OJ, but other than that not worth it.  As I said, I had cheese omelet with OJ, my husband had the Hog & Chick with a side of bacon. Sausage was store bought and gross and bacon was undercooked even though we asked for crispy....  I would NOT recommend this place to anyone!

o-s-HJF5-ou09v9jDwDzhg.text: Look, airport food is never going to be out of this world spectacular, I've accepted that reality a while back. However, Matt's Big Breakfast in Terminal 4 was decent (again, decent for airport food) and the prices were reasonable. I ordered the honey lemonade which tastes exactly how it sounds as well as the grilled cheese and tomato soup. Simple, clean and cheap. Their breakfast looks legit but I couldn't bring myself to ordering pancakes for the second time in one day especially before my flight back to the 305. Best part of the meal? Our server, Jennifer. She was on the ball and knew exactly when  to provide refills, bring the check and was really cheerful. Hooray for good airport customer service, Snoopy knows it ain't easy!

lE0IbE-1mOA33A82hfL2_w.text: Totally worth the wait! First time in Phoenix and I'm glad this was my first dining experience.  I loved how the staff worked so efficiently together and there is always somebody waiting to help you with refills and anything you need.  It was definitely a show of good leadership with the owner walking around to help. I would definitely plan to eat here many times over if I'm back in Phoenix.  I had the cheese omelet, side of bacon, hash browns and sourdough toast.  Everything was beyond delicious and I would highly recommend the hash browns - crunchy on the outside and so creamy inside.  Killing it Matt's Big Breakfast!!!

tFVpyhinT-kwxhlcnxyRZg.text: Even though we have to drive 15 minutes to get here we are NEVER disappointed! We love that Matt works with a local butcher and other local vendors too.

ywfPcaicDOHDx2vi9UWc9g.text: My girl friend and i went there on a crowded Saturday morning. Customer service wasn't great. Our server Leyva seemed somber and wasn't able to get us a glass of water. The pork chop was dry and tasted like chicken. The prices were ok. I would have been pissed if i had to pay more for the mediocre food.

COMHDcnGnKTbeT6FRfGngA.text: The wait was long because we went on a weekend but the food is worth it.  Their food is really good and their wait staff is great and attentive.  I could see what the fuss was about.  This place has a reputation for being busy and always crowded on weekends, but it is because the food is delicious.

w0r9xIVT-YLFHwHv54Wylw.text: Yum-o! After seeing Matt's on triple D I knew that we would have to hit it up on our trip to Phoenix, and it did not disappoint. We arrived at about 10:30 on a Friday morning and waited for about 10 minutes before getting seated at the bar. I started with the OJ, my husband got the strawberry honey lemonade, both were amazing! For breakfast I did the omelette with cheddar cheese and bacon, husband got the eggs and sausage patties. There is an up charge for the bacon in my omelette but it was totally worth it, there was tons of delicious bacon in my omelette. The highlight if the meal was he amazing sourdough toast and jam. If I hadn't been so full of bacon I would have gotten an extra side of toast - so good!  I wish we lived in Phoenix so we could go back!

7DAimXFO1Z7lX9nGQ-mT3w.text: Went back to Matt's to try another breakfast entree today.  I ordered their omelette with Wisconsin cheddar cheese and added sausage.  Killer omelette and to get it with my favorite home fries, sourdough toast and a strawberry lemonade?  I had another smile tattooed to my face walking out of Matt's this morning.  We got there around 9:45 and waited about 25 minutes for a table.  The weather was a perfect 70 degrees outside so no complaints here.  The service was top notch as always (just like the food).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmm...bacon.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage &amp; cheddar omelette

Uc2ZSqE9fI4rT5UmcLhEhQ.text: I was excited to try after all the hoopla. Seriously disappointed. For the price I had extremely high expectations. The staff & service was great...but my particular order was.   Well..Tasteless. I had the pork chop. It was dry. My potatoes & toast, burned. And since I HATE the flavor of rosemary...double whammy for the papas. I had a to go order so, my bad. Probably won't go back. I can get potatoes & eggs anywhere.

gwE9PMzNuSfSc20EOoNHRw.text: Not much more really needs to be said for Matt's. The wait seemed intimidating but they have it down to system and it was hardly a wait.  Food was fresh and delicious and we all enjoyed our meals. I ordered the pancakes and they are everything you hope a pancake would be.

7JsJMfRPbd_vO6KMd9OH2w.text: Greets spot for breakfast. We waited an hour for a table on a Monday morning which I assumed would be dead. Once seated we were helped right away. The menu was small but a thoughtful selection of breakfast and lunch options. I had the salami and scramble with home fries. Delicious. The salami was a perfect salty meat for the eggs. The home fries were perfectly seasoned and the Orange juice was amazing. Who knew OJ could be that good. I thought this was a great breakfast and well worth the wait. I'll be back

Cd-eZ3K7KAS6xFk6_LFbpw.text: Orange juice is damn good. it's really good. I would argue perhaps the best thing on the menu. Omlette was good, but not the best I've had. It was a little on the soft side and wouldn't have hurt to use a little more cheese. I had to be liberal with the salt and pepper. The toast was cut very thick. One of the highlights was the fresh homemade jam, but you really had to slather it on heavy to have the flavor balance out how thick the toast was with each bite. I would have preferred thinner slices.  As compared to other places I've eaten with "big" breakfasts, this "big" isn't really that big. It's actually quite manageable, which I appreciate and would return for. The new space is beautiful - very old meets new industrial diner feeling. Love the giant wall board in the back creating a hallway to the bathroom.  No wait when we went, which was definitely nice. Seems like a really family friendly joint.

xHQjt3yHQeUnUemUwrQp3w.text: This place was crazy packed at around 10:30am on a Tuesday. I honestly thought they had reinvented eggs and pancakes.  Everything was good I'm guessing the hype is over the breakfast meats which I don't eat. I have to say even as a pescetarian the bacon and sausage looked good. I wouldn't go back alone but I would definitely take some of my carnivore friends there. Staff was great and the place was very accommodating to children. Super pork-centric. If you eat pig, I would recommend you get yourself in there.

A5BmNGepoZx-rPfzRHY7Og.text: Awesome place! It was packed but we had great service at the counter, the menu options were great with organic items and cage free eggs.  The home fries are out of this world! Fun atmosphere, they know what they are doing here!

GedCx8BlzERW51Cj8ve0nQ.text: I've been to a number of places featured on DDD - some live up to the hype, others disappoint.  Matt's did not disappoint!    My Belgian Waffle was topped with a mound of delicious sweet cream butter.  When it melted together with the pure maple syrup on my fork full of waffle, I  reached breakfast Nirvana!  The hash browns were the best I've had in recent memory.  Clearly fried in lots of butter.  The outside perfectly crisp, and the inside was soft, buttery potato perfection.  My companions had a cheese omelet and pastrami scramble  I tried them both and they too were outstanding!  The mixed berry jam was wonderful.  The Chef (owner?) stopped by our table and explained she makes it weekly from whatever berries are available.   Service was outstanding and all the workers seemed to be having a great time, which made the visit even more enjoyable.  A big tip-o-the cap to everyone at Matt's.  If I lived in Phoenix I would be a regular!

1ikNUtvdiEKTW-xK95_J6Q.text: Breakfast was awesome!! The big in Matt's big breakfast is definitely for the size of the food not for the building.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eU2T8Lvr1cACKjhNGmLgMw.text: A good restaurant. Always very busy.  Don't confuse the Midwest Chilli with Cincinnati Chilli.  It is not over spaghetti.

ymWL-U1wgDIlR7W0oyhJHQ.text: Enjoyed the huevos rancheros for brunch! I thought the potatoes were really good and seasoned. I went on a Monday morning so didn't have to wait to be seated.

T41Se2abXq5wsDvIqvzRDQ.text: Ordered the waffles and omelette special (eggs, andouille sausage, pepper jack cheese, and jalapenos) with homemade fries. Waffles are fantastic if you smear the butter around and mix it with the syrup. Nice and soft. Slightly sweet when waffles are by itself. Bacon that came with the waffles were tasty, as well.  Omelette was flavorful, but a touch of tabasco sauce enhanced the flavor. Homemade fries are delicious. The housemade strawberry jam that came with the toast was delicious, as well. Friendly staff. Very busy here - like a 30 min wait.

PlvXK1KRPNL8xtFH24HNwQ.text: The breakfast was just okay. It was expensive for the daily special, and the potatoes that the waitress recommended were not fully cooked and a little under done. I would not probably return or recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Photo of breakfast special scramble of the day...  Just ok...

qEBboXTw5vAqwb8XipfOKg.text: I know I'm gonna make a lot of enemies with this review but here goes.  It doesn't quite live up to the hype.  Having gotten rave reviews from the local paper and from the community in general, always be prepared to wait about an hour to get a table.  The food is by no means bad, but with the exception of their daily special, their selection is ordinary - this took me by surprise considering how many people rave about the place.  On top of this, the service hasn't been great.  The only time we've had decent service was when the waitress was trying to flirt with my friend, which was honestly rather amusing.  That aside, they do make pretty good pancakes and if you do really insist on seeing what the hype is all about, I advise you to stop by within an hour of opening to avoid the wait.

A0-nA15edFYb4aiw5xaucQ.text: Excellent service and excellent food at reasonable prices! Ate here on a late Saturday morning after a 45 min wait. It was worth it! Although they have plenty of waiting room, my co-diner and I combed the area for neat shops and street art! Great start to our day!  The only thing I didn't like was that they charge for extras like another small (1/2 cup) cup of syrup for my three thick griddle cakes.  Overall I enjoyed it and my date was impressed so I would go again just - no griddle cakes for me.

r5EIMAI3wsJ4v7-STdmsQg.text: Love this place! Come here every time I am in Phoenix. The food is incredibly fresh and everyone who works here is very friendly. Usually a wait, but completely worth it. My only complaint is that their daily specials aren't full time on the menu, especially the Eggs Benedict (which is only offered on Thursday's). Their hollandaise sauce is made from scratch and out of this world!

CbCMy-izAVb7nHw9lGPeAQ.text: Best breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix. Not that there's a ton of competition. Old school food with modern twist. The staff was super nice and quick. Prices are decent. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area.

qHE7jA9nE7BrXycZHT5fAw.text: The orange juice tasted kind of off but everything else was delicious. My favorite might have been their homemade jam with the thick cut toast. I ordered scrambled eggs and potatoes as well, and the potatoes are full of flavor. I definitely left full and would come back again.

xUyFREH4S93reAjhBRPq7A.text: We went to Matt's on a Wednesday morning and it was packed.  The wait was relatively quick however as they turn people over quickly.  I had basted eggs, hash browns, and bacon with sourdough toast.  All the ingredients were excellent quality and cooked to perfection.  The jams were homemade and there were 2 offered though they only bring strawberry to the table.  I requested the blueberry and they gladly brought some at my request.  Both were excellent, but I preferred the blueberry.  The bread was also homemade and was also great.  All in all, well worth the wait and drive.

Yw-PX1YlgEBbI1U81FOBuA.text: Monday special: Huevos Rancheros Verdes are a must!! The home fries were tasty!Great option for a quick and healthy bite before heading to the airport. Friendly, quick service. Coffee is delish.

1_cjjGGWU0oiqCk4PUfbZA.text: Definitely worth the wait. I love this place! What a neat spot. The waiters were friendly the food was great and the atmosphere was wonderful! We will definitely be coming back!

1lM_Sx2IBYtgJJY-96F__Q.text: Was out in Phoenix for a business trip and found this place thru Yelp (obviously)... Cute breakfast/brunch place... Small in size, but what I'm used to for a place like this. Decoration and table condiments cute...salt & pepper shakers are like little mason jars. Okay the food... I had the daily special which was the normal Eggs Benedict. It was decent, nothing to write home about...the Hollandaise sauce was waaaay too lemoney for my taste but the potatoes were delicious.

2E9JFH0iJViGCGYGcqj74Q.text: Ok. Not great, barely good. Just ok.  Maybe I just expected too much, I don't know, but the potatoes were bad, the omelette was average and the service was adequate (I asked twice for water which I never got.) Oh. And I didn't even finish the slice of bacon - which borders on sacrilege.   With the big lines, I thought they did a good job of cleaning tables and readying them for the next group but that's not a big reason to endorse a restaurant, huh?

qHaeYhnqsiHHaG2oP35BpQ.text: I'm a regular at Matt's and truly love the food.  You can't go wrong with the daily specials.  I'm giving it only 3 stars because of a recent experience that was very disappointing.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy special, which was very good however the biscuit to gravy ratio tipped towards the biscuit.  A little extra gravy was needed to compliment the large biscuit.  When I asked for some extra gravy the server told me it would be an additional cost.  I agreed to the extra charge and totally enjoyed my meal.  When I received my check, I noticed the extra charge for the gravy was $3.95.  Now the entire meal was $10.95.  I was charged almost 40% for a little extra gravy.  When I questioned the tab, I was told that I ordered a side of gravy and that was the cost.  Really good food, but I felt like I got nickel and dime'd for the extra gravy.  There should be a balance to the dish and I had to pay an extra 40% to achieve it.

Ietb52PcLCBTtgemwI2Duw.text: Ate there once with family.  So noisy in there you can't even hear yourself chew. Everyone talking, they need to do something about the acoustics. The food was good

TNzunUWZyR3UQeeXDEjNsw.text: The food here is AMAZING! It was featured on the food network. I met a friend here and was genuinely surprised on how good this place was. They pride themselves on fresh ingredients and they deliver. Its a bit eclectic and the area is interesting. Yet, even so I would say its a must go!

ufTqYU4tEQrwsUqjBaeQsw.text: I went to Matt's Big Breakfast with my wife on 08/15/14. We were staying at the Westin and a front desk employee had recommended Matt's to us. The reviews on YELP were great and it's only a short walk away, in the hot Phoenix sun, so we thought we'd check it out. When we walked in we were promptly greeted and seated ourselves at a table for two. There are tables and a breakfast bar to eat at. The restaurant was busy but not crowded. I can imagine that people are waiting in line to eat at Matt's on weekends. Our waiter and waitress, yes, we had several people take care of us, quickly took our order. Great team work! I had the Hog and Chick, with an extra egg and bacon. My wife had a waffle with a side of bacon. My meal came with home fries and toast, I also ordered a freshly squeezed OJ and we both had coffee. The coffee was good and refills were plentiful. The OJ was freshly squeezed and delicious. The service continued to be great and our meals came out in a timely manner. I had ordered my eggs over easy because I like my eggs runny. Two eggs were cooked perfectly but one had no runny yolk. My home fries were cooked with onions and rosemary and were piping hot. My toast was only one slice of wheat but was very thick and easily compared to two slices of regular wheat toast. The star of the show, for me, was the bacon. It was two of the best slices of tender, thick cut bacon I have ever had, at a breakfast place. My wife told me that her waffle was really good and agreed with me on how good the bacon was. Matt's Big Breakfast did not disappoint. If your visiting the area or just dumping your kid off at ASU, definitely head to Matt's Big Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and Chicken with an extra egg.

XduNYmXMyNsS_b3dh2Gy9Q.text: Great place - but get here early if you want to get your day going!  This place fills up fast and stays full!     Small place but personal service.   Coffee and creamer is excellent - not sure of their secret ;)  I've had the pork chop plate (don't recall the name), waffle, and the Schreiner's local sausage and egg scramble.   No, I didn't have all this at one time, this was over the course of several trips LOL.   Everything was excellent with the exception of the Schreiner's deal - I didn't realize it had rye seed in the sausage and I'm totally anti-rye.     Other than that everything I've tried, the experience, and service was great.  Clean.  3.5 stars easily earned, I'd give 3.9 actually...

2FS2pULuDUBPcgPb9DQBww.text: French Toast and eggs is absolutely delicious here! Breakfast lovers this is a must stop shop! Five stars all day!

Qa-0zHC_-yqI85upzhpbog.text: When I first started going to Matt's, 7 years ago, this place was amazing and well worth the wait! Unfortunately, the food is nowhere near as good as it used to be. They overcharge on everything and the service is not great either. It's really disappointing.

XLbvDWhSKG1GjOlD4Gzgzg.text: A solid 4.5 stars for this downtown Phoenix breakfast joint!!  I went with the 'daily special' (which was erased and replaced by a different breakfast dish before I was done eating, sooooo . . . maybe it's more of an hourly special?).  Eggs Benedict with hash browns.  I also added nourbon cherry sausage and a side of toast.    Everything was phenomenal.  I've got absolutely nothing to complain about regarding this place.    I'll finish with the strongest compliment I can pay a restaurant which is this:  I'll be back.

8KE-emsmIggLlEnVvhPYMg.text: One of my favorite breakfast places in town. I always tell out-of-town guests to eat breakfast at Matt's for a wonderful lasting memory on your tastebud and mind!!

RyLexSPdLp8YnIWmENYjHg.text: I love this place. The service is good. The food is AMAZING! It's a must go here in Phoenix. Just be prepared, because of how awesome it is- it will be crowded. But oh so worth it.

kAtLVSyT-My6DWNdqu42oA.text: The scrambled eggs with chorizo are absolutely delicious. The waitress is very hot.. very friendly service. Love the vibe!

t8DB93wIkiaV6gGj68vH-w.text: Big plates of food so bring an appetite! Fresh farm to table food that is so delicious and the coffee they serve tastes great!

RW4qa4_KiJqiim_DJ2lvSw.text: We finally made it to Matt's! How many YEARS have we talked about going here? I don't remember, but I'm glad we did.   My partner and I picked out a weekday to venture out to Matt's since I'm not big on waiting for food. I'm hungry, get me a table, take my order and put the plate in front of me a few minutes later. Matt's did just that and more.   After a quick drive into Phoenix from our home in the vast wasteland of corporate chain restaurants that comprises Desert Ridge we made it to Matt's. YEAH!!, no wait we were seated right away. Our server came by quickly and took our beverage orders while giving us a few minutes to peruse the menu.  I ordered the special and he had the Chop and Eggs. We shared a side of sausage. TI hhe coffee was amazing as were both breakfasts. I'm not a fan of their Home Fries but you should try them anyway...it may just be me.  I haven't looked yet, but there are probably hundreds of reviews for Matt's. We were probably just the last ones to get there. Unless you go after us for the first time, then YOU'LL be the last ones to discover this amazing breakfast spot.

IjTBEda_msgh1l1VDvQX6A.text: This is the best Yelp suggestion yet.  Matts Big Breakfast is amazing.  The prices are great, the food is wonderful and the people are absolutely incredible.  Gonna miss this place the most when we head back home to Colorado.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit and gravy special.......fantastic

nAdUnDLr3jMxa5VMJuEblg.text: Food is good but staff tends to be cold and distant.  Get the fresh squeezed OJ. It's really good!

Yto9iOpN7e6x4RfnkGnAdg.text: Been here twice - best breakfast in town. You will have to wait - but the staff set the right expectations, so you know exactly how long you're waiting. Once you sit down - they are fast, efficient and again . . the food is outstanding.  Good job Matt's. Keep it up!

la_fpVr9-8tYlU-wSEVxxQ.text: Wasn't Worth the Drive Across Town  I had heard a lot of hype about Matt's, and had friends who went there who raved about the place, so I made the 30 minute drive to try it out.   The place was packed, and had people waiting for tables, so I took an open spot at the counter. To start with, the stools were completely made of metal, including the seat which was hard, slippery, and shaped like a button mushroom with no contours for comfort. I was uncomfortable and felt like I had to brace my knees against the counter in order not to slide off.  It didn't take very long to place my order, for the "Chop & Chick" and I was brought coffee right away. The server was friendly. The coffee was alright, but the server didn't return to see if I wanted a refill while I was waiting for my breakfast. The wait to receive my food was on the long side, but I can see that being so busy would slow the process. The wait wouldn't have been a big deal, but my stool was so extremely uncomfortable that I almost left.  When I was just about at the end of my patience sitting so uncomfortably, my food came, and the server finally refilled my coffee.   I can't say anything good about it. The portion was average - disappointing given the "Big" in the restaurant's name. My pork chop was way overcooked (dry) and apparently unseasoned, and there is nothing complementary that I can say about the home fries. They didn't mess up the scrambled eggs, but my breakfast overall was so unappealing that I only ate a couple of bites. Since my server hadn't returned to see if my meal was satisfactory, I decided to throw in the towel and just get off of that stool and out of there. I left enough money for the food, headed out the door, and back across town and had a fine breakfast elsewhere.   At Matt's, I didn't get quality, quantity, value, flavor or service. I didn't even get breakfast.

k8V6oemXw_Bw1P6GvwBn1g.text: Didn't love it. I tried it because of Food Network, but I did not have a good experience. My omelette was luke warm, and the potatoes greasy. It's very loud, and it is extremely obvious that they want you in and out asap. There was one guy racing around, yelling to people like he's had way too much caffeine. I really have no reason to go back.

Nv4LDZYawg-W_LWnJ-nJqw.text: What a great place for an airport restaurant!  My cheeseburger was fabulous.  The fries, however, were not that fresh.  But in general, this is the best airport restaurant I have ever visited.

6dBTCLxB_Q015d1_FomatA.text: The waffles are f'n airy and amazing. Generous portions and quick service. Friendly staff at the counter. Definitely recommend it.

IlG10GqengaDnOGA9uzzNw.text: Food was okay, place was tight and small very busy though so thats why I decided to eat here. The charge $2 for extra syrup because i ordered kids pancakes for my friends son which where dry. I got an omelette which i felt i could make better at home. The food lacked seasoning alot it was all very bland. Across the table we all got different items to experience the menu and this was our first and last time. I have had worst trust me but nothing worth coming back for.

o4ZlemH1bZ8JV_c0xYXWyg.text: Happy with my experience.   Came here recently for breakfast with my girlfriend. We arrived and were informed the wait would be 45 mins to an hour. Luckily we only waited for around 30 minutes.   We ordered the daily special which was steak and eggs...also got some eggs, toast, and hash browns. Unfortunately, we ended up waiting nearly 40 mins for our food which was a tad bit disappointing because I heard good things about this place and service.   Food eventually came out and was delicious... What amended the situation for me was managements handling of the everything. Without us even complaining they paid for our meal and apologized for the wait.   Shout out to management for the professionalism. We will be back.

X09y6yxU3JvajCtKQ_vy0Q.text: Was excited to try this place because of all the reviews. Food was ok, way overrated. Won't be going back!

PkTOB2OQnJ3SDxiJuAE4Bw.text: Has the semi-fancy breakfast place finally jumped the shark?   I am not sure, but the lines outside Matt's Big Breakfast were certainly an indication of the semi-fancy breakfast joint has remained popular. But why exactly?  Matt's Big Breakfast has good breakfast, certainly. But it wasn't so much different than typical diner food. I will credit them with some of the best bacon I've ever had: Thick cuts of fatty, salty, peppery bacon. Definitely amazing.  But otherwise: Eggs, slightly too herbal potatoes, some toast for $9.  The menu is also surprisingly small with typical waffles and omelets at a definitely price premium. They even have a bowl of Frosted Flakes for $5. Why anyone would go out to eat and pay $5 for that, I cannot fathom.  If it wasn't for that amazing bacon, I would have frankly felt ripped off and that I had wasted my time in line. That's the problem with a lot of semi-fancy breakfast joints, the hype leaves you disapointed.

Ji91x5a5LnmciKwFCOwcBw.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is a great place to have well... breakfast. The new location is great, although I wish that they could have added a few more tables.  There is one thing that I hate...Lines. Seriously. I would rather have a reservation. But I hate lines. especially in 100 degrees.   Matt's would get a 5 star, except for the lines. It is a great place for breakfast, and I still highly recommend it. ( I always go for a special.... something new...something different).  Their honey lemonade is awesome :)

pBHLCD1KTst3Ec0m3icUlg.text: 4 stars for food, 3 stars for service.  Food was traditional breakfast fare, good sized portions and homemade strawberry preserves on thick cut wheat toast was delicious! Took a few minutes to get served our beverage, I ordered half caf coffee, but when refilled wasn't asked what it was, just auto refilled with full strength.  While busy, a moment to check in with the customer would have been appreciated.

8Ux0nHh5GRPfgqYA4NzWvw.text: I love this place ! Came all the way from California to try it. We were in Arizona 3 days and went to Matts every morning!! Love the quality of the food. I enjoyed the bacon and eggs and I especially loved my toast. Some people don't know quality if it slaps them in the face. I Also got an oj and a coffee! Next time I'm In town I'm going straight back to matts

EZz_GGoD6Drg9f0X5C-z0w.text: This place is amazing. We sat at the bar so we could see the food go out. It all looked and WAS great. Fresh squeezed juice, homemade preserves, strawberry honey lemonade.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NY-3K9m5ZhDMR89P3QcHYA.text: Best pancakes I've had so far.  Bkfst potatoes were very good.  Salami omelette wasn't the best so I'll try something else next time.

mLcAXSp5d9NcmkivkiL3Ew.text: We dropped our daughter off at work today so that we could use her car to drive to the mountains for a hike. She highly recommended Matt's for breakfast on our way back to the hotel. This is a great find and a MUST when you are in Phoenix. Especially if you're fueling up for a mountain hike. We pulled in at 7:15 and we're back in the car at 7:55. In those 40 minutes we had great food (daily scramble for husband and waffle + bacon for me) and top-notch service (friendly, attentive, and FAST) in a really comfy and happy environment. And good coffee too! Two more days in Phoenix? Maybe two more visits to Matt's.

8x3cTQghXJyy0tMOt4FxSg.text: Matt's Big Breakfast lived up to it's name! We definitely had a BIG yummy breakfast. My husband had the sirloin special*picture posted. Which he absolutely devoured. I enjoyed their basic breakfast with bacon. I wish I would have snapped a pic of the thick bacon. Great food, reasonably priced, and fast friendly service!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KRyjfr9b8RsAsx-64yLn5Q.text: Big? How about a ginormous amount of food!! The omelet was cooked to perfection and the rosemary potatoes were amazing! Staff and service were Exemplary!

69gAkv9IFHzngvziibBbBg.text: This place is worth checking out JUST FOR THE EXPERIENCE. it's retro, feels like an old diner with a TWIST of millennial. ya baby, right up my alley. grub: dank. coffee: dank. environment: dank. noisey tin chairs on concrete floor: RANK (that's where the 5th star ended up :/ ) but if you got some ear plugs throw em on and step into this delicious walk down memory lane (if you're 50+ it's memory lane. under 50 might just be "hipster" lane)

-kqEfJ6pqQ-OeSCTzfc_oA.text: How do biscuits and gravy SUCK here!!!? And it's supposedly a daily special?? Bluh...first time here and I thought it sucked. Muppy biscuits and soggy.   2 stars because they have stevia on the tables.

iqkIsPVUODFH1gQ_LU91cQ.text: Typical breakfast place, but I would recommend it to anyone! Food is delicious, the servers are usually doting and kind.   I know there are a couple locations, so try both!

hub02Y9ke4_NhQ18pxrokQ.text: Great food! 20 min wait on a Thursday. Service was just ok- the waitress seemed like she rather be somewhere else and not friendly. Good coffee ! Overall positive experience

H1tSBzSo4kmmdMKc6j-Bhg.text: This food tasted as bad as it looks! The potatoes were gray/green in color, and tasted awful! How in the world do you screw up a fried potato???? The food was just as dark as it appears in the photo. Really bad food for $16.00. Go some place else!

t1BtGsG-h-JxG7f8ifqxVA.text: Had a great experience at Matt's breakfast we parked right up front and our parking meter had enough time on it we didn't have to pay any! Then we walk in and got seated immediately it was really cute inside, comfy cozy and friendly! The waitress we had was great and very quick and attentive! We ordered and our food came out so fast and it was all perfect and tasted amazing we definitely recommend giving them a try for a breakfast or brunch!!

esUBZcmXeV393vik32q0CA.text: Go on Tuesdays for the biscuits and gravy.    They are so good that when you order biscuits and gravy somewhere else you'll simply just compare them to Matt's and how they just aren't as good.

d_gRwHG5VSskllUrKyFy8w.text: We are visiting from Atlanta,GA. Found this place in a thrillist list.   The place was worth the 45 minute wait.  My fiance order the scramble special with amAzing apple sausage. It was a huge portion and tasted amazingly.   I ordered the chick and the hog with over easy eggs and the house potatoes. The taste was amazing. The potatoes aren't the healthiest option but it tasted so good with the grilled onions. I had the sausage which was a little too salty.   They gave us bread with strawberry preserves. They were sweet and Greta taste.   If we lived here, this would be a regular spot.

1HGMEN9zkpgez6W8wPMaUQ.text: A nice place to grab the late brunch. We tried the breakfast sandwich and it was just great! A simple meal with delicious ingredients. We stopped by there on our way to the museum around 1:00 p.m. There were lots of spots and we easily found the parking. Our server, Gabriella, was fast and provided great service. This is a very neat place and I will recommend my fry to try it out.

l-TEMZvC4Xj-n1-D9-Wyzg.text: Had breakfast here on a Wednesday and man was it crowded. We were able to sit at the bar as soon as we walked in. Our food came out very quick. The bacon is delicious as well as their thick cut toast and home made preserves. My hubby had a breakfast sandwich, he said it was good. The food was good and the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EDcUer9xJ-rA1bhSG6f4VA.text: Matts is a Phoenix staple.  Probably the best breakfast in town! Absolutely the best Steak and Eggs I've ever had!  Great toast, bacon, OJ, homefries!   Great service!  Emi brought me one of my favorite breakfasts I've ever had today!  Thank you very much!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Steak and Eggs in the Land

AvaqXRbJV1T-WQpcYaoorg.text: Overall, this was an amazing restaurant! The food was outstanding, and I would definitely recommend the breakfast and hash browns. Another great aspect about this place was the staff, they were so friendly, outgoing and made the experience even better!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YMisiGFNStnqQF-c4lAs7A.text: Did a quick yelp search found this place and this is the best breakfast I have had in a while.

cWCA96TRaGQGpqtKqzZiNA.text: Our first time and it was amazing! Great service, superb food, and reasonable pricing. The portions were large and filling. The iced tea was worthy of a to-go glass. Although it was a noisy environment, the quaint atmosphere was worth every minute. If you have the time, stop! You won't be disappointed.

hVilzHmaLq8G0TQB7wDtMg.text: The breakfast is AMAZING!! This is a MUST try place if you are in AZ. Service was amazing!!

Z2FCGBLJ1SaooM8grbCL7w.text: Wow the sausage links here are delicious!!!! I had the hog and chick breakfast and oh boy did I enjoy it.  It's my first time  here due to a flight cancelation and I couldn't have done better when it came to breakfast.  It was packed when I first entered but I was seated in a decent time.  I was surprised with how fast my food came out and I would come here again if I didn't have to leave. Staff was friendly and my orange juice tasted like it was freshly squeezed.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Anzhr8ni7nAnrcB7OyAfXg.text: They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  If you are looking for quality than look no further.    My coworkers and I been to this location many times.  And every time we came it was a great experience.  Every time we come here there is always a long wait.  But it's worth it, the quality and the ingredients are top notch!  The hams and the bacons.... amazing!!  The food here is definitely worth the wait.  The place is alway very cramped but it's okay, it's a small little place.  They also have another location, but I have not been to that one, I think it's at the airport.  Overall this is a great little place in the downtown area, I highly recommend this place.  You won't be sorry about the quality, there's a long wait here for a reason :) ohh yeah parking sucks, you might want to carpool!

_gPFuzH2RaZTgeJq6IC46w.text: Incredibly fast service on a Saturday morning, excellent rotating special scramble (chorizo and cheese is what I ordered), and fresh coffee and juice to boot!  Great place to stop by if you're from out of town and trying to get some local flavor!

aMwJPthRT8MRCe6Kf5knHA.text: In Phoenix for work, staying downtown. Matt's was exactly what I was looking for as an alternative to the hotel restaurant or Starbucks. Cool atmosphere, great service, and good food. I had the Huevos Rancheros special on a Monday morning. Didn't finish it all (big plate!) but it was a delicious start to the day. Highly recommend.

WW8QYa4E5uZUiJ-Um1Cr-A.text: A bit unorganized for such great reviews. They skipped over our name on the list so the 20 minute quote turned into 40 minutes. We ended up asking to take the stools at the window counter. Server never introduced herself and proceeded to take the guests order who sat down after us.  Our food was delivered one at a time (out of four) with a long delay between dishes. My friend was finished eating before mine arrived. Food was decent except for eggs. Poorly prepared. Server took tip off counter prior to clearing all our plates. Just Strange Culture.  Turn & Burn!  Good quality product.

7SVYtRgbgA58YQ62MToiNg.text: Don't get all the hype. Ridiculous wait for ordinary food. If you have an hour or more to kill on your weekend then go for it.

FJ3foSS6yUCfRv_tgd4X8g.text: So glad we stopped here while on vacation! Biscuits and gravy were amazing! A little spicy for my daughter but perfect for me! Rosemary potatoes....can I have the recipe please! The bacon was phenomenal! And the strawberry lemonade was the most refreshing drink I've ever had! My oldest had the sandwich hich she was really really good. The staff was quick and very polite! They had a huge line outside but they got people in and out quick without making you feel rushed!

t9FDEiEDQycQe2UZvmYS3Q.text: In town for meeting and found Matts Big Breakfast.   Great food and service.  Recommend highly.

NU6BC56PXowh3FiX5paS-g.text: Been here a few times each time better than the last no the best for little one big still greatest pancakes and if you can get the cherry sausage do it in it a big meat consumer but omg this black heresy sausage was to die for and don't get me started on the coffee !!!!! Love this place only four stars cause the long wait .. But well worth it

96s3W6xrzDQCMSfNNDLgSQ.text: This place is great, food and service is very good. The wait is a bit long to be seated but well worth it.. The home fries are my favorite potatoes..

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside of Matt&#39;s

7b2zGrzGBdtGwRbnSimVpg.text: This is it! I found it!  The one place that has the best bacon, the best hash browns, the best eggs, the best pancakes, the best maple syrup, the best toast, the best jam, and the best coffee all under one roof!!  I love Matts BB!  It has a local, relaxed vibe, the clientele is hip and  cool, and the staff is friendly and attentive.  There can be quite a long wait if you decide to go during peak weekend breakfast/brunch hours, but trust me, the wait is worth every minute.  When it comes to breakfast, I'm a pretty straight forward guy.  Bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast please.  And if I'm feelin' really hungry (and who are we kidding?  I'm always feelin' really hungry) i'll order a pancake for dessert.  Oh, and don't forget the coffee and OJ.   The bacon is unbelievably good; addictively good; sinfully good!  Thick, smokey, peppery, and mmmmmmmmmm, just perfect!  The hash browns are another masterpiece.  Crispy outside, tender and buttery inside.  The pancakes are delicious.  Light, fluffy, and and hot off the griddle; not dense and doughy like most diner pancakes.  You can taste the quality and freshness in every little detail.  The eggs, the toast, the jam, EVERYTHING!!  the decor is simple and unpretentious.  Just one big room with a bunch of tables, a bar that seats about 8 peeps, with a TV to watch Sunday morning football, (thanks for that, Matt!!), and a little side room that seats about 6-8 people in case you have a big group.  If you're ever in Phoenix, hungry, and looking for a down home place to have some down home grub with top notch quality, freshness and love for food, this is the place to be.  I cant wait to go back.

7cJVPsSMyex_ykhuNP6dOw.text: This was an amazing place with amazing hash browns and an amazing breakfast sandwich called the five spot the only bad thing was that it was too small for how much business they had but all in all it was good

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The five spot sandwich with hash browns the bomb

lZ_d_sYrke-ORtMD4nGyow.text: Good food, but they have outgrown their restaurant.

lzEYD6apNveogoeRiIkuXw.text: We went on a weekday, which probably helped minimize the notorious wait time.  We were seated at a high table, in the front/private dining room, which also serves as a storage location. There was a lot of traffic in and out, but not to the point of being bothersome, and the view out the front window made it well worth it.  I ordered the special, a Denver scramble, and had cinnamon raisin toast, with homemade strawberry jam.  The scramble was delicious, but the jam was amazing!  I enjoyed my meal, and my experience, and will likely return.

bqF1pu0g0F25uR60MAHprg.text: WOOOOOOOOWWWWWW!!!   I FEEL LIKE I'M TAKING CRAZY PILLS!!!   What are all of these people doing giving such high reviews???   Once a month, I meet up with my ladies. But after one of our foursome flaked, it was me and another femme with our name on the list for 3.  (We were waiting for drunky who probably slept in).  We went to the brand-spankin' new location which is apparently huge with a whopping 9 whole tables!!! (It could be more, but I am not exaggerating, I can only remember 9) We waited for 20 minutes in the waiting area, and our friend was still not there (suspected hangover) but they called our names and we were seated.  Our lovely young male waiter came along and we ordered drinks and told him our friend would be along at any minute.  He said no worries and would be back with our beverages.    Let me start off by saying I NEVER go to breakfast joints because I do not eat eggs.  No I'm not a vegetarian or vegan, I just hate the idea of eating a fetus.  That's all.  Unfortunately that left me with one or two options with the VERY egg heavy menu... A Waffle meal, a side order of sausage or juice.  Bring on the waffles!!!! We wait, and wait, and wait for our slacker friend for ten minutes. During the ten minutes waiting for our friend, it began to get PACKED at the front door with foodies glaring at our horrible twosome, for taking a four-top. HOW DARE WE!!!!! Don't blame us for where the hostess seated us?  After 10 minutes, the hostess walks over and asks us what the hold up is.   ?????   I'm sorry are we not shoveling down your "BIG BREAKFAST'S" fast enough for you?!  We politely stated, that our friend was going to be there any minute (she was, she was texting us that she was down the street).   THEN THE HOSTESS SAYS (verbatim): "I'm sorry we're not supposed to seat parties until everyone is here. You're going to have to order right now."  ???  Appalled, and not willing to fight, I say: "Okay, well I guess we were both getting the waffles and Britney will order when she gets here".   THE HOSTES REPLIES: "Unfortunately I'm going to have to ask you to order for her, or we wont be able to accommodate an order for your friend."  I giggled thinking she was joking.  She stared blankly at me...  WHAT??????????????  So you're telling me, that we gave you our name and our party number, 3.  You saw two of us even though your little notebook clearly said 3.  You sat us at a large table leaving the masticating buzzard hoard to wish us dead. We've been here for ten minutes when most brunch places expect you to wait at LEAST 10 minutes before ordering.  We cannot enjoy our drinks or reading the menu without feeling harassed. We have to order before our friend OR ELSE. THEN YOU TELL ME, that you will not serve a paying customer because she will order 5 minutes after us???? That's a joke right???   No joke.    (I smiled while all of this was being screamed at the hostess from my angry brain)  I tried to text Brit, but as she was parking she didn't get back to me quickly enough so we decided to order 3 Waffle breakfasts and hope Brit wasn't allergic to anything in the meal???  Luckily the second the food came out she was there and she enjoyed her waffles.  I with a bad taste in my mouth from that did not enjoy anything after that experience.  Separate and apart from the hostess being a B, the waffles were decent, but not 4.5 stars decent. I would give a solid 3 for those.  Our waiter was clearly embarrassed that we were being blamed for the hostess's mistake and told us that we should take our time and enjoy our breakfast. I wish I had gotten his name because he was the only redeeming factor for this place and why it is getting 2 stars instead of one.  He is white, skinny, 20-something and really chill and relaxed. Nice guy.    I will not be returning and will find another breakfast place just as good in Phoenix, like I have all over the valley.  Plus, with more egg-less options as well!  This place has Pizzeria Bianco syndrome where they think their food is heaven sent and give you garbage service because you should be thankful they even gave you the right to eat there.  No thank you.  The bill was appropriate, not exorbitant.  But if I want to be harassed while I eat my breakfast I'll eat with my parents.   Thanks but no thanks Matt, I wish ye well. But perhaps with a better hostess.

GhknhIGwDg3xco5D-rE_AQ.text: I have been going to Matt's big breakfast since it opened up in that little tiny building. I remember when we could walk in and pick where we wanted to eat but that didn't last very long before everyone had their own experience and word spread fast just how amazing the food is and service has always been very pleasant.  I'm so happy that the moved to the other corner of the block for the larger location. The food is worth the wait  it's just to bad everyone else has to agree. If you are smart and a regular you can time the wait and do something else until you think you will be called next.

004_S4IQiQOk0osoC3wqTg.text: Great place for breakfast. It's a local hotspot in the city of phoenix. I was stoked when they opened one in the airport. All of the food is made from fresh I frequents often from local producers. I got a breakfast burrito. It was bomb, but I wish the potatoes in it were hash browns instead of slices.   Will be back again.

bTHkm4jDsCGKxeeTff3qfw.text: Schrieners chicken enchilada sausage and eggs are amazing!  Waffles are incredible and portions are really big.  I am a breakfast buff and I'm really impressed with the great food and fast service!  Can't wait to come back soon.

h-_k9NyMYNcfTy_4KNA0MQ.text: This place is amazing....the food is delicious and quick...worth the wait all though they said about 1/2 an hour we got seated in 20 mins...the staff is super friendly even though it's really slammed....I got the five spot best egg sandwich I have had in a long time...the organic apple juice is great as well as the strawberry honey lemonade....come down to matts big breakfast :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KQNtnyxj9L05N06PTLQkYQ.text: Matt's has become what some may say is an addiction of mine. I prefer "hobby". But Matt's did make it into our wedding vows. (True story.) You see, since I first tasted the glory of the Five Spot, I've basically made it a point to get one on every available weekend day. So my wife thought it wise to pledge support publicly in front of friends and family for my perhaps less-than-healthy "hobby".  The wife works a lot of weekends, and I've found out that the Five Spot can travel the 10 minutes or so to my home largely intact. A perfectly balanced combination of spot-on eggs, melted cheese, grilled onions, and THE best bacon possible makes this the absolute best egg sandwich I've ever had.   Every ingredient is so delightfully high quality that the sandwich shines, bursting forth with flavor and cholesterol and existential angst. (Or, as some might call it, "maple syrup that I dip it in".)   Make sure you order a side of home fries. They're specifically not included with the sandwich which is "how they get ya", but I can't go without. Crisp, delicious potatoes served with a few sprigs of rosemary and... also dipped in syrup.   I had over 140 check-ins to Matt's before they moved and Yelp created a new profile for them. Every single one of them? A Five Spot with Home Fries. I'm pretty sure if you ordered a "Chris", that's what you'd get at this point.   Their waffles are amazing too, along with basically everything else on the menu. Absolutely perfectly fluffy, flavorful, and delicious, from what I've stolen off the wife's plate. And Erenia and the rest of the staff are as kind and amazing as can be.  The wait is rough, there's no doubt about that. But whereas most breakfast places slog along with watery eggs, sub-par, see-through bacon, horrible, waxy cheese, and no twists or turns, Matt's gets it perfectly right every time. Or at least all 140 times and counting.

9Muw4oDP55FSX-Jl-ksLzA.text: Oh my...oh my gosh!!   I love breakfast, and this place is at the top three for my favorite spots.   So I kind of eat like a dude, I'm not going to lie! This place happens to be one of the few restaurants that fills me up! It might be their amazing fresh potatoes, I swear to you they put some magical unknown ingredient in their potatoes and hash browns. Or maybe it's their daily egg scramble specials that just happen to ALWAYS be amazing. No, no...I'd say it's their fresh bread with their homemade jelly. Okay...let's be real here, it's their BACON!!! I love bacon and they make it absolutely heavenly.  Another thing to try are their pancakes. They might just be the best pancakes I have ever had. Simple buttermilk pancakes, nothing added...they are to die for. Try them, you'll keep kicking yourself in the butt if you don't!  Oh, there will be a wait...BUT IT'S SOOOOO WORTH IT!

0wHXtn8Tnwf0h5BNsI9Row.text: Really delicious breakfast. Super cute location and friendly staff! We'll definitely be back to try more things

CqUaDadXq-afoEDVxzd4qg.text: This place is nothing short of amazing. Although very busy, the wait wasn't very long at all and we even got our food in a reasonable amount of time. I got the biscuits and gravy special and it was phenomenal. You could tell that all the ingredients were made from scratch and very fresh. The eggs, potatoes and main course. Everything simply amazing. But what REALLY stood out to me was the strawberry lemonade. Hands down the best glass I've ever had in my LIFE! You could tell even that was made with fresh squeezed lemons and strawberries. It was amazing. This place lived up to its hype and I will DEFINITELY be back next time I'm in Phoenix.

wMUyzUR4sjpFnf11mYD_Kw.text: After a hike, my friend suggested that we go here for breakfast. She has been wanting to try this place for a while. Of the two locations, we chose the one in Phoenix. The wait was a bit longer than I expected. When we got in, the place was packed. I'm not a huge fan of crowded spaces. However, the food was great! I ordered the special, which was a Mexican style dish. It was egg cooked with meat, cheese, and jalapenos served with potatos and tortillas. YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily special

RFT5YAoQFGGJyTSB7A-orw.text: Our valet guy suggested that we try this place out since it was on one of the food shows so we walked over to try it out!  The walk over wasn't too bad, it wasn't too hot and it was overcast but we did come across the original location of the restaurant. So small and CUTE with its vintage vibe!  We arrived at a good time, just as we put our name on the list, a line of people arrived that bumped up from our 10 min wait became 30 mins for everyone behind us. I ordered the daily special - Three Egg Scramble. It had jalapenos, onions, chorizo, cheese and came w/ a huge tortilla. I hoped that it wasn't spicy but it was just a tad spicy for my taste. Flavorful but spicy. The hubs tried and and he said it wasn't spicy but our palettes can be very different when it comes to food.  Staff was very friendly and nice. It's not just the one person that takes your order that serves you, it was kind of nice. Our drinks were always full, we had all that we needed as soon as we asked for something, it was very refreshing to experience such service.   Will def be back when in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Original location. So much smaller!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s Special: Three Egg Scramble
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese Omelet

pd9ia9pUbabEUh3Ac0PbbQ.text: 3/5 due to customer service and the food not being amazing just good. My family was in town and we were in the area and we were looking for a place with great reviews and Matt's Big Breakfast was up there. After reading the reviews and eating, I honestly wasn't that impressed.  When we first arrived we were asked to sit wherever there was a menu on the table. The menu was very simple, just a few breakfast and lunch options.  We ordered: the cheese omelet (had to pay extra for meat & veggies), the chop & chick, the skinny , salami scramble and a coffee = $53 before tip. We did like the fact that they had a healthier option.  I was hoping there would be a great coffee selection being that it's a local breakfast shop in the valley but they  only had basic coffee, we appreciate it being freshly brewed and my mom said the coffee wasn't bitter. So that was good.   When our food came out, the two ladies that brought out or food were honestly kind of rude.. I didn't say anything until my sister whispered over to me.. "attitude much?" So then I confirmed that I wasn't the only one thinking that.  As mentioned our food was okay, not really that impressed with the breakfast. I almost regret not just driving home from the event we were at that morning and making everything we ordered at home. Nevertheless, I do want to give props to that jam & hot sauce they make in house... AMAZING! The blueberry jam had a splash of citrus making a great touch with my toast and the hot sauce was not to spicy and very tangy which is right up my alley!  Our waitress did turn our experience around at the end with her smiling more and seeing if we needed anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The infamous blueberry jam! Yum!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salami scramble (I added cheese)
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1SJCVVUKOy8STt-PMpg0yA.text: I was asked for a breakfast recommendation so I suggested Matt's.  My team was impressed and they all thought it was delicious. The eggs Benedict were pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PCBhxT5qsR7kmYe5gGV-0A.text: Here in Tempe on business and was looking for a place to grab breakfast that was near my hotel.  Matt's sits in a large commercial building facility directly across the street for ASU Sun Devil Stadium.  On the other side of the restaurant is the canal which offers a beautiful view and a great boardwalk to walk off your meal.  The restaurant is spacious and offers seats at a bar, traditional tables and outdoor seating as well. The bathrooms were clean, as was the all of the surfaces in the restaurant (for those with germ phobia).   There were only a handful of people eating breakfast when I was there so not sure how well they can maintain the cleanliness when the place is bumping with a pre football game Bloody Mary crowd.  the menu was straight forward with a bit of creativity. I ordered a skinny breakfast. The portion was perfect for a large person with an appetite who is trying to eat healthy.   They let me substitute salad for fresh melons for $1 up charge. The service was really good, smiles all around and very attentive without invading your personal space.   Given a few more visits and sampling more of their dishes, Matt's could easily be upgraded to 5 stars.  Good on Yah

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skinny breakfast with Mellon bowl and english breakfast tea
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Specials
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menus

C0YgBetI79T9JF_G5McgRA.text: My sister came into town today and we decided to have breakfast. I knew exactly where to take her since we were going to be downtown anyway. This was the perfect day and a perfect place.   This was the first breakfast spot I was introduced to when moving here. I remember going to the original building and putting my name down on the list then waking over to see what the farmers market had to offer while wait about 30-45 mins. For some reason it never bothers me to wait here.  I have tried many things on the menu, but my favorite choice is the hot & chick. It's simple. I get eggs over easy, hash browns, bacon, as well as wheat toast with a bit of jam. I love that the toast is buttered and hearty, the whole meal is good. I love that they don't have any fancy shmancy creamers or anything over the top.  It's just plain ol' coffee, cream and raw sugar. Today was a good day.   Check me out on IG @Rezzilient for more

JUCIuPkvhtXgKZADa0LVig.text: The service was good and the food was bomb everything was fresh and very very delicious

KQmP2zGlaPLkk4_UGrLYXw.text: The best breakfast I have ever had.  It was so simple and just purely great quality ingredients.  Nothing fancy just what they do, they do unbelievably well.  The bacon was slabs from heaven.  Thick cut, chewy, crunchy on the ends and covered in course ground pepper that created an amazing crust.  I ate this as slow as humanly possible and saved one last bite for the end so that my mouth and fingers would smell like bacon.  The eggs were cooked perfectly and you could taste the quality.  The hash browns were so so crispy but inside soft and potatoey!  I loved them.  The homemade sourdough bread was light and airy with a softer, chewy crust.  The strawberry preserves were not too sweet and so fresh.  The pancake was delicious but didn't blow my mind.  Still they had me at bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancake
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick
