Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon from heaven

80wIq0Mv4rVzSYi4TiwDRg.text: Stopped in for a Saturday morning breakfast with my boyfriend while in town for a conference. We did have to wait a while to be seated, but that's expected at any respected breakfast place on a weekend morning.  I got the special of the day that was filled with jalapenos. The portion was sizeable, but it was delicious and SO spicy. The hash browns were perfectly crispy outside and creamy inside, and they and the tortillas helped cut the heat of the scramble.  The coffee was also on point. Would definitely go back if I'm in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special on a Saturday morning: scramble with spicy sausage and jalapeños. The hash browns are so good!

cGhG9PJ5-pVLVuS-So6PZg.text: The food and service is fantastic! It's a good amount of food that's filling, delicious,  and the service is The only thing is its $30 for two meals; but it IS located in downtown Phoenix and you do get a lot of food on your plate. I got the skinny and I couldn't eat another bite after that. Also, they dont have fountain drinks, so I'd say that's the only real downside to this restaurant, but other than that, I'd recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SAaMW20te--tzJLv1OQHwg.text: This place is great. I've been here once before a couple years ago and I just stumbled upon it again today. I'm not sure if I noticed last time but I noticed this time that Guy Fieri has been here. They promptly greet you when you walk in. And they table waiting game is on. It doesn't take long even when it's packed.   I ordered the pork chop and eggs with a side of fried tomatoes. The pork chop is simple but good. The eggs were cooked how I requested. The tomatoes were good too. Moms plate was different. Kind of a custom order. It was very good she says. I didn't get a bite so I think it had to be great. Lol. The strawberry lemonade is good too. The vibe is fast paced servers and medium paced comfortable dining.   I think they handle a busy restaurant pretty well and they're friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WE5Z78wHnyR24r0Bpe_6iA.text: Omg!! This place is always packed. Every time I visit phx I want to try since I've gotten many recommendations. Finally on a week day got in. I'm sorry to say it totally lives up to the hype but I hate passing the word around. It's one of those places you want to keep to yourself so when you have a craving which I now do...you can just grab it. Anyway I had the absolute best waffle.. if you like a lil crunchy on outside but moist in middle with a hint of sweet & REAL maple syrup and real sweet cream butter... see you there

zc5C9hyyuwJ9SfymDW0oSw.text: Finally made it to Matt's Big Breakfast and it was great! This was our first stop of the weekend. We arrived around 9AM on a Friday and it was busy! Luckily our wait was only 3 mins. Everyone was extremely friendly and sat us quick. It definitely made the overall experience really positive.  I opted for the Chop and the Chick and enjoyed it! The chop was decently sized and had a good flavor. It was cooked on the more well done side and I didn't mind. The eggs were nice and fluffy. They were smooth and not rubbery. Lastly the hash browns were nice and crispy!! I really like them with a little ketchup. Oh and don't forget about the toast. It's not your typical bs sliced bread. Definitely tasted like that homemade bread. It was nice and soft and had a good flavor.   Definitely come early if don't want to wait. If you are coming alone or a couple you might get lucky with a counter seat. The food cranks out pretty fast. There are a bunch of street parking around the neighborhood. The service was exceptional and definitely memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chop and Chick

tp2odDp3NSgxMyHV9UARmA.text: Across the street from a church, we came on a Sunday morning.  Street parking; we had trouble getting the meter to read our card(s); others had trouble getting their read too (I wasn't apparent if there's no meter on Sundays).  About a 20 minute wait, but there are lots of seats and benches to wait on. Busy place, waitstaff is friendly and on top of everything.    Menu was varied plus specials; I was pleased to find something that wasn't too heavy but on my weight plan.  I had "The Skinny", hubby had "Hog & Chick".  Tables and bar seating, great service.  Food was served quickly, hot and perfect portions.  Lots of sauce options too.  Featured on Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives, Season 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Behind the bar
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Table Seating
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ketchup

oY0rNWYFtq8GtpMMqbzXOg.text: Not sure what I can add with the 1,500++++ Yelp reviews.......  This place is on point.   Worth the 30 minute wait, yes you will wait.   The outside waiting area has a lot of benches and it is nice to soak up the morning sun rise.   Interestingly enough, the hotel down the street, with their $30 a night rooms brought us some lively waiting entertainment.   Two men were yelling at each other, drunk or on crack.......  I thought they were going to throw down but after 15 mins, the police showed up.......  Nothing really happened, but it was amusing......  I went with the Chop and Chick.   The eggs are perfect, over easy with an ultra bright deep orange yoke - one of the best tasting eggs I have ever had.  The pork chop was average size and thickness, perfect for breakfast, great flavor and seasoning.   The hash browns will take up half the plate, if you are a fan of crispy, this is the one.   Awesome!  I would like to mention their branded ketchup and hot sauce.  Yummy!  The staff is great and hustles.   Overall a great experience.

JAlvzdgnUDJKbC0O0AWQbg.text: This was the third time we visited Matt's. The first time was amazing. The second time the food was awful. This time they wanted to sit us at a table crammed up against the wall with no room to change our minds. Asked if we could sit at a larger table and was promptly told no. So, we left. Such a shame. Really wanted to try them again but at this rate, never going back. We'll find another restaurant willing to work with us for our money.

X5aw0sHzBdIYfDNtPZU31Q.text: The breakfast was a shock for me. This Oasis really was a blessing. I was craving something Heavy yet familiar after w long flight. The parking was a little challenging but i found a spot eventually. Thanks again

P_3Y_MsIJiIiylLZ8dYr3A.text: Egg Salad Sandwich was ok...too much bread and not enough salad :-( was a bit disappointing. You see it right? It looks so big...but it was all bread. I will also say, the bread in the middle, away from the toast was delicious but the thin crust, was akin to a rubber band, almost impossible to chew.  I almost gave up but eventual got threw it.   The macaroni salad was "meh" as well, kind of the same taste as the one made at home, just less sauce. Not worth the upcharge, should have just stayed with the chips.  The saving grace, my friends meal (she bragged the whole time...argh!)  As you can see my friend had Eggs Benedict and looks delicious. She said it was excellent and the Hollandaise was one of the best she has ever had (I'm going to try next time). She said the potatoes were awesome too...and I got one...she is a selfish punk ;-) but they were good.  Great seasoning, just the right amount!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Full View

V_dl82zL4Ri-otWFIpYIaw.text: First impression is that it's super busy at 8:30 in the morning which is usually a good thing.  The service was super quick, friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was super good and would definitely recommend this place!

8Q4iDyYQpHEDk3T-2c3Yrg.text: The wait wasn't as bad as it normally looked to be so we checked it out. Waited about 17 minutes which is reasonable. Once inside the menu seemed to rotate a bit. The breakfast options were pretty classic, things like hash browns, eggs, toast, and pancakes. The food was good and the portions are sufficient for the price. My cousin and I got out under 30 bucks and even added a pancake to our meal. The staff was nice and attentive which seems difficult because it's packed. It's cool if you're looking for a clean homestyle breakfast.

4CyLDAC_QyI037AHDd_Dlg.text: everything was sooo fresh and the service was great. Fresh organic apple juice to go with chop n chick!   crowded and I know why the food is impeccable cooked perfectly

vE2hy8fPFFoI74dn767I7g.text: Everyone knows that Matt's is one of the must-go places in Phoenix for breakfast, which is demonstrated by the long lines on the weekends and the rants and raves from out-of-towners.   The food is fantastic! I have never had a bad meal and the service is top notch. I love breakfast food, and Matt's knows exactly what they are doing!  However, I'm not sure I completely understand the popularity. I only go during the week because while its good, its not "waiting outside for an hour" good. There are a lot of great places in Phoenix for breakfast that are right in line with Matt's.   Don't get me wrong, if you pass by and there isn't a line, by all means get in there and get some bacon. But if there is too long of a line, walk a few blocks to Phoenix Public Cafe.

SYA3cAhqlJuP3dobow1d1Q.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is hands down the best breakfast spot. The wait can be a little long sometimes but it's 100% worth it once that special comes out. Living in walking distance is dangerous

9RPxZCYjpg8W4xKyGfjw3Q.text: It was alright. The food was really good, but the portions were pretty small. There are only seven or so options in the entire menu. The bacon was amazing, so definitely get something with that. No avocado or tobasco sauce unfortunately. The hash browns have a lot of butter, so they actually taste more like mashed potatoes.

-7WuyJ7wvZhrCkRMpq2RoQ.text: In a word...Magical.  The best breakfast you'll ever have.  Homemade breads, sausage (cherry & bourbon was the special one day)...   Ate breakfast everyday of our trip.  Had heard about it from DDD and after all these years business sent us out there.  You know when you work up a place in your head to be great....this place exceeded expectations.  Great staff, friendly, amazing food.   ENJOY!  -  Mal from NJ

iNP-IA9cXUs5u2H4RxTC5g.text: Eggs are eggs, let's face it, but Matt does the other things very well. For starters, the home fries are phenomenal. This is how they should be done. The orange juice is squeezed there and it's very tasty. The toast is enormous and the jam they make there, which is great if you love strawberry. I didn't have the bacon, but it looked and smelled phenomenal. However, the real winner is the pancakes. They were really well done and probably the best I've ever had. They has a very unique taste I can only compare to the buttery taste of Ritz crackers. Putting the maple syrup on it was actually a travesty; do it without the syrup. Overall, great breakfast spot.

qSWGw_tn0P9XItH8lgGhiw.text: Was in Phoenix visiting from California and found this place on Yelp. Food was amazing only bad part is i couldn't eat more and its so far away from home. I ordered a waffle and it was super delicious. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area.

PdgxE2RzrH2g48WL03v3aw.text: Really yummy. I recommend this place. Except they brought out a few tablespoons of syrup in a little cup for my waffle. When I needed more they said I'd have to pay more for it bc it's "real" syrup. My hubby and I had a laugh about it bc why not just charge a few cents more for a waffle that comes with enough syrup?  Oh well!

Kg8nUrQRQGRAtFGlrMh3sA.text: Food is good.  But extremely slow service.  This is my second time and both times its 15 + minutes for takeout.   Completely unacceptable where people are trying to catch flights.

MpHkpoJmmPwL1XzFnuriRQ.text: Went later on Sunday and waited for 45 min for two people, very irritating...when we eventually were served the food was just..OK. I've eaten at many similar type restaurants in So. Cal, like Good Stuff, Scottys, Joe's etc. and Matts food doesn't even come close to quantity, quality or imagination to qualify the more pricey menu for such food...I saw burned hashbrowns and bacon pass me by on its way to being served...Was extremely disappointed and drove 50 miles to try....however, people are lined out the door...just not that imaginative! Come on Arizona!

A5wRtj4-P4I2iXpWHgFflg.text: So, it turns out the place should have been called Matt's Semi-Pretentious Yet Tasty Breakfast. Had the Chicken & Artichoke Sausage with organic baby spinach and Fontina cheese scramble, breakfast potatoes and rustic sourdough toast. Quite tasty... but not the blue spoon diner I thought we we're walking into with the name like "Matt's Big Breakfast". It was not a big breakfast. Coffee was slow to refill and waitresses were a bit inattentive. Food gets 4-stars, service gets 3.

68k832-Gt_zcHO-NKLu0VA.text: My boyfriend and I were passing through Phoenix on a road trip and I heard about all the good reviews about Matt's so we decided to try it. The wait to be seated was about 40 minutes but it was definitely worth it! They're wheat bread and strawberry preserves were incredible along with everything else on our plate. Too bad we don't live closer otherwise I would be here all the time!

_Im5nooptFzM8n3S4fuTOA.text: While popular, we were still able to get a seat at the bar pretty quick for a Saturday morning. I'm surprised it wasn't a longer wait to be seated!  The scrambled eggs were the best my girlfriend had had and my ham, green chile, and jack cheese scramble (their special for the day) was exceptional.  The homefries and hash browns were both fantastic and the toast was great. Probably one of the best breakfasts out I've had in a long time. Definitely going to go back next time I'm in town.

7Va01XK6w7q9_YV4I1KfaA.text: Great food, large portions. The lemonade is very good (star berry, as well as blueberry).

r9ZRV5et5yUyawjNB844Gw.text: We have tried this twice now and won't go back.  the noise level is so high you can't hear yourself think.  the tables are crowded together and the prices are as high as the noise level without the quality.

aHSpfipw-N5Qwf41we-fow.text: We went here today. I must say it was the best breakfast spot my family been too. I had the oats and it was delish. My husband had the special. It was the buttermilk biscuits and sausage gravy. It was absolutely incredible. And my kiddo got pancakes! The were fluffy and oh so good. Run don't walk here!! Great place!

fi5VrS_bsuI8N-XKOlQL2Q.text: This is hands down my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. Their food just tastes like food should! There's a reason that there are always lines of people waiting to get inside; it's just THAT GOOD.

psaWDzRxE7A9LZ07K69u0w.text: What can I say.... I LOVE MATT'S BIG BREAKFAST! Everything I have had there has been fabulous.  The atmosphere is friendly. The food, while traditional, old fashioned comfort breakfast, which has the real butters and goodies that make their wonderful recipes taste so yummy, it is absolutely, hands down the best breakfast place I know! I am hooked on their waffles! If you go during peak times, expect a wait.  There are many dedicated Matt's aficionados.

JArFYZB3fh39DxCj7F5Zug.text: Best breakfast in Phoenix, or anywhere else I've been.  The toast is soaked with butter, it seems as though a quarter stick per slice was used.  It is tasty but probably not the most healthful, if you're in to that sort of thing.  Small small building and busy busy busy.   If you are dining with the sort of person who demands that they be treated as though they are special and likes to order around the waiters, you may want to go somewhere less crowded.

WyUH20QRDUEuRovHhv9_fA.text: The seasoned steak fries have no seasoning, they were out of all the best beers, and portion size was awful.

USgxqlNAVpvbQytldViy9w.text: Matt's is one of my go to breakfast spots in Phoenix. I've been coming here for about 2 years now and they never disappoint.  Nothing fancy on the menu; just basic meals made incredibly well with freshness you can taste. I'm vegetarian so I can't comment on the meat but the pancakes, waffles, omelettes and potatoes are perfect. Even their toast and jelly is amazing. AND they have real maple syrup!  Only downside is the wait time to be seated on weekends (which doesn't personally bother me, they're a great restaurant so you expect it). But, once you are seated and order, the food comes fast!

uGWmh-tjauBoZBfX4DPvVg.text: Sorry Matt, this was my third visit and became ILL from the FOOD.  I had brunch around 11am with my wife and brother. My brother and I both ordered the same item "French Toast",  1-1/2 hours later he and I experienced the same VERY ILL STOMACH!  Oh, one other suggestion, every movement in your establishment creates a decibel of sound.  Now add that up to a full house times a thousand movements...well you get the picture. I suggest sound abatment at least on the ceiling that way you could keep the character of the interior and serve your patrons best. Well that's my 2 cents worth.

AYMDafuwHPZxUPmDWb4zfA.text: Delicious!!!  Crowded and loud but food was fabulous!  Service was great and will be back to try more!

j62ZqtObSYMDuOKUbmTtxA.text: Breakfast is always consistent but customer service isn't. It suck that the service is not consistent. I come here like 3-4 times a week . Well looks like I'm going to have to find a different spot .

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop not so good

HRfANrrT03ng3gfFipRm9g.text: Our first stop when arriving in Phoenix! It was fantastic the very vegetarian friendly! I loved my veggie omelet and my boys said the best waffles ever! Definitely a must while in the Phoenix area

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1xUHWvJvbZ7d8S1yeBUTJQ.text: They have the best bacon in town. I'm sure it is sourced locally. If you find yourself downtown at breakfast time, do yourself a favor and drop by for some fresh O.J., coffee, and anything on the menu (that includes bacon). There is many times a wait, especially on weekends. Allow an extra 15 minutes in case.

jKUOuGYIxnukpK4Vna5KSQ.text: I love their food, but the server behind the bar is consistently way to busy to take care of the customer! Any refills on coffee water etc you have to ask. She is very busy and I feel like because she is so busy the service gets neglected! The restraunt is awesome just wish service could improve since half the experience of going to a place like this is the great service. The last time I was here it was the same service from the same seat from the same server. Ugh we will see if I come back next time!!!

2X_ci1baByydFd-OxtuDlQ.text: Came here for brunch. Cute little restaurant in a nice area of Phoenix. Had an omelette Ava country potatoes. Really yummy.. They allow for substitutions.  Not too many options on the menu. However the options they have satisfy many taste buds. I think there's another location make sure you choose the right one.

KCdEQBrCq6bRYpICpwXmzQ.text: Let's just say thank you yelper for getting me pretty solid reviews on this place so we don't spent a lot of time figuring out some of the must haves.  This is consider one of the decent breakfast I had in awhile.  Coming from LA area we had tons of authentic breakfast here and there, but we focus so much on specialties and yet we forget the traditional american style breakfast is liked.  Let's get to it!  Food=  4/5 nothing special made but the portion and the quality is decent to pass expectation.  The sausage is kind of overrated in my opinion, but the sandwish is a must have for first timers.  Service= 5/5 the food came so fast we don't even have the time to prepare ourselves after setting up our kids in their high-chair which is pretty solid.  When it gets busy you tends to lose their attention but when you ask any of the passing by servers, they will get to it ASAP.  The managers and the owner of the business were very friendly with greets. Wait time= 4/5 the wait can be long but we were able to get right through due to early arrival @ 6:45AM.  The parkings fill up in the back pretty quick. Location= 5/5 the location is right by the freeway so it's pretty hard to ignore/miss in my opinion.  I would give a solid 4.5 but in this case I will give them a 5 since the experience was very pleasant; this is what a good restaurant should be like.

IEKFL35Pf7ijls4MKRbUbg.text: WOW!!  What an amazing find!!  Breakfast was incredible, service was fantastic...definitely coming back again!!!

s94BYWctmLJsasgYwuFLKg.text: Bravo Matt's Big Breakfast! What a great meal we had during our first trip to this place. We both got the Saturday Special which was a scramble with chicken enchilada sausage, eggs, home fries, jalapenos, cheese, and a flour tortilla. The plate was bursting with fresh tasting flavors. The wait was only about 35 min. He food is worth the wait. I love Snooze but I have to say this place beats it in flavor and quality of food. Snooze has a wider range of selections tho. My only knock against Matt's would be the limited choices on the menu. The entire staff was great and the service was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Saturday Special Scramble was amaze!!! Thanks Jeans

Uz4qN-4iQ2dE0q9e6AQzwg.text: Great breakfast! Everything was fresh and real. I had biscuits w/sausage gravy, scrambled egg, home fries. SO had Belgian waffle with sausage. I would definitely recommend.

vLA2T2wJFcnK1GCADKtr-Q.text: Not a fan at all! I randomly woke up one Saturday morning and researched the best breakfast in Phoenix. Matt's big breakfast was really close and voted very good. I showed up, drove around forever looking for parking, waited in line for 30min to be seated, then had very mediocre at best food. Overpaid for boring food, soda sold by the can, so no free refills. Very bad experience. Food wasn't good enough to recommend. We left very unsatisfied, then I believe went to burger king to satisfy our stomach

zZqS1KJw0SYD0poHtrBhfw.text: SO GOOD!!! Found this gem via Yelp and all the other great yelp reviews so my bf and I decided to check it out on a Saturday afternoon 3 weeks ago. There was a 20 minute wait for only bar seating, but the brunch was definitely worth the 20 minutes we waited!  I ordered the waffle (amazing, so tasty) with bacon and my bf ordered the pancakes with hash browns. Pancakes were good, but the waffle hit the spot - so I'd highly recommend getting the waffle.

jvmF_6Z5smr4Rzg2s3hY-w.text: Love this place!!!  I was able to get seated immediately.  Service was excellent.  The food was awesome.  Definitely recommend the waffle.  This location was great but unfortunately cannot say the same about the airport location.  Service was extremely slow for being in the airport.  Would definitely recommend the downtown location though.  I will be back next time in Phoenix.

O3Rx9GhO7cC9ahfIUjv9-A.text: Wish I  of found this place  years ago.   You'd never know it from the store front but if your looking for a great breakfast look no further.    Matt's is great. The staff is accommodating, the food is amazing, and the prices are very reasonable. The quality of the ingredients is evident in every bite. Matt's takes breakfast to a new level.  Matt's Big Breakfast is just that..BIG..  Matt's serves Classic breakfast food with a twist of unique combinations and freshness.  On my first visit I had the salami and eggs, home style potatoes  with sourdough toast and homemade peach preserves. All I can say about the peach preserves (which is made daily at Matt's) is   AMAZINGLY ADDICTING.  Try it Your taste buds will thank you.  So if you love breakfast like I do  give Matt's BIG Breakfast a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-Ip6rDIFPb5Kxv5XYJAVXA.text: Great spot for breakfast. Hash browns were awesome along with cheese omelet/onions/ mushrooms and sourdough bread. Cool spot in Roosevelt Row.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sX_F-I4iDB2hsWeICq5zWg.text: Food was good but the service wasn't very good and we sat at the bar. It was hard to get hot water for my tea or coffee refills. There was very little attention given to everyone who was sitting at the bar. There was not that many people there so there was no reason for the lack of service. Out of the other locations this was the worst service.

TO00RLnjV2KrZVAcVPP6Fg.text: I was really pleased with breakfast here! What's great about Matt's is they do all the basics right. EVERYTHING is flavorful and delicious, down to toast. It's evident REAL, and FRESH ingredients are used. It's when you can get the basics right and genuinely delicious is when you have a gem on your hands. Matt's, open one is the Sierra Vista area!

zeTrZk6k4m7cd5wuxB3qSg.text: The food was unique according to breakfast standards. All the staff were very friendly and able to provide excellent service - even with all customers. The food was delivered quickly and tasty, and the waitress behind the bar was always quick to refill my coffee and ice water during my stay here, I Recommend.

Qj6EGJf_eGbjCEUJMt0gfA.text: The food was good and the customer service was great,  but not sure if the wait is worth being a regular diner here... there was a fantastic coffee shop less than a block to the east where we spent some time while waiting for a table.

nHJYce5cPECbATPBojnurg.text: I landed at the Phoenix airport and wanted a quick sandwich before my next flight. This isn't the place. The service is slow and the staff is inattentive. Had the waitstaff been working and not not talking or standing around, the service could be better. Hopefully their chicken sandwich will be worth the wait.

tffTFblOLbyDKTQWdhMj_g.text: First time here was on a Tuesday morning around 10:30.  I've always heard this place was busy so I thought we'd be good at this time.  We were able to be seated right away but I was still amazed on how many people were there for breakfast at this hour.  Atmosphere was a little noisy but service was quick.  The coffee was just right for my liking, and I had the scrambled eggs with salami with side of hash browns and wheat toast.  I had actually ordered the home fries but got hash browns, which was perfectly ok because they were amazing.  The strawberry jam was fantastic as well.  I'll be going back.

dvTCqnGks8W0E0WP-a9Q3Q.text: Great menu, albeit limited.  Unique dishes that make it hard to choose.

DRYcP7FcCgT7xl-acZjxbg.text: Food was great... wait was long but it was because of how popular that place was. The employees were very friendly.

Fj0BZ8_eTIv7gI3s28lt0Q.text: visiting the area and got this recommendation from yelp. One of the best breakfasts I have had.  The food came out hot and fresh cooked. I had a basic breakfast eggs, potatoes and sausage, good good good.  not much to look at from the exterior but this was a great breakfast.  only reason no five star, canned soft drinks.

Qf0fV37xRWEZm9oH5thBYg.text: Hidden gem downtown Phoenix.  Service was fast & friendly, and the pancakes fluffy & perfect for soaking up butter and syrup.  And it's a great deal to boot.  Love this place.

S4rX5ONSJ1bOhfF6LNYmgg.text: Just about the best waffle and bacon I've ever had... Wow! Excellent coffee and service too.

DLGKFJA536_4mhestAgdIQ.text: One of my best friends brought me here one morning and I had the Monday special which was huevos rancheros. It was simplicity delicious! Solid flavours and great coffee to go along with, I've been here on a few other occasions and I now favor the egg omelette and fresh brewed tea, it is a must have. Just make sure to arrive early as space can sometimes be limited especially on the weekend.

7vivaxUu8wOA8IJRXtx-iA.text: Best dang breakfast in Phoenix, fresh homemade and delish.  Definnitely worht the 45 minute wait.  The potatoes are to die for and the pork chop is, well what can I say you just have to try it out.

Ihds7uq-ru6X30A_FBWmBQ.text: Wow - just delicious food. Fairly limited menu and nothing fancy but the food was just fantastic. So much of it was made in house (including the bread and strawberry preserves). Their fresh squeezed honey lemonade was awesome. It gets pretty busy on the weekends but I can see why. I wish we had something like this in Tucson!

XDWIVzaTrMBERbz7mmOXRA.text: Everything was well worth the wait to get in.  The food was delicious and while a small menu a nice variety of items.  The homemade strawberry preserves were SO good I was eating them with a spoon once all my bread was gone.

TOkwsaYqRtTapJsnqhfzBg.text: Get take out or go late in the morning to avoid the long wait. Aside from that, this was the best breakfast I've ever had. Period. The pancakes were perfect. I didn't know pancakes could be this good. The bacon and hashbrowns were equally amazing. You might ask, how can you improve upon bacon, hashbrowns, and pancakes?  A fair question. The answer is, go try it and find out, you slacker.

0LzffzcJX07y_CaN6aIx0A.text: Great atmosphere and service. Fresh, home cooked breakfast with house made blueberry preserves for the yummy while-wheat toast. I had the scrambled eggs with salami - the salami reminded me of our trip to France. My husband had traditional eggs and bacon. The bacon is thick and peppered. I had the famous home fries - potatoes, onions, and fresh rosemary - great flavor an huge portion. I will ask for a small side next time! I hope Yelp updates the address - they've moved a few doors down. Try out Matt's Big Breakfast next time you are downtown in Phoenix.

LycBoGvrCPOOz0HGby6tfQ.text: Wow this is good breakfast food! I am so impressed with the food scene in Phoenix, it really could rival Philly or New York pretty soon. So I got the strawberry honey lemonade (divine!), pancakes (HUGE for 1 order- my boyfriend and I could have split one order, live and learn) and hash browns. I was so full I barely touched the hash browns and could not remember why I ordered them- I felt I needed them, for some reason. But they come in the shape of a pizza slice with a crunchy outer crust. Matt's Little Breakfast it certainly was not but we were thrilled to discover this place in our quest for pancakes!

TAbptTChjI6aH1w4TeYtLg.text: My husband and I just moved downtown and were excited to explore the local breakfast places. Matt's was within walking distance so it was one of the first places we tried. We did have to wait a little bit but they have a nice seating area outside with water for those hot days :-) we were so glad we waited because the food was outstanding! Reasonably priced, fun atmosphere and great food. We can't wait to go again!

X9R4px9IQ2LqTLUBsrcT9Q.text: The service  was good however  the food  was very greasy.  The ham was very salty and the rosemary  potatoes  was full of oil. Not allot to chose from the menu. Had a waffle  for dessert  and was really  good.

RU1IBb1WUcpjDWaBMtnx6g.text: We are breakfast at the airport location.  Great service and quality food.  We ordered The Five Spot and the Hog & Chick.  Bacon was excellent.  Just simple great quality food with a smile.

MSNPBxXMP-sa9RNpWpG7qw.text: Matt's has well thought out food (although not a TON of options), quick service, and a nice ambiance.  Even though the service is quick, the wait to get a table might be long.  This is a popular tourist and local spot but worth a little wait.  The coffee is roasted locally in Cave Creek and the Cinnamon walnut toast is pretty awesome.

eqFSBdgrZn3lRLd51AbRIA.text: This place is now one of my favs. You can tell it is a staple for Phoenix. Definitely a place you take your friends who are visiting from out of town. I had the five spot, which is a breakfast sandwich is better than you think it would be. Great and fresh two eggs with bacon and cheese! Yummy! I also got some homefries which are seasoned with rosemary and olive oil. Those are good as well. My girlfriend got the Reuben which she said was one of the best she had. The mustard has a horseradish flavor which I'm not too fond of but it went well with the sandwich. My other friend that was with us had the egg salad and she said it was bomb! I also had the blueberry honey lemonade which was great. It was a little pulpy but not too sweet and not too tart. My girlfriend had the strawberry lemonade which was less pulpy and a little more tart. Both were great. Overall a great experience and we will be back again!

S_uYFLgK3Z-G72jnxcV2wg.text: This is how mornings should always start - and personally this is exactly what most of my Phoenix mornings have offered.   Get up, get going, stop at Matt's. Friendly greetings and superfluous amounts of hot coffee - admittedly in the thin end of the scale, but then again I love my coffee most when it's stronger than me.  The daily menu is big and full of energy, way larger than a serving should be -  in other words, an average american size. Over a couple of days I had pancakes, hash browns, fries, goat cheese, ham, bacon, lot's of chilly and so many eggs that I had to send friendly thoughts to every egg-lovers favorite scientist, Ying Rong of Huazhong University of Science and Technology ("Higher consumption of eggs is not associated with increased risk of coronary heart disease or stroke"). It's a nice touch that they use real butter and cage-free egg production.   I like the place even better than the food. The place is vivacious, all customers seem happy in the loud way. Sunday was crowded and full of groups of families and friends. Going alone I mostly sit in the bar area - which creates opportunities to talk to other people. Had an interesting conversation with a local cop one day and a student the next, and of course morning banter with the staff.   Get up, get going, stop at Matt's.

zUMtlU50TZrLhDhORbuYlQ.text: Finally had an opportunity to stop here for breakfast and our timing was perfect!  No wait, but within seconds of being seated the entry filled up with hungry folks waiting on a table.  I was surprised (and a little disappointed) that the breakfast menu didn't have more selections/variety.  Once we had ordered, the food was good.  Oddly enough, I liked the thick, fresh wheat toast with home made strawberry preserves.  The liberal application of fresh rosemary in the cottage fries was nice as were the sweet, caramelized onions.  The special this morning was a Schreiner's Sicilian sausage scramble.  It was excellent and I appreciate utilizing local products.    Even though a couple of the tables around me were obviously business appointments, I wouldn't recommend it for two reasons, 1) the wait you can expect, and 2) the noise level makes it hard to conduct a meeting.  This is a good spot, the wait staff is very attentive and friendly.  I have no problem recommending it or returning.

MVlzjChDgQP5Rr5ShoueNQ.text: This is probably the only place I will eat at alone. The staff is so courteous, you don't feel like you're surrounded by strangers or uncomfortable.  Anyway, the food. That's what you wanna know about, right? I mean you're still reading sooo.  I've had a few things on the menu here. The Waffle, is incredible. I wish my vocabulary was better because I'm sure there's a word better than incredible. I also recommend the coffee, it's so damn good - im an avid coffee drinker. The bacon is large and thick, it's cooked perfectly and seasoned with crushed peppercorn, but in all honesty, I'm not a fan. Dunno why, can't explain it. The servings are huge and definitely a bargain for how inexpensive they are. The hash-browns aren't my favorite. They're crispy on the outside and soggy on the inside, but I guess it's just preference.

WmzlVYqmnW4QK5u0G1PvQA.text: Solid breakfast place. Not as expensive as a lot of other places you will find in airports. Beer prices vary from $5-8 depending on the size and type. Wine will run you about $8 per glass with a pretty limited selection.  I had the Kilt Lifter draft and it was very tasty and helped my 3 hour layover go by a little easier. (May regret the fluid intake as soon as I board)  I also had two eggs and a side of toast, which for $5 I felt was a steal. I will definitely stop in if I am swing back through.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Behind the bar

2XPvOzz34UOM6clnAaNJ1g.text: I just had one of the best breakfasts of my life here this morning.  Hubby and I arrived around 11:15ish and was promptly greeted by their very friendly hostess.  It was packed and we had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated but it was so worth the wait.  I am happy to report that we both loved every morsel.  Their peppered bacon and rosemary home fries have changed my life!  Both perfectly prepared with super deelish eggs over easy.  I saved the best part for last - their amazing homemade rye toast and strawberry jelly with real butter soaked into its yeasty goodness!  OMG I almost moaned out loud while eating it.  Hubby loved his ham and cheese omelette too!   What was even better than their amazing food was their friendly stellar service.  EVERYONE we came on contact with there were so friendly and nice.  We are only here for the weekend and only planned on stopping by here today - we will definitely be back on our way home on Sunday morning!  Thank you Matt's crew for an awesome experience!

e7CeBEpq1HpReVRfdzv4ZQ.text: Absolutely amazing place, I was in town on a Business Trip from Minnesota and am so glad I tried it out.  The Breakfast was out of this world, hospitality was amazing as Vanessa my waitress at the Front Area (Bar Area) was very conversational, super friendly, very quick and attentive.  The food came out super quick and was cooked perfectly.  Get there early in the AM as they get busy later.  I highly recommend this place for regulars and for sure anyone visiting from out of town!

Bm6ZZRHc5mgTMlyZmj2B0A.text: Fast service! Food was fresh and good. Not huge portions, but no too little either. The staff was friendly. Didn't wait long for a table of two. New to area so we wanted to check this place out cause of all the hype.

R3qkhnIyALgdS6HP9D7Bgg.text: This place is always so hard to get into on the weekends for good reason. Delicious, homemade breakfasts with prompt, friendly service. Couldn't ask for more! I ordered their Friday special, which happened to be chorizo, Jack, jalapeno, and a tortilla. Would drive all the way back downtown from Peoria for that again.

l9L-sHcVDEq8KgXpfRgqwg.text: If your looking for a good breakfast in a completely casual setting, Matt's is the place. The griddlecakes (aka pancakes) and waffles were a light and melted in your mouth. My dad has the hash browns and he loved the twist on them. What the atmosphere lacks, the staff makes up for. If you want good breakfast food, eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two eggs, thick bacon and some home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cup of Jo&#39; and omelette. American cheese with onions and sausage - don&#39;t forget about the hashbrowns.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a must try griddle cake

z8XHYpkt7eKO79FRPooxeg.text: The world famous Matt's big breakfast. Came down here specifically since I'd heard so many rave reviews. Maybe I ordered wrong - some of the most bland and dry pancakes I've ever had. And after spending $15 for breakfast (hash browns and milk) when I asked for a little more syrup for the pancakes, was informed they charge for xtra syrup - even though the initial syrup was a tiny metal container. Wow. Pretty sad. Won't be coming back here for sure. Otherwise the service had been quite good.  Extraordinarily noisy location as metal tables and chairs being slid around all over concrete floors - In my opinion the most underwhelming meal for the most overrated restaurant. They did end up removing the charges without my asking when I mentioned how bad the pancakes were. At least did the right thing, and like I said, maybe I ordered the wrong thing. But very disappointing meal. Manager apologized again and asked if I wanted anything else. Maybe you will fare better than I did

PzACTKZijy7Uat5I2LNCNA.text: The breakfast at this restaurant was over the top. The breakfast sandwich was excellent. I think the key was the sauteed sweet onion and the excellent roll it was made on, gave it a little bit of sweet almost maple syrup flavor. Our server was also excellent I asked for a little more coffee right as the bill came and she filled up a to-go cup for me.  My girlfriend got a Bloody Mary that I am pretty sure could have served as a meal in itself.

JDXmj4FgX_6-H4Zqz6ihvw.text: Food looked good & smelled good. Place was packed with people enjoying their food. Tuesday's special is biscuits, gravy, eggs, potatoes & bacon. Unfortunately I don't eat eggs or gravy. They don't sell their biscuits any other way, so I had a choice of paying for the gravy & eggs too or not getting any biscuits at all. I go to restaurants so I can eat exactly what I want...so I didn't get biscuits, or anything else except the coffee I had unfortunately already ordered & the fee I paid to park at the meter because their lot was full. I'm bummed.

DblaaAPLNMPqDVexuDl9ZQ.text: Came here this past Saturday (9/24/16) after an early morning hike at CamelBack Mtn.  It was our first time here, and decided to go with their Breakfast special - 3 eggs with bacon and jalapeno, hashbrown, and tortilla.  They use thick-cut bacon (my favorite!) The tortilla really complimented the eggs and added a nice touch. Overall, a good experience.  Didn't really see anything too special, but will come back again.

8p-g_kQ_20t448-jTBeFXw.text: My girlfriend brought me here on Wednesday morning and it is now somewhere I can't wait to go back to. I had an order of pancakes which were good, I like drowning my pancakes in syrup but decided to control myself and just accept the one 2oz container that came with the plate. I also added to eggs on the side which were fine but decided to get a chicken apple sausage and man I am hooked! I haven't stopped thinking about it since we left (don't tell my girlfriend), it sounded like a weird combination but for some reason it works and it works well! I got a cup of coffee and our waitress was on point with the refills. My girl got French toast with a country sausage and a side of hash browns. The side order of has browns were huge and all of her food also tasted great. Really looking forward to coming back and trying other things on their menu.

wHsdmM2_CDSORp8gf_VI3Q.text: I love the high quality food at this location but the home fries that many have cheered about lacked taste. I appreciate that the food is all natural and that they cook everything in butter, but the food is not mind blowing tasty.   The staff is really friendly and the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Special. Home Fries are just ok
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Breakfast Dish. Great Bacon!

78CSpvOneWVS6X0FtkU9yw.text: Maybe it was an off day.  Saw it featured on Food Network a while back so we drove from Queen Creek to give it a try. Was not worth the drive or the wait to get in. Very disappointing. Was nothing like what the show aired.

KGCtl15V47fuq5wotSjG5g.text: We were so excited to see what all the hype was about... I'm not sure what people think is so great. Three staff members told us about the Tuesday special and how great it was. So hubby and I both ordered it. Then we were told they only have enough for one, so my hubby changes his order. Then another waitress comes and tells us they're completely out, so I also had to change my order. Hubby paid over $14 for the most bland omelette we've ever tasted. And my chicken sandwich was just okay. It was also very bland. The one yummy thing was the hash browns. And they have this great all natural ketchup. That was about it.   Also for a place called "Matt's big breakfast" you would expect something to be large about it. Not so much.   The only other upside was the waitresses are very nice and pretty attentive.

OtkGpZhYA6X3JUf3QOxpwA.text: Great breakfast spot. Came here with my husband for breakfast and loved it. Food is reasonably priced and the service was very friendly. One of the servers wrote a list of other restaurants we should check out for dinner. The food was delicious and made with care, especially their jam, it's a must-have!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Modern/retro feel. I know, it&#39;s an oxymoron but there was no other way to describe it
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chick and Pork

fab0Tpiy1ALNqcMgyR5zCw.text: Mediocre at best. The place is small so it fills up fast and gets very noisy...not something you want with breakfast ...especially if the side of bacon is served cold.

bRh7fbyyr4d0gG_-WIJuBA.text: Been here twice and don't see the allure. Nothing really Big about the place. The breakfast menu is small, too small in my opinion. No gravy? What kind of self respecting breakfast diner doesn't offer gravy on the side? Ordered the waffle this time and it came with bacon. Waffle was a bit overcooked and dry... Nothing remarkable there. The bacon that came with it was absolutely coated in coarse black pepper...not my thing at all. If I want pepper let me add it. I think this place is just "a thing" because it's busy and has a hipster draw to it. It's just not really a great breakfast diner. The service is decent and quick however. Don't understand why there is always a wait. This area must be starved for a variety of decent breakfast spots.

mEOku-LEZs-2mH-zVmiG_A.text: I have to say, I have never really been much of a breakfast person. With that said, Matt's Big Breakfast may change that. Why? Well, let's get crackin'! :)  The Food:  First and foremost, let's talk about the menu. It's small, but covers all you bfast must haves. Eggs to ham, oatmeal to waffles, they have you covered. They even have a big bowl of Frosted Flakes on the menu (ummmmm yum!). I got the Hog and Chick, which is two eggs any way, bacon or sausage, hashbrowns or homefries, with toast and homemade strawberry preserves. I got my eggs over easy, and I mention this becausemost places can't seem to make them right, but Matt's made them perfectly! The homefries were delish, and the toast and preserves made my tummy VERY happy.The only problem I had was with the bacon, too peppery. That is a personal preference though.   The Service: The service was good. It took about 30 min to be seated, which is to be expected. It allowed time for me to walk around a bit and chat it up with my friend. So no complaints there. Our server (and I feel terrible because I can't remember her name) was very sweet and attentive. Only towards the end did her service become slow, but the drinks and food came out in a respectable amount of time.   The Atmosphere: It is a smaller establishment, so its a little "cozy", but don't let that scare you away. Everyone is there to enjoy a good breakfast, so you're in good company. :) It's decor simple. It's pretty contemporary. It's very clean as well.   The Verdict: Matt's Big Breakfast is awesome! Worth the wait, and worth the trip downtown. I gave Matt's 4 stars because I wasn't a fan of the super peppery bacon, and the service got a little slow at the end. Other than those two, everything else was great! I will be returning, and with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog and Chick with bacon and homefries.

0w1x_BYvxZJZWmNJSs1igw.text: Amazing! Honey lemonade so yummy, coffee on point, five spot- delicious, hog and chick -nom nom! :) Highly recommend!

vJHiihCB9YbTuT5MDRU8fw.text: Pretty good place.. Service is quick food is well proportioned.. Just good old fashion breakfast.. Nothing stellar like others I have reviewed but just good.. Nice walk from downtown hotels.

JqOvbk-RDMmbZuyaZCjNlQ.text: Went to matts big breakfast in the Phoenix airport while waiting for a connecting flight. We had the most delightful bartender serve us. They have a really awesome breakfast menu! I am just not that huge of a breakfast person and after being on vacation and eating badly I just really wanted a salad! They do serve salad and lunch items after 11. I didn't eat there as a grabbed a to go salad and just ate it at the bar with my beer! My dad God a burrito that looked super amazing! I with they had more beer on draft! So over kilt lifter and Stella.   I was also super bummed that I didn't get a chance to try their bloody Mary's! They looked so amazing!

1XNuyYYi4vz72t0g-CXvog.text: Perfect local restaurant for breakfast. Be prepared to wait. We came in on a Friday morning and it was packed. I had the hog and chick... Fantastic. Thick cut peppered bacon that's delicious. If ur a fan of bacon give this place a try. Love the ambience. Fits in the downtown area real nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick

od-Zaxz-ONWcOQAT7fuTTA.text: Amazing service and great portion and food. Thanks yelp! This place has many great ratings for a reason! Hmmmm bacon!

odiXjyZbaO3zFMPH3EZSEA.text: Omg, this is probably the best meal I had in Arizona. The rosemary potatoes (aka home fries) are AMAZING! You must order this over the hash brown, do it & thank me later.   I ordered the pork chop & eggs and it was seriously a piece of pork chop. The pork chop was seasoned right, not too salty or bland tasting. The eggs were cooked perfectly as well, I can't say so for all brunch places unfortunately.   This place gets pretty crowded but we were lucky to grab some seats at the bar without having to wait. I believe we were in and out of there within 30 mins. Probably one of the fastest brunch I've ever been to.

o_Q2TaFD2dPY3F2ymCKoOw.text: Sorry fellow yelper's, only 3 stars for me.  This place was good. Was it great? No. Was it awful? Absolutely not. Will I come here again? Sure, I just won't wait 45 min for a table.   Maybe I ordered the wrong item. I don't know. I'm a sucker for pancakes and waffles, and I didn't order them. Apparently that's what this place is known for. I got eggs/sausage/potatoes/sourdough toast. It was good. Nothing out of this world.  Workers were nice and food came out in timely manner.   Again, this place isn't bad, it just isn't "OMG I HAVE TO EAT HERE EVERY TIME I COME TO PHOENIX"...

XbpCRT159kQM7IiyaiW0kg.text: All the morons who think this is the airport location...your wrong. Ok, it has been a few years since my last visit, but seriously nothing has changed and that is good. The joint still had a wait at 10:30 Am (less than 10 minutes) and the waffles are still tops in town. Of course the bacon ain't too shabby either. It's just a unique waffle that is somewhere between a lolo version and a real Belgium variety. Just soft and buttery, a must try if waffles are or even aren't your thing. Only $7.50 for a filling meal, but you likely will have to wait, so try coming at some off peak hour. Park at deSoto market for free parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Always good

Qc9CwOUnvnelPvSkLl1ojg.text: Oh. My. This place is phenomenal. Super good food!! The place is always packed, but totally worth the wait to get in. They use the best ingredients (like real butter), and everything we've had is heavenly. Fantastic scratch lemonades too!!

LbkMnN4tU-vutvKhXVHwKg.text: Ate here for the first time about 10 days ago, on a Saturday morning around 9am.  We had to wait about 30-40 mins.  Holy smokes!  What a meal!  Menu - very limited!  Like 7 items for breakfast.  I was dubious...  Coffee - A+ - locally roasted by the Roastery of Cavecreek.  Fantastic! What a surprise and a delight!  Toast - A+ - artisan bread, very thick, with real butter.  We got the whole grain.  Amazing!j Oh - with homemade fresh preserves.  Hashbrowns - A+ - holy smokes, I don't know how they managed to take something so mundane and make it terrific.  Crispy, crunchy outside, softer on the inside without becoming mushy (retaining texture) and flavorful to boot!  Eggs - A - I can't really evaluate the eggs too much, because I put 'em on top of the hashbrowns and diced 'em up.  Service - B+ - Service was great - until the end when our guy left the check and dropped us like a hot potato.  I wanted more coffee.  They were SUPER busy, and scurrying all over.  I'll give them a B+ overall on service.  We even had an older guy check in on us to make sure everything was alright - like a manger or owner?  But ya gotta finish strong, too.  Paid our bill, and was able to get a small "to go" cup from the cashier.  That coffee was so delicious!  In the end, it was absolutely amazing to me that such simple familiar fare could be so outstandingly better than typical.  It really was quite a surprise.  I love breakfast at restaurants - probably my favorite meal of the day.  I SO MUCH WISH this place was closer to where I live.  This is what all restaurants aspire to be.

3Nsb1vVvg-Jro7TIBJVW4A.text: Food was delicious and I love that they had healthy options. I got "the skinny" which is egg whites, chicken sausage, spinach, and Gruyere cheese with a side salad. Huge portion and absolutely delicious! Pairs well with their homemade honey lemonades.

mxnBwyglfkBqbL2vTScesQ.text: Very busy.  Warm atmosphere.  Service was quick and friendly.  We just beat the rush when we went.  We waited 5 minutes for a seat.  Pretty sure when we left the average was wait 30 minutes minimum.  Make sure to go early if you want to beat the rush.  The food was decent.  You get just enough food for the price.  I got the sweet and savory special.  It was French toast with a large breakfast sausage.  Everything was good, nothing blew me away.  I would eat here again, but just make sure you get there early to dodge the wait.  It's not worth the long wait at times.

Ke0MbMrrPxgeNMgpNhlSug.text: Boring menu, super long wait, everything here is just OK. You will wait more than an hour if you go on the weekends, you will Be starving by the time you're seated, and you will get your food and think: "that's it?"   Not sure why this place is so popular, it could be so much better.

srHKx8Dew1lUOTrriLX1tg.text: A great place to eat!   This time I have to say that I've had a bit of bad luck because the last two times I came (within 30 days) my home fries have been burnt/charred. I can appreciate some crunch but there shouldn't be anything black on my plate. :( my scrambled eggs were semi runny/watery. Sausage and sourdough toast were perfect! Lol  Service was good. Sat unacknowledged for a good 10 minutes before my server came, but was good after.

cLM3GBWSR3KjppxyAVYGyw.text: Close your eyes, spin the menu, point, and order. You will not be disappointed with anything on the menu. Start with the bacon as your meat of choice though.

P5WYsp2G2njmMs_hQINV3A.text: Awesome. Had the 5 Spot: egg, bacon, grilled onions on a roll. Also had a pancake on the side and an ice tea. Full of deliciousness. This place is truly wonderful. I'd be a regular if I lived in Phoenix. The Sunday morning B'fast line was long but well worth the wait. Clearly full of regulars.

0Ww2hNheG_5NfQgtOF9n7Q.text: I visited Matt's for the first time in 2010 before moving to Phoenix. Not only was the food fantastic the staff was over the top too. I've been recommending this place to everyone that I know who plans to visit. Great atmosphere and the experience of the food and staff was again just amazing. Even if you have to wait it's well worth it.

K2FX_ibPQxqy7-j-uBuDSA.text: Read the reviews and I was excited.  Good service.  Clean establishment.  Seated quickly.  We had a waffle and the egg/sausage/hash brown combo.  Both came out fast and were very good.  The fresh OJ was ok...not as amazing as I had hoped.  Overall I liked it and I will return.  The omelette with everything is the best in Phoenix.  Truth.

kE8-dszRjVh7-38FYECbKw.text: What an amazing breakfast experience. Different but all so good. I LOVE that they use all organic products for their food. The toast and strawberry jam was mouth watering. Bacon was so good. We had the daily special and it was so good. We will be back if we ever come back to AZ. I highly recommend this place for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle

VZZZHV7nwJLvvkHpsZ68xg.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said...  Should you go: yes Does is live up to the hype: yes Is it worth the wait:yes  K, got that out the way. I'm always a bacon, eggs (over easy), potatoes and toast for breakfast guy-its exactly what I need and always perfect here. My wife goes with the pork chop breakfast and loves it.   Food is hot and fresh as can be. I haven't been disappointed yer. If your a "breakfast person" this place is for you

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eat at Matt&#39;s: Good advice

ud_18UwTZWT2R_fWF3CIbQ.text: I so love this breakfast place! This is right by downtown ASU so I always go there when I was in school. Coming back almost 2.5 years later, it hasn't changed a bit. It was still so busy but charming!   In general, everything here is good. They have different specials for each day so I always like to get that. However, this time I got the salami hash and hash brown. It was seriously so bomb! They use organic eggs and just organic everything. Food definitely taste fresh. I brought my boyfriend here to try my favorite breakfast place and he had no complaints either! He ordered a traditional breakfast plate and it came with eggs, sausage, hash browns, bacon, and toast. Oh my gosh, this hash brown is the best I have ever had. I almost forgot how good it tasted before going back this time! It was so crispy and not oily at all. I also want to rave about the toast here! It was just on point! I usually don't like toast but this one I could not pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily specials

V1nxaQnGMt4onKdTT37AMg.text: Delicious food and great staff. Matt's never disappoints. Very hipster scene, casual farm to table feel. I had the skinny but it didn't taste as healthy as it was, chicken apple sausage with spinach and egg whites! Amazing!!! My husband had the build your own cheese omelet with country potatoes, the hint of rosemary was perfect. They were great. The coffee was good as well. We will definitely be back.

3tkKVN9nZmXSBrlOy-xrXw.text: I never ordered a scramble at a breakfast place before in my life. Matt's Big Breakfast changed that. I decided to order the Saturday special and it included a scramble of jalapenos, bacon and  cheese with a side of country potatoes. The tortilla that also came with it was like the icing on the cake. I enjoyed every part of the breakfast including the rosemary country potatoes. I couldn't have had a better scramble experience and I recommend coming to this place 10 times out of 10. Yes, the line may be long but it is well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special Saturday scramble

MDJHHz2eqDpro31STYXw6w.text: Creative, and better, take on classic dinner fair, this place really impressed us. We both had the grain careens and beans which is spectacular. This is not normally the sort of food I go for but I really recommend it. All the ingredients blended together in an amazing way.

cGm3y6Df435m9Tl3gWTkLA.text: Great breakfast! I finally got to have breakfast here. We heard about the lines so we left early and got there at 6:30 am. I am thankful for the storefront pictures on Yelp because we could easily drive by without realizing that was it. They had a nice parking lot behind which, when crowded, when it often is, can be hard to maneuver out because it only has one entry.  We were greeted and seated immediately! Yay for the early birds. The homemade preserves in the little cooler looked so appetizing. Our host graciously told us that when we got toast with our breakfast, a sampling of those preserves also came with our meal.  My husband and I enjoyed the daily special, the Chorizo Scramble. Because it came with a tortilla and not toast, we thought we'd better order toast and the preserves. No regrets! The toast and preserves were AMAZING! The sourdough toast was nicely buttered and crunchy. The preserves were just the perfect blend of tart and sweet. Our scramble was good. I loved my raspberry honey lemonade. It was heavenly. When I have a sore throat, can someone give me the recipe, pleeeease?  Everyone else polished off their breakfasts at our table. The consensus was the home fries were tastier than the hashbrowns. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette with hashbrowns
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Scramble with Home Fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chop with Eggs and Hashbrowns

XtXBsrIAmBOzjGYyyGdnYA.text: so freakin delicious.  2nd time being here while visiting Phoenix from California,  and never been disappointed.  attentive staff,  delicious food,  can't go wrong

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. waffle and bacon and the best rosemary potatoes
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. strawberry lemonade soooo good

aW0bmN1lQIH8lF9ytpq_YQ.text: I haven't been here in years. I really liked the food the very first time, but this second experience was pretty mediocre. I thought there was a big menu selection but there's only a few choices in the typical American breakfast categories. Prices usually range around 10-15 dollars. For that price I really hoped for better tasting coffee but it's your average typical coffee found in every Denny's. I ordered the basic breakfast (what my son calls a typical breakfast) 2 eggs, bacon, country potatoes and sour bread toast. My favorite thing on my plate was the sour bread toast! Fantastic! The bacon and potatoes do have their own unique favor. With strong hints of rosemary and black pepper.   Would I come back? Sure, if i was in the neighborhood and it was around a non peak hour. This place does seem to get a bit congested. Be willing to wait 15+ minutes for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eIeJLVcujyORHMkwAKrmyw.text: I haven't eaten at the newest location because the wait time is crazy.  Ate once at the old location and the food was your average diner breakfast food.

zAUZbXxA8Egu57P1OG4-ww.text: LOVE the hog and chick! I would go here all the time when I attended school in Arizona. Now it is a must go whenever I visit. It does get crowded. So be prepared for a wait during the weekends. Other favorites of mine our the 5 spot and the waffle. Definitely one of the best breakfast places I have gone too. If only there were some in Los Angeles!

F5NqmcPld0upACkbi7nmzQ.text: Just like the rest of the reviews, AMAZING FOOD but bad service. We consistantly go to the location in the Marina Heights neighborhood and the servers are always the worst! From falling on the floor laughing and messing around to not cracking a smile once while talking to us, it is always a bad experience with the servers.   They also do not have a consistant host at the front so there were managers yelling from the back of the counter to the front to tell customers walking in to sit anywhere.   Amazing food and there is one bus boy that is the nicest person working there! Worth the visit but needs to step up their service game!

6DMDopGcqH7y6dwSI28nOg.text: My daughter always wanted to try this restaurant. So we went this morning. I'm glad she wanted to go here. So delicious. Staff is wonderful and friendly. I recommend this place to everyone. Delicious food, lots of choices. I can't wait to go back!

z8gFVXZOiyYGAd_OW1vNKg.text: Great place! Great Breakfast spot, just missing a bar! Everybody is friendly here and the food was delicious

Z-GucqH66ubgOCuP_Fdbrg.text: Really good place for breakfast. Fun environment and the food was delicious. Parking is paid only and there was about a 20 minute wait on a Friday. Definitely will be back!

YnH5LLYhE-NFBjFWZi4VCQ.text: Classic downtown PHX breakfast staple. Delicious, and well worth the wait! If you don't manage to eat here while visiting, don't worry, there's a location at the airport too!

u3Ox8JL6SMc9h4nv54Sv1g.text: This place is great. We were staying in downtown Phoenix for a wedding and walked here. Delicious breakfast.

ltECVzUBYlwR4OUrR5rv2Q.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in PHX it has a nice vibe as soon as you walk in, amazing staff, and the BEST breakfast you will have, we got the skinny scramble with the honey lemonade and my breath was taken away. Absolutely amazing, i will definitely back asap

9LJgYTvj5rIHvtCxo2igXQ.text: Always a fan of Matt's, didn't realize this was so close to a project I did a few months back or I'd have been in here every morning. I'm a big fan of the bacon. I usually get poached eggs with it and toast.

MrW72u_8qPpK208yjQnUKg.text: I went here because I love Diners, Drive in's, and Dives. The breakfast was great and the service was good. I'm glad I went. I took my mom with me and she enjoyed her food just the same. If you're looking for a local place with great food and people, this is it. Love the homemade maple syrup & hot sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy scramble &amp; tortilla. Waffle was fresh and delicious

cJItMAl__rzq_naI16og9g.text: The coffee was excellent! Best cup of coffee downtown. I got the French toast special with sausage. It was disappointing. The bread was very chewy and not crisp or hot. Thankfully there was enough maple syrup to pour over. The atmosphere is nice, but very loud and hard to hear the servers. Service was good. Polite servers and staff.  I would go back for the coffee, but will try an egg dish next time.

PCRswLhtIYB0rnLEBlARQA.text: We drive quite a ways to get here but it's so worth it. I will tell you, there is always a wait so be prepared. I love that there are so many options to choose from ... from a little naughty to offerings with chicken sausage.   I love the atmosphere and all of the staff take care of tables so you always have someone ready to help.   This has become a go to for us

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Skinny

DjkHBLC6v15BIdM77Q8Irg.text: This place was awesome. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of the decor. Gosh how I wish this place was just a little brighter, had a warmer feel to it & a little more decor. Everything else, as long as you're looking for a simple, chill vibe, was awesome.   We enjoyed the food so much that we went to MBB twice during our short stay in Phoenix. And I ordered the same thing both times... it was that good! Egg whites with chicken sausage and spinach... substitutes the salad with the hash browns. Perfect!  Work to the wise - get their hash browns. And get them extra crispy. So, so good!  The wait staff are all extremely gracious with coffee refills. As soon as you take two sips, there's someone at your table asking if they can refill your cup. I've had better coffee - it's not very strong, but, it gets the job done. All in all, I'd without a doubt recommend this place as an extremely satisfying breakfast!  Food: 5 stars Service: 5 stars Decor: 3 stars

i6vNZriZj82vT1CqNnSj1g.text: The food is excellent as usual. I've been to Matt's many times. The omelette with American cheese and home fries are so delicious. The sweetness of the sauteed onion mixed in with the home fries is the right amount of savory and sweet.  Ok, on a side note I do wish you guys would offer gluten free toast. It's your restaurant and your right to jump on the gluten free bandwagon or not. Clearly you have a huge following, but it could be bigger just by offering gluten free toast. Jewel's Bakery and Gluten Free Creations have wonderful options.....just a suggestion.

YIKeQ9ljGxqrojrT3z3EHA.text: I have heard great things about Matt's Big Breakfast for a long time so this visit was long overdue. There are a few parking spots behind the building, otherwise there is plenty of street parking too. Arriving around 8am on a Saturday there were still a decent amount of open tables, we were told to seat ourselves and a server promptly came over to take care of us.   The menu isn't huge but the options all sound tasty. They have lunch selections after 11am. I started with an orange juice, which is fresh squeezed and soooo goood. I ordered the hog and the chick with 2 scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, and sourdough toast. My girlfriend got the waffle, which comes with a side of bacon and warm syrup.   I am not a huge breakfast food lover (I know, I know) but this was honestly so good. For the basic breakfast set up I enjoyed everything on my plate. The hash browns were actually crispy (most places never get this right), the bread and jam was perfect, the bacon is thick but has amazing flavor and the eggs are actual eggs. I stole my girlfriend bacon since she isn't a fan but I couldn't even finish it. Her waffle was really good but the syrup was a little too sweet for her. I thought it was an awesome combo though.   Our service was great, our table was a little wobbly and our server even stopped to fix it the second he noticed.   Overall it's a cute little spot with a great breakfast. I would love to try the other menu items and some of the specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rLkA2sphPTdy_ramC35XpA.text: Busy breakfast and brunch diner.   Expect to wait.  This place is best for groups of 2 to 6 or so.    Ordered two of the most popular dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pork chop and chick.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The waffle

HkamM3NQryxDaeUUVtKsAg.text: This is the first time I've ordered a steak and eggs dish, that the steak was actually a great steak, and not just leftovers from the night before. One of the best breakfasts places I've ever been too. Steak was a great cut of meat and cooked exactly how I asked, eggs and potatoes were very good as well. Ordered a side of the thick cut bacon which was great. One of my favorite parts was there Homemade spicy ketchup. I liked it so much I actually ordered a bottle of it when we left and brought it home. The next time I am back in town I will definitely be coming here, I recommend you do the same if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs, seasoned potatoes and bacon

ComLUycZfUjcm7GxE_MHsQ.text: I don't know how I had never been to this Phoenix institution. I stopped in on a Friday morning around 8:00 because I had some time to kill before a meeting. There was a wait.   I was by myself and asked if I could take one of the five open bar seats. The host said yes. I tried to sit down. Then a server started screaming at me. So back to the host I went. I waited about five minutes for two top. So my visit started with a snag and I was annoyed enough I almost just left. I'm glad I didn't.   There aren't a ton of choices on the menu at Matt's. In some ways, Matt's is bare bones. This isn't a brunch place. It's more greasy spoon (my menu was caked in something and the table was sticky), with cage-free eggs, but what they do, they do well.   I got an omelet with mushrooms and onions and home fries. The omelet was great--the eggs were cooked perfectly. I loved the caramelized onion. The potatoes were overpowered by rosemary (I'd get hash browns next time), but they were also prepared well. The wheat toast and jam was good enough to be a meal on its own.   Service was fast and semi-friendly. For what it was, I was happy with my food.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelet with home fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wheat toast with jam

fYGGTGEhuiJh5z1BE4Gtzw.text: I had the Belgian waffle ($8) which came with maple syrup and a whole lot of butter. I also ordered a side of hashbrowns ($3) with freshly squeezed orange juice (12oz is $5). I thought the prices were steep for breakfast items, but the quality is there; they pride themselves of using all-natural ingredients, for instance, real butter and olive oil. You can especially notice this in the hashbrowns, it's rich and very much melt-in-your-mouth. Whatever you do, get the hashbrowns!  Service was okay, they definitely have a lunch rush (I came at 1pm) so everything took a little longer than expected, and the place isn't decorated too nicely, just very simple but definitely clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Belgian waffle ($8), and the hashbrowns ($3). The hashbrowns were worth it!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Daily Specials of the week.

JxH3QHpYjTpGmJXEzT-FlA.text: a hearty 'meh' for this place. I really don't understand the raves at all. The food was fine, but really not special at all. I didn't understand the hype.  Service was perfectly pleasant. $5 fresh-squeezed orange juice was good.  But everything else was extremely unremarkable. I don't plan to return, but wouldn't mind accompanying a group that invited me there.

9iHU3MTP29ptl68Igu8o9w.text: Great breakfast with fresh ingredients. Homemade have on homemade sourdough to accompany my spinach, ham, cheese scramble. Awesome hashbrowns w homemade hot sauce. Super attentive service with super short wait at the bar. All for a reasonable price.

gqjC1-YXMaaVyAWAhZMTFw.text: Lots of people waiting as we entered which I took as a good sign.  My group of four was in no hurry so we put our name in and tried to stay out of the way while being completely in the way.  At least 20 minutes before we were seated, but there was always another party getting called for a table - so it didn't feel long.   Our server was no barrel of sunshine, but she was busting butt (along with every other employee), so I didn't mind her lack of warmth.  She got us drinks promptly, and took our food order not long after.  As mentioned, this is a hustling, bustling place - so I wouldn't expect intimate conversation with table mates.  The food order came faster than waiting for our table, and it did not disappoint.  I had the five spot sandwich - egg, bacon, cheese on a bun I would eat plain.  Add some of their signature hot sauce and the happiness was on! I had a side of hash - crispy, salty = good.  My friends ordered the chick and hog - sourdough toast - oh boy it looked good - and was!  This is a no brainer for breakfast if you have the time.  They know what they're doing at Matt's Band obviously a crap ton of people realize

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_pVIC-WdnI1-FJ34aIo6Qw.text: Had the Tuesday special of biscuits and gravy. It was a very different take on biscuits and gravy, not necessarily bad, just wasn't what I was expecting. The orange juice was good, but it wasn't all it was hyped up to be like the waiter mentioned. Overall food was okay and service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy

lVbpzuNchbN3cTc7ow8VqQ.text: Matt's lived up to expectations! The Hog & Chick was simple and excellent: eggs cooked perfectly, crunchy hash browns, thick toast, and a substitute of "off-the-bone" ham that was salty and super flavorful!   They cram a lot of people into the restaurant, but there's still a wait on weekends (15 minutes for a table for two).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog &amp; Chick with off-the-bone ham (+ 2 eggs, crunchy hash browns, and thick toast).
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front door (outside looking in)

P9tGtHWH026stI81tR6RRw.text: Matt's is always a hit for me. Top notch American breakfast for the modernization of Downtown Phoenix. We come here a few times a month and we're like, "let's go to Matt's!"  My friend had the chili bowl and it had cinnamon in the mix. They should at least put that on the menu but they said it was a hit seller. It was a miss for me.  Huevos Rancheros is a must on a Monday ppl! It's extremely satisfying with the hash browns on the side!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros was the Monday special and it was very delicious
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili bowl - has cinnamon in it

PyAVrWP-LoOLRlU5a1uAGQ.text: Arizona!! What's really good?!?  Me and my friends came here for breakfast today and it definitely hit the spot. Most of us had been up since 3:30AM this morning and my the time we got there(12pm), we were starving. We parked right in front and paid for the meter. The wait was about 10 mins or so to get a table and I already knew what I wanted: Eggs Benedict.  The eggs were cooked perfectly. Each cut into both of the Benedict's resulted in a river of Golden gelatinous egg. It trickled down into the alleyways of Pork Chop Canadian Bacon and funneled into the Sea of Hollandaise...Sauce. Ugh the sauce people. The sauce was so silky smooth. Add in a little of their hot sauce and I'm in heaven. What a perfect way to start my Vacation!   Oh!! Also try the Lemonade. It is friggin delicious. You can definitely taste the honey in each sip but still get the pucker you would expect from a good Lemonade. The first Breakfast spot in Arizona that we tried has made me hopeful for even more tasty food to come. Thank you Matt's for curing our itch for hunger this morning!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Egg Benedict
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Griddlecakes
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Lemonade

n1uOTxL1-6C9bHpoAyKN4g.text: Looking for a good breakfast spot in Downtown and Yelp led me to this gem. On a Monday morning at 10am I had to wait about 25 minutes for a solo seat at the counter.
