Good sign.  I got the Hog and Chick and it was spectacular! The thick cut bacon was outstanding and so were the rosemary potatoes. Even the marble rye with strawberry jam was special. Love, love, love local from scratch places like this. I was super impressed with food and kind service and will let anyone I know visiting to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and Chick w scrambled eggs, bacon, rye.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Go local

k8NZsrluxZsK0hiW701HmQ.text: Came here for breakfast on Saturday morning around 11. There was a 35 minute wait for 2 of us so we walked around a bit while we waited. Stopped into a coffee shop near by (FUTURO) it was a good find.    Once we were seated, we were greeted by friendly wait staff ready to get any drink orders. We got the chocolate milk which was great! The inside of the cup was lined with extra chocolate syrup which made it extra chocolatey and delicious.  We also ordered the pancakes, sourdough with preserves, and the five spot breakfast sandwich.   Everything we got was great!  For $6.50 the five sport breakfast sandwich is huge with perfectly cooked bacon and meaty cheese. My boyfriend deems the pancakes the best he has had in the Phoenix area which is quite the accolade since it's usually all he orders at breakfast spots.   The sourdough and preserves I ordered on a whim since yelp raves about it. I don't know how a simple toasted sourdough butter and preserves are so delicious but it really was worth the hype in my opinion.   Downfalls but not at all deal breakers:  1. the table we were at was wobbly - there were sugar packets shoved under on of the leg bases but it still wasn't working.  2. It was relatively noisy in there. Not bad for the two of us to hear each other but may have been more difficult for a table of 4+

_bpKqUVWZko52ReoqwbIPw.text: Came in on a sat morning and put my name down. Was told it was about a 30 min wait so walked around the area a bit to kill some time.   Came back and even though my name was already called, I was still the next one to be seated which is cool.   Took a couple pics of the ketchup bottle as I waited for my wonderful Saturday scramble special.   Got the scramble and it was worth the wait! They have specials every day which is awesome. On the chalk board is where the special is written out in detail of what it is.   The egg scramble came with a tortilla and really good and crispy hash browns. And the ketchup was soo good.  MBB knows what they're doing!   Pretty happy I got to try this place out before I head back home soon! Hopefully I'll be able to revisit once more and maybe even pick up a bottle of ketchup too.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RCgTehMkTL1N2la6EiyTsQ.text: My sister brought me here for brunch & I'm not going to lie, I wasn't expecting much. My sister has a much healthier take on restaurants than I do. Don't get me wrong, I like healthy, but I also like carbs & maple syrup for brunch.  The place is cute with its own mini parking lot (or metered street parking.) It's a small to medium sized spot, we happened to stop by on a Friday around 1:00 with lots of open tables. I ordered the Vermont cheddar cheese omelette & rosemary potatoes, super simple I know, but damn that was some good cheese! Every bite I took had melty sharp cheddar, like yassssss!! & the potatoes! Don't even get me started. I don't think I've ever finished my potatoes at any breakfast/brunch restaurant.   My sister ordered the BLT, it was huge! It came with homemade potato chips, wowzers! The quality of all the food was so so so good! It's all HOMEMADE & fresh ingredients. Even the ketchup was homemade; I was a bit hesitant at first, not going to lie, but I tried it & it was actually very good!   I inhaled my food! I even ate all my sourdough toast with the homemade blueberry compote style jelly, practically licked the ramekin it came in. Don't judge me. I will definitely be coming back here next time I'm in AZ!

tmlJEysMkosKx2SZjg88uw.text: Our first stop after landing in Phoenix and couldn't have made a better decision!  I mean if Guy Fieri isn't normally a breakfast person but makes it a point to stop here when he's in town then it must be good! And we can fuuuur sure attest to that!  Everything about this place was awesome and all their food is made from scratch. Can you believe they don't own a microwave? So everything is truly cooked to order and it sure tasted like it!  His - Hog and Chick with Sausage patties, over medium eggs, hash browns, and sour dough toast. The hash browns were cooked to my perfection. The house made jelly that came with the toast was incredible and you can definitely tell it was made from fresh fruit.  Hers - Thursday's special of Eggs Benedict with a side of home fries aka breakfast potatoes. The hollandaise sauce was creamy with rich flavors!  We highly recommend this spot if you're in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thursday special eggs Benedict
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick with sausage patties

vzR_ML1rcpdLvH6e4Bjbwg.text: BUSY, BUSY Place & I had read LOTS of positive reviews - we waited 50 min. for a table (after being told 30-45 min wait time), crammed 5 ppl. at a table for 4 & could not even hear each other talk it was SO loud.  I was expecting a much larger Menu selection, food was fine when it did arrive but all in all this place did NOT live up to the hype whatsoever.  SO many other good choices for breakfast, we won't be back to Matt's - sorry!

SRQgoChYEKxGn8LDze6Row.text: Matts is such a wonderful place.  My daughter & I found this gem on yelp. And it has now become our fav. We drive from Tempe to matts. The waffles r amazing and the griddlecakes....need I say more.  Try this place if you haven't.

k25JZ9_2a-wtkAFXhok_SA.text: Visited the establishment twice.  Both times on a weekend.  Parking was difficult but expected since it is located downtown.  Breakfast was good but not great.  Expected amazing so I was left somewhat dissatisfied.  Service was just OK.  Will try again and update if my mind has been changed.

XpK_aPdCRGwu3snWFnIrtw.text: After a long night shift at work, bf and I decided to try this place, with all the great reviews, how can you go wrong?! Looking at the menu for a bit, I decided on the Pork chop and eggs. This is where I went wrong, I was extremely disappointed. For starters, I'm super happy it came out so quickly, but at the same time, that tells me it was cooked ahead of time-huge turn off. So I get my breakfast and was immediately turned off, my "Iowa cut" pork chop was about 1/3 the size of an Iowa cut chop. (Yes, I do realize that I am in Arizona, but I expect to get what I'm told I'm getting!) Next thing that caught my attention was the green color! I about sent it back, not sure what the green paste on it was, but it didn't taste as bad as it looked. Ok, as you can tell, I was very irritated with the pork, but moving on. Potatoes had too much Rosemary, I figured home fries were simply home fries, they were a sad example. Half of them were stale, the other half were mush. Eggs were done as asked, very happy with that. The toast and homemade Jam were awesome, but again, the bread was a bit stale...   The only reason that I didn't give this place one star, was my bf plate. He had the waffle with bacon and a side of sausage, simply AMAZING! Really wished I had followed my intuition and ordered that too!  Staff was very friendly and alert, made you feel like a home town type feel, however, I felt bombarded. Every time he took a drink of his coffee, we put our fork down, or even took a look around, they were at our table. I felt rushed and didn't appreciate the feeling much, they weren't busy, and had plenty of open tables...   Will try again, but certainly won't go back for the pork chops!!

BIGuXhSNBIVTJPmsyKWjgw.text: Just passing through here on the way to San Diego. This place is amazing!! Had an omelette with mushrooms, roasted peppers (actually roasted well), Ham, and cheese. Came with hash browns, and toast, all equally delicious. Staff was very friendly and on top of their game.

WtdGN9ylw58NxC1xfnkYpg.text: Great food. Great coffee. Great service. Cute waitresses. Long waits but worth it. I recommend the daily specials but Waffle and Bacon is my favorite.

VP8NpgfHWwt9sSo3ggCG1A.text: Bring your appetite!  ASU students nearby have a great hangout and breakfast spot.  Food and service at Matt's was great.  They even have complimentary water with orange slices out front if you have to wait a little bit and it sure was hot in Phoenix!   I'll definitely be back for another go and thank you for a nice experience while just visiting.

18d7Lzo8vWEsom3jYkIV_Q.text: They are really good. I recommend them. Not the best I've had but better than most places in downtown Phoenix.

o-ylmmc8SDMtfcRuhlQZoA.text: Really great breakfast. This place is always busy! Def try their homemade bread and jam!!

B14UAUe0zwblA88olGrDhQ.text: Food was good  I was pleasantly  surprised.  Walking in the place in doesn't  look like much  but it must be good as there weren't any empty tables in there.  But breakfast was very good  better than denny's  or ihop I will definitely  return.

sxsm-abB2LdLHpV3JLw7HQ.text: I met a friend at Matt's Big Breakfast for Breakfast (of course!) on a Wednesday morning.  The menu is not too complex and offers staples of an American breakfast.  The real winner here is the jam to go with your toast.  The jam is what makes the breakfast!    Due to the location, parking can be a bit of an issue at times.  This place does get busy for breakfast too.  I give Matt's Big Breakfast 4 stars because of the jam!

nmQWHXzh2nLSVcYs8RAMhw.text: honestly, I don't think there is anything THaT great about this place. Worlds best waffles? I've made waffles just as good with a waffle maker in a college cafeteria ... they don't do anything special with these waffles either-the only option is to order one plain with a side of bacon.... I've ordered breakfast dishes here before and I'm pretty sure they make it taste good by using a lot of butter and salt. There is nothing else unique about how they cook the food... It is very run of the mill. If you are a fan of bacon, it's pretty damn good. The orange juice is Freshly squeezed and SO delicious, and for that I'll give this place 3 stars...

Ey4sEA8njGeptVWEFVWfTQ.text: Great Breakfast place, well worth the wait!!  We were really happy with our meals.  I had the Egg, spinach and fontina scramble special (out of this world)  Coffee and water never went empty as they continually refilled...  Definitely a must go to when you are in Phoenix.

acIpxpnoUUZuGkR10SzV8g.text: I am a big breakfast person. My day rises and falls according to the quality of the breakfast. Mat''s is one of those places where I am going every Saturday morning now. After you eat there, you have a good clean feeling instead of the gross Denny's greasy feeling after you eat their breakfast. I always get the Hog & Chick and man oh man...the best thing I love about this place is the toast. Sourdough toast and it comes with homemade preservatives. It is awesome!

Hx1s2K3cLDWvTKYSbCHu-w.text: I love that this place has free range chicken eggs in all of their dishes. My breakfast was delicious. They played good music too. The reason they didn't get 5 stars from me is because it's so loud in there because, unfortunately, like many other restaurants in Phoenix, they have a concrete floor.

AyEyJ7-vv3XyR_xFR5Akug.text: Sunny side up eggs were perfect which is not all that common. Thick cut peppered bacon was perfectly crispy, thich cut rye, and amazing rosemary potatoes. Coffee refills were also served promptly. This place in the airport rivals some popular breakfast joints in Phoenix.

wcUywQb6hmu4lbjxcgzi4w.text: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had! Get the Hog and Chick and the chocolate milk. The thick cut bacon is awesome... My only negative is the wait is about 20 minutes at 9:00 and gets longer as the morning goes.

96uH4BLcsC1cOilor1R_hA.text: Absolutely AWESOME!!!  Best breakfast ever actually recommended to us by a homeless man who said they have fed him from time to time even let him work for food a few times.  These are great people serving AMAZING food!  BTW the one in the PHX airport has the most AMAZING Bloody Mary...must try!!!

-0AZLdvUqTgckCs8A-OFHg.text: Great food. The bread on the sandwiches was really fresh. The iced tea is amazing. The atmosphere is nice too. Definitely recommended.

QmdrdZAoxyvUvWZ8AqEpHg.text: I really thought this place was going to be super good. The menu was limited and the food was good but not as great as everyone makes it out to be. I will not be back.

G-fiDjtj9KFqTDPMshAbrA.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is soooo delish! The first time I ever game was after graduation at ASU and it was still in the old location that was tiny! It definitely lived up to everything I'd heard about it. It tastes like good home cooking and everything on the menu is yummy. I also like that them menu isn't huge. My dad and stepmom always want to come here when they are in town visiting and I definitely have no problem with that! I think I would go a lot more if I lived closer to downtown..this is more of a destination breakfast for us (but worth it). The hash browns that come on the side are sooooooo decadent and amazing. Probably the best hash browns I've ever had. There is always a wait but it goes by fairly quickly and there are a couple benches at the newer location so you can sit and wait. Five spot and hog & chick are notable faves. You won't be disappointed!

eLf8798jcxU__juuWVCgXA.text: Was in Phoenix for a convention and looking for a place to have breakfast. I found Mate's on Yelp and gave it a shot.  It was fantastic!   Food was awesome, service great, and ambiance was just what I was looking for.  If anyone is downtown phoenix and looking for a great breakfast go to Matts.

VHdM8KHb18li_7En2T2HEw.text: Too trendy for it's own damn good. They refused to split a check. I really didn't experience anything that isn't available elsewhere with less hype.

owxoamtUi8gP8tWeTGXP6g.text: My all time favorite place to have breakfast! My girlfriend takes me there every time that I am in town! I recommend the Belgium waffle and their bacon is amazing! I absolutely love this place! They should have more nationwide!

RKSuWRqzXQd8X6SPJ0_8xg.text: I love this place for many reasons! One the atmosphere of the place is just really cool and modern. Second, the service is great; all very friendly staff. Third, the food is beyond delicious. I ordered their breakfast sandwich, I couldn't even finish it all. They serve you huge portions here, so come with your appetite. Don't even get me started on the bacon; so fresh, juicy, and delicious. Overall this place just is amazing for breakfast. They have my business. Try them out!

WGgcv8EPIri6FGKwjiJUfQ.text: Not the Matt's it use to be. Hash browns greasy, eggs not done right. Very disappointed

qegIYpT0NIgj-_j6bQf9Rg.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in Arizona hands down! Every time I have visitors from out of town I suggest this for breakfast. Even when they were at the smaller location I would bring my friends from CA there when I used to live in downtown. I come here a lot with my man and the family and it is never disappointing. The prices are unbeatable for the quality of the food. My favorite item that they serve is their hash browns. I can't put my finger on what make them so delicious, they just are. My last visit they served us burned hash browns but they fixed it right away with the delicious hash browns that I love so much. I usually get some coffee and share a five spot with Eric. The five spot is an amazing breakfast sandwich that has thick bacon, egg, cheese and grilled onions all on delicious bread. When we have a crazier appetite we go for the five spot with an order of waffles. WOW. Unbelievably yummy. There's usually a wait but it's well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle, 5spot hashbrowns &amp; coffee. Perfection.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XnS0tDKuAI4IwD2lE1MKmQ.text: Came to town for some training and wanted to try this place out. Not just because it was on Triple D but it got great reviews on Yelp too. I had The Five Spot with a side of homefries. The food was excellent, has to be the best breakfast sammich ever. The homefries are really good too, but the sammich was the best. Definitely worth checking out. I went on a Monday around 1 pm and the place was pretty full, but no wait. Its good enough to wait for though.

kgK69rsMWEFz7nexg27foA.text: Bad food bad service.  Heard about this place . Cold waffle, servers insulted that I would notice cold food.  Would never recommend .  I see they are building new place in my neighborhood. 32nd and Camelback. Will tell my neighbors not to bother.

Kl9ocd6nmpdEHQBq3NwOig.text: Been here several times.  Breakfast is always fantastic and the coffee is great!  The only downside is the wait during the summer.  But even then, the food draws people (even me).  Whenever I'm up and in downtown for breakfast, this is my go-to.

esjI_BK-TruVm3JOkHBy1g.text: I've been trying to get over to Matt's for some time - but since I live in Chandler, it's not often that I'm in Phoenix during breakfast hours.  That said, boy oh boy was it worth the extra 30 minute drive.  Everything was spot on.  The service, the food, the ambiance - just wow.  We got there close to closing time, so they were out of a few things, but that's to be expected when they're so busy.  Probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had - and the pancake is in the top three of all time.  Very few restaurants bother with real maple syrup, but for me it makes all the difference.  The bacon was up near the top I've ever had, and I will be back as often as possible.  Simply put, it's the best breakfast destination in Phoenix, period.

TkogX-T7jlWN_bfHbwzp9Q.text: I'm not sure what the big deal is about?  The place is always packed so they must have something going on but the two times I've eaten at Matt's the food is bland or borderline bad.  It's breakfast food!  You almost have to go out of your way for it NOT to taste good but Matt's seems to manage.

F-8e0qNRYXIDoJlf5fcrzA.text: Never been here and the wait was about 15-20 min. Yet it was worth the wait. The menu was short and simple which I love. Very organized staff and we had a party of 4 yet we were served pretty quick even though they were very busy.  Everything was so good we all cleaned our plates. Our servers were very nice and attentive even on a fast paste environment. Definitely would recommend this place.

ggr6TEKSzZTCF-GqKzwFmw.text: My friend read some great reviews so myself and 3 friends just went today.  Had the special it was great cool atmosphere great service,  very attentive. .. A must go if you want good scratch cooking breakfast. ..

B-GMQ48jG3EapDQOjt-RMA.text: Yes, sometimes you have to wait in a long line. No, the line isn't that long if you don't come on a weekend (like everyone else does).  Yes, get whatever special they have on the board for the day. And damn well better get 2 or 3 glasses of that fresh squeezed OJ. All the waiting is worth just that alone.

5DA3vVnnS81Vgd7Skybr5w.text: And Babe Ruth lines up to the plate and points to rafters in the outfield...and the pitch- it's hit deep-it could be- IT'S GONE! HOME RUN!   My party and I arrived during the bustling Sunday brunch rush around noon and waited about 30 minutes for our table. When we arrived at our table we were greeted by a very attentive and soothing server and surrounded by a cozy yet comforting ambiance. Our server was fantastic in her suggestions on food choices and when my friend declined the toast that came with the meal, she suggested that we get it anyway as the bread is speculator. Our server was correct. The toast was thick, fluffy, and delicious with just the right amount of butter and a side of fresh in house strawberry preserve. The breakfast menu is limited to around 8 or 9 items but every dish we ordered was damn near perfection. I ordered the rib-eye and eggs and could not be more satisfied. The steak was juicy and seasoned with just enough to give a great flavor without being bland or overbearing. I will be coming back to frequent this wonderful restaurant for many a brunches to come. Well done Matt's Big Breakfast, well done!

lndkVsM4skyTvfZrQsh9ng.text: A delightful eating experience. Chicken apple sausage was tasty and cooked to perfection.  Waffles with crispy/buttery edges... Delish! I would highly recommend this breakfast spot

kzPh9mEMbrBVsOpCHxYtGA.text: Matt's is the perfect breakfast place. The menu is simple with only about ten dishes and they have a daily special that is always good. I sat at the bar area and the waitress there was really nice and even offered to put my milk in the fridge so it would still be cold when the food came out. It's a small place,so there will be a wait,but its well worth it.

qelhLkDJgz5SbqmUrsqaPQ.text: Solid breakfast. Is it so good that it warrants all the attention it gets?!? Absolutely not. But like I said before, solid breakfast. Nothing fancy, just plain old good breakfast items that are done right.

7CaLwOLphOemwuhWaOJ9aQ.text: Excellent breakfast in a warehouse setting. We tried the Belgian waffles and bacon and eggs.  The food was served quickly, was hot and fresh. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly. Would definitely eat here again.

xXTuAi6YnKILcXX1aFhvog.text: I almost didn't stay to even find out how the food was because of the rude bald guy. I don't know if he's the host or an owner or a manager...I didn't see any kind of name tag or anything. We walked in, stood there for a bit, then bald guy greeted us. We asked for a table for 2. He replied "Ok...it'll be a bit of a wait." We asked about how long. He replied "I really have no way to tell". Seriously?? I mean, restaurants of all types and sizes have been giving approximate wait times since the beginning of time. You can't give me a ballpark? 5 minutes? 5 hours?? Something??? I was parked at a meter and had already paid for an hour so I decided to wait at least a little longer since parking was paid for. Had I been in a free parking place, we would have left for sure. We sat on a bench out front behind an old guy with a big fake boob lady whose backs were facing us...he kept putting his thumb inside her panties and molesting her butthole. They continued inside the restaurant as well. I'm sure this entertainment helped us pass the time, but unfortunately they probably aren't there all the time so your wait might be more boring.  Thankfully bald guy wasn't our server. We got Britney (dunno if it's spelled right, sorry!). Britney was fantastic. She was friendly (which is something I wasn't expecting because of reading other reviews while waiting for the...maybe 15-20 minutes it took for us to get a table.) She made great recommendations and was very prompt and pleasant. She is the only reason I give 3 stars instead of 1 or 2.  The food was...decent. The bacon was kind of thick and floppy for my taste. I like crispy bacon, but to each his own. The special was decent, the waffle was edible but not great by any means. The hash browns were delicious and tasted like buttery mashed potatoes inside. It was stuff I'd eat again but wouldn't see myself craving and traveling across town for.

UC4KdA6JA-qh3cJatZaX4A.text: Love this place!  I love it even more now that they moved to a significantly larger location.  Everything I have ever eaten there has been scrumptious.  My only regret when I go here is that I cannot fit more of the deliciousness into my belly!

Dvud1vmXbGXs5AWIfXapPw.text: Ok ok, this place is fine.  But it's so LOUD.  Don't expect to have an actual conversation with whoever you are dining with.  And it's a little hard to find something on the menu that doesn't have bacon.  If you're a veggie there is one option you can, but the veggie option (like for an omelet) are scarce.  However, what I did order tasted good, it's just not something I wanted to eat really, it was kinda my only option.  When I go out for breakfast I want an amazing breakfast burrito with a side of fruit, not some eggs I could have made at home.

Xu6GYqYTv6LFAxr03q1Vfg.text: Decided to come here after I saw that Guy Fieri loved the Chop and Chick. We ordered the Chop and Chick with home fries and asked for the strawberry preserves with the toast...yum! The chop was flavorful and eggs cooked perfectly! The honey lemonades are a must! We also got the griddle cakes and they were the best pancakes I have ever had! Moist and perfect! There was a wait but for good reason! Everything was delicious!

68gTxzOcaCC8I4bwWKvWLw.text: Damn where to start... hash browns are amazing, the honey lemonade is delicious, the bacon omg... I get lost in the rich fatty piece of heaven lol. Highly recommend it!

zwPkIBDoKuxqSwcI1oHcPQ.text: I honestly dont understand what all the rave is about. Chicken sandwich was good. The omelet my husband got was average and pricey. The waitress barely checked on our table and her shorts were so short her butt cheeks were hanging out.

L0JzicP1BlTJbsZ-xlFIOA.text: A small local restaurant with excellent service and food.  I was seated at a window seat immediately and was promptly served.  The hog and chick was delicious.  Worth a visit if you are staying in the downtown area.

rdFpXUUPNrVawE52ssynvg.text: Bacon was wayyyy too peppery, they should really just call it pepper bacon. The waffle was bland. However the omelet was perfectly cooked and the ingredients were fresh. The home made butter and the syrup made up for the waffles lack of flavor. Its nice that everything is fresh and natural but when 50% of all the food is some what bland it doesn't really cut it, and the servers were friendly but are a bit out there. Its hard to explain, unique, yet uncomfortable. I saw one waitress get on her knees and put her face right next to a guy ordering as he just stared at her and awkwardly gave his order with the most frightened expression. My dining companions might be back, but I will not be. It just equated into a mediocre experience.

5oZJo8yOiWSpRjdZC6IYuQ.text: Never had the chance to try the food... When I asked them how long the wait would be they told me they don't give wait times.... Snooty

2joLw1Py_8BWGOndVzj4sw.text: This place is soooooo good, a must when traveling to Phoenix!

lN5Sioo1IN6kYweg0tDOHA.text: Love live love the omelette with ham, American cheese and onion.  Also their homemade jam is awesome.  The only draw back is it is a bit loud.

Eo6XAP8CEqtkgHsXsZvnYw.text: Service was efficient and friendly. The omelette and hash browns  were amazing. We were disappointed with the pancakes. they were so dry and crumbly. Extra syrup didn't help much. Coffee was really good but no half and half milk only

UMs2sKl3lg5iMVE3xNE1sQ.text: Such a great breakfast!!  Wait was a little long.  Not sure I can say the wait was totally worth it but I loved the food!  Waffle was great!!

P4wSJv3k6_Nj9OGorfT3Zw.text: My husband and I have been going to Matt's every Monday for two years now and we love it!!! Everything on the menu is fresh and served hot!! The special of the day is amazing and the waffles are perfect!!

T7YjOJJQp1-hSZpEi1vDFA.text: Excellent breakfast food, and my new go-to lunch spot on weekdays. Everything is freshly made and locally sourced, and it shows in the flavors delivered. I especially recommend the airy griddlecakes and delicious toast with their home made strawberry preserve. Can't recommend this place enough for the quality of food, and the friendly service and reasonable prices just enhance the experience.

OWjh4vEXbS-xtrz-X9wOOA.text: Good but not great like I heard it was, pork didn't have much flavor at all, waffles were pretty good though

tvnusM3Hw3833Vh9kKXPKA.text: Fail, Fail, Fail, Fail..... so after trying to get to this place for months, after reading all these amazing reviews I can not begin to explain the disappointment of our long anticipate wait for this supposedly fantastic spot for breakfast.  Where to start. ... Cold-reheated potatoes,  not just one of our plates but 2 of our meals came out like this ( we arrived right at 6:43am) expecting freshly made food first thing in the morning...followed by "Center Cut Sirloin " a.k.a. Hamburger Patty priced at $15.99 Daily Special.  Seriously guys, Dennys serves a better Sirloin Steak breakfast. Then seeing Costco "Kettle Chips" bags stacked in the open view kitchen and showing them on the menu as if they are something that was prepared there fresh. Lastly,  one of the male workers complaining about his work schedule to another in a very unprofessional manner,  in short form, I would not recommend spending  $58.00 for breakfast for 3 Adults and 1 child.... First and LAST visit my family will be making to this place.

ifTs5exiKDQOPHWYNM6seA.text: Really good french toast and coffee was excellent. Came in on a Saturday before 0900 and waited for only 5 minutes. Staff were friendly and courteous.

UdXVt7GuQgAEz0aOVhKH3Q.text: The menu isn't overwhelming. The scrambled eggs I ordered with chorizo were really good. Hash browns had subtle taste and didn't need much of anything else to taste good. Would recommend if your looking for a good place to get breakfast.

RWlnwQoZNUUOL9ll2ZTPaQ.text: So beyond sad that I have to write this review. I have been coming here off an on for a year... And today was my first bad expeirence but after reading some of the other reviews I don't think my expeirence is off par. I sadly won't be attending this establishment any more. It ties directly in with service and possibly the cooks... Normally its quite busy at lunch however I showed up at 11:15am so I think I beat the rush because I was able to sit down immediately. I asked the waitress how much just a side of one little pancake in addition to my meal would be and she said $3. I know the are a tad overpriced but for the healthier food on the menu I would pay that little bump in cost... not so much for little pancake. I ordered the special which was Eggs Benedict and asked that my eggs were cooked overhard. As I'm waiting for my food I realize that my water wasn't a fresh water (strange) it possibly was sitting out for awhile because it had 3 half melted ice cubes at the top (strange). So I asked for a fresh water which I felt like I was a bothersome. I received my food and took a big bite out of my eggs benedict only to realize that I was eatting a raw egg. I looked down and saw the dizzle of the yolk running down my food. Since my server didn't check on me after the fact, I motioned the first server I saw and told her I ordered it overhard and showed her the egg yolk. She looked a little dumbfounded and took my meal away. Returned shortly after with a new plate... or so I thought. Seeings how this was the special for the day I can only imagine that they had a big o pot of water in the back harvesting all these poached eggs. Well what they did with my eggs was throw the half eaten and the other poked egged into the pot because I received the same eggs I parted with earlier. I was so beyond hungry I just ate it. Luckily I have no dieases or anything that the next eggs benedict customer would be concerned with but still I'm a stranger... with my food all up on their food. I don't know doesn't sound appealing and makes me think what else do they do back there?! In addition, while eating my food, I ran out of water. No refill. Nobody came to check on me. No service. I didn't even get a bill. I had to walk up to the front to pay.   I did note that the owner who is usually there wasn't there this time. Not sure if that had anything to do with it this day. I just don't feel I was treated like a customer. Text my husband on the way out saying... well looks like I won't be back to matts big breakfast again... Overpriced food plus bad service... I rather go elsewhere.

muXDqlpaVZPRKf_Clhr41A.text: I like the new digs ;)   The new location, although larger, still feels snug & homey to me. The personnel are wonderful as ever! Friendly and competent :)  The food is delicious, as always. I had the Hog & Chick, which is 2 eggs, thick cut bacon & home fries. The eggs where just the right size (I was complaining about tiny eggs at another establishment earlier, lol), the bacon was perfect & my favorite part were the home fries, which were cooked to perfection. My daughter had the Waffle. I'd tell you how that was but she had inhaled it before I got a chance to taste it :D She told me it was really good & it's too bad I didn't get any, lol!  This time around my baby & I stopped in after hiking South Mountain. You know how some people look good no matter what they've been doing? That's not me, lol. But I have no shame, I stopped in anyway! You'll see all kinds here, people dressed to impress, some who look like they're headed to work, others who look like they're having a PJ party, some who look like they're going to or coming from the gym & then some who've just come off a mountain :D Regardless, it's one happy family here & there's a feeling of real camaraderie, all based around the love of fresh, yummy food!

ji81tI9GQBS5slFi7eMc-g.text: Another Yelp score for me. I stayed downtown and did a search. It wasn't far from the hotel so we walked over. The area was not looking like there'd be a highly rated food place but bang, there it was. Nothing overly fancy from the outside but man the food does not disappoint. There's a decent selection on the menu and the prices are very reasonable.  No matter what you order, try the thick cut bacon. It's excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside wait looking at the entrance.

bOBB_anoRzNA8AP6nck8aQ.text: Eh....Guy Fieri can keep it.  The good:  strawberry preserves are amazingly good, sourdough toast thick and well-buttered, good coffee with real cream, and hash browns fried in butter.  The wait wasn't too terrible for a Sunday morning after church.  My daughter's pancakes were fluffy and good.  Now for the not so great:  burned bacon, burned hash browns, dry overcooked pork chops, and my scramble was watery because they didn't saute the jalapenos first to  get the water out of them.  When I'm paying $100 (including tip) for breakfast for 6 people, I expect a higher level of cooking skill than I can achieve in my own kitchen.  We weren't coming back anyway, but the noise level added to everything else guarantees it.  They are very big on fresh, local, and cruelty free ingredient sourcing, which is fine, but I think you pay for that gimmick much more than the cooking skill.

8070ZGw_KlSYPA4NDUYFlg.text: We came for breakfast and the food was delicious. The meats are very flavorful. Hash browns were awesome. I would have given it 5 stars, but the wait was about 1 hour. Then again, this is a sign of a great place.

mXvC8r98OCNXOQFRg5R6qg.text: I went here after an overnight shift because it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. I thought the food was decent and good. Not spectacular but for a dive it was fine. It is very small and can get fairly packed adding to the character. I didn't get to see Matt but would return for basic breakfast food.   Visited April 2012

hFOWSwjDK82PMqt224-0VA.text: I've been to both locations, both downtown and in the Biltmore area. The Biltmore location is slower and the wait staff isn't quite as energetic but the food is pretty good in both places.

RJ-CrKzpg816zo4uPG2WfQ.text: The line is always out the door and around the corner. The food wasn't worth it.

Zx3MWDm8IdHtrlY74GrCDw.text: I showed up this month for the Yelp breakfast club.  To me this is a really good neighborhood breakfast/lunch place.  Not necessarily a destination place nor worth the wait outside.  The food is good and priced correctly.  The space is still cramped for parties of 5 or more

j-_5MhgI4Qr0sX8b9Bic3A.text: Had a relatively high expectation. Got disappointed fairly quickly. Waited about 20 minutes and sat close to the entrance. No problem, no big deal. In fact, I expected us to wait before being seated.   The daily special ran out right after I ordered and lot of the things were out by 11am. I understand the business is doing well but you really cannot allow things to run out more than few hours before close! Sad. So instead of the pork chop and the daily special, we opted for the waffles and the 'new - updated' daily special.   I guarantee that this place is much better than Denny's. It's ludicrous to compare Matt's to Denny's. Sure it may look similar but the quality of the ingredients and the dishes themselves speak for themselves. But, to me, Matt's wasn't all that special. Perhaps all the hype and media have changed the restaurant a little bit? Who knows..

UeF0xdpYRTXl77mzq9RQGA.text: Good customer service and the breakfast is good. We usually order the hog and chick and waffles.

kYHspWgEOt_Wq20TlGcV_w.text: This place is amazing. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars is because the menu is somewhat limited. However it had everything I wanted and was delicious. People are very friendly and a cool sort of vibe..

fnqh2Y5OsTWaZCAgjbzp-A.text: Hand down, the best breakfast place in town. I love the weekly special and the waffle here. Came here every other weeks for the last 3 year!

UjllhrvkB-y-HqQNT4_oJg.text: After eating here I simply cannot understand the hype. It's kind of like the whole restaurant has a chip on its shoulder. The only positive is that our wait was short and the food came to the table in a timely manner. I ordered the Hog & Chick with bacon, over easy eggs, and home fries . The bacon was incredibly overcooked and splintered into individual fibers in my mouth. I've completely burned bacon before and it tasted better than this. The eggs had no flavor and were somehow watery. The home fries were decent, but there were multiple, half inch long Rosemary stems in  the way which provided a challenge to eat around. Final point of contention is that nothing can be subbed. I have a gluten intolerance and asked if anything could be subbed for the toast that came with the meal...nope. I get that some restaurants think gluten intolerance is a bunch of hoo ha and don't want to cater to that particular group of eaters, but in my thinking, as long as the sub is of equal or lesser value to the toast, why not? Matt's clearly doesn't agree. Regardless, I don't believe I shall return. No big loss.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog &amp; Chick with splintery bacon, watery eggs, and roof of mouth impaling Rosemary studded home fries. Eat with caution.

DPnKMA5F4vN_EFXj-hZfaA.text: I found this place by accident I had family visiting from out of town who wanted to find a local breakfast joint so we just ventured off and luckily we did. I just relocated from Denver and live in downtown only a few minutes from Matt's Big Breakfast. They seem to always have a wait even during week but to me it's well worth it.

e8-7v8aGCEn29plBmyyk0A.text: Saw this place on diners, drive ins, and dives so when we planned our vacation to AZ we included this place. Amazing!   When we first saw the menus we were a little worried as it was a bit limited. Once we got our food we knew why. Absolutely delicious!! Most definitely recommend eating here!!

52_3Cpzqqf-N_gfJHAlbIg.text: sweet baby jesus this place is amazing. We have been on a yelp kick lately and after a heavy night of drinking we decided to do breakfast in the morning. After a short early drive we arrived and were greeted by the most friendly staff I have ever encountered, mixed with a smell straight from heaven. we sat down, and ordered the special which was a egg scramble, the hog and chick, and two waffles. the coffee was amazing, the orange juice was omg, and the service was so fast and friendly. We took one bite of our food and it seemed like a whirlwind. the food is so good that you are in and out of there before you know it. if you go anywhere for breakfast it needs to be here.

s7jn5l3aChw4jv1s2SAycw.text: Our experience was only alright but the owners did take care of us afterward.  I could taste the quality of the food but we came on a Sunday morning which I don't advise.

QNfhIZZYOzrnFhrG-32KkA.text: The BEST breakfast spot in all of Arizona!! There's a special everyday!! I go here every Friday an the food is always on point!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop and Chick is money!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The specials of the day are the best!!!

b6zGdrLRG0dAmh3reZd_BQ.text: I had the scrambled eggs special with ham and sweet peppers and home potatoes. The herb smell and flavor notes were very lively.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled eggs with ham and sweet peppers. Side of home potatoes.

FKkKq5_1_J3jU9Gd94sMWg.text: Great food, nice place. A little pricey but a good experience.

dTv1GHXW9ZnFspAuAz0iPA.text: Good food, long wait but if you are in good company it's worth the wait. I love the pancakes, they are sooooooo good. Their bacon is just the right thickness and crispiness.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

OXlpOfKSuupVHJdNwl6lxQ.text: Okay. So my sister mentioned she saw this on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. It wasn't the same spot, as they had moved from the original location to open up a larger restaurant. The back lot parking is tiny and awkward, since you'd have to back out of it to get out. But, there is plenty of street parking.   We showed up on a Saturday morning, after a walk through the nearby farmers market. The wait wasn't all that long. It was only 15 minutes for us, as we were here at about 9:30am. But, it got pretty crowded when we left.  As for all the great reviews, hrmmm... Overall, I think the food is just average. My parents got the griddlecakes, bacon and eggs. My sister got the porkchops with homefries. I ended up getting eggs, sausage, hash and toast. The parents griddlecakes were huge. They could have easily split them to share. I snagged a piece of bacon and found it quite tasty. The hasbrown was kinda overcooked, almost to the point where it was sorta burnt. Not quite, but almost. Some nice soft, white bits in my hashbrowns would have been nice. The toast was pretty chewy and took some teeth gnawing action, in order to swallow. My sister's porkchops and homefries were just okay. Though the chops look like they were seasoned with something, it wasn't all that flavorful and a bit dry.  The servers were friendly and prompt. They were quick to refill drinks. The only notable thing that stuck out was that they were sitting 3 people at what I would consider a 2 person table. A bit of a tight fit there with all the knee bumping action going on.  The place is good. It's just not great. Definitely nothing spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Griddle cakes

qpBoyBhtwityoC76_K2_ZA.text: Love quick, delicious breakfast? The portion sizes at Matt's quite satisfactory and I usually go for "lighter" menu like biscuit sandwich. The downtown location is not too far from my work and has a very cozy atmosphere. Just like most breakfast places, they have a bar for people to sit at.

CQROkSfIH2XRPrwWkCgXeg.text: Expect to wait but the food is worth it. Fresh and local with nice portions. Bacon is thick and delicious and coffee was really good too. I got the breakfast sandwich and the entire thing just about melted in my mouth - the bread was super fresh. Their homemade jams are simply delightful. Will definitely come back.

rF_l4gj0y2a5OyW2PkpEnw.text: Been here a dozen times for breakfast and never left hungry or disappointed. Sometimes the bacon can be a little tough but it is pretty thick. The coffee is excellent and the waitresses are always cheerful and goid at their jobs. The only downside here is that it can get crowded at times.

2nWB9oO0EOxhV41GYyDz0Q.text: We were visiting Phoenix and stumbled upon this gem on Yelp! It's located downtown but parking is not inconvenient at all; there is a small lot or metered street parking, which seemed ample even during the lunch rush. We arrived around 11:30 on a Friday afternoon. The restaurant was fully sat but no one was waiting in front of us. We had a party of 6 and I would recommend to try to keep your group small. This is a very quaint little space with limited room for large groups. It's only a one room restaurant. That being said, we waited about 25 minutes (which we were accurately quoted).  We sat down and were greeted promptly. Long story short, the service was friendly and the food was amazing.   Highlights:  -Iced coffee: I almost never order iced coffee in breakfast restaurants because it is almost always completely diluted by the melted ice. Here, they anticipate this and double-brew their iced coffee which leaves it tasting extremely bold (like a cold brew).   -Apple juice: seems like a weird thing to choose as a highlight, but it was so fresh and I believe cold-pressed!   -Strawberry honey lemonade. So refreshing in the heat.   -Chicken Apple sausage: just omg. Must try.   -Rosemary potatoes: life-changing. No one at the table could stop raving about them!   Also, the gentleman greeting and coordinating the seating was friendly and helpful. The owner also stopped by the table which I thought was a nice touch.   I would definitely recommend this place! You won't regret it. The menu is a little small but only because they take so much pride in the things they do serve.

-wkOgFtqffsba9JJ9BwMaw.text: This is one of the best breakfast places I've tried in the Valley. The freshness and quality of their ingredients are manifested in the very good food they serve. Service is friendly and quite fast, considering that our group came at a time when the eatery was very crowded, which seems to be typical of the establishment. The popularity of the place had its downsides, of course - long waits outside and parking can be tricky in this part of downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s Big Breakfast, on the southeast corner of 1st Street and Garfield.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs over easy, bacon, hash browns.

cqA1mlTfVCYsFgcqC7qW7w.text: I loved the location. Came from the airport and was about ten min away. Had biscuits and gravy and eggs. Cooked perfect. Kids have omelette, hash browns and bacon, they loved it! The bacon was thick and sweet ! Cooked perfect. Service was excellent. All servers work together and every single person in restaurant thanked me for coming in!

941gQg9-5K8I5EC7MjAg2A.text: Great location, cute atmosphere. Staff was super friendly. The food we had was so delicious. I had the Hog & Chick with ham. The ham was super flavorful and my eggs were cooked exactly as I requested. My daughter had the cheese omelette and it was very good. Both plates were good sized portions.

34kJm6ILPmk6AEuL0CO0wQ.text: It's 5 freakin Stars!!!!  I've had the pleasure of eating at this establishment several times and I am continuously impressed by the goodness of the food and customer service this fine establishment has to offer.   The  food prices here are more than reasonable based on the quality and portion sizes offered. You can order the special and it will feed two at the right portion sizes. I leave food on my plate almost every time as I am stuffed.   Two areas to be prepared for are: 1) to wait outside in the phoenix desert heat to be seated, this is the rule; the exception is walking straight in and being seated. 2) The restrooms are there but the only hold one person at a time. If you got to go you may wait again in line.!In the men's restroom they have a toilet and urinal but no divider, so it's one at a time. Can't speak on the ladies as I am not one nor am I a pervert.  The customer service is awesome to me; I am called by name. I go here but I'm not a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_UAXk43lKZDAkCZs4J7Jcg.text: Best breakfast I've ever had! You have got to try this place! I had the special today only substituted egg whites it is delicious!!!!! The iced tea is sooo yummy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s special
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing!!!

JqA0mmG2HuZPgrs0_9Rxcg.text: I heard good things about the main Matt's Big Breakfast chain, but this one was very mediocre. Maybe it's because airport food is never as high quality as outside food, I'm not entirely sure.   We had the Sonrisa Burrito, which was decent. I liked the thin tortilla that they used and the salsa was a nice addition, but the burrito was very oily and dripped a ton as we ate it. Their potatoes were also undercooked and had a weird texture to them...   I'm usually a huge fan of breakfast burritos, but I wish I had skipped Matt's Big Breakfast and tried Sweet Republic next door at the terminal (even if it was 10 in the morning!).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonrisa Burrito

V7UHuDZ_3f_HiF55hIAH7w.text: Read this place was all the talk and have been wanting to try it out. Wait time was typical 30 mins so not bad. The food was fresh and AMAZING! the only reason I didnt give it a 5 is because I paid 3.50 for lemonade with no free refills. I would not have gotten the lemonade had I known. $3.50 is a bit much for a drink with no refills.

Liv0KZEfnAUdmxFiGp6Q4g.text: Long wait time....  and they won't seat you till your whole party is there... well, we were, but still had to wait.  I had the French Toast w/bacon.... VERY yummy!  Stole some hash browns from my friend's plate... love crispy hash!

ADvv3aHdts3yyY6bdDPLzA.text: This place is amazing and has since branched out to a few other locations so you don't have to battle the parking and crowds of downtown! Their scramble of the day is usually really good, but don't skip the sourdough toast and jam! My only hesitation for not giving 5 stars is the menu is on the short side and drinks are really limited.

OkLD-J02u3wZ-4y28zqBSA.text: So bomb! Bottomless coffee is what I like to hear when going into a breakfast joint. Very homey cool vibe to it. Very laid back. Felt like I could go here all scrubby or more casual and cute. I went here with three other people when we woke up one morning and we all got different things for about $10 each. Supppppper good prices!! Service wasn't that great I would say though. Over all rly good and I am wanting to go back.

6OV5GJTTUxf_9lTzvemHpA.text: A perfect breakfast. I went twice in two days when I was in Phoenix at a conference. The food was well-prepared, the service good and the prices right where they should be. My only gripe is that I didn't see an option for a half order and the servings are huge. People should always have the option of eating less and wasting less.

Xq31udFnjJsZTjL-WiWcwg.text: This place rocks!  A buddy and I stayed at the Sheraton. We wanted to eat a quick, good, filling breakfast before catching a flight. The walk from the Sheraton to MBB was easy and quick.  This is definitely not a chain. We got there about 7:15am and we were able to sit down right away.   Our waitress was terrific. We told her we weren't trying to sweat her, but we had to catch a flight so she took care of us. Service was prompt and friendly. I wish i remembered her name.  Wasn't sure what to order. Asked her. She said waffles. Definitely the waffles. I RARELY order or eat waffles. I don't know why. I just don't. They were awesome and hit the spot! The bacon was thick cut, crisp, and flavorful.   Coffee was good.  We left around 7:45am. The line was out the door.   I strongly recommend MBB if you are staying downtown. It will be well worth it!

XhCfEovn-R67_hUXt2JxmA.text: It's a cool cozy spot. Eating here I feel like it's False advertising though. It's called "Matt's BIG Breakfast," more like "Matt's BIG Priced Breakfast," the portion was really small for the price. Got the two eggs, bacon, hash brown, and sourdough bread combo for about $10. The food was good, but still left feeling a little hungry still. Overall it was a good experience, the service was on point, and the place was clean. I would of gave them 5 stars but like I said the portions wasn't up to par with the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GmMadJzyFg5jQm8CF3TU-Q.text: My husband and I just left and it was not very good. We went because I saw it on Diners Drive in and Dives and had really high expectations. We first got there the guy at the counter was nice, but when we sat we did not get very good service. I had the chop and chick. The pork chop and eggs were okay, but the potatoes were not good. My husband had pancakes and bacon. The pancakes were really good which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1. The bacon had a lot of pepper which we didn't know it had pepper at all. The orange juice was fresh squeezed which was the one good review I could give. I don't know if it was a fluke that we had a bad experience, but we will not be going back. We spent almost 40 dollars and I couldn't eat most of it. I would prefer to go to Denny's!!

UxfkjnDgO-F_j8JXoQ6O_A.text: Oh my! Everything is as it should be at Matt's. The waffles are from scratch. The seasoning on the potatoes is addicting. In a time of house BBQ sauces and organic syrups Matt's breaks the mild with their house ketchup. I can't explain the feeling of eating a hearty breakfast made from fresh ingredients. What reminds you of a greasy spoon diner ends up being a beautiful place for serious coffee and food. I would advise you to not pass Matt's by because of the wait. The time goes fast and they turn tables over quickly.

6Aa-Jm1Bn3KYBVdynNpWeQ.text: Matts big breakfast ride once again they hit it out of the ballpark! Really really good food and the staff is awesome thank you Matt. I will definitely be back in anybody reason post better go get your breakfast now!

fZxGh2K2dXDq1dtlliT7dQ.text: Our first stop in Phoenix and super happy we came here for brunch! Simple rustic little restaurants with excellent service and food. We were in and out of there in 35 minutes but I can imagine the wait over the weekends here.  I ordered their Wednesday's special, sweet and savory dish...french toast and apple pork sausage. WOW was the French toast fluffy and tasty! Best I've ever had and pork sausage was delicious.  Bf ordered The Skinny, basically an egg white omelet with spinach and apple sausages with a side salad. A very healthy choice and that's exactly how it tasted. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wednesday&#39;s Special

2xS2guY8JkKQZ1b0VVrFqw.text: Everything that everyone says it is and more. Super delicious. Everything was made to perfection! I had the waffle and bacon, my friend had the pancakes. May have been the best pancakes I've ever had.

1PsLYyTdfivbEHAZznnXUQ.text: I ordered the Hog and Chick breakfast. I order the eggs basted with bacon and home fries.  The bacon was fantastic.  They offer hash browns or home fries with a side of toast.  The home made jelly is wonderful.  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MTYbkdAmfUOHTWmm04Bajg.text: I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich for lunch. I could barely taste the pesto. It would be better if it was served with pesto instead of, what I'm assuming they do, just marinating the chicken breast cutlet. The macaroni salad was amazing and it is the only reason why I'm writing this review.  Great macaroni salad.

p4acdQzisy_tu-Kpw0yL-A.text: We were invited to eat here at the request of one of my relatives visiting the Phoenix area.  I have seen the establishment on TV and have heard of it's reputation from the media, but, even living in the area for many years, I never found the necessity to travel  downtown  to try the food.  We arrived at about 10 AM on a cool December morning and upon arriving we we noted that the area outside the restaurant was surrounded by potential patrons.  After putting our name on the list for a table we patiently waited fr 40 minutes for a table. With a wait like this I expected something over the top in a breakfast meal.  When we obtained our table it was in a small room with 2 refrigerators a prep table and cleaning sink.  Not much for ambiance, but, I needed to see the food and the presentation.  I ordered the waffle special and others ordered egg meals. I was somewhat amazed at the small serving size of the waffle which was about 6 inches in diameter.  The side was 2 slices of bacon.  The egg dishes were nothing out of the ordinary and were similar to what I cook up in my kitchen. Prices were average for a breakfast establishment.  Serves was a shining star for the establishment.  Our staff was great once we got into the restaurant.   Bottom line...This is a tourist destination made popular by a media celebrity.  As a local, I would not make the trip again to this place. in their defense, they have other locations in the area and I have not visited those to determine if the quality of food was any different.    If in the area and you want to make  the trek to downtown Phoenix and say you've been there, enjoy.

5W1WbB2BxgKuPw78jEeRxQ.text: After a year I finally made it back to Arizona. Matt's big breakfast was the first place I wanted to eat for a morning meal. I was not disappointed at all. The waffle was one of the best that I've ever had. The bacon was tasty and I enjoyed every bite of my meal. The strawberry honey lemonade is great to have as well. It is a bit noisy inside, but you barely notice it when chowing down on the delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best. Waffle. Ever.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The view from out seat.

ZCdVn7tzcNxrmEEo_sHa-g.text: My party of 7 only had about 15 minute wait. Cute atmosphere!   Loved the the window bar seating area. We ordered chop & chip, butter burger, the chili and the chicken breast sandwich.  The chicken breast was delicious. Pesto seasoned just right on a soft bun and very filling. The chip and chop was also good but the portion size left you wanting more.  The butter burger patty was cooked to order and very filling. The chill was amazing!! The bummer was that it was served warm. They had a yummy blue raspberry lemonade. The service was quick and friendly except our waitress who looked like she was pissed.  Not a friendly person at all. The bus boy should be promoted to waiter he had the perfect personality.  All in all it was a good experience and I would have given it 5 stars if our waitress was better.

LNgI-IHtkvvfYRrvdyvI1Q.text: I stumbled into Matt's Big Breakfast after a difficult overnight shift with the rest of my night team and immediately devoured a meal.  This place serves the perfect post-shift breakfast, which means that it also probably serves the perfect post-binge hangover food too.  Coffee is diner-style, with frequent visits from friendly waiters bearing big pots of coffee, and the Five Spot consists of a perfect-sized breakfast sandwich with thick-cut bacon and delicious eggs.  Even better, the price for that sandwich is equivalent to one from most fast-food restaurants.  You may have to wait a little bit for a brunch table on the weekends, but that only attests to the quality of the food.  Matt's Big Breakfast makes me look forward to overnight shifts.  That's one of the highest recommendations I can give.

V9sjkIkb0h-p7ztRoThs2g.text: Food and service were excellent. It doesn't look like much from the outside but you won't be sorry if you give this place a chance.

aehhsa9ISuZN_7A61LQ3zw.text: Bomb breakfast. I got a Belgian Waffle with Bacon, eggs, & hashbrowns. The bacon was thick and seasoned. The waffle had great flavor and also was cooked good. It was soft all around (before the syrup & butter were added). I like mine a little crispy. Overall, it was pretty good. The hashbrowns tasted homemade. They were great. The perfect crispy to soft ratio :). Scrambled eggs were just like any other breakfast spot eggs.  Servers are really attentive.

53oFFXYjwZIZTOwiz6Gk6w.text: Food was good but the menu was basic. No great selections, kinda normal. I like the waffles better then the pancakes. Freshly squeezed orange juice was good.

-HWJ2a5-Zo7FbUSfvvaX5Q.text: Chop and Chick breakfast was just ok. Pork chop was paper thin and way over cooked - tough and dry.   Eggs, hash brown, toast was good.

HcnuW5ZzeeVS8NZeiDBScw.text: Its been a long time since my last visit to Matt's.  I used to make the pilgrimage pretty regularly to their old location, but hadn't taken in the new place.  Boy, what an upgrade.  Their old place was essentially a shack that (somehow) managed to cram about 20 people inside.  It was a cool place and was unique to the neighborhood, but it was really crowded inside and the wait times could be epic.  The new place is roomier, can seat twice as many patrons, and feels much more like a neighborhood restaurant than a corner hole in the wall.  The wait outside can still be long at times, but at least now you won't feel as cramped inside as you do waiting in line.  Not wanting to wait in line, but wanting a hearty breakfast, I came here at about 7am on a Saturday.  Just came by myself and grabbed a stool.  My server told me its usually just after 8am on Saturday that it gets busy and the lines start to form.  So my timing was perfect.  Even at 7am the place was a little over half full, but no wait time.  The patrons I saw ran the gambit from families with kids, to ASU Downtown students, to workers in suits, to neighborhood artists.  Similar to what I remembered at Matt's old place.  For my meal, I went with the Salami Scramble.  Molinari salami mixed with scrambled eggs and accompanied by toast with homemade strawberry preserves and hash browns (you can substitute home fries if you want).  To wash it all down I went with their fresh squeezed lemonade mixed with honey.  Unusual drink mixing the sweetness of the honey with the acidic taste of the lemonade, but very good.  The scramble was incredible as the salami had just the right amount of kick, wasn't oily and they didn't skimp on the salami portions.  The strawberry preserves tasted very fresh and accompanied the sourdough toast perfectly.  Total cost for the scramble and sides, lemonade, tax, and tip was $15.  Good deal given the hearty portions I received in return.  The server was very friendly and the staff were all alert, attentive, and in good spirits even this early on a Saturday morning.  As with their old location, the detractors would probably tell you the biggest negative about this place is the wait.  Even now that they have a new location twice as big as the old one, the wait can still get long.  Take it from the waitress I talked to, get here before 8am if you can.  I did and was in and out in 30 minutes.  Matt's has a following for a good reason.  Great portions of hearty, locally sourced food at reasonable prices.  A legion of fans will tell you its worth the wait.  Count me among them.
