H90T3LQ7d-5U5iYMhwMrbg.text: Fun and unique  Mom and pop restaurant. A very small dining area with a menu that helps you decide by only being a page long. The food is very good with the pancakes and hash browns being note worthy. Expect a wait due to its popularity.

dWwHoq6dMT8o50v2wcIEYw.text: Great little breakfast spot. Reasonable prices for a great meal. Biscuits and gravy were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jXgwrXCWLcNll-vVdtKTVA.text: Our favorite bruch spot in Phoenix. Great food, good portions and fast and kind service! The toast and jam is so good!

n28leaVJpEKq098sICUYqA.text: I love this place, if you are looking for a great breakfast spot check it out. The wait is a little long at times but well worth it! Best pancakes ever!

QXlGsnYpabxv6qjOTwAHdA.text: Omgoodness!  Simple breakfast done right!  You literally can taste the quality & freshness. Even the ketchup was exceptional. I had The Hog and the Chick - 2 eggs, bacon, home fries, toast. The average breakfast but Wonderful!  Really fresh eggs scrambled just right - not too hard, not too soft. Thick wide slices of sweet peppery bacon which had less fat. Oh my, the home fries. Chunks of potatoes with onions, some with crispy edges, some without. Thick slices and of sourdough toast with delicious butter served with blueberry preserves. It seemed as if the blueberries were picked yesterday. And not too sweet. The perfect breakfast to say the least. The guy next to me had the Sirloin steak that he said was fabulous. I also ordered the Strawberry Lemonade. I almost drank the whole glass full on my first sip. Go there you will not be disappointed. All fresh local food.

MRMy8cTEsyfx1cT61GJPXw.text: My first visit to the new bigger location and I was shocked to still have to wait for 30 min on a Wednesday am. I think it was mostly spring training tourists. Anyway, I finally got a seat at the bar and once again enjoyed my favorite breakfast in the world. I can't explain how Matt makes a simple breakfast so remarkable - I'm just glad he does. BTW the new location is only 100 yards north of the old one. Try the bacon! the fresh OJ is to die for, and the hash browns are potato perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Line on wed am..
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-dRZD6cHxDcScBt6-DtaqQ.text: I have gone to Matt's for lunch several times as I work nearby. Don't be afraid to order lunch- it's as great as breakfast. I enjoyed both the BLT and the tuna sandwich. I go a little after 1PM and have no trouble getting a table.  Don't get me wrong- their breakfast rocks. But don't be afraid to go for lunch.

MkThewyyGGRRBtVeYPSfrg.text: Epic place to eat. incredible food and service. I know what im talking about. Your done here.

sFsBxSN_CJu1d9BhMyeLlA.text: Went here for breakfast today with a friend. The special was a spinach scramble, which my friend had. I had the Belgian waffle.  Both dishes were excellent.  We arrived at about 8:00 a.m. on a Tuesday morning, so no wait at all.    Only complaint: the music was a bit too loud.  Definitely a winner!

P5dyJ32kXpTL5MoXCXRR0g.text: We have loved Matts food for a long time. We met our kids with their new baby for breakfast and found they have no baby changing station in either bathroom in their place on the lake in Tempe.   The most disturbing part...when we asked about it ....the manager was disinterested.   Wondering.... what are they thinking?

4hPmHbWleYGGtYqSr9n2wg.text: I have been waiting to try Matt's Big Breakfast after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. However, for all the wait, including the hour wait outside the restaurant, it was a "meh" kinda place. The waitress in front was great with remembering the parties in line, and keeping you updated so we didn't have to be that annoying couple that keeps looking at her and her list to see how many people in front before us.   Once seated, the busboy brought out 2 plates, one which had old crusty food on it. I asked if I could have another plate because it was dirty, showed him, and then he used his finger nail to pick it off in front of us! Then handed the plate back down. Alright I get this is a diner, but still....your finger nails are not clean! and watching you pick off the food does not make me feel any better. I think he realized his disgusting behavior because after that he asked if I wanted another plate. It's fine I said, just praying I don't get gastrointestinal issues from it!  For breakfast, we shared the five spot, and the pancakes with a side of his famous hashbrowns. The portions are large, but the food was average. The five spot breakfast sandwich was tasty, with thick slices of bacon. But it was okay, nothing to wait an hour for. The hashbrowns were mushy consistency, not the crusty deliciousness Guy made it seem like. And the pancakes were good but again just average.

b6nEZ04oOcZmfDJgaK01vA.text: Simply one of the best breakfasts in the valley. From the food, to the attentive service, they never disappoint. I usually order a coffee and the special, and they are always superb! It's always fun to go to the location downtown, but it does usually have a long wait, so I prefer going to the newer location at 32nd Street and Camelback, where the wait is generally much less time.

4uuBiyqxNKYFBm2j3mdE6Q.text: I'm not sure why Matt's gets so much vitriol from some of these reviewers.  Maybe it's just the usual Food Network backlash?  In any case, Matt's makes a solid breakfast.  The home fries are seasoned with rosemary and taste great.  The much-hyped bacon really is good... it's the right balance between chewy, fatty, and crispy.  Eggs are always cooked up well and the portions are a decent size.  The coffee is good too.  The sandwiches for lunch are good too, and the BLT is the standout.  I've actually taken to ordering home fries instead of chips to go along with my lunches.  The only real downside i can think of is that it's sometimes packed, and it can be a  wait to get a table.  When it gets like this, the staff naturally tries to turn over their tables quickly.  It's good because the food comes out lightning fast, and good because your wait to get a seat isn't too long!  But it's not so great when you feel rushed.  That said, this is a really good breakfast, a solid lunch, and well worth a shot if you haven't been here before.  This isn't just Guy Fieri hype... it's good food and one of the better breakfast places in the Valley.

9dMwKS5ZHrBS-t55a6JEDw.text: Not much to add that everyone else hasn't already said, this place lived up to our expectations. The waffle was pure heaven, I'm sure I could have inhaled it if no one was looking. The thick cut bacon will make you question all other bacon you've ever had. Ham off the bone? A religious experience. Both the honey lemonade and the fresh-squeezed orange juice should be sipped like fine wine. Go here. Bring someone with you so you can steal food from them. Seriously.  Besides the food, the service was wonderful. Our waitress was extremely attentive and personable even though the restaurant was busy. The wait wasn't as bad as some make it out to be, be patient and your chance to enter Valhalla will come.

Nk2opfEiLJwJb9Hkv4rnqA.text: It's ok, and it is different.  I don't really get all the excitement about, it's novelty food.  I had "The Hog & Chick" and wasn't really impressed at all.  The novelty factor going on is a play on the word "big."  But it's not big servings, it's odd cuts.  Instead of 2 slices of toast, you get a single slice that's about an inch thick.  Three strips of bacon that are about double thickness.  To me it was just novelty though, there's a reason toast isn't that thick and bacon is usually sliced thinner.  When it's cut this way the toast was just a bit too much like a mouth full of bread, and the bacon was chewy, not crispy.  On the positive side, the hashbrowns were great, the over easy eggs were done perfectly, the waitress was very friendly, and the service was amazingly fast (Tuesday Morning, 7:30AM).  I'd consider going back for the service alone.  But I wasn't a fan of the food.  It was fairly average, which I guess is impressive for novelty size/slice items?  But I don't get how this can be getting so many 5 star ratings for being great service but otherwise just high priced novelty food.

pk__6IZ5T8oFKD67J-2Wsw.text: Trip downtown for flowers. Wife had seen or someone had told her about Matt's.  Wow! Did find a place to park but had about a 20 min wait. We were there fairly early on a Saturday morning and really did not expect this many people downtown for breakfast.   Decor was mostly just a large room with a small room and tables.  I am one or the people that say it is pretty hard to mess up breakfast. I am pretty much an egg, bacon, toast person. But there are many things you can do to make this breakfast great.  The eggs were cooked just perfect, the beacon was thick and taste, the potatoes were different from what I expected and were great, now the toast. I usually get rye toast as I did this time. Surprise it was marble rye. My favorite. This is the only place I Have ever gotten it at breakfast. My wife got the same breakfast only with sourdough and scrambled eggs.  The food was very good. The service was OK. I know there was a lot of people waiting to eat. I felt rushed.  When I am in the area at breakfast time I will be stopping in for a meal.

XtvO7NQHPyZ6RaUIgJMoxQ.text: Matt's is always really good. You won't be disappointed with anything you order. The quality of ingredients is above that of most places and the service is very attentive. If you're a fan of a really good breakfast, Matt's is one of he best in the country.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The special that day...sausage and jalapeño scramble

oZvh9O5EoXsO9ZYupDJjnw.text: Finally getting time to get down to write the review for this gem of a breakfast/lunch spot. Its places like this that make me want to move more and more to downtown Phoenix.  Ive been here a few times already and I try something new every time. I do have to say that the steak and eggs has been the fav thus far. A True man's man meal meant to satisfy that inner lumberjack. They cooked the steak just the way I like it which rarely happens. Unless you go to some pricey steak house, they always like to cook well done or still moving. Not Matts I washed it down with their  absolutely refreshing, fresh squeezed oj. Even their toast and jam was addicting. Breakfast has to be my favorite meal of the day, so a ideal breakfast spot is key. Matts has secured its way as a top performer in that category.  Moving past the enticing grub at Matts, the customer service was excellent. The place always seems busy driving by but when you go in, they usually get you in right away. The staff is more than friendly and always checking to make sure your dining experience is great. The joint is small but put together very well with a vintage, yet modern vibe. Watch out when you first sit down though, Its like planting your ass on the toilet in winter. Seats are metal so it takes a minute to warm up.

9XoWd2Hu3RX6FM1468unCg.text: Other than the wait it was really good. I got the pork chop and it was okay but i wouldnt order it again. Everything else is made really well and with great ingredients. Its simple but delicious.

pk6dc9ODz7sC6IrZYq-ZoA.text: One of my favorite spots to eat at, and I will go out of my way to venture here from Scottsdale. They used to be in a tiny spot that would have an hour plus wait, but they have moved to a much larger location that can seat many more and rarely has a long wait. Try the waffles, or the daily special. Everything is locally sourced and DELICIOUS.

tKi-NLntIsw18DKfc6YfEQ.text: Expect to wait for about an hour. The food is ok nothing spectacular. There are too many amazing dining options in downtown phoenix to wait so long here for basic food.

G7oOL--iQpaT3Giy1Sz8Fg.text: So good. Soooooooo good. Waffles were on point. Plus they had coffee. Too bad there wasn't any alcohol for the shitty date I was on

JysbI_9ZhvsQMSzB0NXnPA.text: I really enjoy this breakfast restaurant... That during my one week vacation, I stop here 3 times!!! Order the hog and chick generously portion eggs, hash browns and oh yeah the XXL bacon which is worth the sometimes long wait, but hey there's water outside to cool you down during the Phoenix dry heat... Staff were also very helpful and with a great attitude at all times

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My hog and chick makes the long line all worth it..kudos to the staff @ Matt&#39;s big breakfast for such a great breakfast

uRv7fj354D91FsNBle1Tcg.text: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. They say on their menu that they try to buy local, and fresh and make straightforward dishes, and it definitely is a winning combination.   Service is a bit chaotic (they use a bit of a team approach), but attentive and effective.   The place is also a great value; they serve a lot of food for the price.

ZEwPOnspVhDRnWsX--PTFw.text: Upon arrival, we came across a past customer who left a travel bag behind at lunch, when he stated his situation the manager refused to show any compassion "it's been passed to the city of Phoenix, here's the number, that's all you got." lack of empathy as a manager, especially for a customer who already came though. This is how you treat your people, huh? Nice situation to walk into, it could have been handled better and not for everyones display. Everything else: Despite the trendy styling, the food was mediocre...Plain, flat, overpriced, nothing to write home about, chicken pesto and Cobb salad. Next time I'm in the Arizona airport,  I'll find a different restaurant.

k1qCcLVpm4-Op7Xso4B97Q.text: It was my friend's birthday and she wanted to celebrate it here and have brunch. Coming here, I wasn't sure where to park & I couldn't find a parking spot so I parked at the visitors parking lot right beside the old Matt's big breakfast ($4 for 2 hrs). The wait was not bad, we waited for 20 mins. for a group of 7. When we were inside, the noise level was very loud, it was busy. Our table & chairs was set up really close together with the other tables so there's no room, we can't extend our feet and arms. I have no where to put my purse so I hanged it on my chair. I ordered the Hog & chick, it was very delicious. The hash browns were crispy, bacon was thick and yummy, my egg whites were perfect and my sourdough toast was very good with their home made jam! I also tried their freshly squeezed orange juice, i love it! it was not too acidic! Service was good they keep up with refilling our drinks and if we need anything else. I love everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sourdough toast with strawberry jan.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette w cheese &amp; bacon &amp; house potatoes.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hog &amp; chick w scrambled egg &amp; crispy hash

gtehaqSk0T-gcDJ1O-ECKw.text: Such fresh food and the best hash browns I've ever eaten in life!   The 30 minute wait for a table was well worth it!

ghbNLrb7DJnAguSZWTcN-w.text: The pancakes were fluffy and sweet. The real butter and maple syrup were the perfect topping for them. The service is fast and efficient.  The waffles and bacon were a hit with my friends.  I definitely recommend trying it out if you are in the neighborhood. I'm not sure I would recommend driving out of your way to get there unless you are a True foodie.

GxnwfjiYhnvETvRihiZ3ZQ.text: so we came here on a Thursday morning and were able to sit right down which was nice compared to the upwards of two hour wait on our first attempt to come here. Like many we saw the restaurant on TV and thought we check it out given the hype. The menu is pretty limited and it was more than a little loud on the inside but overall kind of your typical hipster downtown location for anything in America.    Instead of your normal diner fair which is kind of what we were expecting there was a lot of nicer styles of foods with definitely a direction towards local and organically grown which is a nice refreshing change. Service was OK as they were definitely moving people in and out.  Ordered the salami scramble and home fries and it was on point. My wife ordered the waffle which was decent.  Had iced tea because that was the most appealing on the menu for a beverage and we got one refill in spite of servers walking by repeatedly most notably one particular blonde female that just kept walking and staring at my empty glass. Overall the staff seem to be pleasant but seem to want to move bodies in and out rather than provide customer service.  Our server for example took our order and that was the last we saw them until it was time for the check.  The food is great and that's the reason why it is scoring as high as it is (wanted to go with a 2).  Service was timely but impersonal.  Clearly they have changed the menu from when they were on television which is neither good nor bad as again the food was great (at least mine was).  I don't see coming back again anytime soon but I will say that I highly recommend the salami scramble with home fries.

mZ5tYf24Ffd61kuGmzG6DA.text: It took us forever to finally get our butts in seats at MBB because frankly we aren't early risers and it gets crowded. Well, we should dragged our butts out of bed! The food was great and well priced. I have always wanted to try their waffle but also felt like having an omelet and potatoes. So I had my omelet and potatoes and my fiancee got the waffle. Best of both worlds! The service was good, the ambiance is friendly, parking is easy. It's a great local spot, the kind that you take visitors to...if you can get out of bed. And you should. I have other things on the menu I need to try!

Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The famous waffle
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aEIOn5C_bxtfdDDcxclz-w.text: Server was nice...had heard about this place from hotel. Excited to try it. Long story short...paid 20.00 plus including tip for Pancakes, bacon, and juice. Pancakes were big...3 of them...given about 1 oz of syrup...requested more...they charge 1.50 for extra syrup. Asked for coffee with cream or half and half...they don't have it, just milk. OJ was 4.50 for 12 oz. They do use maple syrup, but honestly it tasted like any other pancake syrup. Pancakes were dry as I really didn't want to pay extra. This is the first review I have ever written...downloaded yelp today. I feel this strongly about reviewing this place. Very disappointed. I feel like price wise they are like an expensive steak house where you are nickel and dimed to death. Not at all worth it. Just my humble opinion. Sorry, not usually one to complain...

upJi9a5VKPYTjXMBfIH20Q.text: Great Food, easy menu, worth the wait for seating! Service is fast once you are seated, waiters and waitresses take good care of you...The get o the food. Wow this is my new special place. You like a great breakfast here you go.

wtz4uO_gUW4bCZUylMjD9A.text: This place was something I had high hopes for, and the food actually wasn't that bad. The service was mediocre and seemed to get worse as it went. I always drink water and as soon as I ordered mine, the girl just walked off as if she was annoyed at me not getting a juice. I ordered two entrees and my mother ordered one. My mother ordered a cheese omelette and was asked for the type of cheese, the style of toast, and which side preferred. I got the pancakes (called something else) and the 5 spot which had grilled onions, bacon, and egg. As soon as I said the 5 spot, she started to walk away with no questions. I asked how the eggs were and changed that, then I said I also wanted the pancakes. As a server as well, I thought this was kinda passive aggressive when I hadn't been even slightly rude. She wrote it down and walked off. After our food arrived the 3 large pancakes were served with one small butter slice on the very top and that was all. On the side was about 1.5 ounces of syrup that would've covered half of one pancake. I ate the 5 spot first while waiting for our server to come check on us so I could ask for more syrup and butter. She never came till I finished that and I had to look around as if I needed something till someone saw me. She came over and I told her I'd like more butter and syrup. Her words were "the butter is free but the syrup will be $1.50 more."  I asked why they are serving 3 huge pancakes with that little syrup and charging for more syrup when you can't eat pancakes without syrup. She replied "because it's real maple syrup and they make us charge". It's not her fault I suppose but if I'm paying $8 for pancakes, what good are they without syrup?! I should've sent them back right then but I didn't want to be rude. It's just not a place I'll ever return to or recommend to anyone.

vWTmqFi0Oab_ZwNgDWb72Q.text: Not seeing why this place is so popular. Crowded. Atmosphere is like eating in a train station. Food was either very bland (the eggs) or spiced up so much (the pork chops) I didn't recognize it. I wouldn't eat here again even if they lowered the prices.

g1i-tdiQjJxLfObusAeAEA.text: I take all of my out of state company to Matt's. Solid, farm fresh, local menu. Thick cut, peppered bacon, housemade lemonades and orange juices and Cave Creek Coffee are just a few of the staples here. Try the chop and chick -traditional egg breakfast, served along a smoked and seared pork chop. To die for!!

8cTSDhjdSz3LVrKpzGNXpQ.text: Yes, the food is fresh and tasty and fairly priced and locally owned, woo hoo!  But is it worth two hours on a Monday morning to get a place for 3 people to sit? No. Not ever.  So even though I won't fight to get a table there again, I can say that my omelette was hot and tasty, the rosemary potatoes savory and filling, and the toast thick and...toasty. I like my coffee a little stronger, but hey, I recognise that many people don't, so no points lost there.  Because even though they have real butter and syrup, the whole reason I go out to breakfast because I want the time-saving convenience of having someone do everything for me. In that amount of time, I could have done the shopping, made the food, and cleaned it up, and I would have used real butter, too!

n6skysphYSKEIX9h01GJRQ.text: I don't really know what's up with all the good reviews.  This place was really crowded, so I was expecting some GOOD-ASS FOOD.  But it was just okay.  Everyone of our party of 4 got something different and it just seemed like standard breakfast food.  (I got the Belgian waffle)  Positives:  The inside was cute, we got the weird private front-room next to the fridge, so it was nice and quiet, and the orange juice was good.  Other than that, I don't know why we had to wait so long.  Extremely standard.  Could've gotten this breakfast downstairs at any Hilton Hotel.

_aKklzu0QxagBOSPdcBbXA.text: Waited 40 mins for our table. I was expecting the food to be better for that long of a wait. Took them almost 10 minutes to bring me water. The food was just ok. Also, I asked for a side of syrup, and it was a $1.50 extra for a small amount. I don't mind the extra charge, but 1.50 for like 2 oz? If anything it should be an extra 50 cents. OR there shouldn't even be any charges cause it is a breakfast place!

1BdTiahs6iNa9jTsfZXphw.text: Yum!   Loved the atmosphere and menu!   Was even busy on a Friday mid morning!! I can just imagine how packed the place can be on weekends. Good service, and easy parking.   Got the breakfast special-scrambled eggs with spinach and sausage. Hash browns were a little different, Kinda mushy. I will be trying the country potatoes next time. Friend had the salami scramble. Also delish! And good size portions! We had left overs to take home.    Will be back for sure!

o3i_PpTQc-sC8SMkg8LWzw.text: Best breakfast I've ever had in my life!!!!! Everything is organic. Great service and the food is definitely worth the wait. Also they make sure they get you in when it is busy.

CFnYF6nPoL2paIbZzV7waQ.text: I've been dying to go here since the last time I was in Phoenix! Nobody does breakfast better. The bacon is delicious. I've only been twice but I love the hog n chick! They have a homemade jelly and their toast is huge. Haven't tried the lemonade yet but I've heard it's good.

4cohsJy1cCAa266DqJWHEQ.text: Definitely not worth the wait.    55 minute wait of close to in order to have been given the waitress Allison and her sour mood.  Never once smiled, did not bring the order correctly (and when I mentioned it, she rolled her eyes and smacked her gums as if I was the problem.  I said I have a pork and berry allergy (so please no jelly) and I did check to see if they used different pans and cooked on different grills.  My food came with Jelly; and as I said when I mentioned it to her; chomped her gums and rolled her eyes.  The nicest person in the place was the man whom was cleaning tables.  He was constantly smiling and just a great aura about him.  The GM I am guessing was nice enough to come ask me how extreme an allergy was.  IT IS AN ALLERGY and if I AM SAYING SO, must be EXTREME!  My dates food came, mine came roughly 7-9 minutes after; I am glad she did not wait or hers would be cold.  I had an open face cheese omelet as when you walk in the door you see their staff checking other omelets with a  fork on the window sill and then putting it back - to then check another one.  To me that is a bit gross and with a food allergy (thus me asking for open face), it concerns me.  Cheese omelet should have been called open face greasy melt...  Lastly, one other gross thing that caught my attention.  The man collecting payment, he touches money (counting it as well as collecting from patrons, credit cards and the such, even picked up trash from the floor; then turns to the window and brings food to a table.  Never once in my 1.25 hours there did I see him wash his hands or leave the floor.  They will not go broke do to my one post - yet if it helps one person - then I am glad.  I would not go back, service sucked other then GM, food was second rate, and wait time - not worth it.

fd-eTqEZ1G8hmdamNDkH3A.text: Good, fast service, large portions and tasty food. It's nothing fancy, but they have perfected what they have! Love it!

jR3SlXu02X1lGoRoHnCc1A.text: Yum! Very much enjoyed my breakfast!  The family and I stopped in before an appointment down town during the week, perfect time because there wasn't a wait at all, even for 6 of us. We got to sit at the cute table in what looked like their front area that doubles as a prep kitchen.   We did have to wait a few minutes to get drinks, seemed to be last on the waitresses priority list. Over all service wasn't stellar, but the food was great so I didn't mind much. My brother did enjoy his strawberry lemonade tremendously, if I am correct it is house made lemonade and homemade strawberry preserves added. Looked yummy!  I got a traditional 2 eggs over medium (made perfectly! just runny enough with no snot on the whites), hash-browns and bacon. The bacon is awesome! thick cut and peppery!  A few others got their special that day, eggs and churrizo and a tortilla, wow so good! Not too spicy and tons of flavor!  Matt's is pretty darn good!

h-_dCKCWd_Yh0yhdD1zTKA.text: Good if you like your food cold and over-cooked.

TLGD6Q7CHqljtOGvNK346g.text: Had the 3 pancakes and their Bomb.com iced tea (unsweetened, but so good you do not need or want to add sugar) the staff was do great to us. Our table was wobbly and another waitress totally stopped what she was doing to help us out. We will be returning!!

E848Sufi4zx4tJN8-cR7gA.text: The perfect breakfast place! We visited the 1st street location downtown. I ordered the cheese omelet with veggies and home fries that were deliciously seasoned with rosemary and it was very good. I would recommend the home fries over the hash browns. I also had a side waffle that was perfectly fluffy. For any vegetarians, they don't substitute any of their meat options unless you want tomatoes, but they do price correct your meal if you don't want meat.

nbsFjkQmtGSuNNrd4CiBbQ.text: Decided to stop by and grab breakfast with the boyfriend. It was really good. Fresh ingredients and for as busy as it was, great customer service.

SEZegNlcODiTrgfvN1OzIQ.text: i was a bit skeptical after reading some of the less stellar reviews. but i have to say, it really depends if you appreciate the small touches to cooking that make the difference between ok food and absolutely thoughtfully executed food.   for example, some people say the hash brown potatoes are just no big deal. but if you've ever tried to cook them, it's hard to get the perfect combination of crunchy on the exterior and soft-almost fluffy on the interior.  and this level of execution follows all the way through to the eggs, the choice of peppery bacon (often called millionaire's bacon in san francisco), and coffee.   if you have cooked breakfast, are not easily fooled by heavy buttery sauces, and look for excellent technique and execution, this place is worth the wait. so grateful to have found this in phoenix.

7SUvOsnSfJSqBfLuB5LGIA.text: OMG, the best. Fresh everything, I was there when they were in the smaller building. But, still as good. Well worth the wait.

DviWlIceM9ME6aQsbg7qzg.text: *Warning - devoured the food before any pictures were taken*  Just flew into Phoenix from Detroit last night and already knew we had to come to Matt's Big Breakfast this morning. I found out about this place from Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives and had to try the famous Chop & Chick. Splitting this between two people and then adding a side of the chicken apple sausage was definitely enough for both of us!   Although the service from Gabby was great, I was a little disappointed with the size of the pork chop. It wasn't as big as I was expecting, but it was still delicious.   All in all, I will still recommend this place to anyone that comes to Phoenix. I'm kicking myself now that I didn't get more sourdough bread for the road because it was that awesome.

jkESFVggIL7A3A9kg0sm_g.text: MATT'S! I don't even need to write this review. Everyone already knows how awesome Matt's is. AND IF YOU DON'T KNOW: RUN THERE.  Whenever we have to drive up to or through PHX from Tucson, we stop here. We go without eating breakfast, drive the 2 hours, wait in line and eat here. It's just that good.   This place is simple. The frills* are few but they make a hard impact. The thick-cut sourdough toast with super excellent fresh homemade jam (*frill). The rosemary (*frill) on the home fries. SIMPLY delicious.  My go to is the 5 Spot (breakfast sandwich with egg, melty cheese, GRILLED ONIONS (*frill), and thick-cut bacon, and one pancake on the side (real butter, real syrup *frills).   For the two of us to eat here: full breakfasts with coffee, it's under $30. The wait on the weekends for two is usually 30 minutes, so not bad for regular breakfasters like us.   Seriously, the food is so fresh and that's just what makes it so good. The staff is so efficient and extra friendly. We always have so much fun and such a good meal here. This is a place where we will always visit as much as we can.

nF81bL8Ewz_LZG98hQpg4A.text: What a surprise to stumble upon this restaurant. My connecting flight changed gates two times, ending at gate 10....and net door is this fine establishment. My mind thinks breakfast at any time of the day or evening is a perfect choice so why not at least give this place a quick once over...  Interesting menu...the pork chop catches my eye so hey, why not, lets give this a go. It came out to the table in 5-minutes...steaming hot, with my eggs scrambled lightly as I asked, breakfast potatoes....I would have preferred hash browns, but these were good...toast, and one huge pork chop...awesome.  My eggs were perfect, and the potatoes were perfect as well, and the toast...I ordered rye, but didn't expect to get TEXAS rye toast...LOL, these were huge slices...buttery and quite tasty....and that pork chop...it was amazing, thick cut, minimal fat around the edges...bone in, and so moist and tasty.  What a real surprise finding this place...good service, excellent food, and the price...$9 I think....incredible.  Definitely earned a 4-star, perhaps a 5-star after a few more visits...in any event, a good experience all the way around. And speedy...in an airport waiting for your flight or making a connection, you don't have much time to sit around waiting for a server, food or a check when your meal is all done...this place was conscious of that requirement and did a great job. I will be back...I hope to see you there...!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chop &amp; Eggs
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HBvcZ-Pr9ijefziNH-J2Ag.text: Amazing breakfast spot, give this place a try.  Despite being packed, we were still seated within a decent amount of time (10 min tops).

3AXcjV8Oq2qxn7V7fSPSpg.text: After a late incoming flight and not much sleep, I woke up hungry and needing caffeine in the worst possible way. When my sister woke up we began exploring breakfast options before heading out for a hike. She mentioned this place and a few others but this one was the only one I had Bookmarked on Yelp and I'd really hate to waste all my research time. So we loaded up and arrived around 9am and there was already a 30-minute wait--ordinarily I would've gone elsewhere but I was on vacation and the weather was perfect so we just chilled. Almost 30-minutes to the T we sat down and ordered our repast.   Coffee- I thought it was pretty standard diner coffee; nothing good but nothing great. Apparently they sell bags of it to take home if you really find yourself enamored with it. 3*  Bacon- Pretty amazing tasting bacon--might be the best I've had at a breakfast place. It's thick-cut and loaded with pepper and you can tell it's high quality stuff. 5*  Sausage Patties- Pretty good homemade sausage patties that had some nice spice to them. 3.75*  Waffle- My sister jocks their Waffle pretty hard and after having a taste I can see why. It's light, crisp and has a terrific Buttermilk flavor. She eats it without syrup (heresy, I know), but I can see why.  4.5*  The Chop and Chick- This breakfast comprised of two Eggs over-medium, bone-in Pork Chop, Country Potatoes and Sourdough toast. The eggs were cooked perfectly; the potatoes were great and I really liked the Rosemary they put with them; the Sourdough was hearty, but nowhere on the level of SF Sourdough; and the Pork Chop was cooked well and left a bit pink--the way pork should be. My only qualm was that everything was served with very little to no salt on it; which is fine, I suppose, because I'd rather it be under than over. 4*  Blueberry Jam- This came with the Sourdough Toast and it really deserves its own special category because Matt's really outdoes themselves with it. Maybe the best blueberry jam I've ever had--not too sweet and tremendous blueberry flavor. 5*  Service & Ambiance- Really good and friendly service that kept my coffee cup full and checked on us frequently. Matt's looks a lot bigger inside than does outside and has a modern-industrial feel to it. 4*  Value- Everything is very reasonably priced as none of our dishes cost more than $10; compared to the Bay Area this is an outstanding value. 5*  Matt's is a terrific Diner that offers top quality food; fast and good service; and is value priced. I'd probably rate it at a solid 4.5-stars but I'll round it down to four because the underseasoned breakfast was a bit annoying. Other than that it's highly recommended if you're in the Downtown Phoenix area!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I could eat this with every meal!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sourdough Toast with Blueberry Jam
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Attacking the Sausage like a boss!

s2VzHwA1Y3oiGVzkaxRT1g.text: Overrated and not worth the wait. I thought the bacon was decent but definitely not the best I've had. Was slightly too charred too. Hash browns were okay but a lot of dirty potato skin in it. Waffle was dry, even after dumping syrup on it. I would go back if there wasn't a wait, but definitely not worth waiting for.

jz0nwAcxEqfeL8b3Ko8CfQ.text: Didn't realize how big the salad was lol but the egg white omelette was very good. Loved the chicken sausage

-PMCq0gdfxJCeZMW-i_Xcw.text: We went there last week because other reviews said it was a great place for breakfast. Glad you think so, I do not. The meal was awful - for both of us. I thought they served the absolute worst hashbrowns I've ever had. Not a place I want to visit twice.

mGWRApaSD6kQ6PXjP7F6Dw.text: I've been here twice, and each time is amazing. First time I had visited with some coworkers. The food is awesome and the service is so kind!   This place is so busy! If you're looking for a quiet place for food and conversation, this isn't it. I don't care, because it can tell everyone and everything is upbeat.   I recommend going on Sunday for their steak and eggs, the hash browns are amazing, and the steak is a much better quality than I thought we'd get.   Only downside is that they don't split checks, I totally get it, but when you visit their Tempe location, it doesn't make sense to not split checks since they are in a work campus for Statefarm.

JvbcfkeEdP4h0lqr2rpBWQ.text: Nice brunch place! The wait was about 20 minutes for a Saturday morning. The host called out name when we were at the farmers market but he put his bag in front of the line when we came back. The hashbrown was different from most hashbrown you would get at like a Denny's. It was a brick shape where it's really crispy on the outside but on the inside it was soft so I wasn't sure if it was cooked all the way. Not bad though! Just nothing too special from most brunch places.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

212_MOp5-Ht6PD5re_yTrA.text: Yes there is a lot of hype about Matt's and yes it's worth it. So is the wait. If you arrive any time after like 8:30 am on the weekend you will have to wait. It's no fancy brunch spot, just a good ol' traditional American breakfast that hits the spot. Eggs toast potatoes jam waffles pancakes and options of meat if that's your thing too - ( I've heard they have the best bacon around) it's all delicious and it really is BIG.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect omelette, and hash browns ,multi grain toast and fresh jam. They keep the coffee refills coming too.

6iptYfLPyVjiMCpvevj6mQ.text: I like that they use local farm products and some of the stuff is organic. The strawberry honey lemonade was different and good. I got the hog and chick breakfast - eggs were great, hash browns were super greasy, but spot on with the texture and taste. I prefer crispy bacon, which this wasn't but it had a good flavor. And the strawberry preserves on the white sourdough toast were excellent. I like that they have different specials every day of the week, so I need to come back and try the eggs Benedict, French toast, and biscuits and gravy at some point!  Very tasty menu and a cute little place.  There wasn't much of a wait - and the service was quick so that was nice.

AlzNHPSuXqjJe0RUB9eBCg.text: Service was good. Place was clean. BUT the food was kinda bland and unseasoned.

_0j1qrcJg6YHRdd__vivhA.text: This place was delicious! My husband and I came here for brunch. The eggs Benedict was amazing.

pGrNlifjSOx5lHlVPkMVfA.text: Great local breakfast spot that is a fan favorite for out of town guests. Plan on getting here early or waiting a bit because it is not the largest restaurant and it gets very busy during peak times. They have always changing lemonade flavors that are fresh and delicious as well as daily food specials. This past visit I tried the "hog and chick" which comes with two eggs, either country sausage or super thick cut bacon, and either hash browns or breakfast potatoes and toast. The sausage comes in link or patty form, I ordered the patty form and made a little breakfast sandwich out of the ingredients. The five spot breakfast sandwich is always a great value for only $5.95. If you have some time stay around for lunch, the butter burger and macaroni salad are out of this world!

wcOjXCcBWK1ECN5R9n6h5A.text: Really great food! Big portions. Just be prepared for the loudness. A lot of background noise for hard of hearing.  However spectacular food!

FWoKWon2And0PzMxemGmQQ.text: I love breakfast and their breakfast is my favorite, but that is beside the point. A lot of places make good food but I don't review a lot of places. I'm taking the time to write this because every time I come here I'm blown away by the service. These men and women hustle. Few places in the valley keeps a staff that even pretends to be accommodating. There is usually a line out the door. The staff is always moving, always seating customers, always following up and getting food out. I love it.

G8w40yQUfy8ksZdNQsxCvg.text: Love this place! Delicious food, cool vibe, friendly service. Amazing cheese omelette..their strawberry jelly is to die for and mouth watering waffles..even their toast was delicious! Highly recommend this place. I'm making it a tradition every time I visit Phoenix :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o2H88XOXZ54oyvStXx17yQ.text: Food was good, waitress was pleasant, as was everyone else we dealt with. The menu is small, but everything looked good and our food was great!

eb4v95gt3R3lNMCKDXcxTg.text: The food here was really good and quick. I had the chicken apple sausage eggs hash browns and the big sourdough toast. The coffee was a bit weak but the food was good and the service.

Y1FK1aWAfYxjNGtm1DL5bQ.text: First and foremost, a huge and sincere thanks to William and the entire staff of Matt's Big Breakfast. Your hospitality and generosity opened the door to visit you all week during our stay in Phoenix. I have always had a tendency to support local restaurants and the quality/engaged service you provided made our group feel comfortable.   The items that I order included were the amazing & fresh pancakes (Monday), Waffles (Tuesday) & Bacon, French Toast (Wednesday), Chops & Potatoes (Thursday) and Waffles & Bacon (Friday). I can honestly say that I did not have a favorite breakfast.... they were all amazing in their own right. Fresh thick bacon and divine rosemary potatoes were amazing and the strawberry honey lemonade made my time away from home worthwhile.   By the way, I am still shaking my head at the separate check/separate payment method confrontation that occurred between my collague and your owner on the final day of our stay yet since I am choosing to leave it to it being a simple miscommunication, I am rating you on the entirety of the visit.  Thank you again for doing such a fantastic job!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jpdocvWXske6IspaUU3g8Q.text: This was our first time here and we LOVED IT!!  We sat at the counter facing out to the street.  We ordered after 5 minutes and within 10 minutes we had our order!!  They are quick and service is GREAT!!  I had the five spot and I definitely recommend it and my husband had the hog and chick and he recommends it too  All I can say, looking forward to visiting Phoenix again so we can come back to Matt's!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So Yummy
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot was AMAZING

zYfljxopbwutSFMeXesOpA.text: Stunning, stunning, stunning food. The whole town was here on Christmas Eve and it's our new favorite breakfast stopover while in Phoenix.  Try the eggs Benedict special, and do yourself a favor and try their amazing coffee! They'll even pour a fresh cup to go for you, which is excellent if you're about to begin a long drive like we were.

m_ppcV6GDxdFQ6-7fM9ORw.text: I wasn't sure about this place at first. Reading through the menu, I flipped it over several times looking for the rest of it. It's a short menu. My belief is that if you have a small menu, then whatever you do make, better be good. And this was. I liked my breakfast sandwich- the bacon was nice and thick and the sandwich was big and filling. Potatoes had rosemary in them which I'm usually not a fan of but I actually liked it this time. Hubby had a waffle which I took a bite out of (of course) and it was delish. The prices are decent enough. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

hO-3A5IUAVeLf9W3_HZjPg.text: I disliked the food and the service, food was cold and we weren't seated probably. The service was subpar from other breakfast joints in the area and took a very long time to get served. My partner on the other hand enjoyed his meal and thought they did and okay job.  As is any review, they are totally subjective to each individual go there and see for yourself.

fSAIgR8gYiBp-DAhSdrlCA.text: honestly, its all about that toast and homemade jam! place is crazy busy during peak hours.

_6hmwYTNykpnf32h4_EXog.text: Great atmosphere. Food was delicious. Simple menu with great specials. Loved the strawberry jam. Home fries were amazing. Very busy. We had a big group of 11 and it's a small space but it was still family friendly and accomodating. Overall, great experience.

ITPuNtjhjj01ktdBKTDFFA.text: I hit the MBB every time I'm at sky harbor airport and it's amazing!!! They can turn tables fast and the food is always consistent.

xlmS-DhNR4B_kU22Q2-eMA.text: This was my first time and with the construction in the area it was hard to find. Once in and seated my eyes wandered, everything that came out looked delicious. I thought it was a little expensive for a traditional egg breakfast but it really was delicious. I would definitely go back and recommend it.

-Ow4PxLmwv4kICXhm46xVg.text: Breakfast, coffee and homemade orange juice? Any day, anytime!   I was so curious to come to this place after I saw it being featured on the Food Network channel (yes, yes.... "diners drive ins and dives" is one of my MANY guilty pleasures) And it didn't disappoint!  Honestly. You know it's a a good spot when it starts getting full on a monday morning.   First things first, if you can find parking on the street. Do it. You'll probably thank me later. The restaurant has a tiny parking lot in the back, but it's so tiny that you pretty much have to back your way out. Just save yourself the headache.   As for the food, amazing! The breakfast menu is not the most extensive, but it has all the right stuff. Omelets, pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, you name it.   Since I'm such a bore when it comes to my food, I opted for the cheese omelet with a side of home fries and wheat toast. The omelet was cooked to perfection. But I have to admit; the country potatoes and homemade strawberry jam were the best part of the experience. Who would have known?!  Definitively will come back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelet with house potatoes

sDbzkxFQgWU5bNHz5FpJiA.text: Came here for brunch. Waited about 20 mins outside to get a seat. Ordered their chick and chop it was good! Shared a waffle with a friend and it was delicious! Real maple syrup was to die for! I was gonna order french toast with maple sausage but it's only part of their specials depending on the day. Hence the 4 stars. Overall, food that I ordered did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chick and chop cane With hash browns and toasts with home made strawberry jam. And waffle with real maple syrup. Delicious !!

tcsdB-u0qU-vfEa2BJ2EGQ.text: Great place food was good as well. There's a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. Try the specials, you can't go wrong

umCAz7nAznnxuY1ujiqTkA.text: After all the hype I've heard for Matt's I was underwhelmed and left hungry. The service is quick and friendly. The strawberry jam is delish, I honestly would just want to come back to buy jam if they sold it by itself. Otherwise there are plenty of places in the valley that can also pride themselves on great ingredients without the long wait time or uncomfortable dining room.

CqyUtarhlFEX_khST-g_PA.text: This place seemed like one of the top rated brunch places in Phoenix, so this was the perfect stop for my boyfriend and I to check out right when we landed early in the morning to start off our Labor Day Weekend!  We got in on a Thursday afternoon and there was probably only a 10 minute wait. We started off with their highly recommended lemonades (me with strawberry, boyfriend with blueberry). For the main dish I got their homemade belgian waffle with bacon and my boyfriend got the chop and chick with bacon on the side. We shared half of each dish with each other and both dishes were great! I was a huge fan of the pork chop and rosemary potatoes that came with his chop and chick. The belgian waffle is also a must-try; it was very fluffy and just the right portion size. It is divided into four chunks so it is easy to share.  Service is fast and friendly here. Everything is reasonably priced as well! With our drinks and dishes, our bill came out to be around $35ish from what I can recall. This is a great spot in Phoenix to try for brunch, either at this location or at the airport if you happen to catch it there as well!

-74XXc1r2wfNTYCdInYuNg.text: Got the special Classic Eggs Benedict.  I have never had eggs Benedict and I loved it. The only thing that threw me off is that it is a plate that could be eaten at lunch or dinner. I think I would enjoy more if it were for lunch or dinner.  This could simply be that I am inexperienced with eggs Benedict. The service was great and quick.  The vibe was great as well.  Well done everyone!

8rBAlY0LQvN9w20ov9Y9fQ.text: Soooo good. We were kinda short on time and we're concerned it would take a while....nope! Food was out in no time and yes...fresh! Got a burrito and the kilt lifter. Gf got the BLT and an ice t. Both of ours looked so good we half'd it. Bacon was awesome and the jalapenos were on point! We live here and have never been to the location downtown...we'll  be headed there when we return. Oh btw staff was great. Super friendly and the price was not bad at all....especially for the airport. Can't get 2 crappy pizza and no drinks from pizza Hut for that price. Sold!

q-otmKLma7fo6wbI5L0bvw.text: Absolutely delicious, humanely raised eggs and bacon, real maple syrup, homemade bread, good coffee, and super fast delivery of our food to the table. What more could you want? Highly recommended!

0INw3YZhHE1dfgtl2y-qBQ.text: One of the best breakfast we ever had. The hash brown has so much flavor that its so worth it to drive downtown just for this. dAt potato, i would recommend to anyone.

7uriSh7WoPCGsvuthH2T0w.text: Can't go wrong with this place for.breakfast. I love waffle and they have the BEST waffle and bacon dish. I'm known for being picky with food and wow I didn't want to put my fork down. The food was delicious,the servers were amazing, the service was fast. The wait time was not too bad even with a lot of ppl waiting because the staff were quick. Definitely My go to breakfast spot whenever I'm in Phoenix.

aFvc6jPxjc7Dg5FWSyaSsg.text: Stopped in on the way to the airport and had a most amazing breakfast ever.  Super fresh food, funky cute place, reasonable prices.  I ordered pancakes with patty sausage.  The pancakes were really hot, which melted the REAL butter perfectly and was served with hot 100% maple syrup.  So good.  The sausage patties were generous (probably 8oz total), uniquely spiced and delicious.  Coffee was great and refilled regularly, which means service was excellent.  My brother in law had the special - a spicy Mexican egg combination with lots of jalapenos, spicy chorizo and cheese. He only had good things to say.  My sister had bacon and eggs, over easy - eggs cooked perfectly.  The bacon was really peppery and thick - yummy if you like peppery bacon.  At any rate, we had a great, big, breakfast - really recommend this cheerful, tasty little establishment!

mjsddEZsogTJutti3ewmLg.text: Visiting Phoenix I went to Matts for breakfast!!! Everything was delicious! The waffle, honey lemomade, breakfast and surprisingly the sourdough bread with the homemade blueberry jam was AMAZING! Make sure you order sourdough and blueberry jam!

s5GWke9x9xFNrH1Np3t6-g.text: After waiting outside for a table we got one close to the bathrooms and it was heinous. The large orange juice should have more water than orange. The ambiance is pretty busy so the waitress. Hence, it is a whole mess without mention that the bill arrives just on time to kick us out and welcoming the new victim. The food was ... Oh yes it was as bad as the service. Probably it wasn't my day and not even the sort of place I will repeat. PD: I am not a bacon person.... If you are not a bacon person don't waist your time.. If you are... Check other reviews !

DiRe05AUIYXRNepuiZK1rw.text: If I died and had one last meal, it'd be breakfast from Matt's. I was a regular at Matt's for four years and not enough great things can be said about the owners, the staff, and the food. If you don't have patience issues and can withstand a short 15-30 minute wait, do yourself a favor and stop in for the Hog & Chick and a hot coffee. The hash-browns are some of the best you'll ever have and the bacon is thick-cut, peppery excellence. If you don't enjoy your food or your experience, send me a message and I'll reimburse you. I'm not kidding.

I0cr4su1FNIpnX-B1ISodg.text: The first time I went here I thought it was a good Yelp pick.  The last time I went here I shelled out $18 for a scramble without meat, and a large OJ.  If you come here with a party of four your tab would be close to $80.  $4.50 for a large OJ that was probably bought at Costco for $5 a gallon!?  Food is good, but not worth the high cost  and wait considering the location is in an industrial area.  I have been to hundreds of restaurants world-wide and know what is a reasonable cost for your meal.  Diners and Dives made it popular, but now I think they are gouging the customer for their product.  Cashier tried to justify costs, but the #s just don't add up.

xBX7nGNJrHAU2MLKsJVDYg.text: Disappointed sums it up. I don't understand why this place is so busy? My pork chops with eggs was average at best. Nice sear to the pork chop but it was dry. Would only go back if any co workers wanted to try it out. I'll try the  omelette next time.

iCGsBl3l9Pw0HrlSZ5rl5Q.text: Matt and Ernie are some of the most genuine people I've ever met. Both very hard workers and the food at their restaurant is amazing!!! I love how they give quality ingredients but the food is still very affordable.

ra1lOoE2Hlh3HkHibttx0A.text: So the food is fine..but the "new" location eeew! Its sooooo gross!! We sat st the bar and right at the window next to us was  a homeless guy takung off his socks..then makinga drug deal..then across the st a guy jumped in the dumpster and a transient couple was making out on a tarp..came from california and was wanting to eat here..never again!! The parking scks too if you do come here the reuben looked good and strawberry lemonsde was yummy. My salad was meh..

m1Wbf5zvZzk6rW1P9UqHxg.text: Oder eggs, hash brown and bacon person next to Oder the same to go after he had his breakfast because bacon smell great

Y5IReNLJfOsSwekW15oLPg.text: Above average breakfast and will most likely be going back. The waffle was wonderful and the syrup was real. Fantastic thick cut bacon. One thing though it seems strange to me that biscuits and gravy is missing from the menu of a breakfast joint. Very busy place however we were seated quickly and service was quick.

yR_xA7X7O8YoXpHXmtIFXA.text: We recently visited Matt's for breakfast. We were seated at the counter and the food came out quickly and was fantastic. However, our waitress was less than stellar.  She gave us our food and ignored us the rest of the time.  The thing that really bothered us was that she and another server were talking about their customers.  Basically, right next to where we were sitting.  How unprofessional can you be?  I loved the food ,but I am not sure if I will return based on the behavior of the servers.

4Cf1iJKwpRg-5RR4VtFltg.text: First tried this lovely little breakfast joint about two years, and have been dying to come back! It usually ends up that I'm in a different part of town or in the neighborhood after Matt's is closed. Absolutely delicious breakfasts! And huge! In a nicely decorated downtown space! The service is on the ball - but you almost feel a little hurried. Still, an undeniably fantastic breakfast! I would rank Matt's in my Top 5 Breakfasts of All Time (yes, I am that serious about breakfast).

0ASoPCIWa7BzrNy63mfDaw.text: Best breakfast ever, anywhere. Farm fresh food. Lightest waffles. Delicious local bread. Unbelievable bacon.

oHbrttWXVBVXFdVY5poemA.text: Big Portions.  Come hungry.  Leave satisfied and fat.  Food quality is top notch and you MUST try the bacon.  Peppery, thick cut, and just as good as bacon gets. I had the special (which was eggs benedict). Sauce is a little on the sweet side but really very good.  No shortcomings here.  Great place for high-energy, busy breakfasting to get your a$$ going!

dNUA2T1SI4hC-IhklkCuXA.text: This was my first time here. I came here for the sixth "meeting" of the Breakfast Club UYE. I might have to update this after going a few more times but first impressions were very good. I don't know what else I can say that hasn't already been said. This place has been on every "watch someone else eat" food show around and been reviewed a hundred times over. I am told this is their new slightly bigger location. It was very nice. We did have to wait until all of our party showed up to be seated. Which ended up being 14 strong when it was all said and done. Once we were officially on the list the wait wasn't too long and they had put together a few tables to seat all of us together. Due to the noise level inside the waiter addressed each end of the table separately so he didn't have to yell across the table. Drink orders were taken and soon after water and other drinks started to come out. Two people went around the table getting food orders. I had to get the griddlecakes even though the egg scramble with chorizo special was very tempting. I came for pancakes and that was what I was sticking to. Now I thought the food came out fairly quickly unless I was just caught up in conversation which is known to happen at the Breakfast Club. So many great people to talk to. My griddlecakes were awesome. Some of the best I've had ever. My one small complaint was extra syrup is $1.50 and I love a lot of syrup on my pancakes. But it was worth it because it was real maple syrup and the pancakes were so good. I finished off the entire stack of three pancakes which I'm told is quite a feat as they are big and rich. I was hungry and was determined to make it through. They didn't split the check but let each of us pay our share and in the end it was all taken care of. I will definitely be back to try all of the other stuff on the menu which is why this review may or may not change. I hope it doesn't because based off the pancakes alone this place is one of the best and deserves all of the attention and the line outside to get in. Can't wait for the next Breakfast Club "meeting".

K2P0_DRNkF348oGijDO7Rg.text: I hate complaining but this place is highly overrated. The place is small and the food is just okay. I had the waffle, some bacon, eggs, and hash browns. Nothing to write home about.. just review. Haha

CLYkUg7vmHBLbylch1WCTw.text: It was greasy, they don't put onions in the hashbrowns. I would not recommend this place

n-WdcjyCt4T2w9TEoFKJ6w.text: My favorite breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix! Great atmosphere and service. You can tell everything is made from scratch. Their fresh squeezed orange juice and honey lemonade is delicious. I usually order the special and the griddle cakes to share with whoever I'm with. I recommend sharing to get the best of everything.

_tMoV-W8g0MV1EyYj3RSsw.text: The food here is amazing. Their specials are usually the best thing on the menu! The bacon is extra crispy and thick, which I love. The eggs are great and usually accompanied with sausage, cheese and whatever else you'd like. There's a jalapeno and eggs special that is to die for if you like a little kick in your food. The only downside to this place is that there is always a wait (30-45 min) on weekends to be seated. But it's worth the wait. Also, they don't serve mimosas but you won't care about that once you've tried the food.

olljAepWXhTBvZftpKP00Q.text: Good food, decent prices, solid service...Didn't have to wait despite a bustling Friday morning scene...sat at the bar...Had the five on a spot breakfast sandwich which was very tasty...Lovely freshly squeezed orange juice, the real deal here. The con ? It's a very loud space....  I'm glad  I tried it after hearing how popular Matt's wash...Everything seems freshly prepared, the atmosphere is upbeat and you can be in and out of there in a snap...  Unfortunately, I live in North Scottsdale and there aren't places like Matt's by me...Hopefully one day. Good job mates...keep up the good work...

xinfDPtXjzj3Vw_NTx7MnA.text: Was visiting Arizona and asked where would be a decent place to eat. When I first found this place it didn't appear to be a hot place. Appearances can be deceiving.   I have had some great food in my travels. But this was the best overall experience I had. I ordered a regular breakfast and had pancakes on the side and of course an RC cola.   The wait staff was attentive and very friendly. So friendly that I felt like a regular. The place was packed with customers but the wait staff worked as if it were not an issue. My food arrived hot and quick. It was absolutely delicious.   I would personally recommend matts big breakfast to anyone. I will be returning when I visit arizona in future.

_tkzWnc7l5r7luzFWfoNDQ.text: Very busy, but still quick and attentive service coupled with great food...the place is a winner.  It is relatively small so expect a wait on weekends.  I will go back, and I can recommend that you give it a try, too!

ZLe_Twk5hsI8Gxt9Vco2lw.text: We make this a destination for our family as much as we can! The waffles are superb! And the omelets come the size of your face! And you wish you could have more (despite your overstuffed stomach).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffles! My personal favorite! I ask for some strawberry preserve and turn it into my syrup substitute! Yum!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ruben
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sour dough with some of the best strawberry jam I&#39;ve ever had!

5-_hNS9DJ5OYuCGNtLQGXQ.text: Quite literally the best breakfast I have ever had. I had the French Toast special today and my mouth has never been so happy. I think I had a foodgasm. In addition to the amazingly flavorful food, the ambience was really cool inside and the entire staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The owner herself even came out to see if we had any questions!  This place is the best.

SEXvEDsE6_D8Fq9lWJwxqw.text: Every part of this breakfast was perfect. The ham was the way God intended country ham to be. Cut the leg off a pig, cure it, smoke it, slice a huge chunk off of it fry it up and eat! The hash browns were....crunchy and creamy. I have never eaten a hash Brown that I considered delicious until today. Topped off with two perfectly fried eggs and thick sliced sourdough toast with home made strawberry preserves....heaven on a plate.  Service was attentive and quick...highly recommended!

F_t_x4Qq55qOQD9b_fwoxA.text: Amazing breakfast! Small spot with big flavorful food. I got the Five Spot breakfast sandwich, amazingly soft bread!! You can taste how fresh all the ingredients are! First time here loved that we walked in and thru a large window you could see staff hand jarring jam! This place is a hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Eat at matts&#34; cool urban vibe
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place has a young hip vibe with amazingly flavorful food to back it!

7JfjQXUFyPvZeCII0NkkGA.text: I heard about this place not to long ago and decided to give it a try.  It was packed, so the wait was pretty long but it worth it.  The fresh squeeze OJ is awesome but be ready to drink some thick pulp. I like it but I'm sure it can be a shock for the american taste of the shitty artificial juice that they have us so used to.  The waffle was pretty good. The bacon was crisp and full of flavor.  I ordered eggs with the rosemary fries and bacon. Those fries worth the trip!  Cheers!  PS Great service

VJEoj7AYGq8M1e0Cx0DHwQ.text: When I think of a great breakfast place I would take my friends, I think of Matt's.  Hands down the best breakfast joint!  I understand that waiting for a seat can be long but it is worth the wait.    I know the new place has been open for awhile but I love it!  Bigger location but still the great food and friendly staff!  I am just drooling over the thought of the Belgium waffle with REAL maple syrup and BACON!  All of my favorite foods on one plate.  The Chicken Sandwich with pesto, provolone and peppers is the juiciest sandwich I have ever tasted.  The peppers are not on the usual sandwich. I believe it was the lunch special.  Matt's is a fixture in Phoenix and they are here to stay.    I wish I could give you more stars!!

9YZ4HyaVlXmn2bft0KHjdA.text: A Big Breakfast with a small menu!  Note: this review is for the vegetarian options.  Small, cute restaurant in the middle of a neighorhood area that ALWAYS seems to have a line. Words of advice- WAIT. IN. THE. LINE!   Service- we sat at the bar, which isn't huge (I think there were between 12-15 stools), and the  server was very friendly, very helpful, and very nice. Our food was brought out promptly, water was refilled before we could get close to finishing, and we were checked up on every 5 minutes. 5 stars.  Atmosphere- Really cute place that's always full. It's not huge, but it's not tiny either. Everyone seems to be in a good mood, and its a wonderful BRUNCH location. It's fairly loud, so not a quiet, date location, but great to come with 1 person for good food, or with a small group for brunch at the tables. 4 stars  Food- And now for the best part. The food! They have a small menu which I don't mind because everything is well thought out and creative. The cheese omelet (with Wisconsin cheddar of course) was well-cooked, didn't have too much cheese to make it goopy, and went very well with the sauteed onions. The made-from-scratch Belgian waffle was DIVINE. Every bite was delicious and the REAL maple syrup it's served with is delicious. Don't drench the waffle so you can taste the amazing batter itself and the syrup to compliment it. 5 stars.  Drinks- ORDER THE FRESH HONEY LEMONADE! Wonderfully refreshing on a hot day, fresh, homemade taste, and sweetened with honey to add that kick at the end. 4 STARS.  Bottom line- come early, wait in line with good company, try 1 thing with syrup, 1 without, and order the lemonade. Go home happy.

4kxhYuHI0FjmNJplaHXYiw.text: Awesome service & Food!!! Having wonderful service and then awesome food just makes this place ROCK!!! First time here and it was Great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special for the day!! Three eggs with jalapeno, cheese, ham with wheat toast/ homemade strawberry jelly...yum   yum!!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F2uvQaPCFXxqPBDo-R9Gaw.text: Had the three egg scramble with grilled pork tenderloin and jalapenos that was the special today. Absolutely delicious! If you have a party of six or more be sure to call ahead so you aren't waiting hours outside!

UrqesFHpfXayXtlbF2DWqw.text: I went here for breakfast this morning and found 2 large black hairs inside of my pancakes.

dwOFER9IWvCkIurmWC27cA.text: Mom and I stopped in for breakfast on a Tuesday morning and the place was packed (which is a good sign!). We only waited a few minutes before being seated at the counter (which we were glad as the dining room was packed and noisy). The food was great (had the cheese omelet with mushrooms-excellent!) However the exception was the home fries, which came in a large block, were greasy and tasted like they were previously frozen. Other than that, the service was great, coffee was good and they kept the refills coming. I'll def be back but will choose the homestyle potatoes instead.

-wGeBYBVLHSs-5aJDXOFDw.text: If your really hunger this is the place for you ! Took home half my meal pancakes were on the mark . Service I little slow . Will be back

SsDhswMF07_W3BOwy6UAOQ.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE that I didn't have to wait on a Sunday for an hour to get me some Matt's. I will be back. Once upon a time in the original location I was quoted an hour & half wait. This time upon arrival I was told we don't give wait quotes but you've only got 4 in front of you. So we waited a minor 10 minutes & were happily eating in another 10. So we aren't early risers by any means so it was more like lunch time & the eggs bene was all gone. Sad faces but hey it's our fault for staying up too late. You know the whole early bird blah blah.

jlyXP2IbPG5HlHfOrlBbog.text: The special - sweet and savory French toast - was amazing! The omelets and home fries were superb. Even the wheat toast was phenomenal with homemade preserves.  We are planning breakfast for the trip home!

2X1YxZJ5cH-eut1PDOBBGA.text: Just plain yummy in the tummy! I love shredded hash browns and they do them up right! I love everything they have, though!

2tp4-o6XL04WwizsZHlWyg.text: Went here a couple weeks ago & there service and food was great. The portion size was big and tasted even better. Very friendly environment. I would highly recommend this place.

5IP5smxAxh7Iw21i4AhQ5A.text: Breakfast for dinner!  Awesome waffles, Bacon really peppery. I love it. Good bar too.

hmC9c00hKxQFkRIi9Hs3DA.text: Had a chance to check it out ..was very busy inside and there was a wait., but the food was good even with a limited menu. Id go again if im close by

bRJ_DMOcCj2D8p0VyiI_wQ.text: Was in town for work. Saw this place on DDD and went on the way to the airport. Awesome food. Had the special- chicken sausage scramble with hash browns. Both excellent. Best meal of my trip here. Will definitely be back.

fXEPjSPY0rVcE67lqUb4Gg.text: Living in Carefree, we don't get downtown Phoenix very often.  When we do, it is a MUST to have breakfast at Matt's.  It may be a hole-in-the-wall, but it is a great hole-in-the-wall!

mM10aYPszkVZU5N49WKC_g.text: Stopped by near the end of their day as it was convenient and didn't know what to expect. The servers were excellent though they must have been getting geared to shut down. It was late enough we had no wait at all and our server encouraged us to take our time ordering and enjoying the meal. I wasn't super hungry, but I tried the special (three egg skillet with peppers and other goodness) and it was amazing. I will definitely be back next time I am downtown in the morning.

i20oHVkv7nmzYqtRhYnJvA.text: It was alright.  The prices were a bit steep for the portion (from my perspective), and the food was just okay.  No minds were blown away at my table.  Service was good though and the place was tastefully decorated.

NmyXEd_4t5M_2pSPFBaRpA.text: We visited Phoenix last week and ate breakfast here twice.  The food and the staff were terrific.  I wasn't hungry for many, many hours after having breakfast!  It's a bit on the noisy side and you do have to wait.  I think we waited between 20 - 30 minutes each time.

_2AR3XhWNE25uoNeE7sYIg.text: Hands down the best breakfast join in Phoenix. Good atmosphere, good service, and absolutely amazing breakfast food.

OlHlbm-xmAVFDFcTivMEbA.text: This place is hands down amazing! First time there and I will definitely be coming back. :) friendly staff, fast service and very comfortable setting. Their menu is simple which I loved! Their ingredients are top ingredients. Don't even know where to start..... My absolute fav was the waffles! So amazingly tasty! Their home fries are so delicious. My dish came with toast so I got wheat toast, it was so delicious and it comes with butter and jelly theee best!! And to top it off the bacon is oh so yummy ;) Wish they had a location in the LA area. Love this spot!

qcRo-t9xk7q2JkkenkmhJQ.text: This place does have really good breakfast, the homemade jelly and hash browns are pretty good. But the 12oz OJ for $4.50 is ridiculous!!! I know it's fresh squeezed but really?

4oF4kxuMNTQ5XQR-ApW8sQ.text: How did anyone give this place a score lower than a 5?? You must hate breakfast. The quality of the food is equal to any in the US.

xmGgC0oKGUYUMovyJGlExw.text: This is the best breakfast in town. All very fresh. The wait staff are wonderful. They don't seem to have a certain area that only they handle. Everyone helps everyone. But get there early, it gets crowded fast....But if you have to wait a bit...it's worth it. Honest

td974KQTngJi6A1oy6fwew.text: The food was so delicious. Servers came by a bit too much, so it was slightly overwhelming.

uJBcpvf_5KLJ025KZG7DCQ.text: New Location with way more space, they have a prep kitchen seating available via reservation if you have parties greater than 5.

fuoptv_oLgnBf8kKC_qwjQ.text: I have been going to Matt's over 10 years with my family and love this place. I always order the waffle and bacon....so yummy! If you are looking for a great meal and in downtown Phoenix, you won't be disappointed. It is worth the wait!

1_4eqF6NqO6n6i0xIF0-RQ.text: Long wait, but very good food! All four of my group got different things and loved their breakfast! Plus, they have RC Cola, instead of.......ya know!....

2WFbH-jshwwMxNnQskyhJg.text: They say when traveling, go where the locals go and this a nice gem. A little hole in the wall place but with all the people outside waiting to get in, you know it has to be good.  They even make homemade jam for their toast! Nice place.

VohWovqLSZjDw51nOjE7tQ.text: Sooo good!! Had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing! Came here for breakfast and it was a great environment for the group and kids. Great coffee too!

iqJuhPYdoFpkUPKb86U7Bg.text: I don't understand what the hype is all about. The wait is always long, the service is slow. The bacon tastes good but is severely undercooked. The waffles taste like cardboard. The prices on the website don't match in store menu prices.

WaekBlZjg9WOjYJ6cZUIjA.text: I attended a 3-day conference in Phoenix in June, and ate breakfast at Matt's twice. Both times I ordered the standard eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast, and it was absolutely perfect. To a "T". Eggs were cooked exactly to order, the bacon was among the best I've ever eaten (maybe THE best), and the rosemary potatoes simply delicious. What impressed me the most was that everything was precisely, perfectly the same on the 2nd visit. I can't go halfway across the country just to go to Matt's, but thinking about it sure makes me want to plan a trip to Phoenix!

TNN2gUkIurdaiorhiLMThQ.text: Classic case of overhype leading to disappointment. After waiting 30 minutes to get sat, we ordered off their tiny, tiny breakfast menu.  I ordered a cheese omelet and waffle. The waffle was excellent the rest was blah. The eggs in my omelet were not scrabbled all the way so chunks of yolks kept presenting themselves and they clearly added the cheese at the last second because it wasn't melted. The home fries were greasy and had no seasoning besides rosemary. I had to cover everything in salt until I finally gave up and left the greasy mess on my plate. On the plus side my husband enjoyed his breakfast and the service was good

IhyAwX5ZMVFfP-H8Bu-Alg.text: Menu items are simple and delicious. Pepper bacon is perfect. Homefries are light and perfectly cooked. Pork chop was flavorful and perfectly seasoned. Bread and homemade jam were perfect and the atmosphere and service are impeccable. I never had an empty glass or mug which is a rare treat at any small restaurant.  With a mix of industrial and retro, it's a hipster's delight, but no so much so that my hillbilly husband felt out of place. I'm hard to impress but this place did. Protip: come early or the line will be out the door but the food and service are worth the wait

M4hsEeuLRRviYsdUPfaUcQ.text: What else can you give this place! Ernie is the best, most kind beautiful hearted restaurant owner there is. Their food is top quality and delicious and so is their coffee. Ordered milk for the kiddos and it's organic. The bread is so good and they make their  house-made Blueberry  preserves, and their home fries with rosemary are soooo yummy.I can't believe she remembered me. What a compliment, "I can never forget your eyes" she said. Thank you Ernie!!! You know how to run a restaurant

_PuvFiustwUOrhg0m5TCtQ.text: Are the hash browns supposed to be almost raw in the middle and taste kind of fishy?  Everything else was okay but those hash browns needed some serious help.  I think this movie on tv right now called "Big Miracle" is better.

PI5kW5Xf2HHF6aqCL2dsZw.text: Last visit was not a pleasant experience. I was dining alone and carrying a briefcase. I was given a seat at the bar that is ahead of you and to your left as you enter. Not the long tables facing the window. But the smaller one across from that.   There was a piece of scrambled egg on my chair. I grabbed a napkin from the unused chair next to me to wipe it off. I sat down on my newly cleaned chair and put my briefcase on the empty chair next to me and started looking at the menu. 30 seconds later someone informs me they are planning on squeezing in next to me. You are practically elbow to elbow at that bar. So I take my briefcase off the chair and go to put it on the floor (no room on the table) and I'm disgusted by all the pieces of leftover food littering the ground.  I'm not putting my stuff on such a filthy floor. I walked out and headed to Phoenix Public Market. On the way, I phoned Matt's and asked to speak to the manager. I explained what happened, she said that they ALWAYS keep the floors clean, so she doesn't understand how it happened, and would I like to come back and get a to go order ? No. I would not.   I've been here once before and thought the food was pretty good. Although it's really not worth dealing with all the hassle of the long waits, small tables, and sassy help.
