It's bacon and eggs and waffles. Not exactly 3 star Michelin fare. There are plenty of good, CLEAN, breakfast restaurants in the city that have the same type of food. So I don't plan on going back anytime soon.

f1M4rPQnRz4GAhPjeSia4w.text: Seriously as good as it looked on Food Network.  bacon was top quality.  I got the special which was chipotle cheddar sausage scramble and a side of bacon.  honestly the star may have been the strawberry lemonade though.  fresh made with strawberry puree it was delicious.  thank god for the time difference we got there early enough the wait was only 20 minutes.  a million thumbs up

lO7pV6zIi_AVYlVzBzslfw.text: Not impressed with this place at all! There was so much grease on the omelet and hash browns it left me grossed out, the pancake tasted like they made it where they burnt some bacon...after all the reviews I thought this would be a good breakfast before flying back to Texas, bad choice for sure. Del Taco would of been a better choice.

wY11PjmAGbkxSOVzRQxyew.text: Cool vibe, very friendly staff and really good food. If you're downtown this is a great place for breakfast.

cNMGk4su88Gemqv8Rik17g.text: In downtown Phoenix for work, wanted to get a good breakfast. This place was just fantastic! Good portions, fresh ingredients, and great service. If I'm ever back in Phoenix again I would absolutely come here for breakfast!

qEbHfhXYGSraso4HldnIBA.text: It was about a 15 minute wait ; the weather was okay but the food was amazing . There bread & fresh jam is everything . Definitely a go to breakfast spot if your in Phoenix .

1mUhzZ1ak3v6qV5NtdX-wQ.text: Fresh food. Very tasty. There is a very good reason why there has been a line to get in EVERY time I have gone. SO worth the short wait.

7YhW6Z1a4BVBtMcPfIboKA.text: My wife and I ate here during our trip to Phoenix because the restaurant was featured on triple D. The food was amazing, the jalapenos in the eggs were fresh (a rare treat for a michigander) and the chorizo was spicy. The best part though was the rosemary potatoes! perfectly crispy and they did not skimp on the rosemary.

8NLYsEh9wFj2tTM0jaVcQA.text: I was so pleased with the service and the food. I had the chop and chick. The chop was juicy and seasoned well, and the potatoes with rosemary were delicious. I would go again. The wait was a little long but worth it in the end.

CyuTIQ2gNMgp28MvMAPTxg.text: Food is very subjective so what I'm not crazy about, someone else may like.  I had an omelet and had bacon added to the inside.  They were generous with the amount of bacon.  If you're one of those people who can't tolerate even a little golden color on your omelet you'd be unhappy.  It wasn't a lot or bad but there was some.  I don't care about that.  The orange juice was obviously fresh squeezed from good oranges.  My problem was the hash browns.  They were in a rectangular, flat shape, overcooked (crisp) and oily.  It was obvious the rectangles are made ahead of time and thrown on a grill as needed.  My toast was a disappointment too as it seemed like instead of spreading butter on each piece they had put an indentation in the middle of one slice, put a huge glob of butter in the indent and put the two pieces together.  One piece had very little butter on it and all in one spot.  The other piece had a well of mostly melted butter so that piece had too much on it.  The service was very good and people were friendly.  The seating leaves a LOT to be desired.

6SwciWGUyeFWUFvnow0FBA.text: Not worth the hype.  They hand you menus as soon as you put your name in, as soon as you rear end hits the chair the waitstaff is demanding your order.  After your food has been served you practically have to jump up and down to get any attention.  Food was mediocre at best  and luke warm by the time it got to us.  Not one of the 3 would ever go back

PNBg9UPcOy__SbBcpqx9Cw.text: First time today at Matt's. Had the special which was andouille sausage scrambled eggs with spinach and cheese. Let me tell you it was fantastic. The homemade strawberry preserves sourdough toast delicious coffee and great service make this a must stop for those living in the downtown area. Not a long wait, service was quick and I would recommend this breakfast spot to  anybody.

rzNtrd61dnFl-iHgQ0fTOQ.text: I was really looking forward to eating here. Unfortunately, it turned out not be as good as I expected. I was in town and staying near the airport with some extra morning time and decided to take the light rail system to downtown and walk to Matt's. First, it's in a great area of Phoenix, near the downtown ASU campus. It's a little bit of a hike from the train line to Matt's but the walk was great. I sat at the counter and was greeted very warmly, with was the best part of the visit.  All of the waitresses were great. I went with a simple breakfast, eggs in a sandwich with bacon, which was pretty good.  I also ordered the homefries, as opposed to the hash browns. Can get hash browns anywhere and wanted to try their personal touch on fries.  Absolutely plain and lacked much flavor. Too chewy and rubbery.  At that moment I wish I had ordered the hash browns.  It's a cute place, service was great and everyone was very friendly.  But in this particular case, I was disappointed in the food. I'm not a big meat eater and that is probably what sells best here.  Maybe next time it will be better.

OPQmWlRbr0JudVDvlSjKrQ.text: Not impressed. My homemade pancakes are way better than these. Bacon and eggs were tasty, but again, pretty easy to duplicate at home. Plus, they nickel & dime you. $1.50 for extra maple syrup?!? I don't care if is the real stuff; that's just bad customer service. No need to come back.

GQAJWYywT7VJEsHFZFwUFg.text: Gina Caste terrible server. She was just mean, the moment she came to the table. My daughter whose very laid back noticed it and made a comment about how it made her uncomfortable. I know we all have bad days but when you put that  onto your customers you need to go home or find another profession. Very disappointed with the service. The food was good but tasted different from what we remembered, we've eaten at Matt's over the years and it seemed different from our last visit. It's also gotten a bit pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waitress Gina was horrible obviously didn&#39;t want to be at work. Disappeared had to get my own to go box. She should&#39;ve taken the day off

2jhYeLigk9SuV4ywLr8Qxg.text: Huge portions, yummy food. I had the sweet and savory French toast and my headband had the breakfast sandwich. We will be back.

9PcU9Ko3wvDT-W9ngRL2CA.text: In town for business and visited to have breakfast.  The Eggs Benedict was on special for Thursday and it was amazing.  One of the best I've had..

05fuSjVOKp3cTDqy8eWFWA.text: Quaint little diner with excellent service and delicious food! We had the breakfast sandwich. The roll was fresh, eggs cooked perfectly, excellent quality bacon and the grilled onions were a tasty addition. The homefries are outstanding! Loved the fresh rosemary, I'm making them that way from now on. Most importantly a great cup of coffee!  If you are in Phoenix, its a great stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b_snTiImYwvbf7EfhS5-XA.text: Not sure what the hype with this place is but it's simply "just ok" the prices are ok, the decor is adorable, but the food is ok at best.  The service is the reason it's getting a 2 star, because the service we had wasn't the best. Server acted like she had somewhere else to be every time she got to our table, but while we were eating or waiting you would see her chatting away in the front. I've had better brunch in Phoenix, I won't be coming back here.

8dOqA0qvvoMhCVYaSdLZkw.text: Tried to eat there on a Sunday morning, 45 minute wait. Tried again on Monday and seated right away. Coffee was great, husband and I had the Skinny Breakfast plate, great flavors and lots of healthy greens on the side. Our boys had the waffle and griddle cakes which they devoured. Service was fast and friendly. It was morning after the WWE Royal Rumble and sat next to celebrity wrestler. Our boys could not have had a better morning.

vhxzeW8vhG6_Ueajl8VfFw.text: Found this place by mistake with my boyfriend, really good food. It was just kind of expensive and the service wasn't the greatest. Great place to try at least once, it's always very busy for a reason!

70wnj9OM06mKS5VlqJkZGg.text: Maybe I am missing something but I don't understand the hype.  They didn't have soda on tap and just RC Cola cans which is fine but I do want my caffeine in the AM and I'm not a coffee drinker.  The food on the menu sounds excellent but once we received it I was underwhelmed. It felt like items I could easily make at home.  Gave it two stars because the bacon was good and crispy.

byWYXWDz5UQYuryKzPgwnw.text: Coffee is good however, it is loud unnecessarily packed as in the tables are too close together, the tables are to small for more than 2 people. However the coffee is good

8Q_2p7jPA_Z_1rcaw9_NWw.text: Get there early! Cause the line is out of hand otherwise. It is LOUD, fun, and totally hipster. Had a great time, while eating yummy food. Our server was the cutest little thing and very knowledgeable and honest about the food choices. We took her recommendations and had an awesome breakfast. Will DEF be back. Would have given 5 stars except wait was too much!

3bVL9XgHlFDNj-AU0ao2TA.text: I had a very nice meal here. My waffle was absolutely delightful, bacon was flavorful and crispy like I had asked for, and the blueberry lemonade was so refreshing. I wasn't a huge fan of the home fries just because I like them much crispier and these were honestly pretty mushy. My grandma said her pork chop was bland but still tender and tasted better with A1 sauce. All of the employees were welcoming and attentive. I would've liked to have seen some more sweet breakfast options, perhaps with fresh fruit or something like that. All in all, a great breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

e61oPRdcj_tWVE-98pZMEg.text: Off the chain as my dad said haha.   My dad was in town so we stumbled across this little joint and we were surprised. There was a little wait but the host informed us that it was a short wait compared to the traffic they usually get on Sunday's. We were seated quickly at the bar which we didn't have an sue with. It's on the louder side, but I don't mind at all.   They have their daily special and Sunday happened to be steak and eggs which sold out a few minutes after we go there, and I ordered the waffles. Everything was so yummy! Truly like a southern breakfast. The waffles were so soft and fluffy, and the eggs were also cooked just the way I like. The ingredients they use seem to be pretty good for you too (real butter olive oil cage free eggs if you're into that kind of stuff)   The staff were so nice too even though it was packed. I'll be returning :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunday steak :)
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffles (my dad took the bacon lol not many purely vegetarian options btw)

O3LBR9yXRrQCHa0jjAI_-g.text: A cute little breakfast spot! Good food, interesting menu choices, delicious homemade jam! Also loved the pancakes with real maple syrup. We didn't have the best server but the food was good.

E-uSo3PfM9J6zUVKDulUrg.text: The potatoes here are amazingly delicious!  I had a cheese omelette, bacon and the sourdough toast is thick and yummy.  The strawberry Jam is perfect  There are so many good things here it is well worth the wait  it's noisy and it's crowded and the food is wonderful!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg &amp; cheese omelette 2 slices of bacon, home style potaoes.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m-zFDbc2pch0bT9GLnInJg.text: Decent breakfast fare with just a touch of attitude and a bit overrated in general but it's a'ight.

VzwKPphnLONYfYp7WYWUUw.text: What a delicious surprise. Taking the long trek back from Tucson to California.  We wanted something that was better than fast food but easy and yummy. This place is fantastic. We had the steak and egg breakfast and the pork chop and egg breakfast... one word, wow. That protein melted in our mouths. Customer service was wonderful too!

O9iQF7bpF_rEuEJzuygjmA.text: Sorry, I'm just not impressed with this place. No substitutions allowed, no split checks and the place was noisy and the coffee was cold. My breakfast was lukewarm and the waitress was surly. I won't be back. Giving it 3 stars only because I wanted to like this place.

GUA6IhVf1z45ZNzEjiYYuQ.text: This place was incredible. I had the Thick & Savory thick cut French toast win smoked apple sausage and it was on point. If you love French toast, then Matt's won't disappoint. The waitress at the bar was super friendly and nice. Only bad thing about this location is the construction outside. Limited parking spot, but the food just made the issue go away! Come out and try Matt's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

INQga0EFzIcqzUVsYU7UiQ.text: So good. Unique flavors. I'm glad we didn't miss this place on our drive to Sedona. Excellent waffles and chorizo and eggs. My husband lives the bacon!

0pbG2N4ki1aCWNRCKwRMBg.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Phoenix! Great local breakfast food for a good price! The fresh orange is amazing. Great environment with friendly staff.

JdrImQJRwZoWEgn-XRQYEg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE breakfast at Matt's.  Weekdays are better than weekends, or so I have heard, I have never attempted a weekend.  Menu is simple but the food is not.

zjgfw2Ytyq4t5aGj_O6MxQ.text: We liked the citrus infused water while you wait on benches under shady trees. The freshly squeezed OJ which was so good, thick sliced bacon (the meat is fresh from Queen Creek), the hash browns were freshly shredded, the jalapenos were fresh, the waffles with real whipped butter and real Vermont maple syrup were mouth watering! I loved the fresh roses on the tables, the exposed brick on one wall, and the big windows on another side with natural light coming in. The servers, managers, and all the staff were friendly and nice, too! We WILL definitely be back! It was worth the 40 minute wait for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waiting for our delicious breakfast!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 40 minute wait was 100% worth it!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slightly spicy scrambled eggs with white cheddar, fresh jalapeños, and country sausage with a tortilla.

80gxL7bE11nQjqxDmmbh_g.text: I would give them 5 stars if their coffee was better. Everything else however is fabulous! The bacon, rosemary potatoes, fluffy griddle cakes aka pancakes are to die for!

IC_5yeyBn4SZ_aZSbY7fqA.text: Food was amazing! My son who is beyond picky ate his whole meal!

vVAtR-k_2SLUWVHYcp-_bw.text: Huge line outside Saturday morning. We put name on list but only waited 10 minutes. We sat at the bar, really nice servers. Excellent breakfast here and ours was served really quickly.  Hot toast! Fresh squeezed Oj!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jJ9Jh5IkXHSn5R0zH7QWJQ.text: Usually like this place husband loves their Steak and Eggs disappointed it's only served on Sundays (( He had Pork chop and Eggs instead very small chop ,used to come with 2 now it's only one but it was dry anyway Didn't care for it all. The only thing good was the coffee. We felt very rushed to get out so they could set more people mind you nobody was waiting as yet we got in and out early.

b2Gs2wB6WarEqJ5V-RdgvQ.text: Always packed!  Service - This hurts in the service department. Sorry. I just never feel important to the waitstaff.  Food - Well... it's a big breakfast... As Advertised!  Notes: Did i mention that it's always packed?!

8PW6gHD9-tfJfXUcnxnhDQ.text: I have been here several times however today was different. I found the food to be so-so. Everything was over cooked, not 1 person asked if was wanted anything else or how was our meal. The service was horrible. I won't be back nor will I recommend it anymore

vcubdNep2s60_onJeM_Jug.text: Wow. Best breakfast place I've ever been to.  Visited while in town for the Superbowl (boo Pats!) and this was one of the famous go-to places I found. We went and holy crap, the line was LONG. It took us like 30-45 min to get a table. I would've waited an hour to eat here though. The food was THAT good.  I started with the strawberry honey lemonade. Best lemonade I've ever had in my life. The honey complimented the strawberry lemonade so well, I could not believe it was not a more common drink. For breakfast, I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the cherry sausage. My Dad ordered the standard breakfast and we also shared a waffle.  The waffle came out first, so we started with that. Best waffle I've ever had. The flavor and crispness of it was so unique and delicious. I did not think a waffle could blow my mind, but that one did. I ended up finishing most of that waffle, when originally I was just planning on taking a few bites.  By the time my breakfast sandwich and sausage came, I was already feeling full, but I powered through it anyway. I got halfway through both and felt extremely full, but could not let myself waste such quality food. The sausage's flavor was very sweet and almost dessert-like. The sandwich bread was this giant artisan looking bun and the eggs, bacon, and other fillings were cooked and spiced perfectly. I feel like a broken record at this point, but this food was phenomenal.   If this breakfast place was in Capitol Hill in Seattle, they would put everyone else out of business. Our best breakfast places pale in comparison to this spot, and we have some solid breakfast spots.  You've set a new standard for breakfast, and I hate that because you are located so far away! PLEASE come to Seattle!

3nTLD4HpzNUdC-Ko-gdMew.text: Solid breakfast, the menu does not habe anthing fancy on it but what they cook it is done to perfection.

OA838qL70Gwr9mlH5ut4rg.text: Came in for some breakfast with the bf during our weekend escape to Phoenix and we were not disappointed! We arrived early enough to not have to wait more than 5-10 minutes for a seat, which was amazing. We had the best service by the ladies working the counter and the food was cooked ridiculously fast by my LA standards! I ordered the waffle with bacon with a side of egg whites and fresh OJ, Totally hit the spot. Tried a bite of my bfs pancakes, wow! Best pancakes I've had in a while. A definite must visit for foodies looking for a straightforward American breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle with bacon and a side whites. Just what I was looking for!

_-kbHU7v0v4gzFUQa-yYjg.text: Cool Spot. I arrived in Arizona that morning and my dad said we had to try this Triple D (the food network) rated spot.   Good thing we went when we did we waited about 10 minutes, but when we left the wait seemed to be 30+!  Anyway, the service was very good, my dad started asking the waitress questions and this is usually when I get a little embarrassed, however she knew her shit and my dad liked her responses.  Home made juice was great, coffee was good hot and strong.  The food here is VERY BASIC, but they use the best possible ingredients.  The bread for example that came with my omelet was artisan shit, so good with nuts and seeds....mmmmmmm and the jam although may not have been homemade it was the expensive stuff :)  I will definitly be back if I am ever in the hood!

Oj_SZ3ej88nxy133wL_zqw.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is good. Not like St. Francis good, but like the best diner food without the transients and lard that one would come to expect from traditional breakfast joints.  They mostly local and farm fresh, quality ingredients and although there isn't much variety, they do standard breakfast well.   If you want a fresh American breakfast with freshly squeezed juice, come here. Be prepared for a long wait if you snooze.

jP2AIhF_7a4yUypV3uisiw.text: Gotta say, I was underwhelmed. I was surprised because of the great number of super-positive reviews.   I ordered the Hog & Chick. My first shock was the much-lauded bacon. While it's nicely cooked, it's almost completely covered in coarse-ground, strong pepper. To me, it was inedible. They very kindly replaced it with sausage, but that was almost burnt. Puzzling.  The next thing was the hash browns. I ordered them "extra crispy." What came out was a pale, limp, undercooked, slight greasy brick of potatoes. They looked nothing like the pictures I've seen posted.  Since I'd already sent back the bacon, I sucked it up and ate it but it wasn't appealing or tasty.   I don't live in Phoenix but, if I did, I don't believe I'd be back.

YN0lcgX4oxd42w6o9oJ8FQ.text: Solid breakfast, good service, long waits. 3 1/2 stars.  I first went to Matt's Big Breakfast years ago when it had first become really popular. I was pleasantly surprised to see that it's still going strong years later--although I wasn't as excited to have to wait in a long line, just like before! The new setting is at least twice as big as it used to be, so it packs in a lot more people than in years past. Although they're still turning out some solid food, it doesn't seem as inspired as before. It seems to me that the push to grow has resulted in some decrease in quality. Maybe this is a nostalgia thing for me--the past is always better in my memory.  Setting: This place has a very cozy feel to it. You sit very close to your neighbors, so you shouldn't bring your most private conversations here. I like the breakfast bar area the most. It's a pretty simple setting--it's about t he food!  Food: I have had a number of items here over the years, and they've all been really good. The bacon and sausage selection has always been particularly good. During my latest visit, I had the day's special, which was a 3-egg scramble with sausage, spinach, mushrooms, and some cheese, served with potatoes and toast. I think that the savory dishes like this (as opposed to sweeter dishes like pancakes and waffles) are what Matt's does the best. I wasn't really impressed with the sausage in this scramble. It seemed more like a mass-manufactured sausage than anything I remember having at Matt's before. The potatoes were over-oiled, but everything else was decent. The highlight of my breakfast may have been the preserves for my toast. The blackberry preserves were really good! Lots of chunks of real berries. Despite what I said about the savory vs. sweet thing, the waffle was pretty good, too.  Service: Solid. There is usually a decent wait here, especially on weekends. The best time to come is during the week if you are able to do so, because the weekend waits can be an hour long.  I'll come back when I have the opportunity again in the future, but my breakfast attention has drifted elsewhere.

9emKeE7Qzx7NeJFV7fXHBw.text: Great food (not just breakfast).  Everything is better than you think is possible.  Matt and Erenia are genuinely nice people who deserve all of the success that they've achieved.  Even when extremely busy, the staff does everything possible to make the guests feel comfortable and to be accommodating.  I do try to avoid the crowded times.

eTQVPtyO8AoqCtOhQQa-jw.text: Breakfast, as good as it gets! The food, YUM!  The service, outstanding! The vibe, hipster chill. The wait at 8:45 on a Sunday morning, 5-10 minutes. Phew, I would have happily waited 30 minutes.  Matt, I applaud you for taking the time to prepare everything from scratch with only the finest ingredients.  It shows in the homemade belgian waffles with sweet creamery butter & real maple syrup, the thick sliced peppery & oh so perfect bacon, the omelets made with Wisconsin cheddar, the rosemary home fries, the breakfast sandwich, the fresh-squeezed OJ and, of course, the bottomless cup of locally roasted dark roast coffee.    I can only imagine how good their biscuits & sausage gravy would be... if they had them, but I love a restaurant that does a few things very well, instead of trying to be all things to all people.

g0eCyLcS_izxPOvL9f_t5g.text: This place is amazing! The blueberry honey lemonade was to die for! The sourdough toast with blueberry preserves were out of this world! I can't wait to go back! The price was just right and the decor was adorable! I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I ordered the special! It was so yummy!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute little pigs were everywhere!

am5Yqoz3sAlFth4aJrb15Q.text: I have lived within 200 meters of this fine establishment for two months and I finally ventured there today.  Why did I wait so long?  I have to admit, I was unimpressed with the petite breakfast menu.  I am used to pages of breakfast options.  1 page for eggs, 1 page for scrabbles etc.  Well Matt's has 1 page (period).  What they lack in options they more than make up in quality.  They are not a jack of all breakfast trades, they are masters of a few.    I started my first foray with a simple two eggs, sausage, hash browns and toast.  Potatoes were actually browned to a wonderful golden brown.  The cinnamon raisin, walnut toast was thick and great.  the home made country sausage links were a nice blend of spice and subtle sweetness.  Ok, my eggs were a bit runny they were more over easy than the over medium that I wanted, also a bit cold.  But I survived.  I sat at the counter and the young lady that served me there was wonderful.  She really added value as a friendly attentive server.  I tried to see if she had a name tag so I could specifically mention her, but I never saw one.  I will return with friends and family soon.  Side note- I was a bit disappointed to find they do not open until 6:30am.  I got there at 6:00am.  I can also tell you that on a Saturday morning, they were already full and had people queuing up for tables by 6:55 AM.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 eggs sausage links hashbrowns cinnamon raisin walnut tosst.

m4AEsXTtUFwqUP-B5rtYvQ.text: Extremely disappointing!  Overpriced $8:00 for plain pancakes which came with maple syrup - then charged extra for a bit more maple syrup.  Pancakes were dry and flavorless.  Oatmeal was good. Home fries were sludge - far from crispy.  Thick bacon would have been good but for way too much pepper.  Waitress was a humorless zombie.  Also refused to do two separate checks.  Geez how hard is that!! We will not be returning.

1FLp80FRx9hn4p-JwD-Gvg.text: Had the Classic Eggs Benedict, it was amazing. Vanessa our waitress was great. Always moving and very attentive. Thanks.

NHorLVIxeWLPpo293QK0bg.text: The waffle was so light! Homemade sausage exploding with flavor and home fries that make you lick your plate!!  I'm so mad that I didn't find this place when I was in Phoenix before!  This restaurant has made my top 5 restaurants in the country!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best breakfast I have EVER had!

q0t5elHSzE-0f26Z74ONww.text: I'm new to Matt's and I agree with the hype.  Great food, great prices, and now they're in the Biltmore area.  Definitely try this spot.  Great Food!

m-0UWFeijLanlkAlvT3inA.text: Why go to Wendy's a few steps away when you can get a high-quality, wholesome breakfast from a local diner?   We had a pretty darned good breakfast -especially for airport food. I loved our awesomely sassy server who offered gracious, quick, and efficient service.  I ordered a waffle with bacon (next time I'll get even more of that crazy delish bacon!), which came with real butter and syrup. My husband ordered the hot oatmeal -without the listed raisins- and our server very thoughtfully brought a side of a fruit compote as a substitute add-in, which was perfect.  Including fresh OJ for me and unlimited coffee for him, our total was just $27.  Our server even brought a coffee to-go for my husband to take on our flight. We'll be back!

1X5sBxDauequMArvN__uEA.text: It's Saturday so finding parking is incredibly difficult. We arrived at 11:10, did not get a table for 2 until 12:05. You cannot grab seats at the breakfast bar when available, you have to be wait listed for that too. The restaurant is freezing with metal chairs, I presume to turn over tables faster.        We ordered a glass of milk, the strawberry honey lemonade and OJ. The lemonade was heavenly, and the OJ was best. The food and drink is strictly why they got 3 stars at all. I ordered their BLT. Joe ordered the Belgian waffle, a side of hash browns and bacon. We placed our order at 12:10, didn't get our food until 12:36.  The bacon was great, the Belgian waffle was the prefect amount of sweet. Thought we should try out new restaurants since we're in a food desert in Laveen haha. Will not be returning here though, sticking with our favorite Morning Squeeze in Scottsdale or Kiss the Cook in Glendale when permissible.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT

06cizFq9bbNQe59QGLaUMA.text: This place is very good.  We came on a Saturday afternoon and were sat within 5 seconds.  No joke!  The decor is trendy urban with the concrete floors orange walls exposed brick and vents. Love the corrugated aluminum walls outside.  Service was quick and on point.  Very friendly!  The food was more than aqueduct. The omelette was very filling and the sourdough toast with jam was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sourdough toast!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelette with sausage and hash browns

VuKo-P6RkOCErOPDURnmWg.text: That's big breakfast holds the best bacon I've ever ate!! If you order anything from here make sure it has bacon!! I honestly don't know how they do it but I've never ate bacon like I do here. They always have daily specials that I do recommend to go with because their specials or pretty much their signatures. I highly recommend this place for breakfast

Ajd7STyYczDSKyNy50ZFZg.text: I really don't think I could ask for more in a breakfast.  This place is hopping, but if you're dining alone, they'll do their best to scoot you into the bar amongst the other solo travelers.  I ordered chicks and something: two eggs, hash or home fries, sausage or bacon, and your choice of yum-yum bread with homemade preserves.  I took mine: poached, hashed, patties, and wheat with extra butter and the strawberry preserve.     Staff was attentive, I didn't feel rushed in spite of the congregating line in the courtyard, and the food came fast.  Lots of happy people and smiles.  If I could change just one thing...the coffee is a bit weak for my tastebuds and they make their iced coffee by pouring hot coffee over ice (no-thank-you!).  And if I could change two things, I would recommend that the hashbrowns be cold water washed before frying - this allows them to crisp and prevent that gooey middle that mine came with.  Other then that: bliss.

g0ngfl_wYFRai304r4T4Pw.text: We were seated right away. Friendly staff, great food nice place. Came after seeing triple d. Worth the drive from Cali

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three meat scramble

1SC6ybma_mTvT3_U4bvR1Q.text: These guys ain't kiddin about breakfast, Me and my lady's first time trying out Matt's. I had the biscuits sausage and gravy with house potatoes( mmmmmmm it was good and well portioned) my lady tried the Belgium waffle with bacon(it looked delicious). Definitely coming back to try a different breakfast special..

6wUi3FsaIudMMDvApjG7Pw.text: Flippin' AMAZING! Portions as big as your head. Bring you appetite and check your diet at the door. There was a short wait, but totally worth it.

NOqFlGowQJ6Px2O66IwUPQ.text: I can't get enough of this place, everything is so good it is totally worth the line you see on the weekend! You should always try the specials the offer and the jam!

ROD9vOPvEv9x4JXm-apZMg.text: I love this place. I always get the salami scramble with strawberry honey lemonade. ALWAYS. Because it's the most amazing thing on the planet. Just go for it.

gdBH-zPqjrwAcjJ2mDek4Q.text: Meh. My boyfriend and I were starving for brunch so on a recommendation from a friend we went to the Camelback location. We waited 30-40 minutes then were seated....but no one took our drink order for at least 10-12 minutes. We looked at the menu and were shocked-- no variety! Nothing really stood out to us that we had to try. And I'm sorry but $8.45 for two eggs, potatoes and toast? Insane. We ended up paying for my coffee to go and went to Snooze. Way better experience. I'm not likely to try or recommend this place. two stars because at least the food is organic and everyone else seems to enjoy it. I'm just a normal person who wants a good meal at a decent price.

yiXIrdVKh4wi63lz0S0hAw.text: I used  the yelp  app  to  find  this place  and the  reviews  were  right  on  the  money. Service  was  fast  and friendly. I ordered  a special  for  the  day  3 egg with  home  fries  a little  over  priced  but  delicious , tasted like  home  cooking. The  stone  wheat  toast  with  what  tasted  like  home  made  jam  complimented the  toast  greatly bomb. I will  eat  here  again  and  recommend this place  to  friends  and fellow  yelper's

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B5d8sh9aMsyp9Q-dmNmSrA.text: I'm all about the QUALITY of food and the quaintness of the facility. The fact they use local grown, organic ingredients... SOLD ME then you add in the cute decor and limited tables I WAS HEAD OVER HEELS! They treat you VERY WELL, we had our 2 little girls with us and they came by to offer pens for them to color while we waited for the food (which wasn't very long) - the food was hot, fresh & Delicious the Coffee was AMAZING and they HUSSSSLLLEEE to get you in and out to accommodate the people waiting which as a consumer is important because we all get discouraged by long lines or tons of people wiating out front. I can't wait to go back-

Xxyd2lvz_oeV3phPyhlgBg.text: On the advice of a friend stopped in for breakfast. So glad I did. Was told that at times the line is out the door. Thankfully, waltzed right in and was sat immediately at the bar area. I was not that hungry but the aroma's coming from the kitchen made my mouth water. Instead of getting a single menu item I opted from the offerings under "On The Side". My dish consisted of one egg over easy (perfectly cooked and tasted farm fresh), think cut bacon (oh my, simply delish) and toast with homemade preserves. It was easy to tell that the kitchen took pride in their dishes and uses only the highest quality ingredients. If I had to complain about anything would be the noise level. With so many hard surfaces conversations definitely bounce around this tiny gem. But I'll take it. Service was fast and friendly. Absolutely charming, will be back!

UDdm-x56matKsUvqe9vdMw.text: I have been here twice and both times I have enjoyed my meals and came away a very happy camper.   On my first visit, I tried the Chop and Chick, which was really good, but being I currently have braces on my teeth, I found the porkchop was a little hard for me to chew, but it didn't deter me from eating it. I also had their infamous Rosemary Home Fries, which are cooked in olive oil and Rosemary and SO DAMN GOOD!   This time, I had the Waffle, which came with bacon and I ordered a side of the Rosemary Home Fries. They are so addicting! The bacon as thick and cooked just the way I like it...and so tasty! MMMMMM MMMMMMM GOOD!!!  Got in and out of there this time within an hour and barely had a wait for a table but then we went earlier this time too. The first time, we waited I'd say between 20-30 minutes for a table but it as well worth it.   I recommend giving Matt's a try. This place is great and the service is excellent.

zcapWYAwO57vWpYbzpL6-Q.text: This will make me the most unpopular man in Phoenix, but I just don't get why such a big deal is made about this place.  Is it good? Sure.  Is it worth waiting in line for? Not really.

XLI9MYWrSxSJG-gqqs4Efw.text: First time here, service was excellent the portions where big and the rosemary potatoes where awesome

e2AAQuLlxD9W2BD4tl-IlQ.text: This is to-die-for foodie experience.  Every taste bud in your mouth is entertained by the bountiful food flavors.  The staff is friendly and efficient. The fresh squeezed orange juice is incredible.   Go there hungry. Leave there completely satisfied.   This writer will be a frequent visitor,...YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilling with some good friends

ZQV3BU3tgdULZhJhnHLmyw.text: Amazing French toast and they use all local companies for their bacon & sausage, yuuummm!

cSJEtOtseNctMe5TM4n0bg.text: Would be a five, but only one bathroom per gender. Seriously? Everything else was great. Super efficient and great food. But figure out the potty sitch!

AhiCK5TqZJFsrN2oQr2YkQ.text: Despite the rave from yelp reviews, I thought this place was just OK - nothing special if you ask me. Nothing wow'ed me. I came in around 6:30am so beat the crowd which started pouring in an hour later.  The food portions are generous.  Pulpy orange juice - YUM  Hash brown was bland on its own (ate my friend's hash brown), not as flavorful as I would've hoped. I still ate the whole thing with ketchup and pepper.   I ordered The Hog and Chick with eggs over medium, thick bacon and wheat toast. The home fries were too hard for my taste, wanted them to be more on the softer side with crispy edges but it looked and tasted overcooked. The bacon was thick but it also tasted overcooked. Again, I still ate everything so still good.  Service was great - they came around a few times offering coffee and water refills, asked how we were doing.   I'd still recommend a trip here but go in with low expectations. It might have been all the hype about the placed that I heard (it was featured in Triple D) so I came in thinking this was going to be a diner with something unique to offer...

U9IIL92NkMLwyhE8vUqjvQ.text: The BEST breakfast in town !!!!! Friendly staff ! I love the griddle cakes !!!!

F3SO5t7-7fElwLNicxBXrg.text: I first heard about this place on Arizona Highways.  I had no idea what to expect, but since it is a very rare occasion for me to be up at 7am and I happen to be in the area,  Matt's big breakfast was my destination.  The venue is pretty small with an equally small menu.  I was expecting more options.  We ordered waffles with bacon and The Five Spot (breakfast sandwich).  Both were very good.  Coffee was from cave creek and was pretty good as well.  Service was great.  Our server was upbeat and friendly.  She told me how much she loved working there and I can see she was sincere.    I do plan on coming back here.  I grade them a solid A.

oqMau95oX9v7V3-HTknCgA.text: Pretty near the Heard Museum and the Phoenix Art Museum, I found Matt's accidentally while curiously driving around this little hipster/artsy pocket of Phoenix. We got there at 2pm when they close at 2:30 and I was really happy to get my afternoon breakfast fix while visiting town for a mini-vacation with my mom. Luckily it was not packed at all at this time on a weekday and they were happy to fit us in before closing.  We both got a daily special egg scramble which was really tasty with chorizo, jalapenos, and aged cheddar. I loved the home fries, though if I'm being nitpicky mine were a little burnt in spots and the rosemary would have been nice chopped up finely instead of big sprigs. Overall, the plate was very oily and greasy and it was definitely something I could whip up at home but it still hit the spot. I appreciate a relaxed diner that uses fresh and less-processed ingredients. Also, fun fact: in Phoenix unlike Portland or San Francisco, the waitstaff at a hipster diner are blond, tan, and in great shape. Everyone was extremely nice and we left to a literal chorus of "Bye! Thank you! Have a great day!"

XKPiJHrvBXEdNXp1ytYPCQ.text: They pull off the dinner, but in an upscale way. Eggs over easy with hash browns and a pork chop...basic dinner food, but better. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were some of the best that I have ever had, and the pork chop was flavorful. The toast, that I put under my eggs came with homemade strawberry jam so I ordered a second order just so I could try it...and it too was great. Their prices are only slightly higher than a dinner. The atmosphere was done very modern but with a salute to an old school dinner. I actually came straight from PHX airport and got there before the crowd. I heard my waitress talking to someone else and she said the "wait" usually starts around 8:30 am. By the time I left, they were on a wait.

yUlkkPwvymO9Qrsvw66uQw.text: thanks to diner drive ins and dives and guy fierri for bringing this place up on the show wow its the best place in town from service from start to finish thanks sooo yummy and clean worth the long waits to get in try it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. a very nice breakfast at matts this morning worth the 40 min wait

55HLoar7z8q7JMcCdH5Nyg.text: Probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. Bacon was superb. Even the oatmeal was tastier than usual. Fast service was a huge plus too.

5SzmjZuF2ABD-aB_Zk-omQ.text: My new favorite place! From the bottomless coffee, to the service, everything was great. The wheat bread, and home fries are amazing. Our server, was very helpful, and super sweet. Definitely coming back!

nZMIKInch8-RntZLSo1JoQ.text: Went here after everyone I know in phx recommended it.   Space. Felt very temporary and cold.  But that doesn't effect the review.  I'm assuming maybe it is?  Service.  Solid.  Was greeted by friendly staff and the server was nice and helpful.   Food. Got the chop and eggs.  Eggs are eggs.  They were good.  And I liked my cottage cheese, but it probably came from a tub so whatever.  Hash brown was great, super tasty.  Chop. No flavor. Unseasoned.  Bland to the point that I had to cover with ketchup,  which is a shame BC I'm sure they get great product.  Wife got the waffle.  Super good.  Anyways.  3 stars BC its good not great.  Nothing I would go out of my way to come back for.  But if someone asked me for a solid breakfast spot I'd still recommend.

rJEjtmXF8Cxw-UMc7397Qg.text: OMG! Our favorite place to go anytime we are in Phoenix! Rode the light rail all the way across town to make it there before heading to the airport! The absolute best customer service we received at any restaurant while on vacation including an expensive spot in Sedona! Food is always top notch quality and best ingredients like sweet cream butter and real maple syrup. Love love love Matts!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome waffle with thick cut peppered bacon!! Cost is sooo super reasonable.

L6ajs86uKux64zg-iQK4QQ.text: Order the Waffle and get a glass of orange juice. Eat some bacon and have some of that bread with jelly. If I started my morning like this, it would be a great day!  The only problem with the place is not a lot of seating so there is always a wait. Other than that you have the best breakfast in town.

-ZK2uLhvq6dMk460cTWlMQ.text: This place is hip and serves large portions of fresh organic food. The service is speedy and the servers are sweet.   All the food we ordered was on point. Can't go wrong with the Home fries, but these are extra tasty. I got the breakfast sandwich. The bread was great. My dad got the eggs Benedict. It was a lot of food and he couldn't finish it and he always finishes breakfast.   I watched at least 4 people take selfies in here in a span of 45 minutes.

kVNqNSYsUaOsW8lUTGqCZA.text: Was in town for GC. Stopped by on the way back to LA. And this was a good spot to find in downtown PhX. The coffee was great. It had no bitterness at all even drinking it black. The food was good, the thick pepper Bacon was all it's cracked up to be. Had the chop and chick and it hit the spot. The preserves are good and not too sweet. Would definitely come back if I am in town. :)

WddMCpRAKx4DWRcmo6tiuw.text: Fun staff. Sit at the bar. Mamacita burger add egg was awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Makers rocks w a soda splash

p8K4XE7X3b8TuuBKNDZ08g.text: Duh. Because this place is the bomb.com! The pancakes and homemade preserves are the best! I usually always get the salami scramble and the lemonade.....and an extra pancake. Because fat.

fHvKs474wlBbzRyG0VmKdQ.text: Always crowded, but wait is not bad - and is worth it. Food is delicious and service awesome. My only "complaint" is that the host today was abrasive with snide comments.

Cf_s8GexhU_mIxMfbzOZXA.text: Matts Big breakfast is a quaint place to enjoy a simple meal.  Great location, easy parking and friendly people.

-N3LkI-WvmtQfpiWRkFizA.text: Service is so far above expectations at an airport.  Server April is a game changer.  Food is way beyond the norm.  Looks, smells, and tastes amazing.  Listen to the servers as to what you should order.  The house makes classics.  Oh, and "good portions" is not adequate.  Behemoth portions is the word, and for a great price.

PTvKK4Y1FqvDXSG0SDtJ-A.text: I ate breakfast here on the 4th of July. Honestly, the food is decent (nothing special)-it's also overpriced.   MBB is a small restaurant that always has a line out the door and around the corner, but since I've eaten here, I really don't understand why.  Maybe everyone's visiting Phoenix like me????  I highly recommend going to LoLo's, it's better (more options and taste wise), and you get more bang for your buck. A stranger (Phoenix resident) also leaned over to tell me that LoLo's is definitely the better option.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The special of the day
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 8oz. OJ

FEQ8eYCbzFPRiOkfIriyrQ.text: This place is phenomenal. I would only be adding to a long list of gushing reviews, so I'll be brief.   When you go (and you're planning on going -- right?) ask about the food. So much of what they serve isn't store-bought. It's hand crafted. That toast you get? On fresh baked bread. The bacon? From a special local butcher. The jam to spread on your toast? Homemade. And delicious.   Service with a smile.   Great new (larger) digs.   Go early. This place is POPULAR for a reason.

DMgCysvTPcAqKDXRsoFlcw.text: Seen it on Diners and drive ins. Went the next day. Great food. A little bit of a wait, but nothing terrible. Had breakfast and it was amazing. Pork chop for breakfast! Will definitely go back!

7WtPOhl3LE0IqIyUvdCHeQ.text: I personally prefer to go to the 32nd St & Camelback Location, as this location usually has a ridiculous wait-time. Now, that's not to say the wait isn't worth it, it's just a personal opinion that breakfast food shouldn't take an hour+, and I have been a few times, some of which luckily didn't require an extensive wait. In any case, the food is as good as you can expect, a little pricey, but indeed one of the best breakfast spots in Phoenix. Like any good breakfast place, they'll make pretty much anything you want, and have a daily feature, but it's hard to have to stray from the menu. Between their Chop & Chick (two eggs and a skillet-seared pork chop) or the Belgian Waffle, you simply can't go wrong.

0ZGyrTleh2VuuefbeD1TiQ.text: Matt's is the best. The food is simple, but delicious! Great atmosphere with reasonable pricing!

Aaiml1yVQfhIJUk19abR4A.text: Really good food, very fast service.  No place is perfect but here a lot of effort is applied to make it run super well during peak times.  I always know there will be a wait unless i show up 30 min before opening.   But its worth it compared to other places that advertise same quality.

NHglUHkYDezrGrtOOFl_cg.text: I was first introduced to Matt's Big Breakfast when I was a resident of Flagstaff, AZ, where waiting for a good breakfast is an everyday part of life.  I know that some people in Phoenix will not be able to wait, since they have their Denny's and Waffle Houses in their neighborhood.  The staff is always in a rush but as pleasant as cherubs.  The coffee smells delightful, and the honey lemonade is the bees knees  The food is the best part! I love the ingredients that Matt picks, which are local and organic when the product is convenient, affordable, or rockstar status.  All the eggs are from local cage free chickens.  All of the jams and jellies (which rotate on a daily basis) are from local businesses and they will probably help relieve any allergies you have (if you live in Phoenix).  When I was a young Big Breakfast eater, I enjoyed the Five Spot and worked my way up to the to the succulent egg and pork Chop and Chick before graduating to simply ordering the special, and trusting that Matt and his minions will take care of me.  The specials are the reason why I keep coming back, and why I bring my friends.  I have brought out of town poets, musicians, and artists to Matt's.  They all love the diner feel, the orange and simple menu, the nice and friendly staff, and of course - the BIG breakfast.

MkBbf7mcU3TurKLsjR9N4A.text: Great food, quick service, good atmosphere! The hash browns and omelette were delicious.

IZn0GT7dz_OqZmQlo97ieA.text: The waitress' chests were the BIG in Matt's Big Breakfast...  When we travel, our days revolve around our food...always trying to find that town's "wow" restaurant. While Matt's Big Breakfast was super super friendly and quite quick at seating us and serving our food....the meals were just okay...nothing really special. I ordered their daily special which was a scramble with spinach, cheese and sausage. The portion was perfect...not too much, not too little....definitely not BIG. My error was ordering something I can get at any breakfast diner I guess. BUT it was healthy, that's a plus! My husband ordered the pork chop...again, it was good. Nothing "wow'd" us as we had hoped....well maybe we were wow'd when the waitress would lean over and refill our coffee cups. Again, we found Matt's BIG in the low-cut tight dresses of the waitresses, no complaints there though.

tdLEx6bggb4oLzAvOAW_6Q.text: My dad and I wanted to try a new breakfast place and really enjoyed this one. We got to pick our seat immediately on a Sunday afternoon. The service was good+fast, and the food was yummy too. The only thing we didnt like was how they charged $1.50 for an extra little pitcher of syrup, whereas in most breakfast places we've tried the syrup is free. But overall it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I ordered the waffle and my dad ordered the griddle cakes

T751Unl85h_sf0gfz72tlA.text: Exceptional service, and friendly servers. I came here for breakfast on a busy Sunday morning and was seated right away. My food was out in less than 10 minutes after I ordered it and I was never low on coffee with the servers constantly making sure I didn't need anything. I had a Sunday special which consisted of a 3-egg scramble and house potatoes. Both were very good. I will be back for sure next time I stay the night in Phoenix.

s3S0bIjz9umBZqDsIG9hRQ.text: I'm sorry to rain on people's parades in Phoenix, but this place is average. Is it good for breakfast? Absolutely. Is it worth the hour-plus wait people go through every weekend? No way.  The couple of times I've been there, service has been okay. Friendly servers, but slow with refills on drinks. Also feels rushed - who can blame them with lines out the door? Atmosphere is loud and a little cramped, but not terribly uncomfortable.  The food is good. I would go back, don't get me wrong. But is it anything special? Not really. I've had pancakes there as well as eggs with bacon, and it's pretty standard.

674v3QPMrgoANokaYD-bwg.text: The BACON is sooooooooooooooooo amazing. It is a must. Did I mention the bacon? Food selections are the basics but done well. Only complaint I have is the wait at times can be very long. How about a bacon sample while I wait? One can hope.

0K32Ux-ktPISBeiN_lmVHw.text: This place is worthy of their reputation. Great food and fast service.  Loved the pork chop and eggs.

lR5u4uGWULNVS426UsbsUA.text: The Hog and Chick is excellent.  The coffee is locally roasted.  Be prepared to wait though.  I prefer the home fries over the hash browns.  The bacon is excellent.

j_sYCXJ8E-pl3V0_Un6Plw.text: What an awesome place atmosphere and the food so good ! The coffee and fresh squeezed OJ , the only bad thing that is always so busy ! But is worth the wait !!! Those potatoes and the omelette sandwich made my brunch expectations, really nice and clean place the customer services was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So good !!!

vF-_3Wm8LMGElT-5P33EYQ.text: I was very disappointed. After seeing this restaurant on Triple D  I was expecting much more than we got. The service was poor, we had to walk over to the counter to ask for drink refills, they didn't  come around asking if we needed anything, and they charged us for 4 drinks instead of 2. The waffles were good but, snall, the real maple syrup was tasty, bacon was good, the potatoes were good. But, the prices were steep for what you got. Won't be going back. Going back to The Place restaurant on 51st ave and bell.

ASwWHbpKpMhrFH-iHnffog.text: Dear Matt's big breakfast. I dreamt of your waffles last night.    Big, unbelievably fluffy, waffles. Delicious waffles. Best waffles. The sweet cream butter and maple syrup makes this amazing waffles out of this world.   The thick cut bacon is perfectly crispy on the edges but chewy too. So good. The hash brown is perfectly crispy without being burnt and tasty. The scrambled eggs were so fluffy. The blueberry jam that came with the toast was not overly sweet and just so full of ripe blueberry. And the freshly squeezed orange juice. I'm salivating just writing this review!  The wait wasn't long. We went around 8:30 a.m. on Saturday morning and waited maybe 10 minutes for a table. Service was fast and great.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eat at Matt&#39;s? Yes please!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon and waffles. Perfect combo at Matt&#39;s
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One step closer to deliciousness...

FJkSgmBPWNNhTEd-kGf_IQ.text: Very good filling breakfast with great service and a fair price. I was in town on business and I like to look for a local place for breakfast rather than the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. No complaints. I would go back if I'm in town again. Thanks for the great breakfast.

tN3bo9ILoMMzHxdJ5Z03zw.text: Great bacon and hash browns, overall if you are ever in Phoenix you must stop by. Great service as well food was delivered before I could break open my silverware.

jzNsRPGEHyM5Rgf2D4v5QA.text: One of the best steaks for breakfast EVER!  Perfectly cooked w/ awesome flavor. A bit loud inside, but fantastic service, great food, and extremely reasonable.  I hardly ever give 5 stars, but I can give this place all 5 without hesitation!

yE53OY97JqazHZAr7b3m8Q.text: Not sure about all the reviews here?  This place was so LOUD that you couldn't even have a conversation.  The food was mediocre at best.  Not bad, just nothing special.  Same waffles at an IHOP for example.  You know that little metal pitcher of syrup you get with a waffle, the tiny size...well, if you want more syrup ... that's another 1.50$ please.   So, the prices are fine, family of 4 for 50$, but not worth going back to for the ambience for sure... my ears are still ringing .

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d3tJobKnbsMOtsp_VaSGrA.text: They do not allow substitutions at all in any of their dishes. If you don't eat a specific type of meat you won't be accommodated here.

AAN6l-taWPBsPo48i4abRw.text: I've been coming here since I was really little, and honestly since they have moved building the quality in both food and customer service has gone down significantly.

HViQxuz22ypZcHQgVxthew.text: Not trying to pop anyone's bubble but our experience there for the first time was not good. One in our party ordered poached eggs with a meal. Twice they had to be sent back before they came back good. Two of us had the biscuits & gravy with home fries. My wife's had so much olive oil on the bottom of the plate she had to physically tilt he plate to drain it. Biscuits were over cooked & gravy was just okay. Not enough of it. Home fries had a ton of rosemary & you had to pick a lot of it out. Wanted our first experience to be a good one but it was not. Will not be back.

SGZ8ICB6eKL0g_TSae59xA.text: Probably the best breakfast place in the US. Worth the wait every time. And the staff always welcome me in and always say goodbye. Thanks Matt!

Yh6qyTnC4RrxrYqcA0jvrA.text: Enjoy it when I can get in, but the last two times that hasn't happened courtesy of their new host. Both times went by myself to sit at the counter. Both times was asked to wait, then watched multiple others show up and just grab the seats. He has no control of the dining room and appears continuously overwhelmed.

aUxG1Qju18eznIT4eMsXzg.text: Well here we are starving after the morning shopping at the VNSA book sale at the fair grounds.  This my first time here, my husband has has lunch here and said the food is good.  So we put our names on the waiting list and waited about 15 minutes.  When we were finally called to be seated the host stood at the door and pointed across the room to show us our table.   First of all this place is small, very crowed and the noise level is very loud. Not the kind of place to come to if you have a headache. Our waitress came to get our drink order which was good, but not great my bottom was not even on the chair yet. Not good because I wasn't sure if I wanted breakfast or lunch.  The food was good, but I was sitting staring at the bathroom which is the table I hate to sit at.  Not sure I would go back considering there are so many other places in the valley with better atomisphere, better food and they have enough tables that you're not staring at the bathroom.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ivfQNSUUuI4pugSaL1AsaQ.text: Usually ALWAYS busy, especially during prime time breakfast hours! Plan ahead and arrive early or after the breakfast rush. Busy and upbeat atmosphere, all food choices get a thumbs up from me!

v7h0FzFRbVA8Ns0j0MF8ig.text: Loved the food! The location is a little tight though, so be prepared to sit very close to other tables. I wasn't a fan of how clustered it felt. But the food was delicious. Eat the sourdough bread with the homemade jam! Talk about a perfect blend of flavors. I could eat it all day. Ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was great. I'll be back.

E8luVXviYYIQuMH9lv5qlA.text: This cute little breakfast/lunch establishment is always bustlin', though I got lucky at a 9 am time slot on Monday morning with no wait!   Location/parking: This is downtown Phoenix, so there's some street parking and meters near by.  I live close enough to walk.  If you're waiting, you will likely wait outside.   Variety: Not a huge menu but typical breakfast offerings of eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, and breakfast sandwich. There's an option with egg whites and vegetables.   Food:  I ordered the cheese omelet with potatoes and toast.  The omelet was perfect and cooked just right - a basic cheese omelet with my choice of cheese.  The potatoes were delicious, but some were not cooked at all. They were flavored with rosemary. There are various options for toast; I chose sourdough. They brought it with delicious jam.   Service: Efficient and quick.  Most everyone was friendly.   Ambiance/noise level: It's going to be busy likely, and it's cramped, so it's not super quiet but I could still hear everything.   All in all, a good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelet

v3Qfvci2WTVMU7YrWuYE1w.text: The food was great, the staff was okay, and the specials were confusing. I thought I order the correct thing until I looked at the chalkboard and realized I had to be that annoying patron that wants to change everything about a special because the server didn't inform me of the special.

Ep1-m1EWoFsxx_59gcdQ9Q.text: A little pricey but very well worth it. Everything even the ketchup and sauces are from scratch. Great sized portions. Absolutely delicious.

Ehy3e8aAjaIQk47b536_DA.text: Whoa! I have never had such a good breakfast! This place is really good!! I got the The Five Spot which is a breakfast sandwich and I added a side of hash brown.  And wow, the hash brown is so good. It so creamy and crispy!!! The sandwich itself was ok. I liked the sandwich but I felt like I could make it at home. Although the bread is pretty good.  I tried the bacon and it's so crispy!!!   Overall, this place is really good. Got seated right away and the manager here he is so nice. Good service, good food, and good vibes. Will definitely come back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Five Spot and The Hog &amp; Chick

1sXFWbjE_PqvVuA2otwsgA.text: I went here a little while back and forgot to rave about how delicious it was! I went on an Wednesday, and their special was French toast with sausage. I also tried the honey lemonade, and it was amazing! The service was great too, except my food came about 10 min. After the person I was with got theirs, but I can't control how fast things get cooked and I would rather have them serve the food warm than let it sit and get cold waiting for the rest of the parties order. The French toast was delicious because of the house made maple syrup and the great quality of the bread used. I'm not a huge fan of sausage, but this one was soooo good! The bacon though...was...AMAZING! Both of the meats had some sort of sweet glaze, yum! I loved the char on it...yummy. Definitely deserves to be called the best breakfast spot in Arizona.

ZMwk0iySwqi3D7_hD_IIHQ.text: Had some of the softest freshest waffles ever! They literally melt in your mouth!! And, the thickest most delicious bacon.....now, my mouth is watery!!

zRbYB8OaT0TGsvm-hyauSg.text: Quality and quantity. Come with an appetite. Always seems busy but the service is still pretty quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday special, biscuits and gravy

kOBaH1ymG6yvFBoXUctXwg.text: Every time we come here, we were very pleased with its tasty breakfast and brunch. It was always packed with people and bit loud. This might not be the best place to have conversation but the food never betray you. The place has a good vibe and they seem to know how to manage the restaurant. besides the main dishes, try a cup of coffee, it goes well with your meal.

D8_QgE8O2wI1ON2dBtLPKg.text: Maybe my fave breakfast spot in the west!!  Rustic outdoor ascetic gives way to a well ordered and lively dinning experience inside.  The breakfasts are big and tastes and well priced.   I'll be back for sure!

dCtcuefXtWmwWdFu0D94mg.text: 01/26/2014- broke down when a memory of a once delicious waffle came to mind and returned after I swore I wouldn't. Why can't I just listen to myself? Took 1 hour to get seated, brought out a burned waffle, screwed up my husband's order, let our coffee cups go empty (never 1 refill) then 5 different people asked us 8 times if we were all finished, would like anything else, can I take that check even though I just brought your plate, aka GET THE HELL OUT. Ok, this is my last mistake. Matts Big Breakfast I'm gone peace out used to love you but you wrecked our relationship with your dumb hipster waiters

c6wxPo-nTRt7kzeHmIg9XA.text: Great place to eat. Great food and staff. I promise if you try it once you'll be hooked

jHEsIXLH2KxIZXn8Fup_Iw.text: The food was decent but not exceptional. The pancakes were way to sweet. My husband got the Chop and Chick and couldn't even cut into it because it was hard. The service was terrible. On the menu it's stated that you get bottomless coffee, that may be True if someone actually came to refill our coffee cups. I will give them one credit - the portions are large but that's expected for their prices. This was my second time there to give it another shot and will not be returning.

_oKcZwyZYXcVDMWmARUDjw.text: The breakfast burrito I just had was not good. Besides being tasteless, it was dry and the cooks terribly burned the potatoes. The fresh squeezed orange juice also tasted like it was made from green unripe oranges. Maybe worth another shot some day but today was not a good experience.

6PQIixdtuwDALFPFHrnVUg.text: Outstanding. Didn't try the off-the-bone ham but it looked great. Good bacon, great fresh eggs.

L24vNs65cwK5jw1YWtClGg.text: Great brunch but no alcohol!!! In any case I love their midwestern cuts of pork and excellent breakfast flavors. Busy and popular.

aCR44MOEm_XHdXzc1G6Rjw.text: The place was packed.  The staff was friendly.  The food was huge portions,  it was ok not great.  Nothing special except the jam was really good.  We'd probably stop again if we were in the area .

s-tfsFCE1J2_Ytsiq29mCg.text: I'm sorry guys, not sure what all the fuss is about.  We came here because of the reviews, but I would say my experience was middle of the road.  I had the cheese omelette with peppers and onions($2 extra charge).  First off the cheese wasn't anything special for an aged Wisconsin cheddar, and the pricy peppers and onions? Well they were barely cooked with no seasoning at all added, but the worst part was the hash browns, Totally Inedible!! They were greasy, unseasoned and undercooked( translucent through 80%).  My husband had the waffle which was better than most, but nothing outstanding.  I was happy that they helped us out with the bill after I complained about the hash browns, but the manager was not the nicest about it. Made it seem that not  liking greasy, uncooked hash browns is a matter of taste- like it was unreasonable that I hadn't eaten them, and complained!?  Not sure I will bother coming back, there are plenty of trendy diners out there that will treat me better, it's too bad because I had high hopes, and liked their atmosphere.

KKpvIWjEBCB09ZF9jnebQg.text: After reading the reviews, I had to try it and All I can say is Really? 45 minute wait, limited menu (not too healthy either).  The hashbrowns were burned on the outside and undercooked on the inside, eggs were a little runny for my taste, toast was cold and the bacon was burned.  Would not recommend

kWS0jS5fFhfl6b13FWMO7g.text: I have been to Matt,s mean time and had good food but this time was not good in matter-of-fact it was of-full . The potatoes where undercook. The sausage was sliced but dried out and chewy. I just paid and left. I will go back someday.

nLDdJGqIlRqeMWMI6op5SA.text: The best breakfast in phoenix! Salami eggs were great, a bit spicy and delicious! Good coffee and the bread and strawberry jam is to die for! Can't wait to go back!

Yt3AXAvDa2hLfWNUX08Ewg.text: Matt's is my fav breakfast place ever! I live in la And want to go to phx all the time just for Matt's:) waffles are the bomb.com. I love the scramble specials too. Wish I lived In phx!

FaW1_9gkyRxgle5xCSPA1g.text: My boyfriend, his mother and I stopped in at the airport location an hour before we were to board our flight. We arrived at 10:15 and promptly ordered mimosas and breakfast from our waitress, Amber. Ten minutes later we received our mimosas. 45 minutes later, every single table around us, including the 5 that walked in a considerable amount of time after we did, all had their food. At this point, we have to board our plane in 5 minutes so we track down our waitress, because it had been quite a while since she had checked on us, and asked her if we can just get it to go and please get the check. She walks straight to the pos and gets our check, waits for us to pay for the meal and then sends the manager to let us know that they cannot find our check. Stop...so we just paid $77 for food that we aren't going to get? Owner assured us he will "make it right". Absolute worst experience I have EVER had at a restaurant. If their food is anything like their service, they won't last!

Vr9Z_YfTS3vMfk7IvkZc-Q.text: Great food...I recommend the waffles with bacon and hash browns....amazing strawberry lemonade. Went on a saturday early afternoon and only had maybe a 5 minute wait...def going again

8bRY9qkrcuki6K9DgPToaw.text: I just don't get it.  I have been there twice.  First time was about 2 years ago and both my wife and myself thought it was nothing more than average.  We thought with all the popularity there must be something great here and were somewhat disappointed so decided to try again.  This time was even more of a disappointment.  Somewhat of a long wait.  Then the food:  well if your going there for a standard eggs, bacon, hash browns....you may as well go to Denny's.  I'm not sure what they did to the hash browns but they were terrible and tasted nothing like hash browns.  As for the price I recall being $9 +.  Very expensive for 2 eggs, bacon, nasty has browns and toast.  I always like to give a restaurant a second chance so now I am done with Matt's big breakfast.  Of course there are many other menu items and based on the crowd they always have, they must be doing something right.  I'm just saying that if all your looking for is a standard egg breakfast, this is not the place you want to go.

kCIaRg4n4Lbb9-bQI9wWxg.text: Delicious food overshadows poor inattentive service. My party of four waited nearly 40 minutes today(Friday morning) and when we were finally seated our waitress promptly greeted us and took our drink order. After that, service was slow and had poor follow up. Forget trying to get a coffee cup refilled(I got up and went near the kitchen window to get a refil).    The good news is that the omelette and egg scrambles are delicious and large.  Homemade breads are wonderful. Our meals were delivered by some other team member and we never saw our waitress again until it was time for a check.  No follow up!!! Management may think the team approach is fine but someone, ie the primary waitress, needs to maintain some degree of attention to the table once food has been served. When we were leaving we mentioned this to our waitress and she just shrugged her shoulders and thanked us for coming...wow! I must reiterate how good the food is...We will return again because of that fact.

OfPAF9tNZ69ctBmN9LZfIA.text: I wish I could write a review based on their food because it is pretty good but for me if the service isn't up to par I can't completely enjoy myself. I was really disappointed the last time we went in at the attitudes of the staff. They seemed almost cocky as if they were doing ME a favor allowing me to eat there. They wouldn't tell us an appx wait time, refused to split check saying we could do the math ourselves and just let them know, and several other rude responses to our questions. They really forget that there are tons of other good breakfast joints in the area and we don't need to go there. We are central Phoenix residents and for many of our friends and family the go-to for restaurant recommendations. After the last visit I am taking them off our list of breakfast to recommend. It's a real shame and I hope if we ever go back we will be met with friendliness and an appreciation for our business.

qgyrUCcZZcV15nWCQq0xHw.text: Great fresh food. Have been there dozen times or so wait can be long but its worth the wait.

TMIoWyJ9npc4Msbu2LCaZA.text: Great Food, cool spot, great coffee... What else do you need? The thick cut bacon was amazing!

1HjsdeDM7V-qdGuNI6mWNw.text: Great bacon and pancakes (called griddlecakes), got there at 9:00 on a Saturday morning, had a 30 minute wait in the shade.  Great service and new interior for this location.

VQVTY1j3oJoMrxY2JQmz1Q.text: The best! I love to stop and eat at Matt's while waiting to leave from Sky Harbor.

wKIQXPPzd9MeQPzasW8aAQ.text: Matt's food is fantastic. The BEST hashbrowns I've ever had in my life. I often get the chop and chick and it's delicious. The toast is thick and comes with homemade jam. My one complaint--and it's a huge one for me--is that they do not have cream for their coffee! I simply don't understand their thought process in not offering cream. Their coffee is good, but not with milk or almond milk. Sorry, but this has actually been a dealbreaker for me and I will go to the Phoenix Market Cafe close by instead. I couldn't take a star off for it though because their food is so good. But PLEASE PLEASE Matt, offer CREAM for your coffee and I will be a regular!

oweflU6FW3rA8JTzbfnNjQ.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast!! Waited a little more then an hour but the bike/coffee shop down the road is the best time kill.

Cl8U7GBKAxj2JrnlJq3MJg.text: We had breakfast here on a Saturday morning. The place was packed but they got through the crowd quickly. All fresh cooked and local fresh ingredients.   They don't have a kid's menu (we have two elementary age kids) but they will do off-menu items such as single, large pancakes or waffles.   Service was excellent and very friendly.   We had egg scramble special with jalapenos and locally made chicken sausage. Had a good amount of spicy and a liberal amount of cheese.   The portions were generous to the point where we are half and packed up the other.

FYt36fzZYIP9Qby1m-0hiQ.text: Love that they have Four Peaks beer on tap, including my favorite, Hop Knot. But I'm wishing I had made a different food choice. l ordered the grilled cheese with creamy tomato soup. Because I figured it was impossible to go wrong with a comfort food staple and I'm tired of burgers at the airport. I must have had a shocked look when my food arrived. The tomato soup was no where near creamy, but a chunky-ish tomato soup with no cream. The grilled cheese was no where near the gourmet sandwich the menu promised. So not worth $10. Should have gone to NYPD pizza instead.

6YGDfGQ3IZaPXbEXSS31OQ.text: There's a long time to get in for a reason!  Best service, best food.  It's a place you have to try and fall in love with.

pm7yJJTmEIbpXL2nS677ig.text: I don't understand the hype about this place. Looked up best breakfast in Phx and this is the place that came up. No parking area, had to wait forever outside until I actually got seated inside. Then once I got inside I paid way too much for food that wasn't even good. Maybe I'm missing something,  but needless to say I won't be returning

LlUS15Th1y-hMJoti71OMw.text: Read about Matt's Big Breakfast on Triple D.  So far, Guy has not let us down.  If you love bacon, you have to check out the smoked Applewood bacon.  Even if you are not a  bacon lover, you'll fall in love with these nice smokey slices.  Nice and thick and cooked to perfection.    I had the Hog and Chick with thick sliced bacon.  3 slices bacon, 2 eggs, hash browns or home fries and your choice of toast.  What is the difference between hash browns and home fries you ask....hash browns are shredded potatoes cooked in butter.  Home fries are chunks of potatoes cooked in olive oil, rosemary and onions.    Hubby had the special of the day.  3 meat scramble with hash browns and flour tortillas.  This is definitely a meat lover's delight.  They do not skimp on the meats either.  Canadian bacon, Chipotle  and Cheddar sausage and Spicy sausage and cheese.  One drawback, parking lot is very small and difficult to maneuver around if you have a large car.  The staff were all helpful and friendly albeit a bit slow with coffee refills.  Some say breakfast is on the pricey side.  However you get a lot of bang for your buck!  Definitely recommend you check out Matt's if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side Order of Bacon

9MmYC0dlMskvvbk8X8Ragw.text: Dive side of town but a really dynamic local diner. Short hours and a small footprint make it a tough call, but it's worth the visit. We arrived early, 15 minutes after opening and there was already a 30+ min wait on a Saturday morning.    Good diner-quality breakfast with quick service, good hot cakes, eggs & potatoes. Cheap and a giant meal on a large plate. The place was full of locals; we were the only out-of-state license plate on the street.

PN64NtTKdYOyTR2kZPF9Gg.text: One of the best breakfast places I have ever been everyone is friendly and the food delicious.  The item on the menu is probably overlooked.  Sour dough toast it' tastes like someone just baked it and it comes with homemade strawberry jam.

m9WzRuohIl58f7x3vj13mw.text: Yes x1000! You have to wait to be seated, usually for awhile... But after you order food is served very quickly, and it is ALWAYS worth the wait. Eat here. End of story.

ev5QCFsRwrs8T-qikZQoTg.text: This place is a tiny hole in the wall, so make sure to come early and prepare to wait, cause it's worth it.  The staff is super nice and very attentive.  While you are waiting make sure to grab a menu, so you can peruse at your leisure.  Not that you are going to need a lot of time with it, unless you are a really slow reader.  There is only a handful of items, but don't be put off by that. Cause what they do...they do it amazingly!  Daughter had an omelet with cheese and mushroom, Son and Wife did steak and eggs.  I had scrambled eggs and sausage.  Sounds basic, right.  Wrong, it was incredible.  The eggs were all cooked to perfection.  Most people don't know how to cook, so it finishes on the plate.  These people should hold a class on it.  Eggs cooked through and super moist.  The steak was aged and tender.  The Sausage were fresh and infused with subtle smoky flavor.  My Daughter's omelet was as big as her head and filled to the brim with cheese and mushrooms.  Each order came with potatoes, so me being a fatty, I always gotta go with the hash brown.  They were crisp on outside and tender on the in.  It was a great compliment to a wonderful meal.  A meal that was elevated to an eating experience by the attentive and caring staff.  As a whole all the patrons in the restaurant should have hoisted the cooks and wait staff on their shoulder and showered them with praise, but alas a heart felt thank you, will have to do.
