Nn-rAzXw4T4vBOcyObGRvA.text: Here in town for the wildcard baseball game tonight. Hotel recommended this restaurant for breakfast. They were right, this is a fantastic breakfast. Sourdough toast excellent, ham steak was excellent, hashbrowns are among the best I've ever had.

5yQ5pxym4_rDdf4loC881A.text: Salami scramble - I tried to remove all the salami after I tasted rancid fat, but the rancid taste was also on the overcooked eggs.   So I tried to eat the hash browns. They couldn't be cut, chopped or broken with fork or knife, but I managed to spear the entire brick and gnaw chunks off. I felt my teeth did some manly, brutish work.

Mbbif4phZKC5OKCvrfR65A.text: This place is not as good as everyone on Yelp has made it out to be. Be prepared-the whole place is packed and the dining area and the bar are sat by a host who keeps an ever growing waiting list. I was flying solo. The host was able to squeeze me in and offer me one of the bar seats available. The service was fast and friendly. I had the Hog and Chick (two eggs scrambled with thick cut bacon, hash browns and wheat toast). The hash browns and toast were drenched in butter and my thick cut bacon was greasy and fatty. I probably should have went with the Skinny Chick (their egg white and more healthful breakfast option). The jam/preserves they give you for the toast is very scrumptious. And the coffee was good.

REZvGB6WyHRum-k6ekKwnA.text: Food is always great, always a wait and yes, sometimes is loud. But, if you want great food, you have to endure small inconveniences

F7ALHr4bnbhGRGV1gvvRNA.text: This place has the dullest menu, the most common food imaginable, and terrible atmosphere - at very high prices. The food isn't bad, but there's nothing to it - a burger, a Ruben, tuna salad sandwich... really? This isn't anything special -except the prices. Tuna salad sandwich with chips, which was no better than I make at home, for $13.00. Seriously, forget what you may have seen on TV, which is someone trying to find something interesting to makeTV, go somewhere that has better food - which isn't hard at all to find.

wjtcQ6Crs-Ft1IOpyLsBDg.text: I've been reading a lot of reviews about Matt's big breakfast so I stopped in to give it a try. I have to say I was a bit disappointed in the size of my meal. It wasn't BIG at all. The tables were very small to, barley enuf room to fit two people. The restaurant itself is small to,very little seating. We had to wait for about 30min. before being seated. The food is just ok,I won't be coming back. Matt's breakfast would be an appropriate non misleading name.

6KBPoFDzZh5yhMaQfWXhpA.text: I love Matt's Big Breakfast downtown, but this was a huuuuge disappointment. HUGE. I ordered an egg salad sandwich (which I have had before at the one downtown), and it was just awful. There was literally NO egg salad in this sandwich. The two slices of bread on the outside where so unnecessarily THICK. I took off one of the slices in attempt to actually taste the measly amount of egg salad that was on my sandwich, but even then, the other half of bread was so rubbery i couldn't tear it with my teeth! I was in awe. Even the guy sitting next to me said something about it. Like "wow that's a lot of bread."   Don't get me wrong, their breakfast is fantastic at Matt's downtown! And maybe even good at the airport as well. But I have had their egg salad before and it was nothing like that.  I almost complained to my server it was so bad. Almost. I can't believe I spent money on like a tablespoon of egg salad. I never ever complain about food, I usually just don't ever return if I don't like it. But this sandwich was so pathetic I actually wanted my money back. Of course I'm so passive I ended up not saying anything. Was just kind of hoping my server could tell by the fact that I barely ate any of it. I should have complained and I regret not doing so. I just hate to. But this was so bad. Won't ever go here again.   I still kind of want my money back. :( Sorry guys!

jT6S_xa8OzhXcRS4cJrjzQ.text: Food is pretty good here. I went here for the first time because Snooze AM had a horribly long wait. I have had one of the breakfast sandwiches here and the pancakes. Sandwich was good, pancakes are excellent. If you are looking for a place to go out for breakfast or brunch, then this is a good place to try out.

YQX7Nduz94P1-OzRp6BB3w.text: I tried this after referring a friend from out of town. Great choice and great food. A little crowded and noisy but the food was hot and great! I will return!

tN68mQMu41elGA6iu34xVQ.text: Saw this place several years back on DDD.  I finally flew through Phoenix and went to see the place.    This is the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!!  I am a breakfast snob if it's not better than what can do at home it's not worth paying for is my motto. Everything was awesome I mean everything.  No wonder it's gone from a tiny little place in downtown Phoenix to a three store chain.

518Y6A3SteYzwGh7QS09uQ.text: Where do I start? Well to be clear, I never actually ate here...unless you count my stomach eating itself from utter and total starvation!   Coming all the way to Matts was a stretch for us, living on the west side and having a breakfast place we already love. But...we had heard great things and wanted to check it out. MISTAKE one.   We called and were told there wasn't much of a wait. We arrived and were told it should be pretty quick. I think that's the point where they realized we had kids. This place HATES kids. MISTAKE two.  We waited for 90 minutes! We watched parties come after us, get seated and leave while we were waiting outside. And these were parties of ALL sizes. They even LIED to us and said we were next and sat a party of the exact same size that arrived 20 minutes after us.   We left and went around the corner to the Phoenix Public Market. I doubt that the food here could be good enough to put up with their complete and total bullshit.

Hnql5NMIopIAIQsaJQE3Fw.text: Oh, my god!!  No, I've never experienced breakfast nirvana before, but I know it when I feel it.  Thursdays are Eggs Benedict days.  GO there.  Eat it.  I have never loved this dish before and now may never love it again having sampled Matt's oeuvre.  My countermate recommended the bacon highly.  While bacon with EB is overkill, I must say that, having ordered it, I was entirely satisfied.  It was firm, thick and peppery - Bacon so good that I will be hunting for slab bacon to hand slice and pepper to copy it.  To top this slavishly positive review, even the coffee was excellent.  Though my bill for breakfast was nearly $20, I didn't feel cheated in the least.  It was splendid.  Oh, and did I mention the home fries...?

_lLAVr7GPNWCWE5_eE1z9w.text: Came after seeing this place on the tv in England! Was really amazing such a great breakfast! Defo worth a visit! Don't reckon they need this review from how busy it was go early to avoid having a prolonged wait or missing service.hours!

mOo1EIicuTdi58LqzPGEUg.text: Great food, fast service and an electrical plug under my seat; exactly what an airport diner/eating place should be.

OP1ugyLqSp45VMZgYCW2eA.text: Solid breakfast place.  I would not wait in line to get in, but if there are tables available it is a good place for breakfast.  Nothing exciting or extra special, but very good quality and options.

sz_8Ol8PGNstXZy4Uv0lqA.text: This place has an amazing breakfast! The hogs and chick, steel cutt oats, and pancakes are by far my favorites and I get them everytime! If you go you have to get the pancakes!!!!

wPkX10kKa509q-XmXLS8MA.text: the food was very good but it taste nothing more than the usual! i heard the bacon is pretty good but i wouldn't know... hard to find parking at times and get very packed/

xNMjlqHHDeesRV7vPZtFtA.text: This place is great, hard to get a table, but the owners are fantastic, and the food is amazing.

x6zJs1DVrac8PRFq6bFCCA.text: Always great food and smiling faces!!! I know its a breakfast joint but try the butter burger!!!

4Eoaaar5-ehwiCl9gFuXjg.text: It's an ok breakfast place.  The place is overhyped.  This is no different than what I can make myself.  The coffee is ok.  I was disappointed they did not offer real cream with it.  Instead, it's organic milk only.  The hash brown were mushy on the inside.  The waffle is nothing special.  If you want some quality breakfast, go to Butterfield's.

VNMtkQ4uWoMC3q3zqXuZ5w.text: Went to Matt's this morning for the first time. It was awesome!  Great atmosphere, great food, and great service.  I would highly recommend this place but be prepared to wait for a table. We got lucky and got two seats at the counter. Check it out!  It is worth it!!!

jC2uZ_hZS0FhuXV16Y9yKQ.text: Best breakfast place - hands down.  Always amazing.  Reasonable priced, but they go the extra mile  to make things from scratch.  I have never had a better breakfast lace anywhere!!!!!

lsSM8NL7pHbF8-_Px6ioUA.text: When we first arrived, there was a long line. Fortunately, the staff is friendly and efficient, so the line went fairly quickly. Service was great, the food (griddle cakes for me, pork chop for my guy) was good and arrived soon after we ordered. The only suggestion I would make is that you don't sit at the counters. The metal stools were so slippery that we had to brace ourselves against the counter to keep from slipping off. Otherwise, I recommend the place.

4i9Ust3e4GP3taIKgiZ_NA.text: Thick bacon was hard to chew and not as tasty as I dreamed it would be after all the other reviews. The rest of our breakfasts were large and unique. Service was very good

FuK-pvO80BVsM5uuN-ohHQ.text: Had friends in from out of town and had heard how great this place was so why not.  Visited on a Saturday morning (8:30am).  Very busy, long wait and parking is a challenge. P.S. feed the meters. I didn't get busted but lots of others received parking tickets on the street.   We had a variety of meals (breakfast sandwich, cheese omelet, hog and chick and a special of the day) and waters around (for four people).  The meals were good, wouldn't say great.  The ambiance was less than desirable.  It's very loud, very cramped, not very comfortable and rush, rush, rush.  It felt as if they couldn't get your order quick enough and get you out the door even quicker.  We had plans so the speed was ok.  What I later found annoying was that I had been grossly overcharged.  This is partially my fault, as I should have checked the check, but the rushed atmosphere along with my trusting nature, (I just gave her the credit card to settle up, without looking at the check) got me in the end.  Looking at the check later, I realized we received another tables check as there were six meals and drinks on the ticket and we had only four people in our group.  In the end, I was overcharged about $20, not including the 25% tip I left on the overinflated bill.  My fault, just a warning to beware due to the extreme haste at this place.

mNMkNcmFNANB1bpHYXOhpQ.text: Meh.  I don't get the stellar reviews.  It's fine, but it's loud and there is almost always a wait for some reason.  It's overpriced for breakfast food.  The food is fine, but I wouldn't say fabulous.  The staff is always in a rush.  For me, the noisy environment and the price keep me from going back.

JLBt7IjO1zWuYu3aB5ZPFA.text: We have been here plenty of times and keep coming back because of the food, one time our waitress dug her tiny shorts out of her ass and proceeded to serve us without washing her hands first. We made a comment to the owner she apologized but then we saw the cook cough all over our food. We went there today with our daughter, only a party of 2 was on the list ahead of us. Well once they were sat the hostess sat people that came in after us. When we questioned her about it she said that they only seat party of 3 at their ridiculously tiny tables. Which wouldn't be so bad if they didn't bring every item you order on its own plate. We weren't given an option of the bar or table. Which we would've picked the bar because there is more room and it was available first. They attempted to sit us at the baby table and sat a party of 3 white people at the bar. She was very friendly to the white costumers but not us. My money is green just like theirs. Will not be going back for a long time...please make the little girls that work there wear shorts that are longer than their vagina. Very unprofessional!

WxnrNt506ebpmGqZRNjRvA.text: After all the hype around this place we happened to be down-town and decided to give it a try. I'll be honest it was good food but nothing amazing, I am just glad there wasn't a wait when we went otherwise I think our expectations would have been much higher. I got the griddlecakes because I read they are a must to try and my husband got the Chop & Chick (pork chop with eggs). The pancakes were good, I would say comparable to the good egg, but I would choose the good egg over Matt's. The husband's pork chop had a lot of flavor with a nice crispy outside served with your standard scrambled eggs and above par hash browns. The one thing we got which I will say was very good would be the thick-cut bacon. It was cooked perfectly and for a side order you got 3 huge slices which was enough for us to share. I would come back here however, I would definitely try the BLT because of that bacon, but I don't see myself waiting more than 15-20min for a seat.

_aPgpM7yoL6qK9YTXgz-Nw.text: Love the food there and the portions are big.  Service fast and the servers very friendly. My only negative comment is that the stools at the counter area area a stainless steel and very slippery.  I felt that the whole time I was there I was fighting to stay on the stool.  Maybe they should put some non slip strips on them LOL. Or invest in a different style of stool for the counter areas

fUbiEaHb25_3p5SEAdAWpA.text: Excellent food and great accommodation for food allergies.  Service was a little off...big welcome, but then they didn't notice we were sitting there and served folks who had come in after. Still highly recommend.

7fg-g46Gnu8UIaVvsufwTA.text: The hash browns are too die for. My omelet was well done, not over cooked, and the strawberry spread is delicious.

RsUEeDBRuPzp9N8Xd3GtYg.text: A solid breakfast, but a long wait. Overall it's overrated. At the end of the day they have eggs and bacon and there's nothing much special about that.

NLY1qk1TBTGHbecnxjlxeQ.text: 4 stars only cuz the wait is sooooo long! Outside - line around the block, no lie. Good food! Matt can cook! The food is great but when I want to eat, I want to eat!!

m1ETg3sN6EihgO3HGYRAFA.text: I moved out of town and I cry a little each time I want go to out to breakfast and there is no Matt's around.   Seriously the best breakfast spot I've ever had in six states.

olmI58-u9lg9b_AVyXLCQg.text: We have been going to Matt's for over 4 years now. Never ordered from the menu - always went for their special of the day and it has always been great. Love the staff...and they move people in and out without feeling rushed. Keep up the great work guys!!!!

zJE889i1CJT9w7iGeY6fFQ.text: Great food but usually really busy. I always love what I order and you can tell they use quality ingredients. The only downside is that you usually have to wait.

LJMDLDuZywWyXGh1l4YnBA.text: A lot of hype around this place and they lived up to it! I had the salami omelet and was tasty. Their homemade jelly was so good. Highly recommend this place!

DRCsY-n15eDG-Q1psa4usw.text: BAAAAAAACOOOOOOOON. I don't know if people had a weird experience, but I found the service and the food to be delicious.

opJvKAAgW7bYbyYNvxnBeQ.text: The best breakfast you will ever have. I can't tell you why - maybe take the most simple foods but make sure they are the highest quality, cook with butter or olive oil and you get perfection?  I don't know the secret but people will wait in line for over 30 minutes to eat OATMEAL there?!  I've eaten there twice - my first review must have been written on the other location. This time I had the simple breakfast sandwich. Two eggs, bacon, cheese on a soft fluffy roll. The bacon is outrageous, thick, peppery yum. The sandwich is really big and luscious.  My older kid gets the basic eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon. The younger got the waffles - incredible light, fluffy and flavorful. I can't remember what my husband got but he was a happy, happy man.  The wait is tough especially in summer heat. I've been approached by homeless folks both times. The last one was hilarious. He asked me for a cigarette and I told him I don't smoke. He looked at me with amazement and asked: How did you quit??? Like we have been the best friends forever and he is in awe in my ability to quit. Ha! I laughed and said I've never smoked. He nicely moved on to the next group.  **I had to edit this as I forgot to compliment the service. I love, love, love how everyone says "thank you for waiting". There is no arrogance here. Super attentive service always offering more water or coffee.

IhTm_yQz0iiTAcXZxrUaIQ.text: Ok so I heard that it was a wait to get seated but the food is worth it plus my homie lives on Roosevelt so it seemed like a no brainer. Aaawww it's True and it's a hot min unless u waiting right by the door when they open but that's up to you to decide if all the hype is worth it. I waited close to 40 min @10am on a Sunday so that should tell u. Im not fond of a long wait especially for a simple breakfast because basically I was just to lazy to make it myself. If it's eggs Benedict or some other fancy poached egg saucey type dish than I can understand but ummm no this is ur simple breakfast establishment.     So let's get into the meal;  Love me an egg sandwich and a connoisseur of these tasty impactful little buggers so of course I got the 5 spot. The bacon is so thick and amazing, the cheese is perfectly melted and the huevo was nicely cooked and is nestled in this locally made tasty roll that is so soft w/a pinch of sweetness. I give this egg sandwich a must pick up to go item and eat it in your car or walk home. No need to sit and eat there it takes to long. I do have to say that I think it's super wack home fries nor hash browns come with this sandwich and besides the bacon I can't imagine why pay $6 for a sandwich that doesn't even come with a side of extremely cheap veggie item, which is another 2.95, blasphemy. Anyways I ordered a side cuz my sandy was lonely and gosh darn it they forgot my order. Half way through my egg buddy I realized I still had no cheapy potato shreds in front of me. I had to ask and they still had to make them so u know they was rushed and a lil underdone. Mistake of the waitress not the kitchen staff, which was totally played off and they didn't even hook it up w/a free ice tea or coffee so they get a boo!  Nevertheless this place gets a whatever and if I go again it will always be an order out cuz waiting hella long for nothing wowwing is not the buizness, but if I do ima wear a side braid or bun like everyone else who works there as an ode.  FYI this place really deserves a 2 for long wait, forgetful waitress,  simple way nothing on the menu is to exciting hyped up eats but it gets a 3 only for the egg sandwich deliciousness only! Plus I can't seem to figure out how to get a halfsies .

tX14Pc8Dp1Ol4i8xwebMwA.text: I would totally give this place a 5 star rating if it wasn't for the long wait. The food was delish!! My kids had the waffle which is huge and the real maple honey is to die for. The staff is very attentive and friendly. If you have time to kill due to the wait and want some yummy breakfast, then this place is it!

n-nEHPqNtONYJlynetew8A.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has been a favorite, must go to spot for my wife and me every time we come to AZ. We sort of miss the original small building as it was so cozy, but the new building provides the same excellent food and great service. Thanks for the continued wonderful experience Ernie!

oHru6X7nJjU5vg39sgDzyw.text: A must for breakfast fans in the valley. You can tell by the pictures they have quality food. Can/will be busy on the weekends. The staff is friendly. I've only ate at the bar and have had the same server...... who is absolutely beautiful.

w4wuOmmh8YBN1FrPZDRwFQ.text: This place is delicious and I'm not even a huge breakfast person. This was the first time we have been to their new location and its a lot bigger but still quaint. And it made our wait 35 minutes verse the 2 hours it would take before which is awesome! The waitress was attentive and got everything out fast which was nice since we had our wild child with us. Restaurant is super loud so it wasn't a big deal when my daughter got hyper. I got the blt this time and it was great the bacons is thick and crispy. I don't like tomatoes so I should have added avacado or cheese for a little more flavor but still one of the best I've ever had. Lots of homeless people around this area which is fine its phx its to be expected but for some reason they really bother you when you are waiting.

obAgb-mM1Ggw24UECxSLGg.text: I have been here twice now and both times were great!  The food is fresh and tastes wonderful.    Pros: +excellent tasting food +excellent customer service +locally brewed coffee (from Cave Creek) +thick slices of bacon +fresh squeezed orange juice +real maple syrup +you do NOT feel terrible after eating here, like some places!  I felt energized and ready to take on the day  Cons: -may have to wait for a table, but worth it -no biscuits or biscuits & gravy on the menu -would like to see an all-natural sweetener such as Stevia available -would like to see organic ketchup available as a condiment  Those cons are very minor and aren't even a big deal.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

DRqtkqvcSr7zPrbz9cbrTw.text: The location was cool and trendy I loved the decor. Our waitress was very friendly and professional but the other one was showing too much cleavage for a breakfast cafe setting.  My pancakes were dry and not very tasty although the portion size was huge. They were also crumbly sort of like cornbread which I don't really find to be appealing for pancakes.. They had a very organic "made from scratch" taste but not as good as what my mom could make from scratch and she's not a good cook. The jam was very delicious. The lemonade was heavenly. It was very noisy. My husband ordered the porkchop with hashbrown and eggs. He decided his favorite thing was the jam. He normally doesn't like sweets and is a huge meatlover. The porkchop wasn't very flavorful husband thought it was dry too. Both of our menu items could have tasted better. They were quick service was great. I was expecting more of the food. The quality in the ingredients was there I'm assuming organic maybe local? But our breakfast just wasn't that flavorful. Maybe it was what we ordered? After trying our food we both regretted our choices and left disappointed.

x1Yn-L5YguEVSlE_rmShwA.text: This is more than just great food.  It's traditional breakfast fare, creatively prepared  and served by friendly and attentive staff.  I went for opening bell, which is a bit early for most, but no line up.  This is the kind of place you'd want to go back until you've had everything on the menu, except they also have daily specials, so you'll just have to keep coming.

s029zSnrxZ53S4rLzNGi1g.text: Cool place but they put waaaayyyy too much rosemary in the potatoes. I think I had an entire bush!  Not even chopped up just sprigs of rosemary. We asked for more syrup and they told us it would be an extra charge of $1.50!  They only gave us 2 tsp for a stack of pancakes. If you love rosemary and dislike syrup this is a great place!

lcAXhe526oJVdWyNDf0A9Q.text: This place had a really laid back vibe that made the experience welcoming! Everyone was extremely nice and everyone was helpful. The food was amazing. Def coming back when in Phoenix!

DihD8aTzSbYzpIfpxln-7w.text: Love Matt's big breakfast!!! Whenever I go through Phoenix, I make it a point to stop by Matt's   Real ingredients makes for real Food!  I can eat at Matt's and be full for the rest of the day, and be satisfied!  Great waffles! Great pancakes! Great eggs! Great thick pieces of bacon, and not mention their brunch menu.  To bad I live 200 miles away, I'd be a regular! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Special!!  YUMMY!!!!!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffles R Us!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s the 5 Spot!

vGW7t9A2aanTGhIPIxJ-eQ.text: This breakfast place is pretty dang good.  I am a huge breakfast fan and I have to say, this hits the spot every time.  The one complaint that I had, was that the service was really slow.  It seemed like they were shot staffed, so maybe that was why but it is still not good to let down your customers like that.

c9zxL0XbYMwjuVaqxLfsQA.text: Awesome diner food. Place is clean and consistent. Staff is super friendly. Food is tasty all around, you can order anything. The coffee is delicious! Might stop by again today.....

O5nPHKGQBhlPifs1zVXdlw.text: Got the daily special on a Sunday morning. Food was oversold and under delivered. Not worth the wait for me...

7u6H5xGLtTM1HGLePPTLTw.text: Assholes! Don't eat here. They forgot to write our name on the waiting list and then where jerks about it as if it was my fault Had the nerve to roll his guys and everything. Ruined my morning. So irritated.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0YKUYgOCmJBTzlALXl7eRw.text: Good service and good food and good prices. We came here on a holiday morning and waited about 15 mins before getting seated. Be warned that there is no dedicated parking area for this restaurant and you'll have to use the metered street parking. The atmosphere of the place was very busy but aesthetically pleasing enough. However, we came here to catch up with family, and it was just too noisy to hear most of the conversations. I strained my voice as if I was talking in a club. In the end, I would still recommend this place because the quality of the food is good for their price.

gM_x0eZztg-kIoL-P_rVKw.text: went to matt's for the first time for breakfast.  we are huge breakfast fans.  I ordered griddle cakes and another hungry person ordered the salami scramble with fresh tomatoes and sourdough toast.  the jam with the toast was very good; the egg scramble was hot and not over cooked.  my griddle cakes were subpar; have had far better pancakes at snooze, baja cafe...   iced tea was flavored and not informed of that fact when i ordered it so sent it back. nothing to write home about eating here;  we will continue to try different breakfast cafes and won't be returning to matt's.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. salami scramble with fresh tomatoes.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ho hum pancakes.

iiZlZgCvkJJkIWICsFWcOw.text: I came here with a group of friends a few weeks ago. We were ready for a good brunch before heading up to the Grand Canyon. I had heard about this place for awhile and been wanting to try it. We got here around noon on a Friday and there was still a 20 minute wait.  It's a pretty small, bustling place. We were seated near the back and had to pull up a chair at the end for the 5th person. Our server was nice and friendly, brought our drinks and took our orders promptly. I had a scramble with salami and cheese, and I subbed the potatoes for grilled tomato. My other friends got the egg white scramble, the special of the day, which I think was an omelet with pork and cheese.   Everything came out pretty fast which was nice since we were starving. For all the good that I had heard of this place though, I was mildly disappointed. I will say the food tasted good and clean, not greasy or overly salty and buttery. So that was definitely refreshing, but in terms of amazing flavor, it just wasn't there. Got a decent portion for the price though. Honestly, I'd say it's more 3.5 stars than 3, but I don't exactly understand or agree with the hype.

tbXo3NKJ44ECxDL6YDROrA.text: I loved their honey lemonade and sourdough toast! The bacon is also to die for. We did have to wait quite some time to get a table which wasn't fun considering there's no indoor waiting area.

q5JxKn9IWJOlHquX6zcyuw.text: This place definitely lives up to the hype. I love their breakfast and would go every day if I could. The line may be long but it's definitely worth it.   My favorite meal to get is to split a waffle and cheese omelet with a friend. What really makes the meal is the potatoes! The rosemary gives them such a nice flavor and I wish I could eat them for every meal. I also love the bread and jam. It's an all-around perfect meal and I won't stop going there. This location is very crowded but it definitely has a fun atmosphere.

vM3IuqGwzcLfcwnbvDWHpQ.text: It's diner food that's decent, but nothing stood out to us as worth another visit. The staff made us feel incredibly rushed, brought our bill with the food, never checked on us, and started clearing the table as soon as we took our last bites. The restaurant was half empty so we weren't sure why they were rushing us out.

oTXxT2JX8C0sz-o_6EiI4g.text: The Hog & Chick breakfast was great! Loved the homemade strawberry jam for the wheat toast!

Dbpj7f6nuskgQpkXxqGY7w.text: This was my first time visiting the newer downtown location since it opened. It was bustling and very busy. There was plenty of action, and things were loud. However, I knew that going into the situation. The food was awesome, I had their huevos rancheros special and ate every single bite. Service was swift, and coffee was plentiful. Yum!

kHnOdzEFnCMQYPBNLnmi0g.text: Perfectly cooked pork chop with eggs and home fries, sourdough toast was a perfect compliment. Had to get the side of bacon, well worth it. Everything was great! Nothing much else to say but try it! You won't regret it.

XAMVlNpwJrdHEH1bx46VNw.text: I expected it to be much better. At 10:30 on a Wednesday, we waited about 15 minutes for a table for two. We ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich which truly was just average and An order of pancakes that were dry, crumbly actually, and overpriced at nearly $8. The tables are very close to each other which is fine except the music is blazing loud. So between the close proximity of the other patrons and the loud music it is extremely difficult to hear the person sitting directly in front of you on the other side of the table. The staff was friendly and the service was good, but that's not going to be enough to bring us back again.

PthBhr989HFNp9uzh0-nKw.text: Ordered the chop and chick. It was good! Very filling breakfast. I just wish the pork chop had a little more flavor. The hash browns are AMAZING. Blueberry lemonade is not bad. My friend ordered a butter burger and he also wished it had more flavor. No wait on a Monday morning. Good place

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CTdMAL94qgnsNeZSKYM6Ug.text: This is the greatest little breakfast joint in downtown Phoenix! We stopped here on our way out of town. The staff was incredibly friendly, everyone checked in on us, not just our waitress. The food was amazing. They have a simple menu and are excellent at preparing the food that they offer. The biscuits and gravy tasted great, and came to the table very quickly. We would definitely recommend this place, and will visit again!

KQ8yuh8oDLIRtsC8Kc68GQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has high quality, simple food done right. Their griddlecakes are tender with a good rise (although, a tad too sweet for my preference). I also had the "Hog & Chick" with bacon and over easy eggs. The eggs were tasty and the bacon was perfectly done, but the star of the show for me was the hashbrowns. They are simultaneously creamy and soft, with a fabulous crust on the exterior.   Service is so efficient and friendly. For example, our table was a little wobbly, so we brought it to someone's attention. And, the guy had a wedge in his pocket so he was able to fix it right then!  The wait can be long, but the neighborhood is cute so you can walk around to kill time. I visited in winter and didn't have to wait out in the hot sun. If that had been my experience maybe I would feel differently about how the wait affects the overall rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Griddlecakes

BmFENmKjzrVx26xaRMOFnw.text: We went to the location in downtown. I ordered chop and chic and my husband ordered the second daily special; the first daily special ran out just as we were ordering.  I thought my chop was a bit over cooked but it was seasoned well. The rosemary potatoes was delicious.   The second daily was eggs with apple sausage and has brown.  I thought the sausage was a bit bland.   The 'toast' that came with the entrees was deliciously fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop and chic
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The second daily special for Saturday
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A4SDK-H8dF35R7kXejFeeQ.text: Delicious and service is great.  The best hash browns and bacon we ever had.  Everything was tasty, definitely a must.

OX8t50Gqecpnm4Hhy4PYfA.text: Great Service Great Food !!!   We Tried this place for the first time. On Thursday morning around 7:30a.m. we were seated right away. Great menu selection. Large biscuits, very good food, large portions. The food came out accurately, quickly and hot. We were in and out in 30 minutes!  Ask for Skye she friendly and a great waitress.  Also, nice and clean dining area.

-gm9pSQejCXS190HNXpRMg.text: Well the name kinda says it all. It's a big breakfast. Very good food. I just had a basic breakfast with eggs, peppered bacon, home fries, and very good thick wheat toast.  No wait on a late weekday morning.  Very unpretentious appearance,  just good food (and lots of it).  Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2Q5F2m3-znW6uST6TIkZsg.text: Upbeat and urban very much a change of pace from your everyday breakfast & brunch dinner. Staff is friendly and catering to every need. Don't be scared of by the sworn of people waiting outside, good eats await you inside.  Looking for some good pancakes you found the place. Fluffy and filling and don't forget the homemade lemonade.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade honey strawberry lemonade.

uEkgl-tzPQwVHR7RAXPwJw.text: Great breakfast sandwich here called the Five Spot. And yes, it hit the spot!  Came in around 11am with one of my frat bros. It looked busy, but we were greeted and seated right away. Friendly staff.   Also recommend the Honey Lemonade, but heads up--they don't do free refills!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot. Delicious.

OX-Q3pHH6bpenxp9KzKACw.text: For two and a half years I have been anxiously waiting to try this place.... I saw it on diners drive in and dives before I moved to Phoenix and couldn't wait. Things kept getting in the way but today was the big day! After waiting HOURS in the social security office close by, I became starved. I drove on over and had to find parking behind it in the TINY parking spaces, typical of downtown. I was greeted instantly by a waiter and he gave me plenty of options. I sat at the bar and was greeted by a friendly waitress. I opted for the special and a side pancake. The coffee, was awful. They did not also have cream and only offered milk. I was really disappointed as I like a very simple coffee. My pancake was delicious but the rest was subpar. They only offer one hot sauce and my hash browns were mushy. It was a downtime but the waitresses were all talking amongst themselves eating and the chef staff was in the kitchen being ridiculously loud and goofing off the entire hour I was there. I am really disappointed with my visit and will be sticking to my usual US EGG, breakfast joint. If you're in the mood for pancakes and you are downtown I do recommend this place, other than that... try somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AmAhkir1FoLWdf-m0km8Jw.text: Wow!!! For Airport food this is way beyond that! Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix. I had the Mamacita Burger, I added an egg just for shits and giggles. Definitely need to check this place its in the U.S. Airways B terminal.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mamacita Burger

8u4gb5QcNxrVr47kWNgBeQ.text: Excellent food, fantastic atmosphere. I would eat here everyday if I lived here. The waffle was the perfect and everything was absolutely phenomenal

lXcxf4mRgxTqao_wqRVCBw.text: Aside from the fantastic food, MBB has exceptional service. We are on vacation and Yelped to find good brunch spots. The reviews do not lie! MBB was easy to find for us "out of towners" and did not disappoint our tummies.   Only con is their very small parking lot, so we did have to pay to park on the street. Not a huge deal, as the meters do accept cards or coins.   I loved the Matt's Traditions menu found on the placemat. Today, their feature menu item was the biscuits and sausage gravy... talk about delicious! My boyfriend got the five spot and I would definitely order that on our next visit. Both meals exceptional as well as their friendly staff and service.   It's an epic five stars from this Hoosier!

Ve6lfYKPg6cYYo5_pX13dg.text: I couldn't be happier that Matt's Big Breakfast moved into my hood :) I'd been to the downtown location before (and absolutely loved it!), but recently tried out the new one in Biltmore. It's exactly what you'd expect: cute decor, friendly servers, fast service.  First time? Try the griddle cakes! These are not your mama's pancakes. They are sort of like the love child of a pancake and cornbread. And they're delicious!!!

CLRkJFz_O3R4VqXHhVXxcA.text: I'm not sure why I didn't have great time here. I'll describe my experience and you can decide. I came in and it was pretty busy. Came on a Monday morning too. But by myself, they gave me a quick seat by the window. My server came and I was a little caught off guard cause she was really cute, actually all the girls that work there are really cute but this one had a big rack and was demonstrating her cleavage wide and loud. I got it, I know it makes her better tips but for some reason it just rubbed me the wrong way and I think I just got really bad vibes from her. I'm here to have breakfast not ogle cleavage. And this is a family place too. Yeah, I know, what does this have to do anything about the food?  Well, I got the hog and chick (with home fries) and ordered the strawberry honey lemonade. She said they were already out (it was 0900!) so I opted for the blueberry lemonade. Well my meal came I start eating. First, I kinda thought my eggs would be bigger, they're not, they're like normal sized eggs. I don't know, is it too much to expect extra jumble eggs at a place called Matt's Big Breakfast? I ordered the thick cut bacon with it and it's good but overcooked. The bacon's almost burnt, actually it is slightly burnt and I'm pretty sure that's the style here, look at all other pictures. That's not the best way to serve bacon. And I like my food slightly burnt but this isn't the best way to serve thick bacon. It being burnt takes away a lot of the flavor especially with thick bacon. It's almost a crime. The home fries, everyone says how good they are. They're not. Why? Because they're cut too thick. They're mixed with rosemary while being cooked and other seasoning which is awesome but because they're cut so thick, you taste more potato than anything else. It almost makes the seasoning non existent. That's not good home fries. Might as well just cut up really thick fries and serve them.   Finally, my server forgot my drink completely. Never served it. I told her as I brought her my bill. She offered to put it in a to-go cup but I declined. At this point I just wanted to leave. So the food was just ok but I think that server really put me in a foul mood. I don't know, I really need to go back and give this place another try. Probably with another server, lol!

lpGkh0ZAuwN5rgbN0A1KDA.text: Great food awesome atmosphere fast service about a 30minute wait on a sunday morning.  loved the breakfast sandwhich

tPxSqO_uQmVPmJpksGW3TQ.text: I might not be the Duke at Matt's big breakfast but I'm always given the special treatment! Thanks guys!!

dGaVXzv3sutNvZGo5cYuJA.text: Im here visiting from CA and wanted some breakfast before starting work. I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try to to.its amazing reviews.  I walked in and they greeted me immediately.  The  girl behind the bar was nice enough to give me $1 change because I didn't have change for the meter.  There menu isnt large at all, limited options. I order the waffle with 2 strips of bacon and ice coffee.  The coffee sucked but the waffle and bacon were AMAZING! !!   I would definitely come back to try something new:)  I would give it 5 stars if the coffee was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle, bacon and iced coffee

CNaXG4BiHOu_JwhtGWjDgA.text: The food is decent. The coffee; not so good, pretty acidic. It's nice that they will give you honey to sweeten your coffee with, though. Also, I believe they only use butter and olive oil to cook with, which is A+

Vpp1n5qJwOPLTyVRNNUu5w.text: i was always told about this place. The waffles was all everyone talked about. But i went with a breakfast sandwhich and i do not regret it one bit  it was so delicious!!! The bacon was thick and perfectly cooked. I def. Suggest it. My friend had the waffles and I had some, those were so delicious  as well. Definitely will be going back again and again

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwhich

T7mJcIwQOvVMz1s20b7_bA.text: Matt's is very very good and mostly organic! There is a long wait time during prime breakfast hours though usually around 30 min-1hr but definitely worth the wait especially if you have never been! The food is all very fresh and service was quick! The prices are a little more expensive than a typical breakfast place but you're getting fresh and organic food verses frozen. Their coffee was very good and would recommend trying it! Overall we had a great experience and would love to go back again!

tGOLRsexI-rp-EMW2D1P1A.text: MY GF and I drove here on the Harley. Nice day, and nice ride into town. We got there just in time for a 1 hour wait. We just sat inside and waited our turn and just people watched.  I got the Cheese, bacon omelette with a side of bacon, and rye toast. Omelette was very good, they dazzeled it with Rosemary, that set the omelette off. The bacon is thick as Sunday ham slices. It's also prepared with cracked pepper chucks on the bark (outside of the bacon). Very yummy, I'd go back just to order heaping plates of those slabs of goodness. Coffee was a local roasted bean, couldn't say I liked it, couldn't say I loved it, basic drip coffee, im an expresso man so my tastes are cor stronger coffee. Toast is cut nice and thick! They provided some Blue Berry jam that looked home made, it was defiantly a flavor bomb.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ready for some of Matts tasty meat in our mouths. #FLHX #STREETGLIDE

UD45EUExIp1g6c3xsKAggg.text: First time grabbing a late breakfast at this downtown spot. We ordered our food and within only a few minutes, I had an amazing Belgium waffle with 2 thick, peppered slabs of bacon sitting before my very eyes. I barely had time to squeeze my lemon slice into my passionfruit iced tea before this feast sat before me.   After I had lightly buttered and drizzled a fourth of my waffle with syrup, I ceremoniously cut a generous piece out and placed it in my mouth. Seriously, my taste buds didn't know what to do. This was one of the best waffles I've had in my life. After my brain had sufficient time to process what was going on with my tongue and this heavenly piece of Belgium, I relentlessly devoured the rest of the waffle in a matter of minutes. I swear people must have thought I was in a food eating contest.   Then it came time to eat the bacon. After a mere nibble from a corner of one of the slices, the two slices that originally came atop my waffle simply teleported into my stomach. Yeah, that's how good the bacon is. It can teleport. Needless to say, I will be finding any excuse to eat here again in the very near future (i.e. tomorrow).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle. Bacon. Heaven.

1iby49LeOxYU8KlPcYFuNQ.text: The Chick and Chop is one of my breakfast favorites. Ask for CHELSIE at the front counter.   Excellent service, food and coffee...TOP QUALITY.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kn3_PIBMqfCAoAzt2bJm0w.text: I didn't have anything wrong with my meal and service was perfect. However, the breakfast is just average. I went because people said so many great things, kind of a let down.

f3EXmAvAnfQ89rXaNi08Qw.text: One of the most popular breakfast places in the Valley, and it lived up to its billing! Had the special, which was a 3-egg scramble with chipotle ranch sausage and cheese. Side of home fries, delicious, thick wheat toast served with some amazing raspberry jelly, and (based on all of the reviews) I got a side of the bacon.   I don't know where to start. The scramble was great, the sausage with jalapenos were awesome, the home fries were a great complement and the bacon. The bacon was legen-wait for it-DARY!!!  Can't wait to go back, sit at the bar and hang out with Bre H, who gave us some great tips on what to order and kept a smile on our faces!  Last tip: make a reservation if you can, as the line is apparently always long, even for the counter.

CjNSRhKaDNm9CqHwEQ7adg.text: I loved this cute little place!! The food was amazing! Everything was organic and fresh. If you stop by here get their bacon! It's sooo sooo good! This place fills up pretty quick so if you are willing to wait, do it. You won't regret it.

cti5BSl6bdSaHDWe7bvtAA.text: My boyfriend and I ordered the waffle that comes with amazing flavorful thick  bacon with just the right amount of pepper. We also ordered the special, which was a chorizo scramble with cheddar cheese and jalapenos, it was to die for. We switched out the tortilla for toast so we could try the preserves based on other Yelp reviews, the flavor was blueberry and it was AMAZING! I couldn't believe how great the hash browns were, they really take pride in them with a cheese filling, no ketchup needed. The food came out really fast and service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love that this place has ethically grown pigs and cows, no guilt breakfast.

NO31lNu8MRVYNWhBeUE41Q.text: Tucked away in downtown Phoenix, Matt's Big Breakfast offers Big flavor (see what I did there?)  The menu, albeit small, has all the breakfast comfort food that most diners have (i.e., waffles, scrambles, pancakes, etc.) I ordered the special which was an egg scramble with jalapenos, ham and cheese. It also came with a side of potatoes, either hash browns or country style.  The best part of my scramble was the succulent ham. I never tasted breakfast ham so good. If you go to Matt's try their ham, it is no doubt, the best I've ever had.  My hashbrowns were fried to perfection: Crispy outside and soft and silky inside.   I also tried their bacon which is a thick cut peppered bacon. I don't prefer thick cut bacon, but if it's your style, you'll most likely love it.  The service was great and the food is awfully cheap. Wish they had more to choose from on their menu though!

sMkkOKZzYMfeT1SapLrbDg.text: The food is OK. It's the hype on television that make it a big deal. Snooze is the best breakfast place EVER! Go there instead:)

hvFxlDGGb9kUrCayUz7WBA.text: Have been eating here since the TINY spot.  The food is always so fresh and yummy and service  has always been perfect. Have tried almost everything on the menu, never been let down. Love that they try to stay local on all they cook. My favourite breakfast is the salami scramble, but the waffles are so tasty too. Lunch fav  the burgers and BLT the best. I could go on about so many other yummies on the menu, but once you try them you WILL be back. ENJOY.    P.S. brought friends from Colorado and they come every time even at airport location.

UIoGSc48dus9ZHm_9bfoig.text: Great food! Had the special scramble of the day. Husband had the eggs with bacon (which was incredible) and hash browns. Will be back!

mn4cWm5FqnH8Kkj0SlAECg.text: First off , never had a bad meal here. Old or new location.  The new place has the same feel , just bigger and cuter !! Still the same old hassles of downtown parking but that's the norm. We both had eggs Benedict at this visit and it was awesome.  I rarely get to visit Matt's since the wait is so long.  So given the chance to walk right in and sit down on a weekday was such a treat.  The waitress was friendly and bubbly as all of them are.  If you haven't been to the new location , go check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside the new matts

7aiHubifGJ_tFKnBhtP_5A.text: It's simple food served quickly in a trendy area. High prices but the quality was there to back it up. Nothing blew me away to warrant this place's high ratings, but it may be because I don't eat eggs--I had the Waffle, hash-browns and sausage.

5AF8Bb90ojHszCpos_WNZg.text: This place is AWESOME.. Went twice this week. Tuesday and Wednesday.. This is my favorit stop for breakfast everytime Im in town. Food is good, prices are good the coffee is awesome. Love this place. the waitress Trina is so nice.. Food is always hot and fresh.. You can taste the quality....

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE HOG &amp; CHICK

-upKwyzuGwj8mQsd5cEa3g.text: This place gets zero stars. Not sure how they stay in business. If you like getting what you pay for this is not the place for you. Where all the good reviews on yelp are coming from is a mystery to me. Coming here Was the biggest mistake we made this morning. It is not a spur of the moment joint. Plan ahead because you will have to wait 35+minutes just to be seated. Not a good place for a party greater than 4. Ladies: there no where to place your purse so you either eat with it on your lap or put on the floor, which is gross. We Waited the time,got seated & had to wait 10 min before anyone took our drink order. Thankfully we placed our food order at the same time. Waited another 8 min or so to get the drinks. Food took longer to come out. With no kids meal options we were forced to order large plates for the children. So big sad face for that. Food came out & the waffle was good, eggs over easy was fine. My daughter's scrambled eggs were fine. My omelette with cheese bacon ham looked promising & then they didn't get eaten because they were not cooked thru in sections. Figured I'd enjoy hashbrowns but they were terrible. Unseasoned crisp outside & straight baby food mush inside. Yuck. My daughter's homefries were ok except half of them had burned bottoms. I love that they use thick cut bacon but hate that they burn it black so it tastes like charcoal. All in all we spent $75 and change (tip not included) for a party of 5 & TERRIBLE food. Don't waste your hard-earned money here. Unless you like paying for bad food- go somewhere else. Not worth it. You don't get what you pay for. Plan on paying for parking because it is all metered.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burnt homefries, terrible hashbrowns, sections of eggs not cooked all the way thru. Toast? if u call that toast then your toaster is broken

visqW5Mqgn0CaUpIxdaeZw.text: I have been dying to try this place! We went on a Thursday morning and we were seated immediately. The service was quick and our waitress was friendly. We had the waffle and the eggs benedict, both were delicious! The atmosphere was great and the prices were cheap. We will definitely be returning!

npzxzRy0Oow6BNHeFzvktw.text: Excellent food, very fresh. Good service, nice atmosphere. The wait can be killer, but if you have the time, it's worth it.

UxlUZCl0Qr08fVySEiLGOw.text: Not only is this one of my favorite breakfast spots in Phoenix, it's probably one of the most recommended ones I tell everyone to go to when they have family/friends in town.   My wife and I usually get the 5 Spot, this delicious breakfast sandwich that I could easily eat every day. Then we'll typically get the special and split that, so we're always trying something new and the special has never let us down yet. I wish I could say some of the specials we ordered but I'm bad at remembering things.   Yes there can be a wait, but it's always nice out in the morning, they have a great outdoor seating area and your in an awesome part of Downtown Phoenix. If it's Saturday morning you can even walk over to the Public Market and grab some fresh produce or goods of your own.   Once inside, service is fast, almost too fast. I'm always surprised at how fast they bring out the food. They have these small coffee mugs but they never get empty because staff is always checking on you. It gets a little loud inside but we're always able to keep up great conversation with our table of 5 or 6.   So great food, atmosphere, neighborhood and a spot we'll always be going to!

ObstbwqcU0IcBSVKFJyEfw.text: Be prepared to wait, but it is so worth it. Must try the Belgian Waffle!! so so good. Totally homey, down to earth deliciousness. Just GO!!!

0pqRwnPVF8rt6qJUkQgvkQ.text: My brother and I came from out of town and saw the reviews on yelp so decided to make the trip. Best decision ever. Great service and great atmosphere but the food put it over the top. It's hard to differentiate yourself when it comes to breakfast but Matt's makes it happen. Butcher shop bacon, perfectly cooked steak and eggs, home fries that will knock your socks off. Even the toast was off the charts. Best breakfast place I've ever been too. Well worth the drive!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs, bacon, hash browns
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak, eggs, toast, hash browns

LB5Gn5oZOkxHoEnqjhaQMg.text: Oh my Goodness, so amazing!  Breakfast foods are some of my top favorite items to eat. The griddlecakes with sweet cream butter and real (Yes i said "REAL") maple syrup. Seriously these griddlecakes melt in your mouth. The thick-cut bacon was crispy and delicious and i dream about the breakfast potatoes with rosemary.   If you are in the area, or even if you are not.....you definitely should stop at Matt's Big Breakfast!  P.S. I hear the breakfast rush wait time can get a little crazy, I didn't wait in any line however I went around 1pm.

BVDLoVmqWacfJH2h8OC2DQ.text: The bacon..... OMG. that is all. If you come here, please please buy the bacon. the waffles are fluffy and yummy as well. The only downside to this place is there is always a wait :/ But once the food comes out thats all that matters to me and my hubby. Overall, staff is friendly and service is quick and to the point but the food trumps it all.

w_FUmaCwSA-yXlMjZcKJ3w.text: I've been twice, at the behest of coworkers who are more enthusiastic about the place than I am.  It's OK.  It's trendy and seating is limited (though better by far than in their original location), so it can get crowded and noisy.  Lots of nouveau-downtown hipsters with bedheads, nursing hangovers.  Food quality is excellent and features lots of "natural" options.  Service is hurried but friendly.  It's a fair walk (or a short drive, with ample street parking) from downtown.

NbQHHGfsKOpEmBB0Wf9Xpg.text: My husband's favorite meal of the day is breakfast, so while we were in the area I decided to take him to the much ballyhooed Matt's Big Breakfast.  The line wasn't unreasonable, especially for a Saturday midmorning.  Food was served quickly and was made with fresh ingredients, but choices were surprisingly limited...no biscuits and gravy, no chicken fried steak, no quiche.  I just assumed, based on the name, that they'd offer every breakfast item under the sun.  My husband got the omelet of the day and said it was pretty good.  I got the pesto chicken sandwich, and it was alright.  We were both underwhelmed.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken sandwich with macaroni salad

1VBs3ikO-l98albFiPxbVw.text: One of the best morning meals I've ever had. The griddle cakes and chicken apple sausage were so, so, SO good. The atmosphere is real laid back and the service is excellent here. Next time I come to Phoenix I will most definitely be eating here.

J75sEi5SGcT1YKy1OnrdnQ.text: Went for brunch Sunday and the food was terrific!  We had a party of six and wrre seated in the semi-private area. The menu is small and straight forward.  The food was hot and delicious.  The servings huge,vand the ingredients fresh.  It was wonderful.  Will definitely visit again
